story:
Fortunate People started 3 years ago with an aim to share inspirational content related to Bhakti yoga and the Vedas. Our Facebook page now serves over 15K subscribers with daily wisdom, hope-giving news, inspiring music and mantra videos, and practical advice on yoga,  meditation, ayurveda, astrology and much more.

After launching the page we soon realized the great jewel we could serve the worldwide community with by extending our reach around the world with the Fortunate People Campaign.  Our initial page facebook.com/fortunatepeoplesmile became the "bow" for a very special "enchanted arrow" to bring the highest FORTUNE to the world - Fortunate-people.com

Through Fortunate-people.com, we now have a platform to promote the Hare Krishna Maha-Mantra throughout the world by the simple appeal of recording people chanting and uploading the videos for everyone to see and be inspired.

Fortunate-people.com has begun gaining momentum on this beautiful journey with over 500(!) videos capturing over 7000(!) people chanting the Maha-Mantra for love & peace. But our goal is even more challenging.

We aspire to get 50,000 recorded chants dedicated to love & peace! And, in this way, honour and congratulate Srila Prabhupada and his ISKCON movement for its amazing achievement of 50 years of service to the global society.

It all began in London during Srila Prabhupada's December Marathon 2015.

At that time we were inspired by these words from Srila Prabhupada:

"We are making them fortunate. We are giving them service so they
become fortunate. We are spending our blood, gallons of blood, to make them fortunate. This is the sacrifice of the devotee. […] So it is by the devotee's sacrifice that they are fortunate."  
(Jan 18, 1974, Morning walk)

“This Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement is simply requesting people, "Chant Hare Kṛṣṇa." […] It is our duty to make all these misfortunate, unfortunate creatures fortunate. That is our mission.”
​( Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam 1.8.30 Los Angeles, April 22, 1973)

This became our motto – “Make them fortunate”

Ever since, the Fortunate People team is trying to fulfill this mission and mood set by Srila Prabhupada, and so eagerly supported by all of his followers.


Today, we ask you to join us in this effort by donating for the campaign. Our reason for asking you to help is very simple.

At first, when we launched the project our personal resources got us going. But we really didn't foresee all the fantastic opportunities that would open. The team at ISKCON Online (ISKCONOnline.com) stepped in to get us over the first goal – the launching of Fortunate-people.com.

The results have been immensely encouraging and we are more than convinced of the potential. But now we need to both maintain and expand the effort.

With your help we can make this campaign successful and reach our 50,000 chants goal.

Driven by the success so far we have assembled a team of over 20(!) devotees. Most are serving as part-time volunteers. But a few are now serving full-time -  developing the web-site, editing and promoting the maha-mantra videos, updating the Facebook page and ultimately developing the virtual Maha Mantra community. It's already over 10,000(!) hours that our team spent in total working on this project.

Here’s how your support will promote the campaign

With your support we will first maintain the existing work through to the end of the first campaign next year. And we will develop the Fortunate People Ambassadors and Fortunate People Awards extensions to our main page. 

Fortunate People Ambassadors

This feature of the site will enable us to acknowledge the great efforts that many participants have already inspired the world with, such as the Tattva Darsi team collecting chants in the USA or the Radha-Krisna Temple team in the UK or single warriors like Bhakti Swarup Chaitanya Swami (over 80 videos) or Padmavati devi dasi in Holland. 

Here’s a 2 min video of the on-going miracle Padmavati devi dasi is a part of:

Fortunate People Awards

The Awards section would feature monthly TOP15 Mantra Charts of those chants shared in a musical, creative or inspirational way. We also aim to conclude with a beautiful ceremony in Mayapur at the Gaura Purnima Festival screening the best chants in different categories i.e. Amusing, Funny, Deep, Sincere, Lovely etc. Here is the second one we came up with:

By building our site to a highly professional level we aim to attract different high profile media channels like 'The New York Times', 'Huffington Post', or even BBC to cover the campaign. We aim to get celebrities like Russell Brand, Miley Cyrus, Tina Turner and many others to add their chants which could take the whole world by storm.

We are convinced that Fortunate People has the potential to contribute greatly in making the words ‘Hare Krishna’ a household phrase, as in 'take it easy’, 'let it go', 'just carry on' or merely ‘be happy’.

All this would contribute to a completely new public image of the Maha Mantra. This unique combination of the mood of having 'no hard and fast rules' for chanting this Maha Mantra and the Internet  opens a wonderful and tangible opportunity for the Holy Name to reach 'every town and village'.

Our budget:
We've obtained professional estimates for the project ranging between $40-50 thousand dollars. But by engaging devotee professionals we have been able to bring the cost down to less than 25% of this. The following is our budget* for providing modest stipends to devotee-professionals who are contributing their time for the success of this project.



*ISKCON Online continues to support the Fortunate People campaign as its fiscal partner in the US. All contributions to the campaign will be received by ISKCON Online and 100% will be utilized for Fortunate People. Donations in the US are tax-deductible and a tax receipt will be sent to all donors.

If we fail to raise or exceed the amount needed:

- if we don't raise sufficient amount, it would still assist in making further steps on this journey of sharing the Maha Mantra with thousands of people and undoubtedly inspire all of us with beautiful new videos similar to the ones highlighted above

- if we exceed the amount requested (which we're hoping for considering the amount of media we need to produce by the end of the campaign) it will assist with promotion of all these wonderful videos. Needless to say, in ideal case scenario we can rely not just on organic share but also boost and promote every single video we produce. So, you're welcome to donate generously
 

What if you can't donate but still want to take part?!
Wonderful! Please do! :)

a) The most precious offering and contribution you can do is to add your own video and make others fortunate by inviting them to chant the Maha mantra. Simply send it to us using this standard form at fortunate-people.com/addyours. In other words, become an Ambassador!

b) Kindly spread the word. Let others know of the fortunate-people.com itself or spread the word about this fundraising campaign in particular

c) Are you passionate about sharing content related to Bhakti yoga and the Vedas? Then, become one of the FP Media Channel members doing weekly posts at  facebook.com/fortunatepeoplesmile

Or simply pray that we accomplish the goal of collecting 50000 chants by 09 Feb 2017 (Nityananda Trayordashi) and assist in spreading the 'Unique Loving Network of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu' (Adi Lila 7.37)

Thank you for your support
________

P.S. Why not inviting the whole world dance and chant like that? :)

story:
The Story So Far...

Based in Ypsilanti, Toronto, Brooklyn, Champaign-Urbana and McKinney, The Cultural Gutter was founded in May, 2003 by writer, filmmaker and game designer Jim Munroe and comics critic and artist Guy Leshinski to provide thoughtful and provocative writing on disreputable art. Since then, we've had twelve editors in two countries and five cities write on comics, movies, filmi b-movies, tv, science fiction, fantasy, horror, romance, video games, and porn. And in all that time we paid our writers, both editors and Guest Stars. Then we lost our funding grant, but a small, rag-tag band of donors joined forces with the Gutter to keep us online and help us keep our commitment to paying writers for their work. Thus, the Gutterthon was born.

The Gutter offers thoughtful, well-written articles on topics like: the queerness of Mario Bava's Danger: Diabolik; time loops and failures of memory; the history of the first African American syndicated cartoonist, Jackie Ormes; the unspoken and the unexplained in horror; the decline and fall of filmi superstar, Rajesh Khanna; Kung Fu-Powered Afro-Cyberpunk. Now our survival depends on the Gutterthon. So please click Back It and keep the Gutter flowing with the writing you love. Even if you can only throw in a buck, we will thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

What We Need & What You Get

Thanks to donors' help last year we raised enough to pay our new webhosts through 2016, so Gutterthon 2016 is all about the writing. Our $1600 goal breaks down to: $250/year/writer or about $20/article; $250/year for the Evil Overlord for publishing, promoting, finding new writers, day-to-day site management, co-ordinating the in-progress site redesign, making sure the perks are shipped out, and preparing the two Cultural Gutter Press books we plan to publish, The Cultural Gutter Presents Secrets Of Mantis Fist and Return To The Cultural Gutter a new collection of essays from the Gutter. The remaining $350 will go towards printing and shipping perks, promotional materials, paying occasional guest writers and paying Indiegogo and Paypal fees.

In return, along with thoughtful and provocative articles on subjects also get our undying and eternal thanks and your choice of some sweet perks.

Perks Include:

A Cultural Gutter Membership package including a numbered and dated CG Membership Card and a decryption key for decoding the CG Secret Messages posted at the top of the Sponsor's Page.

The British Fantasy Award-winning Fox Spirit Books has donated two hard copies of Eve Of War and five digital copies of The Evil Genius Guide! Eve of War is an anthology of tales from the battlefield edited by Mhairi Simpson and Darren Pulsford.  "Sharp of mind and instinct; with poise and grace and power – Eve's Daughters are a match for any opponent. Whether seeking out a worthy test or assailed by brave (but foolish) foes, she is determined and cunning, and will not fail. Here are fifteen tales from across the ages; full of prowess both martial and magical, from an array of unique voices."

The Evil Genius Guide is a slim volume of villainous flash fiction edited by Darren Pulsford. Tales of mad science! Evil creations! And REVENGE!


Our sister site Pornokitsch donated books from their Jurassic London imprint. You'll have your choice of one print copy of: Irregularity, The Book Of The Dead, The Lowest Heaven or A Town Called Pandemonium. "Irregularity depicts the tension between order and chaos in the 17th and 18th centuries....From John Harrison to Ada Lovelace, Isaac Newton to Émilie du Châtelet, these stories showcase the Age of Reason in a very different light."  The Book of the Dead  "addresses the most fascinating of all the undead: the mummy. The mummy can be a figure of imperial dignity or one of shambling terror, at home in pulp adventure, contemporary drama, or apocalyptic horror," featuring stories by Gail Carriger and Paul Cornell. The Lowest Heaven is "themed around a body in the Solar System, from the Sun to Halley's Comet. The stories are illustrated with photographs and artwork selected from the archives of the Royal Observatory, while the book's cover and overall design are the work of award-winning South African illustrator Joey Hi-Fi." A Town Called Pandemonium "is the wildest, weirdest West you'll ever visit: a shared world anthology created by some of the best new writers in horror and fantasy." (With sweet art by Adam Hill). Just leave a comment letting us know which book you'd like.

Print copies of our first book, The Cultural Gutter (2011), published by Carnegie-Mellon University's ETC Press.  The Cultural Gutter (2011) collects pieces published on the Gutter from Jim Munroe, James Schellenberg, Carol Borden, Chris Szego and Ian Driscoll. This print version also has fantastic infographic illustrations by artist EJ Lee.


A pre-order of our second Cultural Gutter book, Return To The Cultural Gutter, collecting new essays from our editors!

A copy of the Gutterthon Beach Party poster designed for this very campaign by by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company (and Drive-In Mob) and that Caucasians t-shirt that broke the internet.

A cellphone accessory kit for iPhone 4, 5/6 or android. There are cases for iPhones (not Androids, unfortunately, but each kit will include a minimum 2 US cords, a wall charger, a car charger, and a stylus. Just indicate your phone and preferred color:  white, black, pink, red, blue, yellow, green, orange, or purple. (Thanks, Julie Lowry for kindly providing this perk!)

Sassy Diabolik Mug: Enjoy a hot beverage with this sassy mug decorated with an image of naked Diabolik and a puppy  created by Brian Kirby. The mug is 3.75" / 9.5 cm high and 3" / 7.6 cm in diameter. (It's also microwave and dishwasher safe, but I wouldn't try covering it in molten gold).

Last year, Julie Beman and Eric Bloomquist of Chica Non Grata wrote and performed songs based on prompts from three lucky donors. This year, they are donating three copies of Nocturnal Commissions, Vol. 1,  a CD collection of those songs: "At The Library"; "Fortune Cookie"; and, "See Me"--the songs commissioned by three Gutterthon 2015 donors. Nocturnal Commissions includes sweet, hand-made cover art by Chica Non Grata's Julie!

And three lucky contributors can have a song written and performed on the disreputable art topic of their choice by Chica Non Grata again this year! Love Star Wars, Black Widow or robots?They will sing about them. We will put you in touch with the band and you can give them some writing prompts. It's a $1500 value for a mere $150! (Chica Non Grata retains the rights to and ownership of the song. Please don't ask for a theme song or something you will put to commercial use. You can commission something privately if you dig what they write).

NEW PERK UNLOCKED: The Cultural Gutter Presents Secret Diagrams of Mantis Fist! Long rumored and often denied, the Cultural Gutter's have been presented in this volume for the first time. In publishing these diagrams, we hope to reassure those who have claimed that we have been hiding martial arts secrets for our own benefit. Instead, this volume contains not only the recently discovered diagrams detailing stances of Mantis Fist kung fu, but places them in context with a brief historical overviews, film reviews and even the accusations of diagram skeptics in their own words. Featuring art by author/illustrator Evan Munday and crazy talk by the Gutter's own Carol Borden. Designed by friend of the Gutter, Andrew Nahem.

NEW PERK UNLOCKED: Get a copy of the original K. A. Laity short story that allegedly inspired the deliberately neglected SF classic PSYCHO MOTORCYCLE DOLLS (1966). This (3-5K minimum) story includes motorcycles, dames, witchcraft and occult shenanigans plus all manner of over-the-top pulp weirdness. Not available to the general public for at least one year! Signed, laser-printed manuscript available at the end of the Gutterthon.

NEW PERK UNLOCKED: A gray 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a red Krampus handprinted on the cover by the Gutter's own Carol. Just in time for Krampuslauf!

NEW PERK UNLOCKED: A gray 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a green Cthulhu handprinted on the cover by the Gutter's own Carol. Iä! Iä! Cthulhu fhtagn!

SOLD OUT: Our friends at Cinema Detroit, Detroit's premier moviehouse, have offered one of their swanky Cinema Detroit t-shirts as a perk.

SOLD OUT: Kaijutastic needle-felted Godzilla hand-made by friend of the Gutter Kerry Gately-Fristoe! Ferocious! Adorable! He's 6" tall and nearly one foot long.

SOLD OUT: My Pretty Zombie cosmetics' new Madhouse Collection, featuring 3 eyeshadows (Hysteria, Melancholic, and The Vapors), a blush ("Arsenic Trioxide"--i.e, not really arsenic), and a swank dark lipstick.

SOLD OUT: Dalek fingerless mittens/wrist warmers knitted by the Gutter's own Beth Watkins! Be stylish and warm wherever and whenever you are--just like the Daleks! Beth will be making the Dalek fingerless mittens herself and plans to have them done by the end of November. (See the design Beth will be using in our gallery of images).

SOLD OUT: The Gutter's own Carol Borden has donated handmade homunculi for all your abominable needs. These homunculi are one of a kind and made to order.

We will be unlocking more perks as the campaign continues, but even $1 gets our Undying Thanks.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials, hire additional guest writers, or even consider working on some additional books after completing Return Of The Cultural Gutter.

The Impact

We like to think that the Gutter offers something that is unusual online: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art and media. If you donate or support the campaign by sharing, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.

We ran a successful fundraiser last summer, we sent out all our perks, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept going.  With your help, we can do it again. The Cultural Gutter's survival does depend on Gutterthon.
 

Risks & Challenges

We recognize that it's a difficult time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content. But we believe with your help, we can do our little part to keep the Gutter flowing with quality writing.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are hard for a lot of people and any little bit helps, even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy.

Instead, this volume contains not only the recently discovered diagrams detailing stances of Mantis Fist kung fu, but places them in context with a brief historical overviews, film reviews and even the accusations of diagram skeptics in their own words. Featuring art by author/illustrator Evan Munday and crazy talk by the Gutter's own Carol Borden. Designed by friend of the Gutter, Andrew Nahem.
NEW PERK UNLOCKED: Get a copy of the original K. A. Laity short story that allegedly inspired the deliberately neglected SF classic PSYCHO MOTORCYCLE DOLLS (1966). This (3-5K minimum) story includes motorcycles, dames, witchcraft and occult shenanigans plus all manner of over-the-top pulp weirdness. Not available to the general public for at least one year! Signed, laser-printed manuscript available at the end of the Gutterthon.
NEW PERK UNLOCKED: A gray 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a red Krampus handprinted on the cover by the Gutter's own Carol. Just in time for Krampuslauf!
NEW PERK UNLOCKED: A gray 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a green Cthulhu handprinted on the cover by the Gutter's own Carol. Iä! Iä! Cthulhu fhtagn!
SOLD OUT: Our friends at Cinema Detroit, Detroit's premier moviehouse, have offered one of their swanky Cinema Detroit t-shirts as a perk.
SOLD OUT: Kaijutastic needle-felted Godzilla hand-made by friend of the Gutter Kerry Gately-Fristoe! Ferocious! Adorable! He's 6" tall and nearly one foot long.
SOLD OUT: My Pretty Zombie cosmetics' new Madhouse Collection, featuring 3 eyeshadows (Hysteria, Melancholic, and The Vapors), a blush ("Arsenic Trioxide"--i.e, not really arsenic), and a swank dark lipstick.
SOLD OUT: Dalek fingerless mittens/wrist warmers knitted by the Gutter's own Beth Watkins! Be stylish and warm wherever and whenever you are--just like the Daleks! Beth will be making the Dalek fingerless mittens herself and plans to have them done by the end of November. (See the design Beth will be using in our gallery of images).
SOLD OUT: The Gutter's own Carol Borden has donated handmade homunculi for all your abominable needs. These homunculi are one of a kind and made to order.
We will be unlocking more perks as the campaign continues, but even $1 gets our Undying Thanks.If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials, hire additional guest writers, or even consider working on some additional books after completing Return Of The Cultural Gutter.
The Impact
We like to think that the Gutter offers something that is unusual online: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art and media. If you donate or support the campaign by sharing, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.
We ran a successful fundraiser last summer, we sent out all our perks, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept going.  With your help, we can do it again. The Cultural Gutter's survival does depend on Gutterthon. 
Risks & Challenges
We recognize that it's a difficult time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content. But we believe with your help, we can do our little part to keep the Gutter flowing with quality writing.  
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that times are hard for a lot of people and any little bit helps, even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy.

story:
Your contribution  [ Votre soutien ]

[ ENG ] We're almost ready to print. Our goal is to ship the books and artwork by Christmas. This is about asking you {readers & art enthusiasts} to support this project by contributing to a unique presale.

Without you, Déjà Vu will never see the light of day.

  • At a minimum, we need CAD$7,000 to print a limited edition of 500 neatly designed books (96 pages, tentatively 6.7"x8.2") with a textured silkscreen softcover on 100lbs 'Endurance' silk paper. Trust us, this looks pretty good, and we're working with a great printing company that has done several sleek art books in the past. We want to use the 'offset' printing technology (similar to lithography), which provides higher-quality results than digital printing.
  • While we would be very happy to print the above, our dream goal would be to print the book with a debossed linen-wrapped hardcover, ideally on 115lbs 'HannoArt' silk paper. We will be able to do (at least some of) this if we exceed our initial funding goal by CAD$3,000-5,000 (just FYI, in late Oct 2016, CAD$100 = US$75 = EUR68, give or take)

Our goal is not profit, but delivering a unique livre d'artiste that you will want to look at, touch, read, and display. In the book, we will print indications so our readers can access the alternate version of the story encoded in the bitcoin blockchain.

In addition, you have the opportunity to purchase signed, limited edition Giclée prints of the book's illustrations (16"x20", choose one from the five below), as well as the 20 original paintings made specifically for the book by artist Sarah Legault (16"x20", contact us to make a reservation, for instance by leaving a Comment). Check the Gallery (below the video trailer) to see images of all illustrations available for sale -- we will keep adding new ones over the course of the campaign (until we hit 20). Everything will be mailed to your address in a box and shipping tube.

[ FRA ] Nous sommes presque prêts à lancer l'impression. Notre but est d'expédier les livres et les illustrations par la Poste avant Noël. L'objectif de cette campagne est de demander {à vous lecteurs et amateurs d'art} de soutenir ce projet en participant à cette prévente unique.

Sans vous, Déjà Vu ne verra jamais la lumière du jour.

  • Avec CAD$7,000, nous pourrons imprimer une édition limitée (500 ex., 96 pages, env. 17x21cm) sur papier 'Endurance' 148 gsm avec couverture brochée souple en soie texturée et imprimée. C'est une excellente finition, et nous travaillons avec un imprimeur réputé qui a réalisé de nombreux livres d'art de très grande qualité par le passé. Nous voulons utiliser une technique d'impression "offset" (similaire à la lithographie), qui donne de bien meilleurs résultats que l'impression digitale.
  • Nous serions ravis d'imprimer avec les paramètres décrits ci-dessus...mais notre rêve serait de pouvoir imprimer, sur papier un 'HannoArt' 170 gsm, un livre relié à une couverture rigide recouverte d'une percaline en lin, et ornementée d'un décor à froid. Nous pourrons réaliser (au moins une partie de) ce projet si nous dépassons notre objectif de financement initial de 3 000 à 5 000 dollars canadiens (soit $10 000-15 000 au total). Pour information, ces jours-ci, CAD$100 = US$75 = EUR68 (estimations). 

Notre objectif n'est pas de réaliser un profit, mais de produire un livre d'artiste que vous aurez envie de regarder, de feuilleter, de toucher et de lire. Le livre contiendra les indications nécessaires pour accéder à la version alternative de l'histoire encodée dans la blockchain du réseau bitcoin.

Nous vous offrons aussi la possibilité d’acquérir des impressions 'Giclée' des illustrations du livre (édition limitée, signées, 41 x 51 cm, à choisir parmi les cinq ci-dessus), ainsi que les 20 peintures originales réalisées pour le livre par l'artiste Sarah Legault (41 x 51 cm, contactez-nous pour réserver, par exemple en rédigeant un Commentaire). La Galerie accessible sous la vidéo ci-dessus contient les images de toutes les illustrations disponibles à la vente, et nous en ajouterons de nouvelles tout au long de cette campagne (jusqu'à atteindre 20). Tout sera expédié par la Poste à votre adresse dans une enveloppe protectrice (pour le livre) et/ou un tube en carton (pour les œuvres).

About us  [ les auteurs ]

[ENG] JP Vergne is an award winning scholar and author born in France in 1983. He has published two books on the history of piracy and capitalism (L'Organisation Pirate, 2010 @Éditions du Bord de L'eau; and The Pirate Organization, 2013 @Harvard Publishing). In the past, he worked with math-rock band Chevreuil to create a soundtrack, and produced the animation film What is the pirate organization? His work has been featured in the media on dozens of occasions (print, web, TV), and JP has given talks at leading international events such as TEDx and South by Southwest. He has been based in Canada since 2011.

Sarah Legault (London, ON) is an award winning filmmaker, director, producer, animator, and writer. Her first stop-motion animation Dear Love earned the Best Animated Short Film award at the 2014 Toronto Independent Film Festival. Since 2005, she has won 10 awards for her unique custom motorcycle paint work and participated in about 50 group exhibits in Toronto, Berlin, Krakow, or Los Angeles. Sarah's work spans illustration, stop-motion animation, doll making, painting, and curating multimedia shows.

[FRA] Jean-Philippe Vergne, né en France en 1983, est universitaire et auteur. Il a publié deux livres sur l'histoire de la piraterie et du capitalisme (L'Organisation Pirate, 2010 @Éditions du Bord de L'eau; et The Pirate Organization, 2013 @Harvard Publishing). Par le passé, il a collaboré avec le groupe de math-rock Chevreuil pour produire une bande-son, et a produit et co-écrit le film d'animation What is the pirate organization? Ses travaux ont été mentionnés dans les médias à de nombreuses reprises (presse, web, TV), et il a été invité à présenter son travail lors d’événements tels que TEDx ou South by Southwest. Il vit au Canada depuis 2011.

Sarah Legault (London, ON) est auteure et réalise, produit et anime des films. Son travail a reçu de nombreuses distinctions, notamment le Prix du Meilleur Film d'Animation au Toronto Independent Film Festival en 2014 pour son premier film d'animation Dear Love. Depuis 2005, elle a reçu une dizaine de distinctions pour sa fresque peinte sur une moto, et a montré ses travaux au cours d'une cinquantaine d'expositions de groupe à Toronto, Los Angeles, Cracovie ou encore Berlin. La pratique artistique de Sarah combine l'illustration, l'animation en stop motion, la création de poupées, la peinture et le commissariat d'expositions multimédia.

Support This Project  [ un moyen simple de soutenir Déjà Vu ]

[ENG] Whether you're getting the book or not, you can always help by spreading the word! Think of people you know who like graphic novels, poetry, art, sci-fi -- or a combination thereof. If you dropped them a short personal email, you'd already be helping a lot. And of course there's social media. Thanks for that.

[FRA] Que vous achetiez le livre ou non, vous pouvez soutenir ce projet en le mentionnant autour de vous! Qui, dans votre entourage, s’intéresse à la littérature, à la poésie, à l'art, au roman graphique ou à la science-fiction?  En leur envoyant un petit email personnalisé, vous nous aidez déjà beaucoup. Et bien sûr, il y a les réseaux sociaux. Merci pour ce soutien.

story:
Take charge of YOUR publishing goals!

There's been a shift in the publishing industry; the power is now in the hands of the writer. You have a story and Fistbump Media wants to give you the tools to share it with the world!

Fistbump Media, LLC specializes in making the web awesome. This includes helping bloggers and authors mold their stories into awesome books (and e-books), from creating cover designs to publishing and everything in between.

Our President and Founder, Dan King's publishing portfolio contains over 30 books by various bloggers and authors, including 3 publications of his own.  He has experience in self-publishing AND traditional publishing; basically, it's safe to say this dude has some expertise in this area. His own self-published book, The Unlikely Missionary: From Pew-warmer to Poverty Fighter has sold over 10,000 copies and has had a great impact on the way people think about short-term missions!

Fistbump Media has a huge drive and passion to get life-changing stories into the hands of readers! By contributing to this campaign, you can help authors and bloggers gain access to the tried-and-true strategies they need to tell their stories to the masses!

Give a Little, Get A LOT

We need $5000 to produce this entire e-course; this will cover video production (76%- the most cookies), course content development (11%), and some caffeine here and there to keep our engines chugging (13%)! 

Note: The percentages in this pie chart of the breakdown of costs are approximations. Actual percentages may vary.

What's in the course? Check it out (and click to view on Pinterest)...

So, what's in it for you? Check out our awesome perks lists! You won't believe the deals that we are offering! There's everything from an EXCLUSIVE campaign contributors' e-book outlining tips and tricks of self-publishing to a few coveted website development packages. So get 'em while the gettin's good!

The Impact

We believe in the power of stories. Stories have the power to create change. We, at Fistbump Media have witnessed this first-hand with Dan's self-published book, The Unlikely Missionary: From Pew-Warmer to Poverty-Fighter, and subsequently with countless other projects.

The Unlikely Missionary has encouraged and inspired many to go and do something bigger than themselves, to make a difference in the world, or even in their own backyard. It's inspired some to start blogging their own experiences and many have self-published their stories as well! This domino effect all started with one man's willingness to talk about his experiences and how they've changed him.

There are too many stories out there that never get told—this is a tragedy! So many people have such incredible stories already written, but they’ve never been heard because they haven't been published. Traditional publishing is difficult to pursue and obtain and many authors have no idea about this extreme power shift in the publishing industry! The result is, unfortunately, countless people who miss the opportunity to be inspired, encouraged, and changed. These are the people who are waiting for YOUR story and they don’t even know it yet!

Enter Fistbump Media! We are here to restore power to the writer! That's what this project is all about; it's about giving the writer with that awe-inspiring story all the tools they need to share their story effectively so people can be moved to change the world in unfathomable ways!

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

Of course, we know that you peeps are going to get us above and beyond our goal! So, in an alternate reality where this doesn't happen, we would have to scale back on production a bit (it's that or get our kiddos to work...which we hear is somewhat frowned upon...) and sacrifice depth of content. This means less info, but we would still pump out a Fistbump-worthy e-course!

Can't contribute? You can still help!

We know not everyone will be able to make a financial contribution and that's OK! Support Fistbump Media by sharing the mess out of our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, wherever!

#fistbump

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryan Toxopeus, author of the epic fantasy novels A Noble's Quest, and A Wizard's Gambit. As a husband and father of two with a full time day job to pay the bills, it can be a delicate balance to find time to write. However, I am passionate about my stories and characters and am dedicated to completing my first trilogy, the Empire's Foundation.

Unfortunately, starting out as an indie author is tough going. Despite glowing reviews (A Noble's Quest is rated over 4 stars on Amazon, Smashwords, and Goodreads), word of mouth only travels so fast. There is no shortage of indie books on the market, and we also have to compete with traditional publishers who have the financial muscle to take most of the spotlight.

Indie authors are grabbing more and more attention, not all of it good. While I've read some amazing books from indie authors, I've also read some bad ones that look like first drafts. Unedited, I haven't been able to finish them.

That's why it's so important to me to pay for professional editing and cover art. I want to put out the best book that I can, so readers aren't disappointed. Word of mouth is hard enough to generate without killing your chances with poorly edited prose.

Perhaps you have had an experience where you haven't picked up a series until it was finished, or near completion. I know several times that has been the case for me, where I only discover an author after they have finished a series and I hear someone say, "You need to read this. The whole series was amazing!"

With your help, I can finish this series quickly. I am committed to finishing it, but if it were left to me to raise the funds alone, it would take years to save up.

A Hero's Birth is not the end of the story, but it will be my final crowd sourced project. Once this series is complete, my writing will have to sustain itself through sales. I will continue to write the next series, Strongblade Siblings, but it will only be published as I find the money to bring them out.

With your help, I hope to one day write 10 books (minimum) in this world that I created. But each epic journey begins with a single step. I've taken it with your help, and I just need a bit more momentum to keep me going.


What I Need & What You Get

I will be working with Shen Hart, who will be doing the developmental editing. I've known Shen for a few years, and she is highly regarded for her developmental editing and marketing knowledge. It will be a pleasure to work with her! She has given me a reduced rate of $1000 to help me with the flow of my manuscript.

My Aunt Mary has offered to do the copy editing for free, with the cost of "patience." If you have read A Noble's Quest and/or A Wizard's Gambit, you know her amazing ability already. She works miracles with words, and I am forever in her debt. 

And Harvey Bunda is back to do the cover art for $800. He's worth every penny, believe me! Not only do I get the book cover, but he does the painting on a large scale so it can be used for posters and any other advertising I might want. He has also offered to put together another promotional video for the project, with storyboard interleaved with artwork, followed up with a speed demonstration of his painting process. If you're not familiar with the videos, I highly recommend checking out the ones he has done for A Noble's Quest and A Wizard's Gambit.

I'm setting the goal for the project at $1000. I'm over half way through the first draft of A Hero's Birth, so the editing needs to be done ASAP. If I need to wait on the art, I will, as editing takes a great deal of time. The full $1800 sounds like a lot of money to me, but I think $1000 is achievable.

If I reach $1000, I'll start stretch goals in $100 increments to get up to or beyond the $1800 mark. For each $100 above $1000 that is raised, Harvey will bring out a new character portrait (at a cost to me of $10 per picture) and I will include them with any physical perk, including international shipping. For the first $800, the characters will be: Eliza, Sarentha, Thomas, Ben, Ramar, Thurzin, Dowreth, Sharrow. 

To give you an idea of what they will look like, I commissioned a card for Ramar, which you can see now.

If I somehow break the $1800 ceiling, I have a large pool of characters to choose from, and will put it up to a vote for those who have backed me with requests for physical perks. The list of characters is: Pellin, Marcus, Arus, Jordak, Gleriph, Gayle, Thrak, Thigglin, Ellie'nethise, Shump, Gum, Erwin, Denton, Lyle, Richard, Feng, Hallo'mien, Glezxnodin, and Adam.

Why would I need to go higher than $1800? Because there will be physical perks available, so not all of your donation will go towards my editing and artwork. For each perk I have set the donation price at Item Cost + Shipping Estimate + $5 Actual Donation. If I have multiple orders for the same items (i.e., 5 A Noble's Quest mugs) the price comes down, and more of the Item Cost translates into Actual Donation. Also, the Canada Post website is terrible at estimating shipping costs (I found out from my last Indiegogo), so any savings from multiple orders of the same items will likely disappear into shipping costs.

Any additional money above and beyond my needs will go toward extras, like bringing out the final map for the series. Harvey was kind enough to do the first map for free, and his rate was quite reasonable on the second.

As you can see, the world expands a great deal from A Noble's Quest (left) to A Wizard's Gambit (right). A Hero's Birth will again double the landmass, and will include both the map from A Wizard's Gambit, and a brand new map.

There are many perks available:

From my novella, Demon Invasion for $1 backers...


To mugs with the cover art on them...



All the way up to unique autographed canvas prints for the three covers for $250 each.

The e-books will be available (you will receive your e-book copy of A Hero's Birth before it's available for sale), as will print copies. I look at crowd source funding as an opportunity for people to pre-order the book they're helping to bring out. And for those people who want more, there will be posters, mugs, notebooks, magnets, and more! And don't forget those character cards from stretch goals. There's something for everyone! For a full list of perks, check them out on the side.

If I don't reach my goal, the money that is raised will go toward the editing. If I reach the initial goal, but don't reach $1800, the money will pay for editing first, and I will come up with the rest to pay for artwork eventually.

One way or another, the trilogy will be finished. It will just take longer if I don't make the money with this Indiegogo campaign.

"But you're a Canadian," you say. "Why are you looking to raise USD?"

The editor and artist I'm working with take USD payments, so raising $1800 CAD would leave me over $300 short.


The Impact

At GenreCon last year, attendees got to meet my daughter, who dressed up as Darth Vader. One cosplayer, Judge Daven Brown, bought a copy of the book and said, "If you helped raise a little girl who is that awesome, what has that brain of yours created in this book?" 

Epic fantasy has long been male-dominated. From Tolkien's work, to Feist, there have been few characters for women to get excited about. I believe it is the job of writers to give exposure and opportunity to all kinds of people - although not all in one book. Being inclusive of everyone is impossible. But when 50+% of the population is ignored as heroes in epic fantasy, there's a problem.

Eliza Winston is my part of the solution. She's strong-willed, spirited, and still feminine. Trained to use a crossbow when words fail, she isn't afraid of getting her hands dirty to reach her goals.

There's another under-serviced group, and while men do have representation, it's skewed. We are bombarded with images of muscly men all the time, and in epic fantasy this translates into hardened war veterans with bulky physiques.

There is little room for a thoughtful, reluctant hero like Thomas. Sure, he's a big guy, and can do some damage, but it takes a lot to make him fight. And a character who's scrawny and weaselly like Sarentha rarely gets any attention.

Humans fall along a spectrum, and by helping to support my writing, you will start to see figures who are not the media-driven "ideal," yet they become heroes in their own right.

My last Indiegogo campaign made A Wizard's Gambit possible, and I hope you can help this one succeed as well!


Risks & Challenges

There are none, really. This last book will come out, sooner or later. It might take two or three more years, when my wife goes back to work and we have some extra money to do it, but it will come out eventually. Even if I have to squirrel away $10 a week to do it. 

If the Canada Post website has grossly overestimated shipping costs, I will refund any excess to backers.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand the economy went belly up, and has been slow to recover. Not everyone has money to help out. It might be obvious, but put your own financial security first. I would be eaten by guilt if I found out that people who are struggling to make ends meet donated to my campaign.

If you really want to help, but can't contribute money, share my campaign. I'll be putting out daily ads all month with different angles. If any of them strike a chord with you, feel free to share them so others might find out about my writing.

Alternatively, I've been told Indiegogo has some sharing tools you can use to spread the word.

Whether you contribute financially, or by sharing, I thank you for your help. It means so much to me and my family. (My daughter boasted proudly to a local book store owner the other day that she has her very own copy of A Noble's Quest, and I look forward to adding to her collection!)


Direct donations: $320

These are donations from people outside the Indiegogo platform that I will add onto the total when calculating the total donations when figuring out how many character cards will be commissioned.

Direct Donors:

1) Adelle Kivari, $50

2) Carla Toxopeus, $70

3) Rob Hilton, $100

4) Libby Ackerman, $100

My name is Ryan Toxopeus, author of the epic fantasy novels A Noble's Quest, and A Wizard's Gambit. As a husband and father of two with a full time day job to pay the bills, it can be a delicate balance to find time to write. However, I am passionate about my stories and characters and am dedicated to completing my first trilogy, the Empire's Foundation. 
Unfortunately, starting out as an indie author is tough going. Despite glowing reviews (A Noble's Quest is rated over 4 stars on Amazon, Smashwords, and Goodreads), word of mouth only travels so fast. There is no shortage of indie books on the market, and we also have to compete with traditional publishers who have the financial muscle to take most of the spotlight. 
Indie authors are grabbing more and more attention, not all of it good. While I've read some amazing books from indie authors, I've also read some bad ones that look like first drafts. Unedited, I haven't been able to finish them. 
That's why it's so important to me to pay for professional editing and cover art. I want to put out the best book that I can, so readers aren't disappointed. Word of mouth is hard enough to generate without killing your chances with poorly edited prose. 
Perhaps you have had an experience where you haven't picked up a series until it was finished, or near completion. I know several times that has been the case for me, where I only discover an author after they have finished a series and I hear someone say, "You need to read this. The whole series was amazing!" 
With your help, I can finish this series quickly. I am committed to finishing it, but if it were left to me to raise the funds alone, it would take years to save up. 


A Hero's Birth is not the end of the story, but it will be my final crowd sourced project. Once this series is complete, my writing will have to sustain itself through sales. I will continue to write the next series, Strongblade Siblings, but it will only be published as I find the money to bring them out.

story:
¿Qué?

Cuando las islas hablan presenta un suceso insólito, tal vez imposible, sumergiéndonos de lleno en una novela ágil de tintes concernistas.

Un nuevo idioma parece haber nacido del interior de las islas Cíes. Son voces susurrantes y extrañas que perturban a quienes las escuchan y que obligan a preguntarse sobre su autenticidad y su origen, pero también sobre el porqué de su existencia.

Este es el hilo conductor de Cuando las islas hablen, que nos mantendrá en inmanente suspense, y que a su vez hilvanará la voz interior de quienes protagonizan una novela abierta, urdida desde una concepción política y alegórica de la narración, permeable a la reescritura crítica de los lectores.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Julio Fernández Peláez.

Autor de las novelas La risa del conejo, La losa baila el agua, K-mandra o la velocidad de los sueños y Gomas de borrar resplandores, es además un prolífico poeta y autor teatral con obras como Billetes transportan mensajes, Filamentos de tiempo, Manifiesto capitalista para destrozar corazones, Esgotar os ollos, O chapeu do indixente, Ananké, Julieta virtual y Cielo Naranja.

Su labor es bien conocida en el campo de la literatura experimental, donde ha recibido algunos reconocimientos como el “Premio Internacional de Poesía Experimental de la Diputación de Badajoz”. Pero también en el ámbito de la escena más vanguardista, donde sus textos han sido premiados en diferentes certámenes: "Cuenca a escena", “Teatro x la Justicia” o “El Espectáculo Teatral”.

Julio Fernández Peláez, os sorprenderá...

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 750€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Cuando las islas hablen que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Julio Fernández Peláez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
UPDATE: Project Successfully Completed!  You can find it on Amazon here: http://goo.gl/CCPRK

Short Summary

Several years ago my wife & I lost our full term baby as a stillbirth.  It destroyed us.  This is the book I wish I would have had walking out of the hospital to know what I was in for and what to expect moving forward.  

My dream is if money were not an issue I'd drive hospital to hospital and make sure no parents of a stillborn baby go home without this book in hand to help them with the tough journey ahead of them.  Stillbirths are devestating to families.  Those parents need help. This book delivers hope and helps take away some of the pain. 

Money is an obstacle and that's why I'm posting this project.  I need funds to get this book edited, have a cover designed, and the inside text formated properly for print.  

Every contribution helps, and is appreciated.  Getting this published is the first step in keeping this dream moving forward.  

If someone were to donate a very large sum of money I'd start working on the next stages of the dream, going hospital to hospital to get this in the hands of those who need it most.

Complete Summary 

Anyone who's lost a baby feels like they should have died instead and are a total failure of a parent.  Several years ago my wife and I lost our full term unborn baby for no explainable medical reason.  It completely devastated us.

My wife had access to many books and support groups. All of them were packed with information on how to deal with the feelings about your body after carrying a lost child.  As a man that information was not very helpful and I was left on my own to 'figure it out.'

Several years later my co-worker experienced the same loss in his family. After sharing the story of how I managed to live life again and how we had a healthy baby after our second baby died, it helped him cope.  Reliving the pain was difficult but the joy that came from helping another family was tremendous.

This is our story of how we worked through the pain.  It's a road-map for fathers helping their family to overcome this incredibly difficult experience.  It's the guide I wish I would have had while trying to pick up the pieces of our shattered life.

These important questions families have are all answered:

  • Why did God let this happen?

  • Is my baby in heaven?

  • Did this happen because I'm a horrible parent?

  • Can I take pictures of my baby?

  • Should I have a funeral?

  • How long will I feel like a failure?

  • Will I ever be able to live normally again?

  • Will people understand I want to be left alone?

  • How can I best support my wife?

  • What should I say to parents who have lost their baby?

  • How can I help someone going through this?

  • What should I do with the baby stuff?

  • When will we have sex again?

  • Should we have more kids?

  • How can I memorialize my child?

Every 20 minutes in the United States a baby is stillborn. There are twice as many stillbirths as deaths due to HIV/AIDS.  These families are sent home without a baby or a clue how to cope with what happened.  

This pain is unimaginable.  Your contribution will help bring hope to these families who are truly hurting.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how your contribution will used:

Editor - The story and advice are invaluable.  However, the text needs to be looked at by someone who is a talented writer to clean it up so my grammar and punctuation errors are not distracting to the reader.  A professional editor for this project costs $1,000.

Designer - Page layout, cover design, and all the little details that go into transforming a long electronic document into a printed book format needs someone who knows what they are doing.  It will cost $1000 to get the raw edited text into book format with a well designed cover.

Padding - Something always happens.  There's an extra $500 in padding budgeted in for those random shipping costs, a software program that needs to be purchased to do that one thing that you just can't do in the program you already have, the hidden fees that come out of no where, etc, etc. 

Your support of this book will help create a resource that's full of needed advice for hurting families and a positive experience for the reader.  

When your perk is delivered the book will feel and read professional.  As a donor, you deserve that.  The families out there who desperately need this information and are looking for answers deserve that.

If I don't reach my goal I'll publish the book in its current form and make a cover myself. This is not nearly as desirable as a professional editor and designer doing it but the contained message getting to the people who need it are what's most important.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a huge difference.  You're helping fund a resource that is badly needed for fathers on a subject that's rarely discussed.  Families of stillbirths are looking for answers.  There's virtually nothing out there for fathers.  Because of your donation they can know what to expect and what they can do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can’t contribute, I completely understand.  Please help get the word out and make some noise by:

  • Posting this on your Facebook page 
  • Emailing the link to someone whom you think would be interested in this

 

Sample of What You Are Supporting...

This is very painful to share, my wife and I wept a lot of tears that we had not shed in a while and it's not going to be easy to read. If you're hurting too much read about our story that's OK, you can skip this chapter. The main reason I'm sharing this is to let you know that there are others out there who feel your pain and to know that the advice I'm giving is based on real life experience.

With that being written, here's our story...

I was living in Japan for close to six years. Five years of that time were spent teaching English full time in two different very small rural towns in Southern Mie-Prefecture. Both of these towns we so rural that there was no expressways built to connect them to the rest of the bustling country most people think of when they think of the metropolises of Japan. The nearest movie theater was at least a 2 hour drive away. Even for most people who live in Mie-Prefecture, most never came as far South as I was living and when people in the nearest big city, Nagoya, heard where I lived they would look at me like I was a crazy mountain man. Mountains and ocean was really all there was, and a lot of great people in that area who had really big heats. During this time was when I met my wife, a sweet local girl who I had to beg over the course of a couple of years to go on a date with me. After I got the chance to show her my charm on some dates we later married and got started having a family right away.

During my time in Japan I was building up my language skills and studying to take a language proficiency exam that December. This was my original pie in the sky goal for me when I first came to Japan, to pass the highest level language proficiency exam.

The teaching employment contract I had expired in August of that year since then I had been studying at least twelve hours a day in preparation for this test.

We made a conscious family decision that I would not work, but rather study until the test was taken and live off of savings during this time. My wife, 20 month old daughter and I moved to a very cheap rental house in my wife's home town. This house was owned by a wealthy man who owned the sawmill located at the end of the street we lived on. It was a nice house for what we paid and one of the amenities was that in the summer time it was shaded by the mountain next to us every day at noon when the sun moved far enough across the sky to hide behind the mountain. I particularly liked that it had about fifteen wild monkeys that lived on the mountain and would cross the street in front of us carrying the baby monkeys on their backs regularly. My wife hated that they would toss our garbage everywhere but being from the midwest, I thought it was rather funny. We also had a very kind neighbor in front of us that was a retired coast guard officer and liked to grow flowers.

Our daughter was quite a handful, especially since my wife was pregnant. With her parents close by there was lots of help and everyone pitched in to help give me the time I needed to study quietly at home.

Our first daughter had been born fairly healthy but had needed to be delivered via C-section and was kept in an incubator for about a week. Between my Japanese skills and memory having faded since then it was basically something related to my wife's blood pressure so they scheduled a C-section and our daughter was born one week prior to the expected date. As far as I could tell it was nothing major, but in Japan they tend to require far more hospitalization for rather minor conditions. This practice was more than I had ever seen in the U.S.A.

Because of the circumstances regarding our first born daughter, the doctors and nurses took care to watch of any signs of abnormality in her second pregnancy. Every visit we left reassured that all signs were positive and we were going to have a healthy baby.

My wife was very active during her second pregnancy. Not only is she very active in general, but also had our daughter to chase around. During that time she always seemed to feel great and felt the baby kicking and moving in the womb. Happy wife, healthy daughter and a healthy newborn that was to be due December 1st. Even though I was unemployed and studying like crazy, all things were looking good and there was a lot to be happy about.

In mid-October my wife was cooking and told me she was a little worried because the baby hadn't moved since the night before. I blew it off because there seemed to be no end to the old wives tales going around that small town in regards to pregnancy. I told her to give it some time and if she still felt the same concern in a couple of hours we could go to the hospital.

Later that night we finished dinner and my wife said she felt like there had been some small movements but far less than normal so she was concerned. The local hospital had a hotline for expecting mothers to call if they had questions and she went ahead and called. They asked a couple of routine questions and sounded as skeptical as I felt. They let her know if she was really that concerned, she could come in and get checked out but everything was probably just fine. It was around 8 pm at night and my wife opted to go in and get checked out.

(Wife: The hospital was reluctant to have me come in. My town is small and they only have one OBGYN that the city hospital had to pay nearly double the average salary to have him move to our rural town. When the mothers come in they call the doctor after hours because they know he has to make a trip back to the hospital from home. Since he's the only OBGYN they try to let him rest whenever they can and not call him unless they really have to. They were not excited about me coming in to say the least. They tried to tell me it was natural for the baby not to move and that he was probably sleeping. I'm a worrier by nature so I forced the issue and told them I wanted to come in anyways and would be there shortly.)

I took her and my daughter in the car to the hospital and was relieved to see one of my friends on duty as the nurse on the floor. She told me most mothers get worried from time to time and it was probably nothing, and that they'd check her out and then have us on our way as soon as they could. I had a seat in the waiting room with my daughter while my my wife went in the back room to get checked out.

(Note: This is very common in Japan for the men to be completely separate from anything having to do with child birthing activities. While Japanese society is changing it does not welcome the treatment of birthing babies as a family event, but rather something women take care of and then show the men later. When I requested to be in the room when my first daughter was born I got a lot of strange looks from the hospital staff and my boss at the time thought I was an idiot for requesting the day off to be with my wife at the hospital when my daughter was to be born and rejected my request completely. I only share this to bring cultural context to the events.)

(Wife: The Nurse took me into the patient room and they put on a device to listen to the baby's heart beat. After about five minutes of monitoring the baby they told me everything was all right. There was a heartbeat and it sounded normal. She smiled at me and told me that everything was OK and there was nothing to worry about, I was just being an overly concerned mother. Less than a minute later she ran over and put an oxygen mask on me and told me she was calling the doctor right away.)

I was in the waiting room with our daughter when the whirlwind started. I had no idea the ride I was in for, and it's only through God's grace and people coming by my side that I was able to make it through what would be the worst period of my life that I could ever remember.

My friend, the nurse, came back and told me it would probably be best if I had the grandparents watch our daughter. I don't remember exactly what happened next but I do remember meeting my in-laws in the parking lot and them basically running with me up to the fifth floor where my wife was waiting.

I felt like I was having an out-of-body experience because the exchange between the Doctor, my in-laws, and I was surreal. While my Japanese was sharp it was hard to follow the vagueness of the Doctor, the strong local dialect of my father-in-law, and keeping up with my mother-in-law's questions, and my daughter squirming around at the same time.

What I thought I had heard was that it was going to be a choice between my wife and my unborn son living. That totally blew me away and I was shell shocked, I think my whole mental capacity shut down once I thought I had heard that. My father-in-law seemed pretty passionate about one side of this argument and my mother-in-law's opinion wasn't nearly as firm but seemed to be agreeing with her husband's.

I don't know how long this went on (it was probably about 2 or 3 minutes) when I finally said firmly for everyone to just stop. I asked if it was between my wife and the baby and that is when everyone looked at me realizing I didn't understand what was going on.

The doctor looked at the ground. My father-in-law looked like he didn't know what to say. My mother-in-law spoke slowly and clearly and explained that there was something wrong with the baby. The baby was going to die and they needed to do something quickly to have any chance at preventing this from happening. They didn't know exactly what was wrong, but, there were two options: One option was to put my wife in an ambulance and drive her to a major hospital (about 2 hours away) where they had all the proper medical equipment to save babies. The problem with this was that the Doctor was sure the baby would die before the ambulance arrived at the hospital. The other option was to perform a C-section immediately and pull the baby out and do whatever they could do to try to save my baby, but since they didn't have all the proper medical equipment at that hospital the chances of it surviving was not good and the baby would probably die.

What a wonderful set of options I remember thinking to myself while everything starting turning into a blur.  

 

Please help by contributing today.

UPDATE: Project Successfully Completed!  You can find it on Amazon here: http://goo.gl/CCPRK
Short Summary
Several years ago my wife & I lost our full term baby as a stillbirth.  It destroyed us.  This is the book I wish I would have had walking out of the hospital to know what I was in for and what to expect moving forward.  
My dream is if money were not an issue I'd drive hospital to hospital and make sure no parents of a stillborn baby go home without this book in hand to help them with the tough journey ahead of them.  Stillbirths are devestating to families.  Those parents need help. This book delivers hope and helps take away some of the pain. 
Money is an obstacle and that's why I'm posting this project.  I need funds to get this book edited, have a cover designed, and the inside text formated properly for print.  
Every contribution helps, and is appreciated.  Getting this published is the first step in keeping this dream moving forward.  
If someone were to donate a very large sum of money I'd start working on the next stages of the dream, going hospital to hospital to get this in the hands of those who need it most. 
Complete Summary 
Anyone who's lost a baby feels like they should have died instead and are a total failure of a parent.  Several years ago my wife and I lost our full term unborn baby for no explainable medical reason.  It completely devastated us.
My wife had access to many books and support groups. All of them were packed with information on how to deal with the feelings about your body after carrying a lost child.  As a man that information was not very helpful and I was left on my own to 'figure it out.'
Several years later my co-worker experienced the same loss in his family. After sharing the story of how I managed to live life again and how we had a healthy baby after our second baby died, it helped him cope.  Reliving the pain was difficult but the joy that came from helping another family was tremendous.
This is our story of how we worked through the pain.  It's a road-map for fathers helping their family to overcome this incredibly difficult experience.  It's the guide I wish I would have had while trying to pick up the pieces of our shattered life.
These important questions families have are all answered:


Why did God let this happen?


Is my baby in heaven?


Did this happen because I'm a horrible parent?


Can I take pictures of my baby?


Should I have a funeral?


How long will I feel like a failure?


Will I ever be able to live normally again?


Will people understand I want to be left alone?


How can I best support my wife?


What should I say to parents who have lost their baby?


How can I help someone going through this?


What should I do with the baby stuff?


When will we have sex again?


Should we have more kids?


How can I memorialize my child?

Every 20 minutes in the United States a baby is stillborn. There are twice as many stillbirths as deaths due to HIV/AIDS.  These families are sent home without a baby or a clue how to cope with what happened.  
This pain is unimaginable.  Your contribution will help bring hope to these families who are truly hurting.
What We Need & What You Get
Here's how your contribution will used:
Editor - The story and advice are invaluable.  However, the text needs to be looked at by someone who is a talented writer to clean it up so my grammar and punctuation errors are not distracting to the reader.  A professional editor for this project costs $1,000.
Designer - Page layout, cover design, and all the little details that go into transforming a long electronic document into a printed book format needs someone who knows what they are doing.  It will cost $1000 to get the raw edited text into book format with a well designed cover.
Padding - Something always happens.  There's an extra $500 in padding budgeted in for those random shipping costs, a software program that needs to be purchased to do that one thing that you just can't do in the program you already have, the hidden fees that come out of no where, etc, etc. 
Your support of this book will help create a resource that's full of needed advice for hurting families and a positive experience for the reader.  
When your perk is delivered the book will feel and read professional.  As a donor, you deserve that.  The families out there who desperately need this information and are looking for answers deserve that.
If I don't reach my goal I'll publish the book in its current form and make a cover myself. This is not nearly as desirable as a professional editor and designer doing it but the contained message getting to the people who need it are what's most important.
The Impact
Your contribution will make a huge difference.  You're helping fund a resource that is badly needed for fathers on a subject that's rarely discussed.  Families of stillbirths are looking for answers.  There's virtually nothing out there for fathers.  Because of your donation they can know what to expect and what they can do.
Other Ways You Can Help
Sometimes you just can’t contribute, I completely understand.  Please help get the word out and make some noise by:

Posting this on your Facebook page 
Emailing the link to someone whom you think would be interested in this
 
Sample of What You Are Supporting...
This is very painful to share, my wife and I wept a lot of tears that we had not shed in a while and it's not going to be easy to read. If you're hurting too much read about our story that's OK, you can skip this chapter. The main reason I'm sharing this is to let you know that there are others out there who feel your pain and to know that the advice I'm giving is based on real life experience.

Hi, my name is Erik. I'm vegan (well, mostly). Here's my dream...

What makes every food better? Bacon. Well, as a vegan, that's not an option. And even if you're not vegan, bacon shouldn't always be an option, unless you don't mind clogged arteries! So, what's the vegan equivalent to bacon? What makes every food better? Avocado! Vegan bacon!
I fell in love with Avocado almost 2 years ago, after inadvertently converting to a mostly vegan diet. It's delicious, healthy, full of good fats and flavor! 
I want to share my love of this green fruit with the world! 
Your contributions will help me self-publish an amazing photo-filled cookbook that is jam-packed with amazing avocado recipes! Everything from the ever-popular guacamole to fried avocado bites to vegetarian avocado sushi rolls.
Help me spread the word about every vegan's favorite food!

Why I need your help...

I have the recipes, and I have the camera to take great photos of them. Now I just need a little bit of money to get self-published and start selling the books at local farmers markets and health food stores.

If you donate, not only will you help me realize a dream of mine, but you'll get early access to this great cookbook via an electronic version. If you donate more, I've got designs for some cool swag ("avocado > bacon" T-shirts and the like). Be a true hipster and get on the avocado bus before everyone else does! And get your " 'cado is better than bacon" swag to show you were on the ground floor of this revolution!

If I don't get enough funds, I'll continue with the book, but might not be able to print physical copies, and it may remain a digital book for some time.

The Impact

People need to eat healthier. People are cutting out all fats from their diets, but not recognizing the good fats they need. Fats like you find in avocado. Giving up bacon for avocado will also have an impact on the world we live in, reducing meat consumption/production which is causing global climate change. Once you realize there's a plant out there as delicious as bacon, it's hard to rationalize hurting your heart and the planet for those greasy strips of breakfast joy.

Help me out if you can by donating. If you can't afford it, help my campaign by spreading the word. The word is avocado, BTW! :)
