story:
BIOSKETCH: MICHAEL HOLLOWAY KING, MD

I have had four decades of experience across a broad spectrum of healthcare and communication skills. I graduated from Harvard College (1975) and Harvard Medical School (1980). In college, I focused on social, developmental, cross-cultural, and neuropsychology–– especially bio-personality and consciousness. I then pursued studies in neuropsychiatry and international public health in medical school.

Subsequently, I specialized in mind-body psychotherapy in my alternative medical practice, and also worked in virtually every aspect of conventional primary care. I am the first physician to address the topic of shame and social oppression, pinpoint their psychobiological roots, and devise a treatment program for their toxic ramifications, which effectively advances the biomedical sciences by 20-50 years

I became an expert in advanced reading and writing technology, listening skills, and public speaking as a communications skills trainer. I have been a national lecturer on stress management and frequent radio show guest and host. I am rapidly earning a reputation as a brilliant writer since publishing “Hide and Play Dead” in August 2013. “Shame on You!” will be my second published work, with more sequels waiting the propitious moment to be released.

_________________________________________________________

THE BRAIN-FREEING AND PARADIGM-SHIFTING PROJECT

There has never been a project of this magnitude and urgency.

About three years ago I made a visionary decision to take on a tremendously challenging, far-reaching and potentially risky project to implement my discoveries in carefully designed stages, even knowing that the repercussions of doing so would threaten and challenge the corporate elite, transform academia, revise our social institutions, and probably accelerate the evolutionary stage of our species.

I devised a bold stepwise strategy beginning with the first of a series of books that are capable of freeing the reader from the “mind cap” of social oppression and its correlates, and quickly leading up to the application of powerful, but non-invasive and safe, technological inventions to directly free the human brain from oppressive and traumatic imprints— as well as advance the curative scope of modern medicine by several decades.

Here is a partial list of what this project represents and the essence of what you will help me achieve:

  • The creation of riveting and emotionally compelling literary masterpieces…
  • The invention of a new writing technology, advancing literary “healing” far beyond the limitations of self-help books…
  • The début of a powerful therapy system to repel the toxic effects of oppression…
  • The disclosure of hundreds of first-ever revelations that revise our collective cultural history…
  • The full depiction of the true nature of shame, abuse, trauma and social oppression…
  • The long-awaited treatise that will change the social and political sciences…
  • The acceleration of the course of social engineering, with an impact upon all aspects of life— from childrearing to adult relationships, from the meaning of life to death with dignity…
  • The clearest path to resist social inequity and curb the core of human suffering…
  • The consolidation of a peaceful resistance movement against the agenda of the corporate elite: a two-class society, elimination of our democratic government, and neoslavery of the working class…
  • The preliminary stage to introduce fully researched and tested technological inventions that not only resolve trauma and repel oppression, but also advance the curative power of medicine and psychiatry by several decades, and also accelerate the evolution of the human brain…
  • The retrieval of innate psychic skills, inherent in our survival instincts, which offer the experience of expanded awareness and ecstatic states, and possibly leading to a spiritual renaissance…

_________________________________________________________

“Shame on You!” is a summary of social oppression in America. In our majority minority nation, most people have experienced some form of rejection or abuse— sometimes in the workplace, at home, or within a social institution.

My work teaches people to recognize toxic shame and abuse, reverse or repel trauma and oppression, and re-invoke the state of blissful love, to then engage with loving and trustworthy peers. But it is difficult to do this when our brains have been warped by childrearing practices, educational systems, corporate indoctrination, and institutional propaganda. To get off the radar screen of human predators, and to quickly get out of an abusive or exploitative situation, are critical for survival.

Yet it is nearly impossible after the age of twenty-five to stay creative, centered, focused and loving as one struggles to protect his or her integrity and boundaries. With increasing age and relentless stress, the human brain becomes increasingly imbalanced: Cynicism, prejudice, self-doubt, compulsions, restricted social lives, remorse, and postponed gratification of essential human needs, tend to dominate most individual’s consciousness.

_________________________________________________________

GOALS AND PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT

As a duet, the first two books are carefully constructed to accomplish many literary, academic, sociopolitical and visionary goals. In essence, “Hide and Play Dead” is an extraordinary enticement, a remarkable and timely “hook”, that subtly opens the dialectic about freedom and slavery and promises to show the reader how to attain a full knowledge about the nature of oppression and a full training in how to also achieve liberation in this sequel, “Shame on You!” Both books dare to free readers from oppressive imprints using advanced neuropsychological principles applied to the process of reading.

Whatever may have been left dangling, unclear or unconscious in “Hide and Play Dead”, where the emphasis is on attaining a strong emotional bond with the reader and to impact the limbic system of the human brain, will be spelled out, made clear and brought into full consciousness with detailed explanations in “Shame on You!” The new book elaborates a treatise, demonstrates somatic principles by “exercises”, and includes an expanded range of examples, such as case histories and further personal narratives.

“Shame on You” will highlight and critique many sensitive and thorny social issues related to oppression and clearly set forth a new paradigm for the social sciences with graphic explanations in explicit text that define the "shame, abuse, trauma and oppression" paradigm from developmental and bio-psychological angles. It will present the technology of shame, abuse, and trauma desensitization, and the “cure” for oppression.

This second book is 90% completed and will be more academic than my first book, but also more humorous in a reader-friendly way. It will include a wider and more scathing social critique of sensitive issues related to oppression. I will reveal pioneer discoveries about the nature of human predation, and demonstrate a variety of treatments for social oppression that can be implemented on a mass scale. 

I truly believe that the ultimate agenda of attaining liberation from oppression is the most worthy cause I could aspire to have in my lifetime. There are many reasons to resist the corporate elite’s final conquest, which may well lead to the demise of American democracy, a two-class society, and systematic social oppression. 

The "Occupy Wall Street", the "99% Movement", the rift in Congress and the resurgence of racism seen during the last election, the deepening schism of wealth, and lack of transparency in government, make this work into a banner or a slogan about self-liberation from the reinstitution of subtle, but devastating, mass enslavement. The concept of neoslavery helps unify and galvanize the disparate elements of a populist resistance to this crisis that emerged in the past two presidential elections.

I will need $75,000 funding to take the project to the next level. This critical mission depends on your generosity.

  • Finishing, editing, and publishing "Shame on You!"...
  • Website up-grading, blogging, and mailing the book with customized cover letters to hundreds of key individuals in academia, politics, medicine, organized labor, spiritual groups, watchdog agencies, and the media... 
  • Book promotion by publicity campaigns, media appearances, and the cost of both a local and a national lecture tour...
  • Basic living expenses as I devote my full energy to the project…

I will be frugal, with the hope that any residual funds can be used to cement the next stages of the project:

  • Writing a "workbook" to be distributed to New Age churches, aficionados of psychology and technology, and social activist groups (combined with sample brain-freeing devices)...
  • Writing a professional guidebook for psychologists, therapists, social engineers, and physicians...
  • Designing and patenting neuro-stimulator and, in some instances, magnetic deregulator devices, along with several other essential products that restore balance to the most evolved part of the human brain: the prefrontal lobes. 

NOTE: 

Copious research and clinical studies have proved that this technology is safe, non-invasive, extremely effective, and easy to use. The process is completely different from electroconvulsive therapy (ECT or shock therapies). A BRAIN-FREEING AND PARADIGM-SHIFTING PROJECT

“Hide and Play Dead” and “Shame on You!” are the Trojan horse of literature. Some readers will just appreciate the books as thrilling adventure stories with psychological intrigue, or masterpieces of progressive literature and self-help methodologies.

On the surface of “Hide and Play Dead”…

  • The novel tells the true story of my remarkable ancestry and how I overcame a lifetime of unimaginable trauma.
  • It is a family saga about the passage of slave-based behaviors across generations, long after Emancipation.
  • It is a “memoir with a message”: Democracy is close to extinction and slavery is currently being reinstituted in America on a mass scale.

  • These are the first books ever written that reveal a shocking treatise about the core of human suffering: the full nature of shame, trauma, abuse and social oppression.
  • I introduce my therapy system, developed over a period of thirty years, to reverse oppression and desensitize shame by means of a new writing technology, which is embedded within the book’s construction and invisible to the reader’s conscious awareness— with conscious somatic de-programming exercises added in the second book.
  • Simply put: Reading the books changes the brain structure of the reader from any oppressive or traumatic imprints to altruistic or loving social engagement or non-violent social activism.

In short, the entire project will:

  • Revise American and African-American history…
  • Change the core paradigms of the social and political sciences…
  • Advance the field of medicine and the treatment of trauma by two or three decades…
  • Accelerate social engineering by influencing every major institution, including childrearing practices…
  • Galvanize an empowered resistance movement to the corporate elite’s schemes to thwart democracy and institute a feudal two-class society of omnipotent rulers and powerless slaves…

This is the literary strategy and brain-freeing technology that Martin Luther King would have dreamt of.

BIOSKETCH: MICHAEL HOLLOWAY KING, MD
I have had four decades of experience across a broad
spectrum of healthcare and communication skills. I graduated from Harvard
College (1975) and Harvard Medical School (1980). In college, I focused on
social, developmental, cross-cultural, and neuropsychology–– especially
bio-personality and consciousness. I then pursued studies in neuropsychiatry
and international public health in medical school.
Subsequently, I specialized in mind-body psychotherapy
in my alternative medical practice, and also worked in virtually every
aspect of conventional primary care. I am the first physician to address
the topic of shame and social oppression, pinpoint their psychobiological
roots, and devise a treatment program for their toxic ramifications, which effectively
advances the biomedical sciences by 20-50 years
I became an expert in advanced reading and writing
technology, listening skills, and public speaking as a communications skills
trainer. I have been a national lecturer on stress management and frequent
radio show guest and host. I am rapidly earning a reputation as a brilliant
writer since publishing “Hide and Play Dead” in August 2013. “Shame on You!”
will be my second published work, with more sequels waiting the
propitious moment to be released.
_________________________________________________________
THE BRAIN-FREEING AND PARADIGM-SHIFTING PROJECT
There has never been a project of this magnitude
and urgency.
About three years ago I made a visionary decision to
take on a tremendously challenging, far-reaching and potentially risky project
to implement my discoveries in carefully designed stages, even knowing that the
repercussions of doing so would threaten and challenge the corporate elite,
transform academia, revise our social institutions, and probably accelerate the
evolutionary stage of our species.
I devised a bold stepwise strategy beginning with the
first of a series of books that are capable of freeing the reader from the
“mind cap” of social oppression and its correlates, and quickly leading up to
the application of powerful, but non-invasive and safe, technological
inventions to directly free the human brain from oppressive and traumatic
imprints— as well as advance the curative scope of modern medicine by several
decades.
Here is a partial list of what this project represents
and the essence of what you will help me achieve:


The creation of riveting and emotionally compelling
literary masterpieces…


The invention of a new writing technology, advancing
literary “healing” far beyond the limitations of self-help books…


The début of a powerful therapy system to repel the
toxic effects of oppression…


The disclosure of hundreds of first-ever revelations
that revise our collective cultural history…


The full depiction of the true nature of shame, abuse,
trauma and social oppression…


The long-awaited treatise that will change the social
and political sciences…


The acceleration of the course of social engineering,
with an impact upon all aspects of life— from childrearing to adult relationships,
from the meaning of life to death with dignity…


The clearest path to resist social inequity and curb the
core of human suffering…


The consolidation of a peaceful resistance movement
against the agenda of the corporate elite: a two-class society, elimination of
our democratic government, and neoslavery of the working class…


The preliminary stage to introduce fully researched and
tested technological inventions that not only resolve trauma and repel
oppression, but also advance the curative power of medicine and psychiatry by
several decades, and also accelerate the evolution of the human brain…


The retrieval of innate psychic skills, inherent in our
survival instincts, which offer the experience of expanded awareness and
ecstatic states, and possibly leading to a spiritual renaissance…


_________________________________________________________
“Shame on You!” is a summary of social oppression in
America. In our majority minority nation, most people have experienced
some form of rejection or abuse— sometimes in the workplace, at home, or within
a social institution.
My work teaches people to recognize toxic shame and
abuse, reverse or repel trauma and oppression, and re-invoke the state of
blissful love, to then engage with loving and trustworthy peers. But it is
difficult to do this when our brains have been warped by childrearing
practices, educational systems, corporate indoctrination, and institutional
propaganda. To get off the radar screen of human predators, and to quickly get
out of an abusive or exploitative situation, are critical for survival.
Yet it is nearly impossible after the age of twenty-five
to stay creative, centered, focused and loving as one struggles to protect his
or her integrity and boundaries. With increasing age and relentless
stress, the human brain becomes increasingly imbalanced: Cynicism,
prejudice, self-doubt, compulsions, restricted social lives, remorse, and
postponed gratification of essential human needs, tend to dominate most
individual’s consciousness.

story:
This Campaign…

…will support marketing and promotion for a just-published book that has already proven its life-changing – even life-saving – potential among readers.

With an intimidating twist, War Baby instantly gets in the reader’s face by asking how a life could go so awry that a bright and generous upbringing would later trigger thoughts of  slamming a nine-millimeter Luger bullet through one’s temporal lobe.

On that fulcrum, War Baby turns, as a hopeful upbringing goes off the tracks to an insane slow slog into active alcoholism, the Luger ever calling.

With drama, humor, and pathos, I tell my story, seeking to regain Dante Alighieri’s “path that does not stray.” Played out scenically and with verve, it reconciles a nearly doomed mid-life journey to one of redemption and resolution.

To tell this story broadly, I need your help. Well-received locally, War Baby now cries out for expanded marketing. Be a supporter and collaborator with me as I leverage both social media and conventional PR and advertising opportunities to get this book’s message out regionally and beyond.

About Me…

I've always loved to write. So, it was natural to begin my professional life as a daily news reporter. That led to 30+ years in corporate communications. And now I work independently as a writer, editor, and publicist. But I came dangerously close to not making it this far. War Baby shows why, in the hope that others can dodge the bullet as I did during some truly frightening  times.

Many seek but not all find the way to recovery; but to those who do seek, it is to them I write in the hope that they will hear what I heard and see what I saw. I invite you to join me in telling this story to a needy world.

Next Steps and How You Can Help

Please consider joining me in an expanded marketing effort. Your help and readership can make a big difference. War Baby is available now through Amazon.com as a Kindle Direct e-book and as a traditional book produced by Amazon’s print-on-demand affiliate, Create Space. I have absorbed costs of the book’s cover creation and art direction as well as many of the other costs of press-prepping War Baby. I now seek supporters for not only the nuts and bolts of continuing production and marketing but to organize fundraisers to benefit non-profits that help folks in need find professional solutions for alcohol and drug addiction. Other funding needs include:

  • Expand and professionalize Web-based promotion of War Baby.
  • Advertise through SEO initiatives.
  • Publicize through traditional media, leveraging electronic distribution through services such as PRNewswire and WebWire.
  • Promote interviews and reviews as well as in-person book signings and speaking opportunities.

So that’s the mission now – one I am urged to pursue as broadly as possible, because, as one of my writers' group friends put it: “If one person’s life is spared the tragedy of a death by chemical dependency, the effort will have been worth it.”

Support and Collaborate

You will be considered a part of this goal. You will be both a supporter and a collaborator, for some of you will share stories that we can incorporate on our website...and, I hope, lead to a follow-up book at the appropriate time.

Please see my levels of  donation and consider one of them. And pass it on, if you think it worthy. Even if you are unable to support War Baby financially, please let others know that it is dedicated to "The Seekers" for a reason. For those who seek shall find.

Most of all…thank you for reading this and your kind consideration in so doing.

story:
Ducky Needs You!

Every Sunday at 7:00 ET fans of a dog named Ducky head over to read the newest conversation between him and his Daddy at Well That's Just Ducky! For four years Ducky and his dad have discussed matters of life and death, love and loss, hope and despair, cats and dogs, and why dinner is late again. Funny and at times poignant, the conversations have connected with animal lovers around the world. 

After much encouragement from Ducky fans, he and his daddy are releasing a self published book in which new conversations and favorite ones from the last few years are blended together to tell the story of one important year in their lives together. Short enough to finish in one sitting, but broken up in a way that will allow it to be enjoyed in bite sized moments, and written in a way sure to please both existing fans and first time readers, the book will include the charming, candid, full color photos of Ducky that always accompany his posts. 

Here's How You Can Help

Ducky and his daddy are trying to keep things lean and mean, but still there are expenses.

  • We're hoping to raise $1000 with this campaign. The money will be used to cover the expenses associated with things like getting an ISBN, designing a cover, ordering proofs, distributing copies, and other unplanned expenses that may arise when a first time author and his dog try to self publish a book and suddenly realize they can't do it all on their own! If we end up raising more than we need we will use the extra money for marketing and increasing Ducky's web presence and, if the book is well received, future published works.
  • Contributors will qualify for a variety of perks based on their level of contribution including promotion on "Well, That's Just Ducky", autographed copies, magnets, pins, and even Ducky posts about the contributor!  
  • If we don't make our goal, we will still publish, but we may not be able to hit our deadline of having the book available for the 2014 holiday season and may not be able to get copies in the hands of as many influencers as we might like. But every little bit helps, so please consider giving what you can fit within your budget.

Help Ducky Make People Happy!

Ducky isn't solving the big problems of the world. But his posts make people happy, help people remember the impact they have on the world around them, and remind us all to tell the people who matter to us, "I love you," every day. We hope you'll help us help Ducky do that for a few more people around the world.

But there are other things you can do too!

If now is not the right time to contribute, we understand. We still hope you'll visit us at Well That's Just Ducky every week for a little smile. And whether you can contribute or not, we hope you'll help get the word out!

  • Like our Facebook page!
  • If you're on tumblr, follow us and reblog us to the high heavens!
  • Keep your eyes on our shop for goodies!
  • When the book is released, we hope you'll consider buying a copy. Or seven (seven copies = one dog copy)
  • And use the Indiegogo share tools to let other folks know you think they might want to consider tossing a few sheckels towards the Duck!

No matter what, thanks for reading and considering! Ducky loves you!

story:
This is our second campaign, we have been on the trail now since November 4th 2013 and have ridden our mules from San Jose del Cabo to Rancho Meling east of Ensanada-over 700 miles so far.  But we need help finishing the trail. We will ride the last miles over the next three weeks. Here's our story:

WILDERNESS. HISTORY. ADVENTURE!

In 1963, a handful of intrepid explorers mounted mules in the border town of Tecate, Baja California, Mexico. For six months they rode south, 1000 miles through the often roadless desert  of the Baja Peninsula. Two of the original ten riders arrived. Along the way they were chased by Federales and had a mountain lion eat one of their mules. They lived through temperature extremes and water shortages. They collected and cataloged plants new to science. They filmed, photographed and journalled. Yet they agreed not to publish. To date, only one article has been written about this "long ride".  50 years later, this amazing adventure-The Meling Expedition-is being ridden again, this time as La Mula Mil (The Mule 1000).

Under the consult and blessing of three of the surviving original riders: Andy Meling, Joanne Alford and Eve Ewing, three modern riders: Trudi Angell, Olivia Angell and Leslie Pringle are travelling the route in reverse, riding along the El Camino Real and as many of the other original trails as possible. There are many parallels and as in the first ride, there is a  "20 something", a photographer and at times a botanist. Unlike the first expedition, we have added riders instead of having them leave! Teddi Montes is a welcome addition to the team. Don Natcho Chiapa has also been sharing the trail, sometimes on his own and sometimes side by side with us. 

Along the way we have been photographing, filming, Facebooking, Tweeting and blogging.  We are already working on a large, hardcover photography book about both our adventure and the Meling Expedition. You'll see the land and her people as they were then and now.

We have asked for $1500. but we actually need about $4000. to finish the ride. There are the obvious costs such as food and occasional accommodations, but also vehicle expenses when we hire ranchers to help move our gear and give the pack animals a rest, guiding fees to local "guias", donations to rural families who feed us, sometimes sharing their meagre resources. Our mules need hay almost every day now as natural forage is so scarce and they will need transportation back to their "homes"  near Loreto, half-way down the peninsula.

  • Any excess funds will be divided as follows: 15% to our three favourite NGOs   (non-profit associations), Coins for Classrooms, Living Roots Baja and Mujeres del Golfo.

    • to employ the inhabitants of the Baja region

    Muchas Gracias!

This is our second campaign, we have been on the trail now since November 4th 2013 and have ridden our mules from San Jose del Cabo to Rancho Meling east of Ensanada-over 700 miles so far.  But we need help finishing the trail. We will ride the last miles over the next three weeks. Here's our story:
WILDERNESS. HISTORY. ADVENTURE!

In 1963, a handful of intrepid explorers mounted mules in the border town of Tecate, Baja California, Mexico. For six months they rode south, 1000 miles through the often roadless desert  of the Baja Peninsula. Two of the original ten riders arrived. Along the way they were chased by Federales and had a mountain lion eat one of their mules. They lived through temperature extremes and water shortages. They collected and cataloged plants new to science. They filmed, photographed and journalled. Yet they agreed not to publish. To date, only one article has been written about this "long ride".  50 years later, this amazing adventure-The Meling Expedition-is being ridden again, this time as La Mula Mil (The Mule 1000).

Under the consult and blessing of three of the surviving original riders: Andy Meling, Joanne Alford and Eve Ewing, three modern riders: Trudi Angell, Olivia Angell and Leslie Pringle are travelling the route in reverse, riding along the El Camino Real and as many of the other original trails as possible. story:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Le comité Solid'ère, un comité caritatif sensible aux enjeux humanitaires à Montréal, avait dans le passé effectué des collectes de fonds pour la Syrie et dont les efforts ont aboutis à 15 000$ de dons. 

La ligue humanitaire Pour Une Syrie Libre en a été l'heureux bénéficiaire et a pu grâce à ces dons, répondre aux besoins urgents d'une population accablée et découragée par l'instabilité, l'insécurité, la terreur permanente et l'avenir incertain qui lui est réservé. Aujourd'hui, alors que d'autres campagnes sont menées en parallèle, nous pensons à ces populations nécessiteuses qui sont victimes des conséquences terrifiantes d'incessants bombardements et qui sont paralysés par la peur et par un dénuement total.

Notre projet est de réussir, grâce au bon cœur généreux de tous, à récolter 2500$ pour que de grandes familles puissent partager des moments de joie en oubliant, ne serait-ce qu'un instant, les événements malheureux qui rythment leur quotidien.

Ce projet permettra de nourrir, de soigner, de vêtir et de réconforter des familles entières qui luttent pour se maintenir en vie et en santé. 

Ce projet, c'est montrer à ce peuple l'étendue de notre fraternité et de notre solidarité à des kilomètres de chez eux. C'est plus qu'un don, c'est leur envoyer des ondes de joie et d'espoir.

En contribuant à la grandeur de vos moyens, vous tracez des sourires sur des visages. 

Y-a-t-il un sentiment plus apaisant que celui de faire le bonheur des autres? 

Le bonheur, c'est vous qui le créez.

  • L'association LIGUE HUMANITAIRE POUR UNE SYRIE LIBRE a déjà perdu un membre brave de son équipe et continue malgré les risques et en toute circonstance, de déployer ses héros dans les zones les plus périlleuses pour faire parvenir vos dons. 
  • Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, l'argent sera envoyé à la même ONG : LIGUE HUMANITAIRE POUR UNE SYRIE LIBRE, qui en fera usage en prenant compte des besoins des civils qui habitent les zones de conflits.

Soyez un acteur du changement.

  • Le succès de notre ancienne campagne pour la Syrie qui nous a permis de récolter 15 000$ en moins de 4 mois, pour cette même ONG qui est plus que transparente, nous pousse à nous engager encore une fois au service du peuple syrien.

    Incapables d'aider ? C'est FAUX.

    Vous voulez aider, mais les moyens vous manquent ? Un dollar c'est déjà une part du budget! 

    • Vous pouvez aussi demander aux gens que vous connaissez de faire leur part et de penser à l'impact énorme qu'ils auront sur une famille.
    • Contactez-nous: Comité Solid'ère  www.facebook.com/comitesolidereboisdeboulogne et faites passer le message !

    Soyez le changement que vous voulez voir dans ce monde.

story:
The Journal of Roman Military Equipment Studies

Introduction

My name is Mike Bishop and I am the founding editor of the Journal of Roman Military Equipment Studies (JRMES). This campaign aims to publish two volumes of the journal (14/15 at the end of April 2015 and 16 at the end of July 2015). At the same time, Arma, the Newsletter of the Roman Military Equipment Conference will be restarted. These events will herald the creation of the Association of Roman Military Equipment Studies (ARMES) to act as publisher for future volumes of the journal and coordinator for future Roman Military Equipment Conferences (ROMECs). By contributing to the campaign, anybody with an interest in Roman military equipment can help secure a future for both the journal and the newsletter.

Background and the target

The video provides some detail of the background to the foundation of JRMES.

Whilst this campaign is specifically aimed at raising funds to print volumes 14/15 and 16 of the Journal of Roman Military Equipment Studies, it will lay the foundations for the establishment of a learned or academic society to take over publication in the future and enable contributors to become subscribers, should they wish to do so, from 2016 onwards.

Volume 14/15 is a general issue with a range of papers (including the siege of Pompeii, lorica segmentata, scale armour, swords, the manufacture of caltrops, and Late Roman equipment in Britain), whilst 16 contains papers from ROMEC XV held in Budapest in 2005 on the theme The Enemies of Rome.

The funding target (£6,000) is designed to allow the printing of a minimum of 200 copies of both volumes 14/15 and 16 which could be achieved with 200 Legionarius or 400 Eques subscriptions (or any combination of the two). That figure of 200 copies is important because of the printing costs (which paradoxically spiral upwards as the number printed reduces: in other words, the unit cost increases) and the need to provide paper journals for libraries (and all others who want it).

A range of perks are outlined below, offering both digital and physical (dead-tree) versions of the journal and newsletter. It is of course possible to combine perks by adding (for example) Legionarius (paper journals and PDF newsletter) with Auxiliarius (paper newsletter), which is especially useful if you prefer dead-tree versions of everything.

Open access

In addition to providing digital options for current volumes,JRMES will now be pursuing an Open Access policy whereby, 5 years after publication, all content from the journal and newsletter will be released as PDFs under a Creative Commons licence. Back issues (from volume 1 onwards) will gradually be made available over a period of time to bring them up to date (conversion of older issues takes a lot of time and effort).

The perks

The perks on offer are as follows:

Calo

Digital newsletter only [2 PDF issues of Arma]

Auxiliarius

Paper newsletter only [2 issues of Arma]

Eques

Digital subscription [PDF journals, 2 PDF issues of Arma]

Legionarius

Full subscription [paper and PDF journals 14/15 and 16, 2 PDF issues of Arma]

Praefectus

Full subscription [paper and PDF journals 14/15 and 16, 2 PDF issues of Arma]

plus listing as founder member in journal

Legatus legionis

Full subscription [paper and PDF journals 14/15 and 16, 2 paper and PDF issues of Arma]

plus listing as founder member in journal

plus paper journals signed by editorial committee

Legatus Augusti pro praetore

Full subscription [paper and PDF journals 14/15 and 16, 2 paper and PDF issues of Arma]

plus listing as founder member in journal

plus paper journals signed by editorial committee

plus dinner with the editor of JRMES at Claridges (travel to and from your responsibility).

What happens if the campaign does not reach its target?

That’s the end of JRMES, basically.

This has to be an all-or-nothing campaign. As print-runs decrease in size, so unit costs increase, and current printing technology means that both offset-litho and digital printing still dictate a minimum print-run of 200 to make the perks affordable. This may change in the future; in years to come, if print-on-demand (POD) technology continues to improve (and decrease in cost) the possibility exists that digital will become the normal type of subscription but with an option for an affordable POD version as an addition to the subscription. We are not there yet, so we must work with what we have: offset-litho printing for dead-tree journals and PDF for digital.

As a contributor, you have the chance to be directly involved in securing the future for the Journal of Roman Military Equipment Studies and establishing an association dedicated to furthering the study of a subject that matters to you. Make a difference: bring back JRMES!

Don’t want to part with cash but still want to help?

You can still help JRMES even if you can’t afford to contribute financially. Share our campaign through social media or email details to somebody who might be interested. All help is most welcome and truly appreciated.

story:
You might be wondering just who I am, why you should care and why you should even consider donating to my cause.  My name is Sean Smith, I am twenty five years old and I have a story.


I was born with a disability called Osteogenesis Imperfecta, a brittle bone disorder that causes my bones to be in a weaker, more fragile state, as well as being shorter in stature and other skeletal related issues.  I also suffer from severe scoliosis, restrictive lung disease, asthma and sleep apnea.  I have been wheelchair bound my entire life, and will be for the rest of its duration.

To date, I have had well over 70 bone fractures and 4 major operations (including the placing of titanium rods through both of my femurs). My medical ailments have caused many hospitalizations, including two times where I was declared legally dead without brain or heart activity.

I have reached a point in my life now, where I need the help of others in order to be independent, successful and safe.

I have been without a handicap accessible van for going on five years.  Without a van, I have been nearly home-bound and extremely limited in my overall life.  I am unable to go outside of my city limits (For now, I must rely on a local public transit) and I have missed countless opportunities, both professionally and personally.  I have also been unable to receive new medical treatments at a facility that I would have to drive to  and am unable to attend college classes due to the unpredictability of the public transit system.

This has been, debilitating - and I have tried in the past to raise funds for this cause, and though somewhat successful, was never enough. I do work, and I make money, but it is not enough, and not nearly close to my goal.  I don't beg, and I don't want pity, just the chance to be out there and living a full, enriched, and safe life.


I am calling on your help 

Help me raise funds to get this handicap accessible van.  With your help, my entire world can change. 

If you want to help – please consider donating, or sharing this fundraiser on your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIN, or anywhere.  I thank you so much.
Sincerely,
Sean Smith

story:
Dreams from the Witch House is now available on both DarkRegions.com and Amazon.


Order Dreams from the Witch House: http://www.darkregions.com/books/new-releases/dreams-witch-house-female-voices-lovecraftian-horror


Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Dreams-Witch-House-Female-Lovecraftian/dp/1626411077


Update (03/02/2015) - We finished at 169% funded and successfully unlocked all stretch goals. Thank you to all of our campaign funders for your amazing support. Check out the Updates section of the campaign page for the latest news and progress on Dreams from the Witch House. 

UNLOCKED - Stretch Goal ($22,000) - All interior illustrations by artist Daniele Serra will be created and printed in full color in the book.
UNLOCKED - $23,500 (stretch goal) - Artist Daniele Serra creates another color illustration which will only appear in campaign-exclusive editions of the ebook, trade paperback and digital art book + All campaign funders receive HD Dreams from the Witch House digital art book.

UNLOCKED - $25,000 (stretch goal) - Daniele Serra's artwork will be incorporated into the design of the book with spot illos, chapter headings and design elements + all campaign backers receive $10 in store credit on DarkRegions.com.

Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror Illustrated by Daniele Serra from the Publisher of World War Cthulhu: A Collection of Lovecraftian War Stories

The history of the Old World is shrouded in secrecy. Creatures and forces unimaginable inhabited this realm for eons, long before any human navigated the surface of the earth.  As the Old Ones have slumbered or observed from afar, humans have assembled civilization upon this fragile planet. Yet the whispers from the elders have been growing stronger, their energy once again seeping into the world. These whispers are being felt throughout the earth; from the roots of our flora to the dreams of our children.  They are preparing us for what is to come.

In Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror the most intuitive dreamers have been assembled to give us glimpses into these ancient terrors and their whispered warnings. Featuring authors Joyce Carol Oates, Caitlín R. Kiernan, Lois Gresh, Gemma Files, Nancy Kilpatrick, Elizabeth Bear, Storm Constantine and others accompanied by the lavish artwork of Daniele Serra, Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror is a representation of some of the finest cosmic horror and weird fiction from female authors in the field today.

If you have any questions regarding how to pledge/your pledge or any other questions please e-mail us at: dreamsdrp@gmail.com

Featuring Original Artwork by Award-Winning Italian Artist Daniele Serra

With your support in reaching the Indiegogo campaign fundraising goal we can commission artist Daniele Serra to create an original full page illustration to accompany each story, expand the book with extra stories and much more. All original artworks created for the book will be available for sale here on the campaign page as they become available as well as other original artworks by Dani. These artworks are being sold in the Add-Ons section below.  

By joining us during the campaign you contribute to our goal of expanding the book for everyone with additional artwork, stories and other materials. Please note that this campaign ends at midnight on Sunday, March 1st 2015.

Including a Novelette from Bestselling Author Joyce Carol Oates and Stories from Caitlín R. Kiernan, Lois Gresh, Gemma Files and Open Fiction Submissions 

In Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror we are delighted to publish the novelette Shadows of the Evening by world renowned and award-winning author Joyce Carol Oates who will also be signing the leather-bound deluxe slipcased limited edition hardcover. Renowned female authors like Caitlín R. Kiernan, Lois Gresh, Gemma Files, Elizabeth Bear, Nancy Kilpatrick, Storm Constantine and many others are also writing stories for the anthology.

Dreams from the Witch House will have an open submissions window for the duration of the Indiegogo campaign. For submission guidelines, please continue to read through the campaign page. 

Dark Regions Weird Fiction #2: Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror

Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror continues the new Dark Regions Weird Fiction line, an imprint dedicated to Lovecraftian horror, cosmic horror and weird fiction. The first book in the imprint, World War Cthulhu: A Collection of Lovecraftian War Stories had a successful Indiegogo campaign that resulted in 23 original color illustrations, three extra stories and an illustrated signature sheet being created for the book. 

Dark Regions Press is an award-winning independent specialty publisher of horror, fantasy and science fiction in business since 1985. We publish ebooks, trade paperbacks and signed limited edition hardcovers from some of the top names in the industry.

Open Fiction Submissions Information for Dreams from the Witch House

 Lynne Jamneck - Editor

Lynne Jamneck is a fiction writer and editor. She has been nominated for the Sir Julius Vogel and Lambda Awards and holds an MA in English Literature from Auckland University, New Zealand. Her fiction has appeared in Unconventional Fantasy, A Celebration of Forty Years of the World Fantasy Convention, Fantastique Unfettered, H.P. Lovecraft's Magazine of Horror, Jabberwocky, Tales from the Bell Club, Something Wicked and the SJV award-winning anthology Tales For Canterbury. She edited the Lambda Award shortlisted SF anthology, Periphery and has published non-fiction for amongst others Weird Tales, Strange Horizons, Fantasy Magazine and the Lovecraft Annual. With S.T. Joshi, she is co-editing Gothic Lovecraft, due out in 2015.


Daniele Serra - Artist

Daniele Serra was born and lives in Italy. He works as illustrator and comic artist, his work has been published in Europe, Australia, United States and Japan. He has worked for Dark Regions Press, DC Comics, Image Comics, Cemetery Dance, Weird Tales magazine, PS Publishing and other publications. He is a winner of the British Fantasy Award.

Joyce Carol Oates

Joyce Carol Oates is the author of more than 70 books, including novels, short story collections, poetry volumes, plays, essays, and criticism, including the national bestsellers We Were the Mulvaneys and Blonde. Among her many honors are the PEN/Malamud Award for Excellence in Short Fiction and the National Book Award. Oates is the Roger S. Berlind Distinguished Professor of the Humanities at Princeton University, and has been a member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters since 1978.

Caitlín R. Kiernan

Caitlín R. Kiernan is the author of nine novels, including Silk, Threshold, Low Red Moon, Murder of Angels, Daughter of Hounds, and The Red Tree. Her award-winning short fiction has been collected in six volumes, including Tales of Pain and Wonder; To Charles Fort, With Love; Alabaster; and, most recently, A is for Alien. She has also published two volumes of erotica, Frog Toes and Tentacles and Tales from the Woeful Platypus. Trained as a vertebrate paleontologist, she currently lives in Providence, Rhode Island.

Lois Gresh

Lois H. Gresh is the New York Times Best-Selling Author (6 times), Publishers Weekly Best-Selling Paperback Author, Publishers Weekly Best-Selling Paperback Children's Author, and USA Today Best-Selling Author of 27 books and 55 short stories. She has 1 million books in print in 22 languages. Lois has received a Bram Stoker Award, Nebula Award, Theodore Sturgeon Award, and International Horror Guild Award nominations for her work.

Gemma Files

Previously best-known as a film critic, teacher and screenwriter, Gemma Files first broke onto the horror scene when her short story "The Emperor's Old Bones" won the International Horror Guild's 1999 award for Best Short Fiction. Her current bibliography includes two collections of short work  and two chapbooks of poetry. Her first novel was published in April 2010. 

Nancy Kilpatrick

Nancy Kilpatrick is a writer and editor. She has published 18 novels, 1 non-fiction book, over 200 short stories, 5 collections of stories, and has edited 12 anthologies.

She writes dark fantasy, horror, mysteries and erotic horror, under her own name, her nom de plume Amarantha Knight, and her newest pen name Desire Knight (Amarantha's younger sister!) 

Nancy has been a Bram Stoker finalist three times, a finalist for the Aurora Award five times and, in addition to winning several short fiction contests, won the Arthur Ellis Award for best mystery.

Molly Tanzer

Molly Tanzer lives in Boulder, Colorado along the front range of the Mountains of Madness, or maybe just the Flatirons. Her work has appeared in, among other venues, The Book of Cthulhu (vols. 1 and 2), Future Lovecraft, and Running with the Pack, and is forthcoming in Fungi and The Starry Wisdom Library.

Elizabeth Bear

Elizabeth Bear was born on the same day as Frodo and Bilbo Baggins, but in a different year. This, coupled with a childhood tendency to read the dictionary for fun, led her inevitably to penury, intransigence, the mispronunciation of common English words, and the writing of speculative fiction.

She lives in Massachusetts with a Giant Ridiculous Dog. Her partner, acclaimed fantasy author Scott Lynch, lives in Wisconsin.

Storm Constantine

Storm Constantine is a British science fiction and fantasy author, primarily known for her Wraeththu series.

Since the late 1980s she has written more than 20 novels, plus several non-fiction books. She is featured in the Goth Bible and is often included in discussions of alternative sexuality and gender in science fiction and fantasy; many of her novels include same-sex relationships or hermaphrodites or other twists of gender. Magic, mysticism and ancient legends (like the Grigori) also figure strongly in her works.

Sarah Monette

Katherine Addison is the pseudonym of Sarah Monette. She grew up in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, one of the three secret cities of the Manhattan Project, and now lives in a 108-year-old house in the Upper Midwest with a great many books, two cats, one grand piano, and one husband. Her Ph.D. diploma (English Literature, 2004) hangs in the kitchen. She has published more than fifty short stories, two novels (A Companion to Wolves, Tor Books, 2007, The Tempering of Men, Tor Books, 2011) and four short stories with Elizabeth Bear, and hopes to write more. Her first four novels make up the Mélusine fantasy quartet,  published by Ace. Her latest novel, The Goblin Emperor, published under the pen name Katherine Addison, came out from Tor in April 2014.

Dark Regions Press is an independent specialty publisher of horror, dark fiction, fantasy and science fiction, specializing in horror and dark fiction in business since 1985. We have gained recognition around the world for our creative works in genre fiction and poetry.  We were awarded the Horror Writers Association 2010 Specialty Press Award and the Italian 2012 Black Spot award for Excellence in a Foreign Publisher. We produce premium signed hardcover editions for collectors as well as quality trade paperbacks and ebook editions.  Our books have received seven Bram Stoker Awards from the Horror Writers Association.

We have published hundreds of authors, artists and poets such as Clive Barker, Joe R. Lansdale, Ramsey Campbell, Kevin J. Anderson, Bentley Little, Michael D. Resnick, Rick Hautala, Bruce Boston, Robert Frazier, W.H. Pugmire, Simon Strantzas, Jeffrey Thomas, Charlee Jacob, Richard Gavin, Tim Waggoner and hundreds more.  Dark Regions Press has been creating specialty books and creative projects for over twenty-nine years.

The press has staff throughout the United States working virtually but also has a localized office in Portland, Oregon from where we ship our orders and maintain the primary components of the business. Visit us online at DarkRegions.com.

Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror Illustrated by Daniele Serra from the Publisher of World War Cthulhu: A Collection of Lovecraftian War Stories 

The history of the Old World is shrouded in secrecy. Creatures and forces unimaginable inhabited this realm for eons, long before any human navigated the surface of the earth.  As the Old Ones have slumbered or observed from afar, humans have assembled civilization upon this fragile planet. Yet the whispers from the elders have been growing stronger, their energy once again seeping into the world. These whispers are being felt throughout the earth; from the roots of our flora to the dreams of our children.  They are preparing us for what is to come.
In Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror the most intuitive dreamers have been assembled to give us glimpses into these ancient terrors and their whispered warnings. Featuring authors Joyce Carol Oates, Caitlín R. Kiernan, Lois Gresh, Gemma Files, Nancy Kilpatrick, Elizabeth Bear, Storm Constantine and others accompanied by the lavish artwork of Daniele Serra, Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror is a representation of some of the finest cosmic horror and weird fiction from female authors in the field today.

Her fiction has appeared in Unconventional Fantasy, A Celebration of Forty Years of the World Fantasy Convention, Fantastique Unfettered, H.P. Lovecraft's Magazine of Horror, Jabberwocky, Tales from the Bell Club, Something Wicked and the SJV award-winning anthology Tales For Canterbury. She edited the Lambda Award shortlisted SF anthology, Periphery and has published non-fiction for amongst others Weird Tales, Strange Horizons, Fantasy Magazine and the Lovecraft Annual. With S.T. Joshi, she is co-editing Gothic Lovecraft, due out in 2015.















Daniele Serra - ArtistDaniele Serra was born and lives in Italy. He works as illustrator and comic artist, his work has been published in Europe, Australia, United States and Japan. He has worked for Dark Regions Press, DC Comics, Image Comics, Cemetery Dance, Weird Tales magazine, PS Publishing and other publications. He is a winner of the British Fantasy Award.
















Joyce Carol OatesJoyce Carol Oates is the author of more than 70 books, including novels, short story collections, poetry volumes, plays, essays, and criticism, including the national bestsellers We Were the Mulvaneys and Blonde. Among her many honors are the PEN/Malamud Award for Excellence in Short Fiction and the National Book Award. Oates is the Roger S. Berlind Distinguished Professor of the Humanities at Princeton University, and has been a member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters since 1978.

















Caitlín R. KiernanCaitlín R. Kiernan is the author of nine novels, including Silk, Threshold, Low Red Moon, Murder of Angels, Daughter of Hounds, and The Red Tree. Her award-winning short fiction has been collected in six volumes, including Tales of Pain and Wonder; To Charles Fort, With Love; Alabaster; and, most recently, A is for Alien. She has also published two volumes of erotica, Frog Toes and Tentacles and Tales from the Woeful Platypus. Trained as a vertebrate paleontologist, she currently lives in Providence, Rhode Island.


















Lois GreshLois H. Gresh is the New York Times Best-Selling Author (6 times), Publishers Weekly Best-Selling Paperback Author, Publishers Weekly Best-Selling Paperback Children's Author, and USA Today Best-Selling Author of 27 books and 55 short stories. She has 1 million books in print in 22 languages. Lois has received a Bram Stoker Award, Nebula Award, Theodore Sturgeon Award, and International Horror Guild Award nominations for her work.

















Gemma FilesPreviously best-known as a film critic, teacher and screenwriter, Gemma Files first broke onto the horror scene when her short story "The Emperor's Old Bones" won the International Horror Guild's 1999 award for Best Short Fiction. Her current bibliography includes two collections of short work  and two chapbooks of poetry. Her first novel was published in April 2010. 

















Nancy Kilpatrick

Nancy Kilpatrick is a writer and editor. She has published 18 novels, 1 non-fiction book, over 200 short stories, 5 collections of stories, and has edited 12 anthologies.
She writes dark fantasy, horror, mysteries and erotic horror, under her own name, her nom de plume Amarantha Knight, and her newest pen name Desire Knight (Amarantha's younger sister!) 
Nancy has been a Bram Stoker finalist three times, a finalist for the Aurora Award five times and, in addition to winning several short fiction contests, won the Arthur Ellis Award for best mystery.





















Molly Tanzer

Molly Tanzer lives in Boulder, Colorado along the front range of the Mountains of Madness, or maybe just the Flatirons. Her work has appeared in, among other venues, The Book of Cthulhu (vols. 1 and 2), Future Lovecraft, and Running with the Pack, and is forthcoming in Fungi and The Starry Wisdom Library.





















Elizabeth Bear


Elizabeth Bear was born on the same day as Frodo and Bilbo Baggins, but in a different year. This, coupled with a childhood tendency to read the dictionary for fun, led her inevitably to penury, intransigence, the mispronunciation of common English words, and the writing of speculative fiction.
She lives in Massachusetts with a Giant Ridiculous Dog. Her partner, acclaimed fantasy author Scott Lynch, lives in Wisconsin.






















Storm Constantine


Storm Constantine is a British science fiction and fantasy author, primarily known for her Wraeththu series.
Since the late 1980s she has written more than 20 novels, plus several non-fiction books. She is featured in the Goth Bible and is often included in discussions of alternative sexuality and gender in science fiction and fantasy; many of her novels include same-sex relationships or hermaphrodites or other twists of gender. Magic, mysticism and ancient legends (like the Grigori) also figure strongly in her works.






















Sarah Monette

Katherine Addison is the pseudonym of Sarah Monette. She grew up in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, one of the three secret cities of the Manhattan Project, and now lives in a 108-year-old house in the Upper Midwest with a great many books, two cats, one grand piano, and one husband. Her Ph.D. diploma (English Literature, 2004) hangs in the kitchen. She has published more than fifty short stories, two novels (A Companion to Wolves, Tor Books, 2007, The Tempering of Men, Tor Books, 2011) and four short stories with Elizabeth Bear, and hopes to write more. Her first four novels make up the Mélusine fantasy quartet,  published by Ace. Her latest novel, The Goblin Emperor, published under the pen name Katherine Addison, came out from Tor in April 2014.









...And more authors as well! Several more female authors have been invited to write for Dreams from the Witch House: Female Voices of Lovecraftian Horror and we are accepting fiction submissions for the duration of the Indiegogo campaign. Find the submission guidelines higher up on this page.





Dark Regions Press is an independent specialty publisher of horror, dark fiction, fantasy and science fiction, specializing in horror and dark fiction in business since 1985. We have gained recognition around the world for our creative works in genre fiction and poetry.  We were awarded the Horror Writers Association 2010 Specialty Press Award and the Italian 2012 Black Spot award for Excellence in a Foreign Publisher. We produce premium signed hardcover editions for collectors as well as quality trade paperbacks and ebook editions.  Our books have received seven Bram Stoker Awards from the Horror Writers Association.
We have published hundreds of authors, artists and poets such as Clive Barker, Joe R. Lansdale, Ramsey Campbell, Kevin J. Anderson, Bentley Little, Michael D. Resnick, Rick Hautala, Bruce Boston, Robert Frazier, W.H. Pugmire, Simon Strantzas, Jeffrey Thomas, Charlee Jacob, Richard Gavin, Tim Waggoner and hundreds more.  Dark Regions Press has been creating specialty books and creative projects for over twenty-nine years.
The press has staff throughout the United States working virtually but also has a localized office in Portland, Oregon from where we ship our orders and maintain the primary components of the business. Visit us online at DarkRegions.com.

story:
My Story

My name is David Thorpe, and I've been writing about music for more than ten years. I'm proud of my accomplishments as a writer, but I think we can all agree that it's time for me to shut up. 
If this campaign is successful, I will stop writing about music. I may stop tweeting or expressing any opinions via social media. Maybe I will stop talking about music out loud in public.
And who knows: if this thing goes through the roof, maybe I'll shut up about everything, forever.

Put Your Money Where My Mouth Is

What I want is simple: to be paid to not write. 

  • Writing is hard.
  • I'm not very good at it.
  • A lot of people, for a variety of really good reasons, think I should probably shut up.

The Impact

If certain funding goals are reached, I will shut up in a series of escalating ways. But the bottom line is that the more money I get, the more fully I will shut up.

Imagine this:

  • You will not know my opinions on various developments in the music industry and the world of pop music.
  • If a new song comes out and I don't like it, you won't hear about that.
  • Maybe I won't tweet about the lost mid-80s David Lindley album "Mr. Dave" anymore.
  • I will never write a "thinkpiece" about anything.
  • If, hypothetically, I really like the new War On Drugs album, you will never even know.
  • I won't have to pretend to care about the latest surprise-release pop album that shakes up the music writing world for 2 hours.
The basic funding level requested ($184,000) will stop me from writing anything about music ever again, in any format.

Risks & Challenges

I'll admit that this is a strange proposition. There are several risks:

  • Maybe I won't make enough money and nothing will happen.
  • Maybe I'll make a ton of money but decide that I shouldn't shut up anyway, because as a white male I have been conditioned by society to think everyone wants to hear my shitty opinions about everything.
  • I might forget I did this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still tweet at me (@arr) and tell me to shut up. Every little bit counts. Thank you.

story:
“At its best, in [Jorge Luis] Borges, Ray Bradbury and Edgar Allan Poe, the short story is coined from precious metal, a glint of gold that will glow forever in the deep purse of your imagination.”

—J. G. Ballard

WHAT IS THE MONKEY'S OTHER PAW? 

The idea behind THE MONKEY'S OTHER PAW has never been done before in an anthology format – Make a list of the greatest classic horror stories of all time and have modern authors create sequels, prequels, homages and re-imaginings. Among the stories selected are: "The Monkey's Paw," H.P. Lovecraft's "The Call of Cthulhu," Dylan Thomas' ghost story "The Followers," E.T.A. Hoffmann's "The Sandman," Robert Louis Stevenson's "Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde," and Saki's "The Open Window." Of course we also have Poe – in this case his unfinished story "The Lighthouse" is at last complete to horrific effect. We also have a graphic story letting us know what became of the Dorian Grey painting after the death of its subject.

PARTIAL TABLE OF CONTENTS:

  • Richard Nixon Saved From Drowning, and The Terminal Villa — Barry Malzberg (two pastiches inspired by J. G. Ballard’s “Terminal Beach”)
  • The Doom that Came to Devil’s Reef — Don Webb (Alternate POV story based on H.P. Lovecraft’s Cthulhu Mythos)
  • Eddie the Great — Steve Rasnic Tem (updates Jekyll/Hyde)
  • The Monkey's Other Paw — Alegría Luna Luz  (gives us the aftermath of the classic horror tale)
  • A True Blue Bouquet — Ivan Fante (A sequel to Octavio Pax “The Blue Bouquet”)
  • Ghostless — Paul Di Filippo (Riffs on Dylan Thomas's ghost story “The Followers”)
  • The Alighted House — Alegría Luna Luz and Edgar Allan Poe (Poe’s unfinished fragment is only the beginning)
  • The Unheimlich Maneuver — Damien Broderick (Introduces Freud into Hoffmann’s “The Sandman”)
  • Footfall — Gay Partington Terry (A Kafka homage)
  • The Gallery of Dorian Grey — Martos
  • A Most Extraordinary Man — Scott Edelman  (A “switcheroo” of the plot in Saki’s “The Open Window”)


WHERE THE MONEY GOES 

We're asking for backing for THE MONKEY'S OTHER PAW to pay for prepress and production costs.  Most of the stories are already in hand. You can think of this campaign as pre-ordering the book. 

WHY PRE-ORDER?

More money goes to the creators and not to intermediates (like that gigantic mail-order retailer named after a river) that add nothing of substance to the project. We anticipate that the book will be ready to ship very soon after the completion of the fundraiser. Books will be printed in the USA.


If you can't help with funding you can still help by spreading the word. 

Alternate limited edition letterpress dust jacket for hardcover, signed by designer and editor. Exclusively for Indiegogo backers.

Limited pine box "coffin" edition with monkey's paw.


ABOUT THE EDITOR

Photo courtesy of Liza Trombi/Locus Publications

Luis Ortiz has authored three art biographies, including the Hugo Award nominee and Locus Award finalist Emshwiller: Infinity x Two, and edited numerous books including Cult Magazines: A to Z, with Earl Kemp, and Why New Yorkers Smoke. His writings have appeared in diverse periodicals including Illustration magazine and FilmFax, and his work as an illustrator appears most recently in Steampunk Prime edited by Mike Ashley. Ortiz lives and works as an editor/publisher and illustrator/designer in New York City.


OUR PRESS

Nonstop Press is an independent publisher specializing in pop culture and genre fiction. Our books can be found in better bookstores, including B&N and online. We will be celebrating our ten year anniversary in 2014. To see some of our books click HERE.

Thank you for supporting indie publishing.

story:
Hi! Our names are Elisha and Elyssa F. Fernandez, and we are 11 and 10 year-old sisters. We recently finished writing our book, I Love Me, about self-esteem for kids. 

It has always been our dream to be authors and help children throughout the world embrace who they are and become their best self. We have always been taught by our mom to love ourselves as we are and many other children do not know this value. Because we have this knowledge, we decided we want to share it!

Statistics in the U. S. show that 75% of boys and girls with low self-esteem are reported doing (or participating in) harmful and scary activities. 

With your help, we can teach kids to fall in love with themselves, have self-belief, give back, take care of themselves, choose wisely for their future, and expand their growth. 

We have the book manuscript written and the illustrations drawn, we just need your donation to help raise our goal of $1,500 in 60 days to cover publishing costs and make our dream come true!

Just imagine a world full of children that know how to believe in themselves, give back, and do their best! This would not only mean helping this generation, but future ones as well! 

We would appreciate it if you could help us reach our goal, but even if you can't contributefinancially, we still love you! You can help us by sharing our campaign link with friends and followers and spreading the word about our book.

With your help, we can save the millions of lives that suffer from low self-esteem today!

Thank YOU!

Elisha and Elyssa F. Fernandez


P.S. These are the perks* you will get with your contribution:

$1 Thank You! Thank You! 

You'll get a Personalized Thank You Email, and 1 PDF coloring page of any I Love ME! illustration of your choice.


$5 You Rock!

We'll send you an E-postcard, and the PDF test sketches of ALL the I Love ME! illustrations.


$10 Gratitude Dance! :D

Would you like an E-postcard sent to a child you know? This perk is for you! You'll also get ALL the PDF test sketches of all the I Love ME! illustrations, and a PDF of the book manuscript before the book is even published!!!


* $20 Pre-purchase the book! 

Just want an autographed copy of our book for you or a special child? Well, this is the perfect perk for you! You also get a FREE coloring sheet!

Estimated Delivery on: December 16, 2013


$20 You Are Amazing!

We will personally call a child you know for up to 20 minutes! We will also send him/her the I Love Me pledge and certificate, and a pre-release PDF of the book manuscript.


* $50 You Are Very Sweet!

Personalized hand-written letter, blog-post about you, mention you on our Twitter and Facebook page, I Love Me pledge and certificate, highlight a child of your choice in I Love Me website gallery, PDF book manuscript, softcover of book, and your name on our website.

Estimated Delivery on: December 16, 2013


* $100 You Are Our Hero!

We'll have a special Skype lunch with a child or send him/her a personalized video. We'll blog & post on our Twitter and FB page about YOU!  Get Elyssa's book, See What I Can Become & up to 3 I Love Me pin buttons (in the USA), name in acknowledgements, PDF book manuscript, softcover of book, your name on our site, I Love Me pledge & certificate, highlight child of your choice on I Love Me web gallery, & we'll give a child at Children's medical center an audio & printed book.

Estimated Delivery on: December 16, 2013


* We will only ship within U.S territory.

story:
You can give as much as you want and as little as 1 euro

Every contribution is precious and will be invested in the pilgrim's comfort and the restoration of the monastery.

Latest news: We opened the pilgrim´s hostel on the 25th of July. Awaiting pilgrims are 20 beds. However we continue to need your support so we may finish improving the rest of the living conditions and have 50 beds ready.

[english] [deutsch] [español] [português]

The Way of St James | O Camiño de Santiago

More and more people are taking O Camiño de Santiago, the Way of Saint James. Last year, approximately 10.000 pilgrims started the Portuguese way at this Cathedral, in the heart of Porto, my hometown.

Most of them are German but there are pilgrims from all over the world.

Albergue host | Hospitaleiros

I completed my first Camiño in 2007, where I met my wife. Since then we have volunteered as hospitaleiros (hosts) in the Albergue of Rates (pilgrim´s hostel), 40km from Porto. It was the first albergue in the Portuguese Way. We got married there :)

The albergue is too far from Porto, especially for the first day of pilgrimage and consequently pilgrims usually arrive very exhausted. Or they "cheat" and take the tram (also known as “metro”).

Monastery of Vairão, the dream

So we had the idea of opening a new albergue in the Monastery of Vairão, close to Vilarinho, midway between Porto and Rates (nearly 20 km from Porto).  This monastery was founded more than 1000 years ago and nowadays it is pretty much empty!

Location: 41.33303,-8.668825

(more pictures)

You can imagine the incredible experiences the pilgrims can have here…

What we need

We already have the support of the local government, the parish and pilgrims organizations and we just need initial funding for construction work, mattresses, kitchen and other equipment (see below).

Every euro is precious and will be invested in the pilgrim's comfort and the restoration of the monastery.

This is a non-profit initiative, based on volunteering and donations. I hope to be a hospitaleiro volunteer there and to help create a learning center for the Camiño de Santiago, associated with the Cathlolic University (where I work).

Construction work (cleaning, painting, water supply...)

11.500

Beds (matresses, blankets...)

6.500

Kitchen (stove, refrigerator, dishes...)

1.500

Living room (dining tables, sofas...)

2.750

Others (lighting, decoration, safety material...)

2.750

Total (€)

25.000

Open this summer!

We hope to open this summer and welcome you there!

We will be waiting for you! Bom Caminho!

[deutsch]

Mehr und mehr Menschen pilgern den Caminho de Santiago, den Jakobsweg.

Letztes Jahr sind ungefähr 10.000 Pilger den portugiesischen Jakobsweg gegangen, von der Kathedrale im Herzen von Porto aus (meiner Heimatstadt).

Die meisten davon sind Deutsche, aber es kommen Pilger aus fast allen Ländern der Welt.

Ich bin 2007 zum ersten Mal den "Caminho" gepilgert und habe dabei meine Frau kennengelernt.

Seitdem arbeiten wir ehrenamtlich als "hospitalieros", als Herbergsbetreuer in der Herberge von Rates, ca. 40 km nördlich von Porto gelegen, die erste offizielle Herberge auf dem portugiesischen Jakobsweg.

Das ist als Etappe viel zu weit -- besonders für den ersten Tag -- und die Pilger kommen völlig erschöpft in Rates an.

Oder sie "schummeln" und benutzen die Tram.

Das brachte uns auf die Idee, eine neue Herberge zu gründen, im Kloster Vairão nahe Vilarinho, einem Ort der ungefähr auf halber Höhe zwischen Porto und Rates liegt.

Das ehemalige Kloster wurde vor mehr als 1.000 Jahren gegründet, steht aber heute weitestgehend leer.

Man kann sich aber gut vorstellen, welche wunderbaren Erfahrungen die Pilger hier erwarten ...

Wir haben schon die Unterstützung der örtlichen Behörden, der Gemeinde, von Pilgerorganisationen sowie der Katholischen Universität, wo ich arbeite, erhalten.

Wir benötigen nun Gelder für eine erste Grundrenovierung und eine Grundausstattung, mit Matratzen, einer Kücheneinrichtung und anderen Materialien.

Es ist eine gemeinnützige Initiative, basierend auf freiwillige, ehrenamtliche Arbeit und Spenden.

Wir hoffen noch in diesem Jahr die Herberge eröffnen zu können und würden uns freuen, Euch dort zu begrüßen! Wir warten auf Euch!

 

[español]

Cada vez más personas recorren el Camino de Santiago.

El pasado año aproximadamente 10.000 peregrinos empezaron el Camino en Portugal, en la Catedral de Oporto, justo en el corazón de mi ciudad.

La mayoría de los camineros son alemanes pero llegan desde todos los países del mundo.

Yo lo hice por primera vez en 2007 y ahí he conocido a mi mujer.

Desde ese momento somos voluntarios en el albergue de peregrinos de Rates, 40 km al norte de Oporto, el primero en el camino Portugués (nos casamos en ese albergue).

El albergue está lejos de Oporto, sobre todo si pensamos que es el primer día del recorrido y los peregrinos suelen llegar exhaustos. Otros hacen trampa y cogen el metro.

Por eso, se nos ocurrió la idea de crear un nuevo albergue en el monasterio de Vairão, muy cerca de Vilarinho, a medio camino entre Oporto y Rates.

El monasterio fue fundado hace más de 1.000 años y hoy en día está prácticamente abandonado.

Os podéis imaginar la emoción de un pelegrino al poder quedarse ahí en su primera noche del Camino?

Nosotros estamos muy animados y reunimos apoyo de la autarquía local, de la parroquia y de asociaciones de peregrinos.

Ahora necesitamos de financiación para la obra y para adquirir colchones, equipar una cocina, entre otros.

Se trata de una iniciativa sin ánimo de lucro, basada en voluntariado y donaciones.

Esperamos poder abrir puertas este verano y recibirlo(a) aquí. Os esperamos! Bom Caminho!

O ano passado cerca de 10.000 peregrinos iniciaram o Caminho Português na Sé do Porto, no coração da cidade onde nasci.

A maior parte são alemães mas chegam peregrinos de todos os países do mundo.

Eu fiz o meu primeiro Caminho em 2007, onde conheci a minha esposa.

Desde essa altura somos hospitaleiros voluntários no albergue de Rates, a 40 km do Porto, o primeiro no Caminho Português (casamos no albergue).

É demasiado longe, especialmente para o primeiro dia, e os peregrinos chegam exaustos. Ou fazem batota e apanham o metro.

Então tivemos a ideia de abrir um novo albergue no mosteiro de vairão, perto de vilarinho, a meio caminho.

Foi fundado há mais de 1000 anos e hoje em dia está praticamente abandonado.

Podem imaginar a experiência incrível que os peregrinos irão ter….

Já temos o apoio da junta de freguesia, da paróquia e de associações de peregrinos (portuguesas e alemãs).

Agora precisamos de financiamento para as primeiras obras, colchões, a cozinha e outras necessidades.

Trata-se de uma iniciativa sem fins lucrativos, baseada em voluntariado e donativos.

Esperamos abrir ainda este verão e recebe-lo cá. Estamos à sua espera!

Bom Caminho!

You can give as much as you want and as little as 1 euro
Every contribution is precious and will be invested in the pilgrim's comfort and the restoration of the monastery.
Latest news: We opened the pilgrim´s hostel on the 25th of July. Awaiting pilgrims are 20 beds. However we continue to need your support so we may finish improving the rest of the living conditions and have 50 beds ready.
[english] [deutsch] [español] [português]
The Way of St James | O Camiño de Santiago 


More and more people are taking O Camiño de Santiago, the Way of Saint James. Last year, approximately 10.000 pilgrims started the Portuguese way at this Cathedral, in the heart of Porto, my hometown.


Most of them are German but there are pilgrims from all over the world.




Albergue host | Hospitaleiros

I completed my first Camiño in 2007, where I met my wife. Since then we have volunteered as hospitaleiros (hosts) in the Albergue of Rates (pilgrim´s hostel), 40km from Porto. It was the first albergue in the Portuguese Way. We got married there :)

The albergue is too far from Porto, especially for the first day of pilgrimage and consequently pilgrims usually arrive very exhausted. Or they "cheat" and take the tram (also known as “metro”).

Monastery of Vairão, the dream

So we had the idea of opening a new albergue in the Monastery of Vairão, close to Vilarinho, midway between Porto and Rates (nearly 20 km from Porto).  This monastery was founded more than 1000 years ago and nowadays it is pretty much empty!
Location: 41.33303,-8.668825

(more pictures)
You can imagine the incredible experiences the pilgrims can have here…



What we need
We already have the support of the local government, the parish and pilgrims organizations and we just need initial funding for construction work, mattresses, kitchen and other equipment (see below).
Every euro is precious and will be invested in the pilgrim's comfort and the restoration of the monastery.
This is a non-profit initiative, based on volunteering and donations. I hope to be a hospitaleiro volunteer there and to help create a learning center for the Camiño de Santiago, associated with the Cathlolic University (where I work).




Construction work (cleaning, painting, water supply...)


11.500




Beds (matresses, blankets...)


6.500




Kitchen (stove, refrigerator, dishes...)


1.500




Living room (dining tables, sofas...)


2.750




Others (lighting, decoration, safety material...)


2.750




Total (€)


25.000





Open this summer!
We hope to open this summer and welcome you there!
We will be waiting for you! Bom Caminho!



[deutsch]
Mehr und mehr Menschen pilgern den Caminho de Santiago, den Jakobsweg.
Letztes Jahr sind ungefähr 10.000 Pilger den portugiesischen Jakobsweg gegangen, von der Kathedrale im Herzen von Porto aus (meiner Heimatstadt).
Die meisten davon sind Deutsche, aber es kommen Pilger aus fast allen Ländern der Welt.
Ich bin 2007 zum ersten Mal den "Caminho" gepilgert und habe dabei meine Frau kennengelernt.
Seitdem arbeiten wir ehrenamtlich als "hospitalieros", als Herbergsbetreuer in der Herberge von Rates, ca. 40 km nördlich von Porto gelegen, die erste offizielle Herberge auf dem portugiesischen Jakobsweg.
Das ist als Etappe viel zu weit -- besonders für den ersten Tag -- und die Pilger kommen völlig erschöpft in Rates an.
Oder sie "schummeln" und benutzen die Tram.
Das brachte uns auf die Idee, eine neue Herberge zu gründen, im Kloster Vairão nahe Vilarinho, einem Ort der ungefähr auf halber Höhe zwischen Porto und Rates liegt.
Das ehemalige Kloster wurde vor mehr als 1.000 Jahren gegründet, steht aber heute weitestgehend leer.
Man kann sich aber gut vorstellen, welche wunderbaren Erfahrungen die Pilger hier erwarten ...
Wir haben schon die Unterstützung der örtlichen Behörden, der Gemeinde, von Pilgerorganisationen sowie der Katholischen Universität, wo ich arbeite, erhalten.
Wir benötigen nun Gelder für eine erste Grundrenovierung und eine Grundausstattung, mit Matratzen, einer Kücheneinrichtung und anderen Materialien.
Es ist eine gemeinnützige Initiative, basierend auf freiwillige, ehrenamtliche Arbeit und Spenden.
Wir hoffen noch in diesem Jahr die Herberge eröffnen zu können und würden uns freuen, Euch dort zu begrüßen! Wir warten auf Euch!
