story:
Our Story

For the first time in my life, I have an opportunity to publish a book of poetry and song lyrics with a publishing house in Ontario.  I have written songs for a long time, but this is the first time I've been able to include my poetry in the same book.  I gave up writing and singing for over 25 years and at this point in my life, it's a blessing that I have such an opportunity.  The goal of this campaign is to raise the funds to purchase copies of my book.  As an unpublished author, it's standard procedure to pre-purchase copies. 

The Impact

I have been writing songs for a very long time.  People have often asked me to share my lyrics in poetry form and it got me thinking that perhaps the poetry I write would also have some value. I would hope that my words could comfort, heal and get people thinking.  It's a collection of my life and thoughts.  I'm proud to be able to share it. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $800 to be able to pre-purchase the books.  I have included some perks for different levels of contribution.  This money would enable me to buy 100 copies of the book. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with others.  I will be posting it on my facebook pages, twitter and my website.

story:
The Stories We Tell: Survivor Testimonial Workshop

Hi! We are Emily Bergl, Christa Desir, and Clare Gagne. We are three members of The Voices and Faces Project, a documentary project giving voice and face to survivors of sexual violence. We are looking to fund a writing workshop in New York City called "The Stories We Tell" for survivors of sexual violence, domestic violence, and sexual trafficking.


This one-of-a-kind writing workshop provides survivors a two-day opportunity to learn and use the power of their own testimony to write and speak out about the violence they have lived through. Survivors pay no money for this workshop, it will be funded completely from the generosity of donors.

This workshop has already travelled to more than five North American cities and many more have requested it. This workshop will cost $15,000 for twenty survivors over two full days. Those costs include workshop space, food and beverages, reading materials, and presenter travel and fees. So every $750 we receive will fully fund one participant. Again, survivor participants pay nothing. Your gift matters - sexual violence, domestic violence and trafficking are issues that affect women and men from every walk of life, and every race and creed - and often the survivors most in need of programs like ours can least afford them

And for every donation over $40, we will send you a CD created solely for the Voices & Faces Project by artists such as Neeko Case, Joseph Arthur, & The New Pornographers who care as deeply about this cause as we do. 

We are grateful for every dollar you donate. We are equally grateful for you sharing the message about this campaign. Please let your friends and family know. And if you want to learn more about The Voices and Faces Project, you can check us out at: www.voicesandfaces.org.

 

Thank you!

story:
Summary

Sacrificial Poets is trying to send 6 of NC's top youth poets to the Brave New Voices (BNV) International Youth Poetry Slam Festival in Chicago this summer. BNV is an educational, empowering, and transformative week-long experience that will help our youth become better poets, mentors, and community leaders. 

$2,000 Will Cover: 

  • Festival Registration Fee
  • Team Housing
  • Team Meals   
  • Spoken Word Workshops 
  • Organizational Development Workshops 
  • Performances and Events 
  • A once in a life time opportunity for these 6 youth!

How You Can Help 

Invest: Contribute online today. With your support, we can make this amazing experience possible for our youth! 

Invite: Help us spread the word about the campaign. Welcome your friends, family, and co-workers to become investors in this cause.  

Champion: Become an active member of our community. Come to events, support youth, and tell your own story. Help us advocate for the importance of arts education, emotional literacy, youth empowerment, and the transformative power of storytelling.

 

What is Sacrificial Poets?

Sacrificial Poets aka SacPoe is an award-winning spoken word poetry organization that serves middle, high school, and college-aged youth in the Triangle Area of North Carolina. The organization facilitates writing and performance workshops throughout the state and hosts regular youth poetry events. In addition, Sacrificial Poets selects a team of six youth every year to take to the Brave New Voices International Youth Poetry Slam Festival (as seen on HBO).

Sacrificial Poets utilizes their own innovative arts education curriculum, known as YouTh ink. Workshops are based on a culturally responsive pedagogy that celebrates learning differences, and is designed to benefit participants in five specific ways: enhance emotional literacy, facilitate identity exploration, refine writing and analytical skills, develop performance and public speaking competency, and build self-confidence. Sacrificial Poets does not empower youth, rather we seek to create diverse, welcoming, and transformative environments where youth can empower themselves.

Sacrificial Poets is a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization. Donations are tax deductible.

 

What is Brave New Voices?

Every summer, 50 teams of youth aged 13-19 come from all across the nation and world to participate in the Brave New Voices International Youth Poetry Slam Festival (BNV). During the week-long festival, which is held in a different U.S. city each year, these youth from Brooklyn to L.A., Hawaii to India, share space on and off the stage, forming powerful bonds of friendship and understanding through the expression of their words and art. They also participate in hands-on workshops with some of the world’s most renowned spoken word poets and performing artists.

Beginning in 2008, the Sacrificial Poets has taken a team of the top local youth poets to experience what is truly one of the most transformative experiences available to young writers and performers today. Upon returning home, these youth have gone on to become powerful leaders in our communities, creating poetry clubs, organizing inter-school competitions, hosting events, and even competing at the adult level in the National Poetry Slam as members of Durham’s Bull City Slam Team. In fact, graduates of the Sacrificial Poets youth slam team have performed at the Sundance Film Festival, featured at the Nuyorican Poets Café in Manhattan’s Lower East Side, and become teachers of poetry to youth across the state and nation.

For more information check out the BNV Website.

 

 

THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

I thought to myself: Can I create something distinctly northern Californian?

Well this is it:

  • Short fiction, poetry, and nonfiction about northern California, written by northern Californians 
  • This Indiegogo is to help bring the project to fruition
  • Contributing to this Indiegogo goes miles in making sure I can distribute this far and wide, and be able to represent our region with a professional publication
  • I have accepted submissions from great writers in the area, including fiction writer and professor Rob Davidson and local poet Lara Gularte

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown:

  • The money is earmarked specifically for printing and shipping
  • Our perks range from free digital and print copies to discounted ad rates
  • What we make goes to printing and shipping. In order for me (and my contributing editors) to make any money, we would have to go way over budget. This Indiegogo is for printing and publishing costs, plain and simple 

The Impact

Making a contribution goes a long way in showing that I was right in thinking that northern California would like a regional, quarterly publication that features northern California writers:

  • I think that this project has value to writers in the North State, as well as every citizen. It is a professional publication of which we can be proud 
  • I have a lot of experience with publishing books, and I was the senior editor at a magazine. Putting out a quarterly anthology is something that I know will be easy for me to do
  • If you want to submit or learn about this project, please email me (Dan) at amalgamconsulting@gmail.com. I would love to hear from you!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that many people will not be able to contribute financially, but there are a number of ways that you can still help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Let people know that we are accepting submissions for the inaugural issue until November 1st.
  • Let businesses know that we are accepting advertising to subsidize publishing and printing costs.

story:
• Who We Are

 

My name is Amatoritsero Ede. I’m the Publisher and Managing Editor of the online Maple Tree Literary Supplement, MTLS at <www.mtls.ca>. It is a not-for-profit, cutting edge 21st century online journal encompassing all the genres of writing, and inculding spoken word, literary photography, visual arts, book history, and the occasional scholarship. MTLS was launched in 2008 to publish new, mid-career or established culturally and ethnically diverse Canadian writers and artists. It has some 10 percent international representation. MTLS began paying contributors token honoraria in 2009, but the editorial board, including myself, has been and still is made up of volunteers who have been contributing to funding the project. 

 

  • Your support will help us in our long term goal of internationalising and enabling literary and artistic self-expression  and empathy that will contribute towards intercultural communications among peoples, groups, and cultures, and help alleviate feelings of alienation which encourages violence around the world.

     

  • To reach this long-term goal, we need you to help us become and remain a platform for liberal publishing of multiracial, multicultural, multi-faith, and international expressions of individual and cultural-group experiences.This is important because there is an ever increasing wave of violence in the world. Your support will help this project affect minds in a positive and compassionate manner towards mutual inter-cultural/ inter-group understanding in a world of full of variety and difference.

What We Need & What You Get

We need an initial USD 75,000 dollatrs as endowment.

 

MTLS website must be re-developed for better navigation, a more dynamic architecture, and for increased, stable, and secure interactivity. We want to pay better honoraria to more writers and artists, to our volunteers, initiate e-commerce, and acquire stable infrastructure. In other words we need to create an arts endowment in other to ensure a sustainable operation funds and a continuous project with long-term goals and impact. We ask you to help us in our vision of increased global peace by contributing to this arts project.

 

  • We have a gift for all donors. Under a new website menu to be called the Express-for-Peace we will publish our supporters’ stories, poetry, random thoughts, artworks, video clips or inspirational writing or arts with your name and bio if you dont mind.

The Impact

  • Our dream is simple and beautiful.  For example a story, painting, spoken word by a gay male or female might begin to resonate with and allow a Muslim male or female of heterosexual orientation to understand or appreciate things from the other person’s experience of a phenomenon; or a scientific essay might be able to provide information which explains differences in sexual orientation as natural and normal. The virtual nature of these cross-cultural encounters will encourage respectful thought. We have been successful so far at a Canadian level. Your contribution will allow us go global with this project with a stronger and durable impact.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • If you are not in a position to give support, you  can support us in kind by spreading the word about this project.

 

  • Feel free to use the indiegogo share tool to share to your social media platforms.

To reach this long-term goal, we need you to help us become and remain a platform for liberal publishing of multiracial, multicultural, multi-faith, and international expressions of individual and cultural-group experiences.This is important because there is an ever increasing wave of violence in the world. Your support will help this project affect minds in a positive and compassionate manner towards mutual inter-cultural/ inter-group understanding in a world of full of variety and difference.




What We Need & What You Get
We need an initial USD 75,000 dollatrs as endowment.
 
MTLS website must be re-developed for better navigation, a more dynamic architecture, and for increased, stable, and secure interactivity. We want to pay better honoraria to more writers and artists, to our volunteers, initiate e-commerce, and acquire stable infrastructure. In other words we need to create an arts endowment in other to ensure a sustainable operation funds and a continuous project with long-term goals and impact. We ask you to help us in our vision of increased global peace by contributing to this arts project.
 

We have a gift for all donors. Under a new website menu to be called the Express-for-Peace we will publish our supporters’ stories, poetry, random thoughts, artworks, video clips or inspirational writing or arts with your name and bio if you dont mind.




The Impact

Our dream is simple and beautiful.  For example a story, painting, spoken word by a gay male or female might begin to resonate with and allow a Muslim male or female of heterosexual orientation to understand or appreciate things from the other person’s experience of a phenomenon; or a scientific essay might be able to provide information which explains differences in sexual orientation as natural and normal. The virtual nature of these cross-cultural encounters will encourage respectful thought. We have been successful so far at a Canadian level. Your contribution will allow us go global with this project with a stronger and durable impact.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
 



If you are not in a position to give support, you  can support us in kind by spreading the word about this project.

 

Feel free to use the indiegogo share tool to share to your social media platforms.

story:
Unleash the power of the erotic word!

Our project:

ForbiddenFiction.com is a start-up publishing venture devoted to writing that breaks the boundaries of original erotic fiction. We will be publishing stories which combine intense sexuality with quality writing. We plan to have fiction in many different genres – contemporary, mystery, historical, western, science fiction, fantasy, romance, adventure, thriller, and horror.  Our stories will cover a range of sexual practices, gender and orientations.

In particular, we are interested in expanding the world of publishing in several ways: 1) Freedom of content, 2) Diversity of format, and 3) Community of readers.

Freedom of creative speech is one of our primary focuses. Most traditional publishers have restrictions on content in ways that have limited the expression of erotic storytelling. For example, mainstream publishers usually refuse or restrict any erotic content, and erotic publishers usually limit which themes or types of sexuality can be presented. Most limit content either to avoid "offending" potential customers or because of personal objections to the material. Instead of these approaches, ForbiddenFiction.com will use content labels (like ingredient labels on food) to allow writers creative expression and the readers to make their own choices of what they do or do not want to read.

Some sites don't restrict content, but those usually also lack quality control. ForbiddenFiction.com is a multi-format publisher with a skilled editing and design team to bring high-quality fiction to readers in electronic, print, audio, and other formats. Readers will have choices, not only in which stories are available, but also in how to enjoy them.

ForbiddenFiction.com will also bring the shared experience of social media formats such as forums to provide space for a community of writers and readers who can discuss the worlds of erotic fiction.

What we need:

We have a talented core team working with amazing authors. Yet, we have some challenges in creating the business environment, which will not only bring the artistic and technical talent together, but protect our creative people on the project. While everything we will publish is legal where we are located in the United States, keeping the right to free speech is an ongoing struggle. The ForbiddenFiction.com team knows that we will need to be ready to stand our ground if the rights of our authors, readers, and publishing team are challenged.

To put it simply, we need to make sure that all of the legal, bureaucratic and other documentation is in place if we run into a legal challenge. We need a lawyer who will set up our documents to avoid any loopholes that could be used to shut us down and be on retainer to meet any legal challenges. The estimated cost of the set-up paperwork alone is five to ten thousand dollars. Then we will need all the filing fees and usual start up costs for a website publishing venture.

What we offer:

We will offer choices in reading and we offer choices in ways to help us. No matter which level of support you can offer (from a Menage a trois for $3 through the Mutual Benefits at $69 to the Noble Guardian of Free Speech at $2500), we have packages of perks including access to reading some of the most amazing erotic fiction as well as toys to play with.

Thanks to our wonderful supporters at FirebirdFloggers.com.)

Read through the list of perks! Check back as the campaign progresses to see what new options we come up with!

If you have items you’d like to donate to make additional, let us know.

Help spread the word:

Whether you can make a financial contribution or not, we ask you to spread the word about the project to others who might help. (You are also welcome to come check us out at ForbiddenFiction.com!) Use the social media links here to tell others.

Feel free to leave questions in the comments section here and look for more as we go in our updates section.

Thank you so much for your support. We are excited to share with you!

Unchain Free Speech!

story:
Whippersnappers is a non-profit, student-run, organization that works to bring first-rate literature to children of the Boston area. In the spring of 2012, a group of students came together with an idea to create an anthology for children, comprised of short stories, poetry, and illustrations, that they felt captured the complexity and the magic of being a child. After assembling a team and working relentlessly to market and promote the publication, the Whippersnappers team is proud to say we've received an overwhelming amount of support from the writing and publishing community as well as a wide collection of superb submissions.

The anthology will be printed by late April and distributed to as many schools, libraries, and day care centers as we possibly can reach. With the ever-continuing battle against illiteracy in the Boston area and beyond, we hope to provide a tool to instill the love of reading and learning to the young and the young-at-heart.

The next step is where we need YOU! In order to make this dream a reality, we need the help and support of everyone who can!

We want to raise at least $3,000 to cover the costs of printing our book. Every last cent you donate will go directly towards the printing process. The more money we raise, the more copies we print, and the more copies we print, the more Boston children can read these excellent stories.

So we are asking for your help in any way you can. Whether you have $2.50 in change on your desk or $250 you've been waiting to spend on a special project like this, please donate. We will be truly grateful.

If you can’t donate, there are still plenty of ways to help this great organization! Help spread the word of Whippersnappers in your local community. Share our Indiegogo link through various social media websites, and also follow us on Facebook, Wordpress, and Twitter! And, if you feel the call to write a children’s story of your very own, submit to us at https://whippersnappers.submittable.com/submit

 

Every little bit helps! Thanks for viewing our Indiegogo!

story:
What's this campaign all about?

Wordier Than Thou, a Tampa Bay-based literary arts organization, wants to publish the second volume of its literature magazine and is looking for your support. Money donated will be used to print this second volume and also to help us create a website that will allow us to publish work from local authors online each month.

What is Wordier Than Thou?

Wordier Than Thou started two years ago as a storytelling and prose open mic. The open mic scene is so saturated with poetry and music that we felt there needed to be a space for fiction and non-fiction writers, and storytellers to share their work.

Our monthly open mics at the Studio@620 in St. Petersburg, Florida will always be at the heart of what Wordier Than Thou is about. But we’ve grown so much since we first started and are expanding our offerings to the local writing community.

What else does Wordier Than Thou offer?

  • Literary events, including uniquely themed readings, workshops for both kids and adults, panels on a variety of topics, festivals and more.
  • A social network.
  • A radio show focusing on local writers and storytellers. We launch Saturday, April 12, 11 a.m. – noon, on Life Improvement Radio.
  • Promotional help for authors.
  • And, of course, a literary magazine showcasing local talent.

So what is the literature magazine?

Our first magazine was a 44-page publication that brought together 13 stories from local writers, many of whom were readers at our open mics.

This first magazine was prose-only, and we plan to include both poetry and prose in our second volume. We’ll also have several guest editors working with us, and will open up the call for submissions to writers from Florida or who have lived in Florida, with an emphasis on authors from the Tampa Bay region.

Our goal is to publish a physical literary journal quarterly, and also to create a website where we can publish work from local writers on a regular basis.

You can order a digital copy of our first volume on Amazon at www.amazon.com/Wordier-Than-Thou-Julie-Garisto-...

Find us on Facebook.

Keep up with all of our events and news by “liking” us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/WordierThanThou.

You can also check out our YouTube channel at www.youtube.com/user/WordierThanThou and watch readings from past events.

* Wordier Than Thou is now umbrella’d under the Showcase Arts Foundation, Inc., a 501(c)(3) non-profit in Tampa Bay dedicated to the awareness of the arts in the community. A portion of funds raised will go to SAFI.

story:
*This campaign was succesful and the book has been printed! If you would like a piece, please follow this link: http://www.amigurumipatterns.net/books *



Hi! About a year ago i started collecting cute crochet patterns on my website called amigurumipatterns.net. In the past year these patterns have been consulted from all over the world and created many smiling faces, from grandchildren to colleagues, no one can resist the cuteness of amigurumi.

As the site kept on growing, a little idea grew along... All these designers on my website make amazing work, they're so good at what they're doing, i think they deserve to be published. And i wasn't the only one thinking this, many of you seemed to like the idea.

Encouraged by all of you i started collecting patterns that are irresistibly cute and unseen unique. Twelve designers are now teaming up to create an amazing collection.


WHAT'S AMIGURUMI?
Amigurumi is the Japanese art of crocheting small stuffed animals. The word is derived from a combination of the Japanese words ami, meaning crocheted or knitted, and nuigurumi, meaning stuffed doll. Amigurumi must be the most fun way to use a crochet hook, with just a little practice you'll make all these amazing designs in a jiffy. If you're not familiar with the techniques, then don't worry. The book will have a few pages explaining all the basics (both in drawings and text) so you won't get lost reading your first pattern.

WHAT WILL IT LOOK LIKE?
The book: It will be a soft cover book of 72 pages in full colour including large pictures and clear written out instructions of all the amigurumi you want to make. There will be basic crochet tutorials for those who take their first steps in amigurumi world.
I've gathered 15 cute animal patterns: Levi the baby Bear, Reco the pig, Zico the Toucan, Tara the Cat, little Tiger, Leila the pony, Johnny the Monkey, Lil Quack the duck, Sartù the Lemur, Bernard the fox, Dakota the dog, Eduardo the donkey, Morton the Moose, naughty mice and Wasabi the bunny (Pictures are available using the tab above)

e-book: The e-book is included in any of the perks. You will receive both a screen resolution pdf of the finished book and a kindle-version with a simplified layout.

The yarn bag: As a little extra i've created a full colour tote bag in biologic cotton that is perfect to store or carry around your collection of yarn. It will have a print of an alter ego of every amigurumi character in the book. The bag will be 42x38cm (16,5x15 inches) with comfortable long handles.

 



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR AND WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN
We are going to need USD 7500 to get the printer started. Everything you pledge is going towards the printing of the book, which includes royalties for the amazing designers-team, taxes, shipping, paypal & indiegogo fees. When we're done, the book will be in full colour, perfectly bound and professionally shipped to arrive at your doorstep safely.



I LOVE IT! NOW WHAT DO I DO?
First, select your pledge in the right column and click the perk you want. You will be asked to deposit the corresponding amount by paypal (you don' t even need an account). This campaign is a "fixed funding" campaign, this means that if we don't manage to hit our goal by the deadline (September 30), the book won't be printed and your money will safely be returned to you. That's why i need your help! Spread the word in any way you can! Tell your like-minded friends about this project and share it on your favourite social networks.

SHIPPING DETAILS
Worldwide shipping for the books & Tote bag is included in the perk price. We will ship anywhere, no restrictions! Keep in mind that books will be shipped after the printing is done, which - most probably - will be by the end of october. The e-book (both pdf and kindle ebook) will be sent to you at the same moment the printed books are shipped.



This summer has been amazing so far. I have been working with the most talented group of designers, collected the sweetest patterns and learnt so much along the way, it has already been worth the trip. I hope you like the idea, the patterns, the group of crafts-lovers and maybe consider purchasing our very first patternbook.

On behalf of the whole team, i want to thank you all for your support!

Pepika, Tilda&Filur, Susan Morishita, Airali handmade, Josephine Wu, footloosefriend, Irene Strange, MysteriousCats, Little Muggles, Pii_Chii, Sarsel, Lilleliis and Joke.

www.amigurumipatterns.net
facebook.com/AmigurumiPatterns.net

For questions you can contact me directly through email or check the FAQ.

story:
Too Much Screen Time Is Impeding Childhood Development

Our children sit in front of screens all day - TV, PC, tablet or smartphone. And it affects their development.
We want to create a book and a community that will make them more active, encouraging them to enjoy the physical world. 

By helping us out, you can be a part of it too.

The Book

Written for a 4-9 year-old audience, Planet Earth Kids Club tells the story of Tom, who lives in Compupiter - a planet where life happens through the screens.  

School is virtual, friends are met via the screen, and even the museum is yet another website to visit...

One day Tom finds out about planet Earth. He then decides to start a Kids Club - with the help of his grandma - and turn Compupiter into a lively and green planet. Join Tom on his magical journey!

The Community

But reading a book is sometimes not enough - we want the kids to get up, grab mom and/or dad, and go outside. Outside the screens. So we created a community where every kid can join the club, by actually doing activities in the physical world.


In order to join the club, the kid needs to do the activities. The kids can then send us pictures of themselves doing the activities, and we will publish it on our website, including their name and the ranks they earned.


What can you get?

Besides helping us making this important movement, you could get wonderful rewards.

A selection of cool rewards is available on the right section of this webpage.
 To name but a few:

- One or more copies of the printed books
- A cool T-shirt with a "Planet Earth Kids Club" logo on it (available in several sizes)
- The book will contain an illustrated portrait of your child!

Who We Are

We are Einav, Lior and Hagar - the creators of Planet Earth Kids Club. We all feel that it's crucial to educate our kids, on how great technology is, but at the same time, that the world outside the screens has a lot to offer! 

Einav Kesher - psychotherapist (M.A. Cognitive Psychology, UCONN, USA), mother of two, and the author of "The tale of an ADHD kid" - which helps kids and parents better understand living with ADHD. Einav's professional point of view and great writing skills will ensure that the right message is conveyed for the kid. 

Hagar Wertheim - illustrator and a mom to be. With her refreshing and sensitive illustrations, and her deep understanding of the issue, kids can easily imagine the life on a planet they've never heard of. 

Lior Frenkel is the creator of the social project "Undigitize.Me", which is designed to raise our awareness to smartphones and other digital addictions. People from all around the world have participated in Lior's viral campaign, which involves their portrayal in day-to-day activities with their "Phone Faced Down". They took a break from the addictive smartphones, and were proud to do so!

Check out our campaign's website for more details here.

While working on "Undigitize.me", Lior had a dream - spreading the word among kids. That is how we came up with "Planet Earth Kids Club".

Where's the money going? 

With your generous help, we will fund the illustrations, design the cover, pay for the professional consulting, editing, book design, and make the appropriate changes to make it look its best for publication.  

Then we will print copies for you and more to spread around the world, in preschools and libraries. 

Also, your donations will be used to fund our website's hosting and maintenance and the online community we build with it. So kids could join the club and feel that they are a part of a movement. 

We need your help!

  • Get the word out, tell your friends and family.
  • Share the campaign via Facebook, Twitter or email or use Indiegogo's easy-to-use sharing tools. 

    Thank you so much!

But reading a book is sometimes not enough - we want the kids to get up, grab mom and/or dad, and go outside. Outside the screens. So we created a community where every kid can join the club, by actually doing activities in the physical world.




In order to join the club, the kid needs to do the activities. The kids can then send us pictures of themselves doing the activities, and we will publish it on our website, including their name and the ranks they earned.




What can you get?

Besides helping us making this important movement, you could get wonderful rewards.A selection of cool rewards is available on the right section of this webpage. To name but a few:
- One or more copies of the printed books- A cool T-shirt with a "Planet Earth Kids Club" logo on it (available in several sizes)- The book will contain an illustrated portrait of your child!

Who We Are
We are Einav, Lior and Hagar - the creators of Planet Earth Kids Club. We all feel that it's crucial to educate our kids, on how great technology is, but at the same time, that the world outside the screens has a lot to offer! 
Einav Kesher - psychotherapist (M.A. Cognitive Psychology, UCONN, USA), mother of two, and the author of "The tale of an ADHD kid" - which helps kids and parents better understand living with ADHD. Einav's professional point of view and great writing skills will ensure that the right message is conveyed for the kid. 
Hagar Wertheim - illustrator and a mom to be. With her refreshing and sensitive illustrations, and her deep understanding of the issue, kids can easily imagine the life on a planet they've never heard of. 
Lior Frenkel is the creator of the social project "Undigitize.Me", which is designed to raise our awareness to smartphones and other digital addictions. People from all around the world have participated in Lior's viral campaign, which involves their portrayal in day-to-day activities with their "Phone Faced Down". They took a break from the addictive smartphones, and were proud to do so!


Check out our campaign's website for more details here.While working on "Undigitize.me", Lior had a dream - spreading the word among kids. That is how we came up with "Planet Earth Kids Club".
Where's the money going? 
With your generous help, we will fund the illustrations, design the cover, pay for the professional consulting, editing, book design, and make the appropriate changes to make it look its best for publication.  
Then we will print copies for you and more to spread around the world, in preschools and libraries. 
Also, your donations will be used to fund our website's hosting and maintenance and the online community we build with it. So kids could join the club and feel that they are a part of a movement. 


We need your help!


Get the word out, tell your friends and family.

Share the campaign via Facebook, Twitter or email or use Indiegogo's easy-to-use sharing tools. Thank you so much!

story:
Who doesn't love a crazy monkey?!

Big Pulp does. We love monkeys almost as much as we love a good story. A good story about monkeys? That's about the best thing ever! 20 of them in one book? Well, we just died and went to Heaven. 

About Big Pulp

We're carving out an independent corner of the publishing world where story matters and writers get paid for their work. Got 20 bucks? You can help us out in a big way. 

Since 2008, Big Pulp has published some of the best genre fiction writers from around the world. Our zine is a modern version of the classic corner newsstand, where writers and readers could find pulp and popular fiction of all kinds - science fiction, adventure stories, horror, fantasy, jungle tales, mystery and true crime, romance, and super-hero sagas. Big Pulp has published long-time writers and award-winners, as well as new and emerging authors. Some of our writers have published hundreds of stories or poems, but many have received their first writing credit - and first payment - from Big Pulp. 

The Impact

Sales are our lifeline. Period. Without sales, we would no longer be able to pay our writers, maintain our website or continue publishing. 

We strongly believe that writers deserve to be paid for their work. We also believe that offering payment significantly increases the quality of work that is submitted to us for publication on our site and in the magazine. 

Big Pulp launched online in 2008, moved into print in 2010. This year, we're adding themed anthologies to our publications. We're no fly-by-night or vanity press! We've been at this a while and want your support to keep it going! 

What We Need & What You Get

$2500 buys a lot for a small press, including dozens of writer payments and a healthy print run for several books. 

All our editorial work - site maintenance, editing and proofreading, sales & events - is done pro bono. Every dollar raised through the campaign will go back into running the site, publishing the magazine, and paying contributors. No exceptions. 

We're not asking for you to give something for nothing! Depending on your funding level, you net a copy of Big Pulp, back issues, a copy of our monkey-themed story collection APESHIT, an awesome hand-crafted Jankie by Phil Good, an original sketch by comic artist Ken Knudtsen (Wolverine, My Monkey's Name is Jennifer), a thorough manuscript critique by Big Pulp editor Bill Olver, or a massive combo pack! Trust us - they are all awesome. 

No $$$? We're cool. 

We know that not everyone has dough to throw around. We've been there. But, it doesn't cost a dime to help spread the word! 

Can you help us find 50 new readers? Tell your friends! 

If you're a writer and want to help keep a paying market in print, make some noise! 

The sharing tools make it easy to help spread the word through e-mail, Facebook, Twitter or your own web site. Tell your friends!

story:
Stretch Goals!

We've reached our goal! Would you like to get some stretch goals? If we reach $5,500, I'll include five illustrations in the book. You've seen the wonderful output of the artists who worked on the promotional materials and now you can enjoy their imagery, in beautiful black and white.

About Young Blood

NEW REWARDS: Custom ukuleles! Patrons can choose between a nylon, 4-string Trashulele OR a wound metal, 3-string slide guitar. All instruments will come electrified with a pickup and a tiny amp in a trash housing. We also have Tentacle Sticks!

Domingo collects garbage for a living, carefully finding treasures where others see nothing. One night, the teenager meets a vampire in Mexico City’s subway. She is Atl, descendant of Aztec blood-drinkers with a very exclusive diet: she will only drink the blood of the very young. She’s also the member of an important Northern narco family. And she’s hiding in Mexico City.

But there are rival vampires hot on her trail, determined to squash Atl and win these drug wars.

Atl doesn’t want to end up with her head chopped off and carried in a cooler.

Domingo just wants a friend, even if she’s got some baggage. Hey, we’ve all got to die some day.

Below, Atl, illustration by Bernie Gonzalez.


The Project

A few years back I wrote a short story, “A Puddle of Blood,” which was published in the vampire anthology Evolve 2. It was about Domingo and Atl, a teenager and a vampire in Mexico City. The story was reprinted Imaginarium 2012: The Best Canadian Speculative Writing.

Afterwards, I began toying with expanding it and making a YA novel out of it. Why? Isn't that what all the cool cats are doing? I want to write something that is a bit noir, a bit vampires, and a bit Mexico. 

I decided to fund this through IndieGoGo after I applied for a small Canada Arts Grant and was denied. I also had a scary medical MRI which convinced me I don't have forever to finish stuff. Both of these events propelled me forward.

Below, Alex, illustration by GMB Chomichuk.

Risks and challenges

I’ve been writing since 2006. My work has appeared in a bunch of anthologies from small and big publishers alike. My first collection, This Strange Way of Dying, is out this year from Canadian lit publisher Exile Editions.

I own my own micro publishing company (Innsmouth Free Press) and I figured maybe I should try to publish this by myself. Hey, why not? After all, I've edited and published other books before.

I intend to deliver the final novel by November 2014.

Where is my money going to?

Production (copy-editing and the like), commissioning a cover (the artist will have to get paid), and most importantly, you buy me time to write. Without time I can't do this. This is why I had applied to a Canada Arts Grant in the first place. Time is money...well. You get the drift.

What do I get?

Depending on your donation level anything from an e-book (no DRM), to a print (sexy paperback!) copy, to the book plus various pieces of swag.

If you donate $100 or more, you get a special chapbook containing four of my short stories. One of them will be completely new!

Or, also for $100, you get a short story critique.

At $150 I'll send you the book in hardcover, an exclusive IndieGoGo reward. It won't be available in this format elsewhere.

At $250, dinner is on me during next year's World Horror convention in Portland.

At $250 I'll write a story inspired by a title of your choice.

At $250 you can get an eerie Tentacle Stick.

At $350 you can have a custom ukulele.

At $500 purchase the Seven Snakes Guitar.

At $1,000 you get a Tuckerization and a secret vampiric gift.

Come on, support it!

Domingo, illustration by GMB Chomichuk

TEASER: Chapter 1

Collecting garbage sharpens the senses. It allows one to notice what others do not see. Where most people spy a pile of junk, the rag-and-bone man sees treasure: empty bottles that might be taken to the recycling centre, computer innards which can be re-used, furniture in decent shape. The garbage collector is always looking. It is a profession.  

Domingo was always looking for garbage and he was always looking at people. It was his hobby. The people, not the garbage. He walked around Mexico City in his blue plastic jacket, head bobbed down, and while he tossed a bottle into a plastic bag he paused to observe the people eating at a restaurant. He looked at the maids as they got up early and purchased bread at the bakery. He saw the people in shiny cars zoom by and the people without any cash jump onto the back of the bus, hanging with their nails and their grit to the metallic shell of the moving vehicle.

Domingo had spent most of the day outside, pushing a shopping cart with his findings, and listening to his portable music player. It got dark and he bought himself dinner at a taco stand. Then it started to rain so he headed into the subway station.
He spent a lot of time in the subway system. He used to sleep in the subway cars when he was a street kid making a living by washing windshields at cross streets.

Those days were behind. He had a place to sleep and lately he collected junk for an important rag-and-bone man, focusing on gathering used thermoplastic clothing for him. He complemented his income with other odd jobs, with the recycled bottles and the interesting items he fished from the garbage. Domingo was well-fed and he had enough money to buy tokens for the public baths once a week.
He felt like he was really going places but entertainment was still out of his reach. He had his comic books and graphic novels to keep him company but most of the time, when he was bored, he watched people as they walked around the subway lines.

It was easy because few of them paid attention to the teenager leaning against the wall, backpack dangling from his left shoulder. He, on the other hand, paid attention to everything. He constructed lives for the people who shuffled in front of him. This one looked like a man who worked selling life insurance. That one was a secretary, but not with a good firm because her shoes looked cheap. Here came a con artist and there went a lovelorn housewife.

Domingo imagined names and biographies for them as he leaned against the cool wall tiles and bobbed his head to the sound of the music. It was Michael Jackson for the day.

After an hour of people watching, Domingo went to look at the large TV screens in the concourse. There were six of them, all showing different shows. Domingo spent fifteen minutes staring at Japanese music videos, then he switched to the news.   

Six dismembered bodies found in Ciudad Juarez. Vampire drug-wars rage on.

Domingo read the headline slowly. Images flashed on the video screen of the subway station. Cops. Long shots of the bodies. The images dissolved, showing a young woman holding a can of soda in her hands. She winked at him.

Domingo waited to see if the next news items would expand on the drug-war story. He was fond of yellow journalism. He also liked stories and comic books about vampires; they seemed exotic. There were no vampires in Mexico City: their kind had been a no-no for the past thirty years, around the time the Federal District became a city-state.

The next story was of a pop-star, the singing sensation of the month, and then there was another ad, this one for a shoulder-bag computer. Domingo sulked, changed the tune on his music player.

He looked at another screen with pictures of blue butterflies fluttering around. Domingo took a chocolate from his pocket and tore the wrapper.

He wondered if he shouldn’t head to Santino’s party. Santino lived in a vecindad downtown and though his home was a one-bedroom, they were throwing an all-night party on the roof where there was plenty of space. But Santino was friends with El Chacal and Domingo didn’t want to see that guy. Besides, he’d probably have to contribute to the beer budget. It was the end of the month. Domingo was short on cash.

Domingo pondered his options.

A woman wearing a black vinyl jacket walked by him, holding a leash. Her Doberman must have been genetically modified. The animal was huge and looked mean.
Domingo recognized her. He’d seen her twice before, riding the subway late at nights, always with the dog. Heavy boots upon the white tiles, bob cut black hair, with a regal stance and a sharp, aquiline face. The way she moved, it made him think of water. Like she was sliding on water.

She moved her face a small fraction, glancing at him. It was nothing but a glance, but the way she did it made Domingo feel like he’d been doused with a bucket of ice water. Something bored into him, snaked around his throat, and he felt the need to follow her.

Domingo stuffed the remaining chocolate back in his pocket, took off his headphones and walked behind her quickly, squeezing through the doors of the subway car she was boarding.

He sat across from her and was able to get a better look at the woman. She was older than him, early twenties, with large eyes that gave her an air of innocence which was quickly dispelled by the stern mouth. The woman was cute, in an odd way.  

He noticed her gloves.  Black vinyl which matched the jacket. She wasn’t wearing a fancy outfit but there was definitely something special about it. He suspected it was more expensive that it seemed.

The subway car stopped and Domingo fidgeted, wondering where she was headed. The woman patted the dog’s head.

He was looking at her discreetly and he knew how to do discreet, so he was a bit surprised when she turned and stared right back at him.

Domingo froze and swallowed. He found his tongue with some effort.

“Hey,” he said, smiling. “How are you doing tonight?”

She did not smile back. Her lips were pressed together in a precise and unyielding line. He hoped she wasn’t thinking of letting the dog loose on him for staring at her.

The subway car was almost deserted and when she spoke her voice seemed to echo around them even though she spoke very softly.

“Should you be out by yourself at this time of the night?”

“What do you mean?”

“How old are you?”

“Seventeen,” he replied, lying only by two months. “It’s early. It’s just before midnight.”

“No curfew?”

“No,” he scoffed. “I live on my own.”

“Ah, a man about town.”

There was laughter in her voice even though she didn’t laugh. It made him stand up and he was ready to push his little shopping cart away, to leave her alone. She turned her head away from him and he assumed this was goodbye. Goodnight.

“I’m looking for a friend,” she said unexpectedly.

Domingo blinked. He nodded, uncertain.

Interested in reading the rest of this chapter? Head over to my blog.

The second and third chapters are also online.

story:
Update:

We are officially off the ground! 

 

Short Summary

I'm Michael Wharton and I've been performing stories about love onstage for about a year or so now. I've decided to take these stories and create Tales of The Nomadic Love Patrol. 

 

Here is a link to an excerpt: http://wp.me/p3JPdl-5

 

 

 

And here is a link to an article about me in San Francisco Magazine: http://tinyurl.com/kpg4j8c

 

In the book I will tell fifteen true and hilarious stories about how we find, lose and hopefully accept love. It's about how, eventually, we come to terms with our membership what I call the nomadic love patrol, that vast tribe of human beings in search of someone with whom to share this life. 

 

What I Need

I need to raise $8,000 to help pay to design, edit, print and market my book. I plan to release it February of next year. 


Who I Am

I've been writing, speaking and thinking about love and the funny ever since I can remember. I won national awards for speaking and writing in college and came fourth in the Sacramento Comedian's Contest. I was editor in chief of the Daily Californian (University of California, Berkeley) before becoming a contributor to xlr8r magazine and an editor at AOL CityGuides where I also did a weekly radio spot. I was a lifestyle writer for Washington Life magazine and I won best supporting actor (comedy) at the New York International Film Festival (1998).

I was a lifestyle writer for Washington Life magazine and I won best supporting actor (comedy) at the New York International Film Festival (1998).

story:
Independent Bookstores of America

Independent Bookstores of America is a coffee table book featuring locally owned, independent bookstores in cities throughout each of the contiguous 48 United States of America. The book is an attempt to chronicle a slice of American life that many people believe is in danger of disappearing. The book will feature pictures of thriving, locally owned bookstores and include a little information describing each store’s unique story.

This idea has evolved as a product of my passion for books, reading, and supporting locally owned businesses. In the book there will be a page filled with information about how and what each person can do to support their local independent bookstore even if they are a consumer of e-books. The use of an e-reader does not have to mean the end of the local community bookstore! Bookstores serve as an integral part of our society and have been a hub for community building for centuries. While the large chain bookstores may be facing problems, local independent stores are making a come back in many cities as we remember the value of having a bookstore where we can mix and mingle and be!

Why I am doing this project 

I'm doing this project for one simple reason; I love bookstores. I also hold a bachelor's and master's degree in political science and believe in the benefits of supporting locally owned businesses. I believe bookstores are one of the few places we have left that can promote civic engagement and community building. But most importantly, I am doing this because project because of what bookstores have meant to me over the years. 

This is a project of passion for me. I moved around a lot as a child, and bookstores were my constant refuge. The first thing I did when I moved to a new place was to seek out the closet bookstore. My hope is that this book will capture the feeling all book lovers get when they first walk into a store.

Why I am the best possible person to write and produce this book

If there’s one thing people who know me can tell you, it’s that I love books. There are many things in life that I may be undecided about, but the one thing that always remains constant about me is that I am an avid supporter and encourager of reading. I don’t care if you read the most erudite books or the trashiest of trash – all reading has benefits, and I support all of it! This is also why I started a website [bookprescriber.org] with the goal of helping people find books they will love  -- I believe non-readers are only a book away from becoming book lovers.

So, practically? I have spent the last six months planning the logistics needed to make this book happen. I have chosen stores in each state (most from local recommendations) along with backups in case of an unforeseen problem with the first chosen store. I have mapped routes, chosen cameras, software, and have other materials in place to start production on the book itself after returning from the stores. I have also worked with a really great lawyer to prepare a release for the stores to sign and have contingency plans in place for any problems I may run into while creating this book.

I estimate it will take nearly two months of traveling across America to complete this book. The money I raise will go to supporting travel, photography, interviews, writing, book design, proofreading, and ultimately, publishing the book both digitally and in hardcopy.

What's next?

There will be full transparency in the creation of this book because I will be keeping a blog as I travel to all the stores. You'll get updates, previews of material that will be in the book, and be able to keep tabs on where I am in the United States.

Another way to help out and support this project whether or not you can donate right now is to spread the word via Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, and your other social networks.

One of the biggest challenges of this project is managing the logistics involved to get to each bookstore and be able to work with someone from each store. Since I am aware of the possible challenges, most of which can be overcome with more time, I am scheduling enough time and flexibility into my research to accommodate any unforeseen issues.

This book project is a dream of mine. It will be a once in a lifetime experience to pursue and create something I am personally very passionate about. I am determined to overcome any obstacles that may arise to complete this book!

Thank you so much for your support!!

story:
My name is Jennifer and I’m a student from metro Detroit. Aside from my studies in engineering, I’m an avid photographer with past showcases in Los Angeles and Paris and previously sponsored work in American Photo magazine.

I’m currently working to raise funds for an upcoming August mission trip to El Salvador for FIMRC, a non-profit organization that has been actively improving medical care for children in underprivileged and underserved areas of the world since 2002. My role as both a student volunteer and photojournalist will take me to a FIMRC clinic that was founded in 2008 in Las Delicias, a rural community only 45 minutes outside of San Salvador.

Along with Wayne State University’s chapter, our work with the Ministry of Health and other partners in preventative health education will expand on the clinic’s community outreach to prevent common problems of malnutrition, gastrointestinal illnesses and other respiratory infections. Particularly vulnerable are the children of El Salvador. Health issues of children related to poverty include diarrhea, head lice, malnutrition, and bronchial infections. Many of the health issues are also due to a lack of education, scarce resources and poor water quality. All of these conditions are easily treatable or preventable, but require support through health education, basic supplies and volunteers.

As a student with a sense of urgency for the plight of children in need of medical care, my objectives will be not only to assist medical professionals in basic medical care and operations, but to also employ my photojournalism skills to document the efforts through digital media to share the experience and raise further awareness of the needs of children in El Salvador to promote the work of FIMRC.

My target fundraising goal is $1600 which will provide assistance for my travel expenses. Digital photography equipment, material costs, documentary services and volunteered time to the community are my contributions to the mission. With your donation, I hope to produce a photo-documentary that addresses the health issues, lifestyle/culture of children in rural underserved communities.

As a token of appreciation, I hope to complete a digital photo project to share with you to commemorate your contributions to international healthcare for children and this mission. This journey is not my own, and I believe the insights found may serve as a unifying connection that bridges our communities and creates a better understanding of humanity’s needs.

story:
A Space Opera Classic in the Making

Hey, my name is Dominic. I've written a space opera military action novel called SACRIFICE. It's the first in a trilogy of novels I've planned that show David Stern's journey from an eager upstart in the military to the greatest war hero of his time. It will be a long ride, but it's one you will enjoy.

In 2694, the human world is on the verge of great change. On the outskirts of the civilzed universe, a lonely patrol discovers a race of spacefaring aliens that leave many in the military fearing for the safety of the human race, but the aliens aren't the only thing that concerns the Human Defence League.

A dangerous terrorist known as Zeus has escaped from prison and ignited a revolution that left unchecked will spread into a civil war. With a potential threat from without and a very real threat from within, the League sends David Stern undercover to bring Zeus in: dead or alive.

David's been waiting his whole life for a mission like this, but his opponent is two steps ahead of him and slowly but surely pushing the galaxy into a war that only David can prevent.

David and his comrades race to track down and assassinate Zeus. The stakes are high and only getting higher and David has to choose what rules he must break in order to level the playing field and get the job done.

What will he sacrifice for the sake of his objective?

Download the first SEVEN CHAPTERS of Sacrifice here.

Give the preview a read and decide for yourself if this is a book you'd like to see spread to the world. I intend to embrace the ebook revolution and release Sacrifice as an ebook available at all major retailers including Apple, Amazon, Kobo, Sony, and Nook as well as in PDF.

What I Need & What You Get

This is a list of how I plan to use the money. My goal is based on quotes and projected rates that I've added up

  • Indiegogo fees + printing fees for the perks (about 30% of funds raised or $2100 based on the project meeting its goal)
  • Professional content editing and formatting ($1500)
  • Professional promotional art ($1000 - $1500)
  • Obtaining professional advance reviews (e.g. Kirkus, $850)
  • Copyright registration ($50)
  • Postage & supplies necessary to mail everything
  • Advertising, primarily using Facebook and Goodreads ($500)

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will use whatever I raise and put it towards the items of most pressing importance. I've listed them according to my priority level. I am already putting my own money into the project, and if I do not reach my goal I will just be delayed and have to spend more. However, I won't give up under any circumstance.

If I exceed my goal, the extra funds will be put into more advertising or art.

To help encourage your donations, I've included great rewards to go with every donation over 10 dollars. Of course, these perks have added significant costs to my fundraising goal, but I think it’s worth it to show the early adopters that your contributions matter and that your money will not only help me, but also get you something in return.

The Impact

I've poured my soul into this book, because it represents the beginning of my career. I've decided to self-publish because I know that the publishing world is changing. People don't need a traditional publisher to reach millions of people worldwide. I'd rather keep control of my work, and keep the prices low for the consumer so that everyone can read good books more easily.

Your donations will help me create a book that goes a step beyond the bulk of self-published novels that lack the quality of books that are backed by big publishing houses. Your donations will allow me to bring the reader a great reading experience for less than half the price of regular novels.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't donate to the campaign, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Please spread the word about the book and this campaign by sharing the link for this donation page and Liking me on Facebook. Eventually I plan to set up a web page for the book as well as a dedicated site for myself, but for now, Facebook is the primary way to stay up to date.

EDIT: I now have a page on Smashwords where I will soon be uploading some short stories for free

Thank you for your time and support. With all of your help, SACRIFICE should be ready for a Holidays 2012 release on all major eBook platforms.

story:
My name is Crash Barry and I write about the seamy side of life in Maine. Perhaps you’re familiar with my rollicking novel Sex, Drugs and Blueberries or my gritty memoir Tough Island. Maybe you’ve read my column One Maniac’s Meat or my other work in the Bollard or you enjoyed the short-lived Crash Report in the Portland Daily Sun. Or maybe you just stumbled across this project because you liked the name Marijuana Valley.

I think we're curretly living in the best time in the history of the printed word to be an indie writer like myself. While some authors bemoan the collapse of the publishing industry, I think that in the Internet era, the future looks brightest for writers who embrace the new paradigm.

And one of the wonderful things about the new paradigm is the relationship between author and reader. Thanks to social media, email, blogs and my books and newspaper work, I feel I have a real relationship with the folks who read my what I write. And it’s been a great year traveling and meeting people at library and bookstore events across Maine as part of my Tough Island: Live tour.

Which has given me the confidence to attempt to raise the money necessary to successfully print and promote my new book Marijuana Valley, Maine via crowdfunding and Indiegogo. The $12,000, or more,  that I hope to raise will be spent on the business side of publishing. While I'm very appreciative and proud of the sales of my first two books, it was a difficult struggle to find the cash to actually get the titles in print. Editing, design, advertizing, public relations and mailing all cost a lot of money. And by pre-selling copies of Marijuana Valley, I'll be able to handle the costs without much stress, thanks to my loyal readers.

In the forthcoming Marijuana Valley, which I expect will be out around the start of 2013, I detail the trials and tribulations of several people –all who happened to live on the same road in rural Maine – as they grew medical marijuana, legally, during the summer of 2010. Marijuana Valley is a vivid, behind-the-scenes look at a tiny slice of the secretive subculture involved with Maine’s most valuable agricultural product.

For the duration of the campaign, I'll be regularly posting updates and special tips and tales related to marijuana and the cannabis subculture, much of which I learned during the last 18-months I've spent researching the topic of marijuana.

I hope you’ll tune in and I hope you'll support this project. And even if you can't help out financially, I'd really appreciate you sharing this details of this project -- and the accompanying film -- with friends and aquaintenances.

story:
Story of My Book

The Caring Computer is a book on modern, everyday technologies that act as doctors combating the scariness of dementia, falling, heart failure, and other issues within seniors. This book explores the intersections of innovative healthy aging prototypes, entrepreneurial caregiving, and the presence of artificial intelligence in the healthcare sector.

My name is Martha Gizaw, and I am the author of The Caring Computer: Today’s Technologies that Serve as Doctors for the Aging Globe. I wrote this book because I believe a variety of technologies can help senior adults live up to their healthy lifestyles in the household. Families fear for the predictable, rapidly-growing “silver tsunami,” and they should consider our current technologies as modern-day solutions to the burdens of caring for their older relatives.

The Caring Computer is a non-fiction book that speaks to caregivers, engineers, and physicians who are looking at aging innovation and technological developments for the first time.

I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover the possibility of closing the gaps between bio-medicine and computing by improving seniors’ health and independence via technological innovation and entrepreneurship. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for aging innovation and technological developments in you. Ultimately, I want people to see this book as a tool to help us seek creative alternative ways to make a difference in the healthcare, research, and geriatric career sectors.

In this book, you’ll learn about the accounts ranging from the significance and benefits of interdisciplinary thinking to the ability of voice-first devices to help users “age in place.” You’ll hear:

  • How startups and organizations are working to bridge the separate worlds of science and technology;
  • What technical approaches are available to help relieve the symptoms of dementia and other problems associated with aging; and
  • How solutions leading to healthier aging can benefit future generations of seniors.

You will love this book if you have an innovative mindset and an interest in enacting positive change in the lives of others.

 

The Book - The Caring Computer: Today’s Technologies that Serve as Doctors for the Aging Globe

The book contains three parts:

Part 1 “Battle of the Sciences” begins with a personal struggle to choose a career path based on either passion or marketability. More specifically, this part deals with comparisons between biomedical science and computing regarding learning preferences and career outlook, and how bridging the two subjects can give way to technologies that help make a difference in a global aging society.

Part 2 “Innovating for Dementia” covers stories that explain the technologies and scientific advancements currently available for entrepreneurial caregivers to look for symptoms and changes in memory and daily routines among dementia patients.

Part 3 “Tech-Savvy Attempts to Conquer Aging” features stories that promote the creation of devices and platforms, from gene-editing tools to mobile apps to AI analysis, that could assist seniors with activities of daily living. The book will then come to an exciting ending with voice-first robots that underwent beta testing on seniors, courtesy of Intuition Robotics and the Front Porch Center for Innovation and Wellbeing.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be in publication with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and launch my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling before publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish it. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also release an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will launch a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help provide me with feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more!

 

About the Author

Martha Gizaw is a graduating student at the College of William & Mary studying biomedical engineering and computer science. She is among a crowd of people from underrepresented backgrounds who hope to begin a STEM career after graduating college. Given that she was diagnosed with multiple disabilities, settling on a college major and career path was extremely difficult for her compared to other students. Originally a natural science enthusiast, Gizaw began taking computer science courses at age 20. With initial plans on studying neuroscience, she faced mixed reactions from family members and professors that urged her to step outside the comfort zone and solve challenging problems beyond her imagination.

Gizaw wrote this book because she has had a curiosity for science and an aptitude for technology and mathematics. While working hard on projects that combine those disciplines, she hopes to make a difference in others’ lives. Chatbots, mobile apps, smart homes, computer vision, and hardware electronics are currently in the market for people from newborns to super-centenarians. Gizaw also considers herself a techie with a dream of becoming a researcher or data scientist in the engineering industry to shape humanity with innovation and insightful statistics.

For more information, you can connect with Gizaw at mtgizaw@email.wm.edu, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and gets published. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered should ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #CaringComputer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 11 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Martha Gizaw


Thanks again,
Martha Gizaw

Story of My Book
The Caring Computer is a book on modern, everyday technologies that act as doctors combating the scariness of dementia, falling, heart failure, and other issues within seniors. This book explores the intersections of innovative healthy aging prototypes, entrepreneurial caregiving, and the presence of artificial intelligence in the healthcare sector.My name is Martha Gizaw, and I am the author of The Caring Computer: Today’s Technologies that Serve as Doctors for the Aging Globe. I wrote this book because I believe a variety of technologies can help senior adults live up to their healthy lifestyles in the household. Families fear for the predictable, rapidly-growing “silver tsunami,” and they should consider our current technologies as modern-day solutions to the burdens of caring for their older relatives.The Caring Computer is a non-fiction book that speaks to caregivers, engineers, and physicians who are looking at aging innovation and technological developments for the first time.I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover the possibility of closing the gaps between bio-medicine and computing by improving seniors’ health and independence via technological innovation and entrepreneurship. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for aging innovation and technological developments in you. Ultimately, I want people to see this book as a tool to help us seek creative alternative ways to make a difference in the healthcare, research, and geriatric career sectors.In this book, you’ll learn about the accounts ranging from the significance and benefits of interdisciplinary thinking to the ability of voice-first devices to help users “age in place.” You’ll hear:

How startups and organizations are working to bridge the separate worlds of science and technology;
What technical approaches are available to help relieve the symptoms of dementia and other problems associated with aging; and
How solutions leading to healthier aging can benefit future generations of seniors.

You will love this book if you have an innovative mindset and an interest in enacting positive change in the lives of others.

 
The Book - The Caring Computer: Today’s Technologies that Serve as Doctors for the Aging Globe

The book contains three parts:Part 1 “Battle of the Sciences” begins with a personal struggle to choose a career path based on either passion or marketability. More specifically, this part deals with comparisons between biomedical science and computing regarding learning preferences and career outlook, and how bridging the two subjects can give way to technologies that help make a difference in a global aging society.Part 2 “Innovating for Dementia” covers stories that explain the technologies and scientific advancements currently available for entrepreneurial caregivers to look for symptoms and changes in memory and daily routines among dementia patients.Part 3 “Tech-Savvy Attempts to Conquer Aging” features stories that promote the creation of devices and platforms, from gene-editing tools to mobile apps to AI analysis, that could assist seniors with activities of daily living. The book will then come to an exciting ending with voice-first robots that underwent beta testing on seniors, courtesy of Intuition Robotics and the Front Porch Center for Innovation and Wellbeing.
 
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be in publication with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and launch my manuscript in July 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling before publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish it. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also release an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will launch a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help provide me with feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more!


 
About the Author
Martha Gizaw is a graduating student at the College of William & Mary studying biomedical engineering and computer science. She is among a crowd of people from underrepresented backgrounds who hope to begin a STEM career after graduating college. Given that she was diagnosed with multiple disabilities, settling on a college major and career path was extremely difficult for her compared to other students. Originally a natural science enthusiast, Gizaw began taking computer science courses at age 20. With initial plans on studying neuroscience, she faced mixed reactions from family members and professors that urged her to step outside the comfort zone and solve challenging problems beyond her imagination.Gizaw wrote this book because she has had a curiosity for science and an aptitude for technology and mathematics. While working hard on projects that combine those disciplines, she hopes to make a difference in others’ lives. Chatbots, mobile apps, smart homes, computer vision, and hardware electronics are currently in the market for people from newborns to super-centenarians. Gizaw also considers herself a techie with a dream of becoming a researcher or data scientist in the engineering industry to shape humanity with innovation and insightful statistics.
For more information, you can connect with Gizaw at mtgizaw@email.wm.edu, Facebook, and LinkedIn.

 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and gets published. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered should ship.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #CaringComputer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book with 11 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Thanks again,Martha GizawThanks again,Martha Gizaw
