Short Summary

The book will be cloth-bound (BN Imperial 4590), with cover elements embossed on it in gold. It clocks in at 528 pages to keep its weight under 1kg. The interior is set on 60x90 1/16 (220x150 mm) 80g paper.

 

The book has been manually proofread and typeset with TeX prior to publication, assuring top-notch quality and satisfaction of values, as confirmed by the participants of previous print runs.

I have commissioned 8 12 talented artists to create a full-page illustration for each of the stories. We got you covered, visual readers!

(Wow, this got outdated FAST.)

Examples of our previous works can be found at https://www.fimfiction.net/user/129042/.

[The Brotherhood of Russians would like me to remind you that this book is, in fact, not written in Russian.]

{Also, OldBoy#5831 is not on our team, nor has anything to do with this project at all.}

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing according the perks on the top-right, you'll get the books you want to get. Everything is already included: shipping, handling, and extra care.

Risks & Challenges

I live in Russia. We love books here, and that's why I've started this in first place. But, as Russia is currently not at best terms with the rest of the world, a lot of organization-related things have been very hard to make right. Right now, I hope that we'll be able to make it. (Don't worry, there will be no issues with shipping.)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want the book yourself, maybe you know someone else who does! Please share information about this campaign with anyone who will love a great read and a fancy piece of community memorabilia. Together, we will accomplish anything.

And that's all there is to it. If you have questions that haven't been answered here, I can be found on Discord: https://discord.gg/YzbVSKs

 

(Confused? Learn about the community at https://whatisabrony.com/)

story:
About the Book

 

Modern Real Estate Valuation -  Guide to Real  Estate Appraisal

 

Trillions of dollars are invested in commercial real estate, such as office buildings, retail centers, hotels, and multi-unit apartment buildings.  Billions are invested in residential properties, such as homes and condominiums.   Individuals and businesses, both micro and conglomerate organizations, invest in commercial and residential real estate.   

 

Real estate holdings have climbed to new heights through the balancing of macro-economic policy, mortgage rates, and elusive market dynamics.

 

However, fortunes have ruptured through economic periods, such as the Real Estate Bubble of 2008, and the Stock Market Crash of 1929.  Individuals have experienced homelessness, unemployment, and financial disasters through these events. Organizations have filed Chapter 7, 11, and 13 dissolving the businesses which they established, abandoning the employees, and the financial structures which they built through  years of toil and sweat equity.

 

 

Modern Real  Estate Valuation – Guide to Real Estate Appraisal  represents a vast corpus of practical knowledge, invaluable insights, and analytical tools of real estate valuation, and informs and demonstrates dynamic developments transforming real estate and valuation, for now and beyond.  These developments impact individual and organizational financial liquidity and health.

 

Whether you are well-seasoned or a novice of real estate and real estate investing, you will obtain a depth and breadth of knowledge equipping you to build a foundation tailored to your investment and purchase  of real estate, which could be utilized for the funding of college education, retirement, and healthcare among other major items.

 

With the tools and techniques of real estate valuation, you will obtain and apply invaluable knowledge for your real estate purchases and investments.

 

 

Building a Foundation of Valuation Knowledge

 

I am L.W.L Moy, EA, author of Modern Real Estate Valuation – Guide to Real Estate Appraisal.   As you preview the book guide, discover the principles of real estate valuation and appraisal, and fortify the foundation of invaluable tools to understand and analyze real estate.  From the purchase of a residence, to acquisition of income properties, such as apartment buildings and hotels, you will obtain and develop a foundation of knowledge and practice in the science and the art of real estate valuation.

 

About the Project

 

Modern Real Estate Valuation – Guide to Real Estate Appraisal  guides the previewer and provides technical tools, invaluable  insights, and practical knowledge  of the science and art of real estate valuation, and informs of dynamic developments transforming real estate, for now and beyond.

The guide delves through the how's and the why's of real estate valuation to help you to make informed decisions.

 

Campaign Contributions and Project Development

 

The fund contributions are applied for the design, editing, marketing, production, and publishing of the book guide.  Dedicated staff to create a tangible book crafted for the investor and consumer of real estate.

 

Your contribution has an immeasurable impact on the development of the book. 

 

Whether a donation to the to the campaign; your preview of  the Introduction, Chapters, or Manuscript, the contributions to the book are significant and substantial.

 

Campaign Contributors

 

View real estate through multiple lenses which will enhance and broaden essential experience for investing.

Discover real estate valuation of yesterday and of today as we progress towards the future:

  • Hear about wide-reaching real estate developments through the years, from eras of crisis, to prosperous cycles, from titans of industry, and how such developments impact your personal investments, and the global-scale economy.
  • Understand and  apply the primary real estate valuation methodologies
  • Amplify insights of the developments in valuation and appraisal and understand its application to your real estate purchases and investments
  • Make informed investment decisions
  • Apply invaluable real estate knowledge and practice the fundamentals for yourself

 

You will enjoy the book whether purchasing a residence, or seek deeper understanding of leveraging income properties for investment, such as apartment and office buildings, hotels, motels, among a multitude of real estate groups.

 

Perks & Rewards

 

These exclusive rewards are provided for those who pre-order my book today:

  • New Degree Press has approved the Manuscript.  The book features interviews from titans of  the real estate, finance, and valuation industries.
  • Pre-order the printed book or the E-book
  • Receive  a personally signed printed edition of the book.
  • Your Name highlighted at Special Acknowledgements part of the book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Contribute to designing the book cover
  • Early  access to the Introduction of my publication, and chapters as Previewer who shapes the content through review, input, and early feedback.
  • Preview the Introduction, Chapters, Manuscript
  • Provide feedback to develop the cover design.
  • Invitation to book topic/workshop seminars where I will discuss the experience of writing the book guide. 
  • Obtain insights to the production of a beautiful publication.
  • Invitation to a Previewer Community via social media, such as Zoom, Skype, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, etc
  • Hour Real Estate Advisory.
  • And more...

 

Publisher New Degree Press

New Degree Press has approved the book manuscript.  I established the pre-order tiers to contribute to the costs of development, designing, editing, marketing, and publishing  the book guide.

 

 

Contribution pre-orders, donations,  and funds are applied towards publishing the book:

CONTENT REVIEW

  • The Editor and I are reviewing and revising content to publish my manuscript, which is approved: Spring - Autumn 2020.

DESIGN

  • Cover Design - the layouts you view are currently a preliminary design.
  • Layout Design of the interior: Print, Audio Format, E-book Format

EDITORIAL

  • Book Editing:  Edit and fine-tune the guide prior to publication.

PUBLISHING

  • Launch & Marketing Program: Ultimately publish the book guide: Q3 - Q4 2020.

 

A Contribution of Immeasurable Magnitude

 

Modern Real Estate Valuation - Guide to Real Estate Appraisal sprung from rigorous years of experience in the field appraising, valuing, and assessing commercial property, such as retail, apartment buildings, warehouse, industrial, places of worship and school, as well as residential properties, such as homes and condominiums. 

Through these experiences, a multitude of data was formulated into invaluable knowledge of technical tools to analyze, evaluate, and understand real estate.

 

  • Real estate is an enormous investment for most people.  Building your foundation of technical skills and practical knowledge is beyond measure.

 

  • A tangible book guide for the well-seasoned expert or novice of real estate and valuation contributes to financial and investment literacy for an era of economic transformation, upheaval, and renaissance.

 

  • The guide bridges the gap between consumers and investors.

 

About the Campaign

 

Built into the campaign order is the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies within each pre-order tier.

 

  • The publisher New Degree Press and I will work closely to ensure we obtain the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. 
  • We will keep all pre-order supporter donors up-to-date as my book reaches each key milestone and publishes. 

 

  • Email correspondence will be sent to you when my book is published, and your pre-orders are expected to ship.

 

  • The publisher provides for both domestic and international shipments.

 

 

Stretch Goals & Bonus Perks

  •  120 of the  books are pre-ordered, book goes to publication. 
  • 150 are pre-sold, an audiobook will be made.  
  • A printed edition will be contributed to the Library of Congress and my local library when the pre-order goal is met

 

 

Ways To Assist and Contribute

 

Pre-Order the Book  for yourself, friends, and members of your network.

  • Receive the electronic e-Book or a printed book edition.
  • Invite your friends and network to pre-order the book to shape the book content prior to publication.  Please do so as a text message or direct message on social media.

 

Review & Pre-Order

  • Register as a Previewer who previews the Introduction, Chapters, or the Manuscript.  The publisher New Degree Press approved the Manuscript and we are currently fine-tuning the conent.
  • Previewers are an integral and an important integral part of the Reviewer Community who previews the content and provides feedback, opinions, and input for the navigation of the book guide prior to publication.
  • Previewer Community meets via Zoom, Skype, LinkedIn, Facebook, and social media to preview and discuss the book content in a dialogue format.

 

Amplify the Social Media Campaign

  • Share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via the URL at the top of the page
  • Please post my Pre-Order Campaign at Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and social media,  with your friends, family and network, use #Real Estate,  and tag me as well as the publisher, New Degree Press so we amplify the campaign efforts.
  • Visit New Degree Press at www.newdegreepress.com to obtain publishing details.
  • Please make a Campaign Donation  via the Campaign page.

 

 

For details, please connect via lmoy0099@gmail.com; llm2@georgetown.edu; and at these social media platforms:

 

via LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter

LinkedIn  https://www.linkedin.com/in/lmoy0000

Instagram  @LLM99EA

Twitter  @LLM99EA

 

Many thanks for your contributions and support of the publishing journey, and I look forward to chat with you soon via phone, email, and the Campaign page!

 

~ LWLM

story:
Hi, I’m James (JP) Mackey. I’m a graphic designer for Minnesota State University, Mankato and I love to write, paint and draw. I’ve written and illustrated five books, mostly for children and young adults. I’ve also auctioned my works off for charity in the past, most notably the Howlween Creature Feature event (2012 and 2014), which benefited the local pet shelter.

It’s been a tough year for everyone, especially for families that rely on food banks to make ends meet. I’ve been there. I’ve lived paycheck to paycheck, wondering if I could feed my family and pay my bills at the same time. I’ve had to use the ECHO food shelf in Mankato, Minnesota on multiple occasions, and whenever I did it was a massive relief. During these times I painted (with the very cheapest materials I could scrounge or make from scratch) to give myself hope for the future, that something I was doing would make a difference one day.

The pandemic has thrown the world into a lurch, and now more than ever people need help. I’m still painting, and I’m still writing. The big difference is I'm not in the dire circumstances I was back when I needed the food bank. Now I want to do a little good and pay back what was given by holding another event. This year, I have created Faster Than Speed.

Faster Than Speed is a story told with thirty-four 20x16 canvases, painted in acrylics. These canvases will be auctioned in May of 2021. The proceeds of this auction, as well as those of the first one-thousand copies of the book, will be donated to the ECHO food shelf in Mankato, MN.

To offset the cost of the print run, art supplies and editing fees, I am trying to raise $4,500. This will produce 1,250 professional, hardcover books on quality matte paper (The first 1,000 copies proceeds will go to the food shelf, 250 will be used as perks of donating to this campaign).

What is Faster Than Speed?

Getting a job done quickly is important, but not as important as getting it done right. Go too fast, and you’ll have to go back and fix the mistakes you made because you were careless. Care, then, is faster than speed.

The main character of this book has been tasked with a very important mission; ride his trusty flurf (kind of a cross between a cat, a t-rex and an ankylosaur) to the city to barter for supplies his village needs to survive the winter. To make matters worse, he has to do it before the weather freezes and his mount goes into hibernation.

Along the way, the main character must make a choice; take care of a tiny creature called a sondling that he’s found on the side of the road, or get to the city as fast as he can.

Will he rescue the sondling and risk the survival of his village, or leave the helpless creature to the elements?

Faster Than Speed carries an engaging story with a positive message for children on the importance not only of taking their time and doing a good job versus doing it quickly, but taking care of those in need. Brightly colored paintings of a fantastic world will hold the attention of children and adults.

Your Contribution will go towards:

The cost of art supplies
Editing fees
The press run of the first edition of the book
Any amount in excess of what is needed will be donated to the food shelf

Perks

There are several perks that await contributors to this book’s production. They include signed prints of the paintings, signed copies of the book, original sketches used to produce the paintings, and a special thank you printed in the first edition.

Risks & Challenges

The task of producing 34 attractive pages of acrylics paintings is no mean feat, and getting them to successfully tell a story at the same time is a challenge in itself. However, at the time of this writing, the majority are in their final stages, and the story is written and in the editorial phase. The final art and editing is conservatively estimated to be complete by the end of February, 2021. The auction event for the paintings is projected to be in May, with the perks being shipped in early June of 2021.

Another challenge is the upfront cost; producing a full color, hardcover book at any level of quality is not cheap, especially if it is to be cost-effective for retail. I will be selling the paintings at an auction at the release event of this book, however that money is reserved for the ECHO food shelf in Mankato, Minnesota. I have saved funds of my own to make this dream a reality, though it will of course set me back significantly.  Your contributions will help me to offset this risk. The bottom line is, this book WILL be produced, but your help will make it much easier.

And of course I can’t do this without you. Please share this message with anyone you think would be interested.
story_txt: Hi, I’m James (JP) Mackey. I’m a graphic designer for Minnesota State University, Mankato and I love to write, paint and draw. I’ve written and illustrated five books, mostly for children and young adults. I’ve also auctioned my works off for charity in the past, most notably the Howlween Creature Feature event (2012 and 2014), which benefited the local pet shelter.It’s been a tough year for everyone, especially for families that rely on food banks to make ends meet. I’ve been there. I’ve lived paycheck to paycheck, wondering if I could feed my family and pay my bills at the same time. I’ve had to use the ECHO food shelf in Mankato, Minnesota on multiple occasions, and whenever I did it was a massive relief. During these times I painted (with the very cheapest materials I could scrounge or make from scratch) to give myself hope for the future, that something I was doing would make a difference one day.The pandemic has thrown the world into a lurch, and now more than ever people need help. I’m still painting, and I’m still writing. The big difference is I'm not in the dire circumstances I was back when I needed the food bank. Now I want to do a little good and pay back what was given by holding another event. This year, I have created Faster Than Speed.Faster Than Speed is a story told with thirty-four 20x16 canvases, painted in acrylics. These canvases will be auctioned in May of 2021. The proceeds of this auction, as well as those of the first one-thousand copies of the book, will be donated to the ECHO food shelf in Mankato, MN.To offset the cost of the print run, art supplies and editing fees, I am trying to raise $4,500. This will produce 1,250 professional, hardcover books on quality matte paper (The first 1,000 copies proceeds will go to the food shelf, 250 will be used as perks of donating to this campaign).What is Faster Than Speed?Getting a job done quickly is important, but not as important as getting it done right. Go too fast, and you’ll have to go back and fix the mistakes you made because you were careless. Care, then, is faster than speed.The main character of this book has been tasked with a very important mission; ride his trusty flurf (kind of a cross between a cat, a t-rex and an ankylosaur) to the city to barter for supplies his village needs to survive the winter. To make matters worse, he has to do it before the weather freezes and his mount goes into hibernation.Along the way, the main character must make a choice; take care of a tiny creature called a sondling that he’s found on the side of the road, or get to the city as fast as he can.Will he rescue the sondling and risk the survival of his village, or leave the helpless creature to the elements?Faster Than Speed carries an engaging story with a positive message for children on the importance not only of taking their time and doing a good job versus doing it quickly, but taking care of those in need. Brightly colored paintings of a fantastic world will hold the attention of children and adults.Your Contribution will go towards:The cost of art suppliesEditing feesThe press run of the first edition of the bookAny amount in excess of what is needed will be donated to the food shelfPerksThere are several perks that await contributors to this book’s production. They include signed prints of the paintings, signed copies of the book, original sketches used to produce the paintings, and a special thank you printed in the first edition.Risks & ChallengesThe task of producing 34 attractive pages of acrylics paintings is no mean feat, and getting them to successfully tell a story at the same time is a challenge in itself. Jackpot Girl is a crime novel inspired by real people, real events. It is a story of a crime gone awry, hope gone astray. The novel is unusual in that the leading characters are mainly female. The characters, from various cultures, discover redemption always seems beyond their fingertips.

As an author/ghost writer of several books, I am asking for your help in covering costs like editing, cover art and keeping a steady stream of coffee coming while I work. It is expected that the novel will be completed by Christmas of 2013 and over 250 pages in length.

I appreciate any assistance and your participation in this project!

story:
Story of My Book

Take It: Genesis Mortalis is a book about British teenage twins, who are anything but alike. When Madisyn Montevega creates the Unorthodox Capitalists Organized Crime Association (UCOCA), she begins to find meaning in her previously mundane lifestyle as a well-behaved heiress. Together Madisyn, her twin Marcie, and their best friend Robbie go on a series of missions to hunt down some of the most wealthy and corrupt businessmen and criminals around the world. But while this dangerous pastime might seem to be all fun and games in the beginning, it begins to threaten all of their lives in a way they would never have imagined. This new vigilante life creates further tension between the girls in vices of both power and sex, and even dares to ruin their family’s reputation, already on shaky ground as newfound magnates among old English money.

My name is Ashlea Hearn and I am the author of Take It: Genesis Mortalis. I wrote this book because I wanted to create an escape for myself from a boring reality back in high school -- I daydreamed a lot in class! I would often imagine what I could do with the power to control my environment. That power mainly stemmed from a great deal of wealth and influence: two elements of control that come with more responsibility than meets the eye. I wanted to explore the dynamics of using money and power in a twisted definition of “good,” while also showing how if you’re not careful, they can turn into something evil and all-consuming. We see these instances quite often on television and in movies, and I couldn’t help but wonder just what kind of mischief people with unlimited resources were capable of getting into.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it’s like to live in a world where wealth - while it may provide unlimited access and open doors of opportunity that would normally not exist - doesn’t always determine happiness, and that greed will eventually come to humble even the most ambitious souls. I want readers to see this book as an opportunity to explore themes of power, greed, and competition in a manner that allows the characters (and the reader) to still have fun. 

The Book Synopsis

Sick of following orders and being her parents’ source of entertainment at lavish dinner parties, a gutsy eleven-year-old heiress from London brews up a plan to create the vigilante organization, Unorthodox Capitalists Organized Crime Association (UCOCA). With the best homeschool education and access to all the resources money can buy, Madisyn Montevega establishes her secret group all over the world, building headquarters under her billionaire mother’s luxury car dealerships. Now sixteen, Madisyn finds herself leading mission after mission with her twin, Marcelle, and their best friend, Robbie Ancens.


Having found a most interesting target for their next mission, Madisyn calls a meeting to gather their agents of UCOCA-London. She informs them of a secret society of wealthy men led by two U.S. senators, who host a gruesome game of Russian roulette, where they convince vulnerable and desperate citizens to be their players. Their common incentive: ten million dollars. With help from UCOCA-Seattle, they must track down the next game in Los Angeles, intercept it, and steal the money before any of the innocent players get killed. 


Later on, the twins and Robbie are surprised when their tutor of ten years, Valentina Dementieva, reveals her true purpose for coming into their lives to raise them. Valentina needs their help to rescue her brother Lukas, who is trapped in the Russian boarding school she had been raised in -- the same school she escaped eleven years ago to flee the wickedness lurking behind its walls. Appealing to Madisyn’s weakness for always accepting a challenge, she insists they save Lukas, though this proves difficult when they discover his reluctance to be saved. They’ll need the help of UCOCA-Ukraine to devise a plan to get inside the fortress and live to tell the tale. 


All the while, UCOCA has an enemy brewing unknown to them: a detective who has been watching closely and finds a way to track the girls’ every move. In comparison to living above the law, handling normal teenage drama is no easy feat for the twins and Robbie, who find themselves wrapped up in a complicated love triangle that two of them will have to bury before it destroys them all. That is, unless their lives as self-proclaimed vigilantes doesn’t destroy them first.

You Will Love This Book...

  • If you enjoy espionage and crime thrillers like James Bond, Mission: Impossible, & Ocean’s 11
  • You like international adventures that explore and dive into different worlds and cultures
  • You daydream about what life could be like with no financial boundaries

Take It: Genesis Mortalis speaks to action lovers and feminists alike who want to grapple with organized crime and vigilantism in a new way.


Ultimately, I hope that this book inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Can too much competition fully turn us against the people we love and trust the most, like our family?
  • Just how long can a power-hungry boss stay in power over their “partners” and organization before either being overthrown or taking themselves out of the game?
  • What happens to those who let wealth rotten their minds since greed is such a terrible vice?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing power, competition, and greed will change us all for the better. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • You will receive a personal handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in the Special Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to help give me feedback when selecting a cover.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Ashlea Hearn is a Marketing Coordinator at an amazing personal injury law firm in Seattle, WA and a Logistics Lieutenant/platoon leader in the Army Reserve. She has always loved to write stories and daydream about living a more adventurous life, something she hopes to make into a reality one day at a time! She is a lover of all things creative, and has even dabbled in filmmaking and directing in college. She ultimately decided her passion was to stick with writing and becoming a published author -- her dream is to eventually have some of her books turned into movies. 

Ashlea wrote this book as a way to more deeply explore some of her daydreams, knowing that the world she could see herself in was a fascinating one that others might want to see for themselves. These were often worlds of espionage and danger, where characters would go on missions around the world, and feel empowered by the ability to not only kill someone whose death would make the world a better place, but to also revel in their riches well after. While adventures like this do seem like all fun and games, Ashlea realized how there is responsibility that comes with these actions — like remaining humble and not allowing power and greed to consume you. These are all elements she wanted to explore in her novel as one of the main characters begins to let this new power of hers take over in completely destructive ways, showing the reality of what these vices can do to a person if they’re not careful.

Music has always been a big part of Ashlea’s life, which you’ll find in her book as several references are made to songs and orchestral pieces. Ashlea enjoys composing music for piano and orchestra as a hobby. She has played piano since she was 9 and violin since 11 years old, performing on stage as part of her school orchestra even throughout college as a violinist in the University Philharmonic Orchestra at Mizzou. She is an avid golfer, and has played since she was 11, though only for fun nowadays. 

For more information, you can connect with Ashlea Hearn via email at aehearn1@cougars.ccis.edu, on Instagram at @angel_ashlea, or on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/ashlea-hearn-35a20a185.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that is totally okay! Here are other ways to help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #takeitbookseries and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ashlea E. Hearn

story:
Story of My Book

Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry, debunks the myth of weight loss within the medical space, examines how fatphobia hurts patients’ health, and explores sustainable ways to improve patients’ health without weight stigma and discrimination. Do No Harm is a great resource for patients in bigger bodies who want to advocate for themselves in the doctor’s office but don’t know how to. If you’re interested in learning about how you can take fatphobia out of your healthcare, whether you’re a patient, provider, or loved one looking to support someone, this is for you.

My name is Hannah Hawkins and I am the author of Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry. I wrote this book because I’m tired of seeing body size discrimination impact healthcare. I know too many loved ones who’ve been misdiagnosed, mistreated, or have vowed to stay away from healthcare because of the weight stigma they experience. Everybody should experience the same level of care, no matter their size.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that the antiquated systems in our healthcare need to change. Weight is not an indicator of health, and it shouldn’t be a hurdle in seeking equal treatment. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for eliminating fatphobia in the medical space, and in life, in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you advocate for yourself, offer weight inclusive care if you're a provider, or help support a loved one in their efforts to manage the fatphobia they experience on a daily basis.


In this book, you'll learn about fatphobia and why it has no place in healthcare. Below are some topics covered in the book:

Diet Culture’s Heavy Hand in Healthcare

Racism and Fatphobia

Fatphobia and late diagnoses

Fatphobia and healthcare avoidance

The Health at Every Size approach to holistic health

How to advocate for yourself at the doctor

How providers can offer weight inclusive care

You will love this book if you are passionate about social justice issues, such as weight discrimination, are a healthcare provider who’s at their wits’ end on figuring out how to treat clients in bigger bodies without suggesting weight loss, or are a person in a bigger body who wants to learn how to advocate for yourself, and know that you’re not alone in your experiences.

Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry is a non-fiction book that speaks to providers and patients who are looking at fatphobia in healthcare for the first time.

 

The Book - Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry


The book is written in 3 Parts....



Part 1 explores the history behind fatphobia and how our society became obsessed with thinness, which eventually bled into the healthcare system. The racist roots of fatphobia and the “obesity epidemic” are revealed, and the efficacy of weight loss is debunked. Antiquated systems’ efficacy, such as the Body Mass Index, are called into question.

Part 2 discusses the harm fatphobia inflicts on marginalized bodies. You’ll see first hand stories from people’s experiences in doctors’ offices, and will learn how weight stigma impacts diagnoses, insurance coverage, treatment options, and overall physical and mental health.

Part 3 contains ways patients and providers can advocate for and practice weight inclusive care. Lindo Bacon, PhD, and Evelyn Tribole, MS, RDN, CEDRD-S share insights on Health at Every Size and Intuitive Eating approaches. Patients in bigger bodies offer helpful ways to advocate for themselves at the doctor’s office.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author


Hannah Hawkins is a financial analyst and first-time author of Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry. Her experience with battling an eating disorder that went undiagnosed for 6 years inspired her to research fatphobia and weight bias in healthcare. After discovering the stark disparities in treatment between people in thinner bodies versus people in bigger bodies, Hannah felt compelled to find a way to address this issue that impacts millions of people every year. Hannah is a firm believer that weight is not an indicator of health, and hopes that one day our medical system will throw out the old, inaccurate weight loss paradigm that keeps people from receiving adequate treatment.

Hannah spent seven months in three different treatment facilities for eating disorders and saw first hand how internalized fatphobia affects people in all bodies. In her past life, she taught group fitness classes at four gyms and ran a personal training business that perpetuated fatphobia.... up until she realized that not only was she hurting people, she was wasting her life away trying to attain a body ideal that will never be attainable.

What was eventually diagnosed in Hannah as a disorder is what’s being prescribed for people in bigger bodies, despite the fact that weight loss has about a 95% failure rate. This discrepancy is keeping fat patients from accessing proper healthcare; no one should be written off at the doctor based off of appearance. Hannah believes that once weight is taken out of the equation, people will better their relationships with themselves, with their health, and with providers.

For more information you can connect with Hannah at hannahhawkins32@gmail.com and on Facebook and Instagram, @hannah_hawkins_.

 

Risks & Challenges

story_txt:
Story of My Book
Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry, debunks the myth of weight loss within the medical space, examines how fatphobia hurts patients’ health, and explores sustainable ways to improve patients’ health without weight stigma and discrimination. Do No Harm is a great resource for patients in bigger bodies who want to advocate for themselves in the doctor’s office but don’t know how to. If you’re interested in learning about how you can take fatphobia out of your healthcare, whether you’re a patient, provider, or loved one looking to support someone, this is for you.My name is Hannah Hawkins and I am the author of Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry. I wrote this book because I’m tired of seeing body size discrimination impact healthcare. I know too many loved ones who’ve been misdiagnosed, mistreated, or have vowed to stay away from healthcare because of the weight stigma they experience. Everybody should experience the same level of care, no matter their size.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that the antiquated systems in our healthcare need to change. Weight is not an indicator of health, and it shouldn’t be a hurdle in seeking equal treatment. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for eliminating fatphobia in the medical space, and in life, in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you advocate for yourself, offer weight inclusive care if you're a provider, or help support a loved one in their efforts to manage the fatphobia they experience on a daily basis.
In this book, you'll learn about fatphobia and why it has no place in healthcare. Below are some topics covered in the book:
Diet Culture’s Heavy Hand in Healthcare
Racism and Fatphobia
Fatphobia and late diagnoses
Fatphobia and healthcare avoidance
The Health at Every Size approach to holistic health
How to advocate for yourself at the doctor
How providers can offer weight inclusive care
You will love this book if you are passionate about social justice issues, such as weight discrimination, are a healthcare provider who’s at their wits’ end on figuring out how to treat clients in bigger bodies without suggesting weight loss, or are a person in a bigger body who wants to learn how to advocate for yourself, and know that you’re not alone in your experiences.Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry is a non-fiction book that speaks to providers and patients who are looking at fatphobia in healthcare for the first time.
 
The Book - Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry


The book is written in 3 Parts....
Part 1 explores the history behind fatphobia and how our society became obsessed with thinness, which eventually bled into the healthcare system. The racist roots of fatphobia and the “obesity epidemic” are revealed, and the efficacy of weight loss is debunked. Antiquated systems’ efficacy, such as the Body Mass Index, are called into question.Part 2 discusses the harm fatphobia inflicts on marginalized bodies. You’ll see first hand stories from people’s experiences in doctors’ offices, and will learn how weight stigma impacts diagnoses, insurance coverage, treatment options, and overall physical and mental health.Part 3 contains ways patients and providers can advocate for and practice weight inclusive care. Lindo Bacon, PhD, and Evelyn Tribole, MS, RDN, CEDRD-S share insights on Health at Every Size and Intuitive Eating approaches. Patients in bigger bodies offer helpful ways to advocate for themselves at the doctor’s office.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

And more...
About the Author
Hannah Hawkins is a financial analyst and first-time author of Do No Harm: Fatphobia & The Medical Industry. Her experience with battling an eating disorder that went undiagnosed for 6 years inspired her to research fatphobia and weight bias in healthcare. After discovering the stark disparities in treatment between people in thinner bodies versus people in bigger bodies, Hannah felt compelled to find a way to address this issue that impacts millions of people every year. Hannah is a firm believer that weight is not an indicator of health, and hopes that one day our medical system will throw out the old, inaccurate weight loss paradigm that keeps people from receiving adequate treatment.Hannah spent seven months in three different treatment facilities for eating disorders and saw first hand how internalized fatphobia affects people in all bodies. In her past life, she taught group fitness classes at four gyms and ran a personal training business that perpetuated fatphobia.... up until she realized that not only was she hurting people, she was wasting her life away trying to attain a body ideal that will never be attainable.What was eventually diagnosed in Hannah as a disorder is what’s being prescribed for people in bigger bodies, despite the fact that weight loss has about a 95% failure rate. This discrepancy is keeping fat patients from accessing proper healthcare; no one should be written off at the doctor based off of appearance. Hannah believes that once weight is taken out of the equation, people will better their relationships with themselves, with their health, and with providers.For more information you can connect with Hannah at hannahhawkins32@gmail.com and on Facebook and Instagram, @hannah_hawkins_.

story:
Story of My Book

The Full Severity of Our Connection gives voice to some of the untold stories and forgotten communities of the Jewish Diaspora. It recounts the year that I lived in Jerusalem (2017-2018) and traveled to Jewish communities across Western and Central Europe, North Africa, India, and the Balkans. It recounts my adventures, the lessons I gleaned, the interviews I conducted, and the joys (and concomitant pains) of Jerusalem. 

My name is Kayla Cohen, and I wrote The Full Severity of Our Connection because my traveling experiences raised seismic questions that ruptured basic conceptions of history, collective memory, and identity.

This book will be of interest to those seeking an adventure/travel thrill (and from the luxury of their quarantine couch!), those curious about cultural healing and recovery from our divisive, politically-polarized current moment, and those interested in questions about Diaspora identity and selfhood. 

My experience of leaving and returning to Jerusalem throughout my gap year held great symbolic gravity. Many of the Diaspora communities I visited had only wished, pre-1948, to have their prayers for redemption and an end to 2,000+ years of Galut answered. At the same time, the idea of a Jewish center and, more importantly, of a single and perfectly preserved people unaffected by the intellectual and cultural currents of majority culture began to dissolve as the meaning of a Jewish essence was constantly defined and redefined in the different communities I visited. 

This book seeks to articulate the full thrust of unique tensions, vulnerabilities, and experiences associated with Diaspora identity for Jewish and non-Jewish readers. 

In this book, you'll learn stories such as...

  • my interviews with the Chief Rabbi of Greece and Spain’s first Spanish-born Rabbi since the 1492 Spanish Inquisition, both of which offer interesting meditations on how Hellenism and Spanish culture have respectively affected their communities.
  • my successful search to find and meet the last Jew living in the Moroccan port town of Essaouira.
  • my gap year program’s meeting with His Holiness the Dali Lama in Dharamshala, India, and his speech to the Jewish community about the future of Israel/Palestine as a Tibetan exile.
  • my collection of observations from visiting different sections of the fragmented Palestinian territories and East Jerusalem.
  • my gap year program’s meeting with an Israeli-Arab Druze Holocaust curriculum creator in Berlin, who sees untapped potential for communication between Jews and Arab refugees in the former capitol of the Third Reich.

The Full Severity of Our Connection challenges our fundamental understandings of identification and belonging. It ruptures our basic conceptions of self and the legacies to which we belong. It offers a moment for introspection, cultural reckoning, and healing.

 

Summary

The book is written in 3 parts:

Part 1  is dedicated to telling the stories of the different Diaspora communities that I visited in 2017 and 2018, including Spain, Greece, Morocco, Germany, the Czech Republic, Bulgaria, and India. Each chapter is dedicated to one country and shares related personal anecdotes, vignettes and interviews.

Part 2 recounts my experiences of living in Jerusalem and traveling to Palestinian neighborhoods and territories before and after I started college.

Part 3 contextualizes the academic and political world of Berkeley, California (and my own college experience at UC Berkeley) within the complicated framework of Jewish history and identity.

 

The Impact

Within the Jewish community, I hope the book and its honest reckoning with the Diaspora’s legacies will push Jewish institutions to include more robust curricula on the Diaspora itself. Recognition of its enduring intellectual and cultural influences -- and its history of interaction and exchange -- could have seismic effects on Jewish education, relations to the Palestinian Diaspora, and Jewish relations to the outside world.

As for the book’s non-Jewish audience, I hope this book better articulates the complexity, vulnerability, and slight precariousness of Jewish identity and Jewish experience, past and present.

Embedded within the book’s stories is an imperative to create more robust lines of communication between Jewish and non-Jewish communities. This book can start those necessary conversations -- and from a starting point that completely reworks our basic conceptions of "self" and "other."

 

*Why I need your help: 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book: when I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook; when I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition; when I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook. My goal is to sell at least 150 copies.

Money raised by pre-orders will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in March 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for when I ultimately publish in April 2021.

*UPDATE: 

In 9 days, my campaign exceeded its initial goal in selling 120 pre-ordered copies. I am very grateful for the support I've received, and I'm happy to share that soft cover editions of my book will be published in April 2021 with New Degree Press!

...But my campaign isn't over! Even though I've reached my $5k goal, I hope to raise an additional $1,000 (adjusted total of $6,000) in pre-sales for the rest of the campaign's duration. Pre-orders raised will now go towards my campaign's ultimate goal: to publish hard cover editions of my book. Any remaining money raised over my $6,000 goal will be donated to a COVID relief fund.

 

Perks of Pre-Ordering:

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now!

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive EARLY access to the Author's Note, Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback if you wish!
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover art and design.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the writing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Kayla Cohen is a student at the University of California, Berkeley, where she studies Comparative Literature (English and Hebrew literature and Arabic language). This is Kayla’s first book, which is dedicated in memory of her grandfather, Dr. Rahim Cohen, a well-respected physician, journalist, humanitarian, and leader in the Iranian-Jewish community. He inspired Kayla's early love for the forces of language.

Kayla hopes to fuse her passion for writing with her interests in conflict resolution in the future. When not studying or journaling furiously, she can be found embracing the upset that is gluten-free baking and using consenting housemates as lab rats to test her grandma's Persian recipes. 


To connect (severely):
Email: kcohen111@berkeley.edu
Facebook:THE FULL SEVERITY OF OUR CONNECTION
Website: Kayla Harris Cohen Writing
LinkedIn: Kayla Cohen
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute monetarily right now. If you can't, please don't stress. I would be honored and grateful if you helped support my campaign in any of the following ways:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. When you do this, use #TheFullSeverityofOurConnection and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please mention my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text message or social media direct messaging.

Thank you SO much for your support! It means the world to me.

With love and deep gratitude,
Kayla Cohen

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Ramana’s Garden is a loving home to 69 kids and a free school for 189 of the poorest village children.

 Like all kids around the world Christmas is a special time for giving and receiving gifts. This year will be very tight for us since we are currently building a new home for the children. You can make a big difference for our kids to help this year so they can get all the warm clothes they need. Like most of India our rooms aren't heated so on Christmas we give nice warm clothes to all the children as well as some treats and maybe a trinket or two. Please help us make this an extra special Christmas . It only takes $25 to create a big warm smile.

story:
Thank you for taking the time to view our LMIR fundraiser! We are members of Advanced American Research Community Inc; and we are trying to spark some Mota-Vation by documenting the positive effects of Cannabis on licensed individuals with minimal to serious illnesses:

  • We currently have a team of Directors and Volunteers who are ready and willing to go great feats to accomplish this goal. AARC Inc. has a group of innovators, and dreamers who want to take as many steps as possible to make a difference in the world.
  • There are plenty of guys out there trying to document the positive effects of cannabis on specific illnesses, and kudos to them; but we want to have hard evidence! We want the before and after diagnosis from doctors on our volunteer subjects, along with video evidence and hard copy documentation.
  • With your help! We will be able to obtain all the necessary equipment and locations to get our project on the road. This will include any electronic recording devices, various locations, and of course our very own natural pharmacy to provide medication to our volunteer subjects free of charge.


Here is what we need, and what you will get for helping us reach our goal:


  • Our minimal financial goal is $250,000.00. By reaching this goal, we would take out all cost needed to give back to our lovely donors the perks that come along with helping us! Shipping included! But more importantly, the rest of the funds will go to our overhead cost to run the project ! This will include any electronic recording devices, testing facilities at various locations (coast to coast members) , marketing to obtain licensed volunteer subjects, video and graphic editing for the finished project, and the site to list all documentation royalty free for anyone to use.
  • Now that we have that established, lets go over the awesome perks we have available to our donors (Images of Perks Also Shown Below). With just even a dollar donation, this will get your name listed on the donor section of our documentary website to show the world you took part in something bigger in life. With a five dollar donation; you will receive a cannabis rubber band bracelet, that lets everyone know you supported the cause. Feel like shuffling to some good music and want to look cool doing it?  The ten dollar donation will get you some awesome Huf socks to make that happen. If the sun is getting you to baked to even focus the go with our twenty dollar donation and get yourself a Mota-Vation hat. The last 3 need no introduction... You can grab yourself an awesome atomizer, a 3 filter water pipe, or a coil condenser water pipe. Just keep in mind; the higher the donation, the more you will receive back in return!

  • If however we do not reach our requested funding amount, we will still do exactly the same thing mentioned above to reach our goal. It’s just going to have to be done on a serious low budget status. All who did donate to our cause in that situation will still receive the perks that came with their kind giving hearts. Rest assured knowing that we want this project completed!


Your contribution will make a difference in the world! Not only will you get something back for your donation, but you’re also giving a new hope to our future in natural medicine:


  • Some fun facts we do know THC does help with are as follows: It helps to prevent Alzheimer's, able to treat more than 300k cases of Migraines, helps fight the hardening of Arteries, slows down tumor growth in lungs, stops neurological effects and muscle spasms, stimulates sexual stamina before and after smoking.
  •  Some of symptoms that we will be researching positive effects of THC will be on Lupus, Fibromyalgia , Rheumatoid arthritis, internal and external pain due from surgery, Pain from Anterior cruciate ligament injury, Epilepsy, Anxiety, depression, ADHD, ADD, and many more.
  • Aren’t you tired of the big pharmaceutical companies taking over everything? We are too! It’s a shame the drugs that have major side effects are presented as a legal object in our society; yet the very thing that grows natural and has little to no side effects at all is deemed illegal in most states. Some well know side effects of cannabis THC that might scare you would be hungry, happy, and sleepy. We will try our best to tone that down for you lol.



We at AARC Inc. know that working on a project that proves positive effects of marijuana is an uphill battle, but we are prepared to take this road nevertheless.


  • A few of our challenges will be to get some medical doctors to cooperate with us on a research level, but we have a few things up our sleeves for that. We also know that there are local rules and regulations to follow while our project is being worked on, but that is why its mandatory for any volunteer subjects to hold a MMJ card.


If you cant contribute; Noooo Problem! :

      You can be part of our underground gorilla marketing team and blast this add all over Facebook, twitter, Instagram and what ever blogs you might see fit. We do have share tools on this campaign, and be sure to like our page on Facebook to get some daily uplifting messages and to stay updated with our campaign status!


Like us On Facebook!


Thank you for your Support! From the AARC Inc. Team ;)

All Items will be shipped at the end of campaign

is what we need, and what you will get for helping us reach our goal:

     life. With a five dollar donation; you will receive a cannabis rubber band
     bracelet, that lets everyone know you supported the cause. Feel like

future in natural medicine:

at AARC Inc. know that working on a project that proves positive effects of

story:
Introduction
Hi, I'm Dee Sutton Velez, a Hispanic activist, who four years ago was in a head on accident after coming back from a rally protesting illegal immigration. My story is about my work and activism involving illegal immigration. A portion of my proceeds from my book I would like to go to helping victims of crimes coming from illegal immigration in order to bring awareness to the issues. One of the most horrific crimes is girls being used in the sex slave trafficking industry, and although awareness is happening often by the time they are discovered its all ready too late and I would like to work to change this and need your help. 


Principles in Peril

  The right to vote while consider sacrosanct may not be as meaningful as the   people believe. Undermined by corruption, powerful elites, and a biased   mass media, the electoral process may be nothing more than an  elaborate charade where the voters struggle to guess which of the cardboard cut out candidates will dance to the music of a clandestine power structure.

Our goals

  I want to publish this book to inform and entertain our readers, and assist victims of a ruthless sex trafficking industry that thrives virtually unchecked on our country’s borders.

  I want to raise awareness of the damage caused by illegal immigration and paly an activist role in bringing meaningful change to a broken immigration system through effective legislation

  Although my work is fiction the problems addressed are painfully real, and in need of solutions. One woman’s personal story serves as a metaphor for a nations struggle to maintain its sovereignty, prosperity, and humanity.

story:
Meet Bill

  • Bill Bonnar is a life-long socialist who has travelled the world gathering experience, knowledge and integrity. He is a highly respected chair of the Scottish Socialist Party, as well as its international spokesperson.
  • It's essential that we make Bill our representative in Govan, Pollok, Cardonald and the rest of the working people's strongholds in Glasgow South West. He is, without a doubt, the candidate with true principles and values - values that put the people before anything, ever.
  • Bill is a true pioneer of the SSP's waged representative policy. As an MP, he would take no more than the average skilled worker's wage of Scotland, which is in the region of £25,000 a year. Not the politician career wage of £66,600... A figure beyond that of most of his constituents. 

What we need

  • We are by no means a party with much wealth. We do what we can with what little we have and seldom do we ask for money. We are in dire need of campaign funds to encourage as many people to vote for the only left wing candidate in Glasgow SW.
  • The sum we ask for is £2,000. This will go towards renting a shop front, hosting events, printing leaflets and literature, as well as creating campaign gear such as badges, stickers and such. Every penny spent takes us one step closer to a just, transparent and fair society. 

The Impact

The mood is changing in Scotland. It's now beginning to dawn on the people that we can elect a left wing party to represent Scotland. Ceaselessly, we have campaigned to show this to the world. As the country's most successful socialist party, we can be used to bring about a society that represents every fibre of its people. 

The SSP are just ordinary people who have become sickened and angry at how the masses of these islands have been lied to, trodden on and tricked by successive Labour and Conservative governments. We understand that we're swimming against the tide but know, wholeheartedly, that the mood is changing. 

Can you begin to imagine how different life would be socialist values in government? Here are just a few of our core policies:
  • A national minimum wage of £10 an hour
  • The abolition of Council Tax in favour of an income-based service payment
  • A free public transport system owned by the national community
  • Scottish Independence - we believe that free of the deeply conservative roots in the United Kingdom, Scotland can become a self-sufficient nation with values of the working woman and man at its heart. 
  • For a full list of our policies, visit www.scottishsocialistparty.org

Risks & Challenges

We're not under any illusions in this campaign. We thought long and hard about standing candidates in what is an incredibly unfair and undemocratic voting system. However, there needs to be a time when we can take the plunge and stand against the winds of injustice. If the world had no freedom fighters swimming against the currant, where would we be? Under the arms of autocracy, beaten and forgotten. This is why we need Bill in parliament:

  • Bill emanates experience, trust and stamina.
  • Bill is a family man, with two daughters Katie and Jenny, and a wife Vivienne. 
  • Bill has worked in Govan for decades and is a life-long resident south of the River Clyde.
  • Bill has courage like no other candidate and represents everything that politicians aspire to be - leadership, trust, democracy and intellect. 
  • Most of all, Bill is someone you can rely on, he is a friend to all and will serve you like no other candidate for Glasgow SW can.

Other Ways You Can Help

We of the left aren't known to have much riches, so if you cannot afford to contribute then fear not. Here are other ways you can help:

  • Talk to people - we need others talking about politics. We need people to wake up and realise that change can actually happen. We can, and will, see that day.
  • Support the online campaign by liking and following our social media. 
  • Facebook.com/glasgowsouthSSP
  • Twitter.com/sspglasgowsouth

story:
Update 4/30/14: We hit our goal! The book is published and the rewards are on their way. Check out dimmedia.com/blueflame Also, we'll have a booth at Spring Con the weekend of May 17th - stop by and say "Hey". 



Help fuel our dream of authorship and independent publishing. Join Dim Media in their follow-up illustrated sci-fi horror story, Blue Flame: Extinguish.

Pre-order yours today!



Synopsis: Blue Flame: Extinguish 

Picking up where the first book left off, in this fully illustrated short story, Jack Gemini is called to the decrepit town of Kausia to answer for the failures of his henchmen, Frank and Earnest. There, the mysterious vile Shuffle reveals his true intentions for the mystical Blue Flame that lies underneath the city. For fear of sharing their fate, Jack agrees to finish the job Frank and Earnest failed. Will Jack not having a soul help his chances of survival? The fate of the world depends upon it.

What Your Funding Will Help Us Do

Your contribution will help publish our second book and launch Dim's further endeavors of writing, publishing, and illustration!

Pre-sale campaign funding will go directly to printing and publication costs through Lightning Press. The book is complete and ready for the press. The hardcopy proof is what is shown in video.  All we need are the pre-sale funds to fuel the initial costs.  For $1000 we will get 200 copies of the book produced and cover the costs of our great rewards listed below. Help make this dream a reality. 

Origins: What is Dim Media?

Dim Media is a Twin Cities, MN based artist collaborative.  Dim combines the efforts of key members Joe, Blaine, Charles, and Ivy in endeavors of art, publication, and imagery.  Over the years Dim Media has painted, created, and shared their vision of art to viewers around. More can be found on the organization at dimmedia.com  


Rewards and Bonuses

Note: All level pricing include shipping to contiguous United States unless otherwise noted. For other locations, see the FAQ below.


Blue Flame: Extinguish Our latest book! The sequel to the 2012 book "Blue Flame". Meet Jack, a man of action. Learn the fate of Frank and Ernest. Discover the secrets of the Blue Flame and Kausia. See what sort of company Shuffle keeps. This is an action packed follow up to the first book while keeping the horror at a maximum. 54 pages. Paperback. Available to ship May, 2014. Available starting at the $5 level (digital copy) and $10 level (physical copy). Includes shipping to Contiguous United States.


Blue Flame The book that started it all! Meet Frank and Ernest when they still resembled something human. Get the first peek at the mysterious Shuffle. Walk the streets of Kausia with the rotting masses. 50 pages. Paperback. Includes over 20 illustrations and concept sketches. Published in 2012 as a Limited Edition of 200 copies. Available starting at the $15 level (includes Blue Flame:Extinguish)


Limited Edition Art Card These limited edition art cards feature amazing illustrations from the Blue Flame:Extinguish. Each card is approx 4" x 6" in size and printed on a heavy cardstock with a rich gloss finish - perfect for display. Available starting at the $25 level


11x14 Limited Edition Signed Print These limited edition prints feature dramatic artwork ripped right from the pages of Blue Flame:Extinguish. Each one is printed on high quality archival paper and signed by the artist, Blaine Garrett. Choose from any of the 8 prints shown below. Perfect for framing or adding to your print collection. Full bleed print arrives with sturdy backing board. Available starting at the $35 level.

Hand Screenprinted T-Shirt Get a limited edition T-Shirt hand printed by Dim Media featuring our artwork. Get ready for Spring by rocking a Dim shirt Available starting at the $40 level.


Dinner With Dim Spend a few hours with Dim eating, drinking, and being a part of the crew. Pick our brains, pitch your comic idea, recap your favorite Netflix drama, whatever. Disclaimer: Limited to Twin Cities contributors only. You pay for your bill and we pay for ours. Available starting at the $75 level.


Custom 11 x 17" Drawing of You as a Denizen of Kausia Let Blaine turn you into one of the grotesque beings from the Town of Kausia. Let the evil that lurks beneath the city transform you into a more vile version of yourself - the likes of which the main antagonist, Shuffle, would like to spend his time with. Custom drawing is suitable for framing and will be hand drawn and signed by Blaine Garrett. Available starting at the $150 level.


Become Immortalized as a denizen of Kausia in the final chapter in the Blue Flame Trilogy We're starting work on the third and final chapter of this trilogy and we want you to be in it! Let Blaine turn you into one of the grotesque beings from the Town of Kausia and become immortalized in the story. We'll adapt your personal style to fit in the mysterious world on the verge of collapse for all of our readers to see. Available starting at the $200 level.


Custom Painting Dim's primary focus is collaborative painting and our paintings sell for upwards of $1000 on average. We want to get our publishing off the ground so badly we're throwing in the chance for you to get an original painting by the members of Dim Media for half the normal cost. While, we'd love to make you a painting like those featured in the antagonist Shuffle's mansion, we'll work with you to create a custom original painting for your home, office, or collection. Available starting at the $500 level.

Examples of some of our previous paintings: ( See our gallery for more )


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

•  Please, tell your friends about us and this opportunity.  Spread the word! It's good for karma. 

•  Use the Indiegogo share tool!

•  Like us on  Facebook or Follow us on Twitter for more updates on the books and other things going on in the dim world.

FAQ

  • Do I need to read the first book to "get" this one? No, even though Blue Flame: Extinguish is a followup to "Blue Flame", both books stand on their own and can be enjoyed separately. However, the second book is soooo much better after reading the first.
  • How much is shipping outside of the Contiguous United States? Please add and additional $5 for shipping flat media (books, prints, art card, custom drawing, etc). Please add an additional $5 if your level includes the T-Shirt. 
  • Can you ship the custom painting featured at the $500 level? Yes, but the cost of this will vary greatly by region and size of painting. Contact us to discuss.
  • I already own the first book. Can I contribute at the higher levels without getting another copy?  Yes, send us a message with what bonuses you would like and we can figure out a price to contribute and still make sure you get your desired bonuses - dimmedia@gmail.com
  • How big of a painting will I get at the $500 level? We'll work with you to figure out what you want for a custom painting, but estimate that it will have approximate dimensions of up to 24" x 36". 
  • Who did your amazing layout/design? Usually Polite
  • Can I sell your books in my bookstore/comicshop? Yes, please! Contact us for details - dimmedia@gmail.com
  • Where are you based out of? The members of Dim Media live in both of the Twin Cities - Minneapolis and St. Paul, and yes it is cold here.
  • Are there more stories/books after the Blue Flame Trilogy? YES, the Blue Flame trilogy is just one slice of the universe of characters and tales we've been working on for years. There is a slough of more books and comics to come. 
  • How do we stay in touch? Like us on  Facebook or Follow us on Twitter or send an email to dimmedia@gmail.com to hop on our mailing list.
  • Will you be at Spring Con? Yes, we'll have a booth at the MCBA Spring Con taking place May 17th and 18th at the Minnesota State Fair Grandstands. Stop by and say "hey".
  • Who prints your books? Lightening Press out of New Jersey. They're a bit pricey but the quality and customer service is amazing.
  • Feel free to ask us anything else!

story:
cooking & poem-ing

My name is Leah Sewell, and I'm a poet and a cook. As the Association of Writers & Writing Programs (AWP) Conference in Seattle  draws closer, my usual mode is to pine wistfully about attending the event—the annual convergence of over 10,000 authors, writers, students and publishers—without actually being able to attend because of a lack of funds. This year, I thought I might cast about locally (in the Topeka, KS or Lawrence, KS area) to see if I could cook myself to Seattle. 

I think of myself as a halfway-decent writer, but other people seem to think I'm "talented." They're most likely exaggerating so wildly in order to get in my good graces so I'll eventually cook or bake them something delicious. But why should other so-so poets get to go attend the most important literary gathering in the nation and not me? I'm positing here that even I should be able to hang out with the big guns. I published a chapbook this year, which is possibly a step in the right direction. I also work as an assistant editor with Coconut Press and I'm a book designer for other small presses, making sure that the truly talented among us are presented in a positive light. If I make it to Seattle, I can rub elbows with so many people who do the same great work that I do, people who also spend ungodly amounts of time in front of their computer screens, all for the good of literature!

I've been told that I can cook a mean meal. Here's where I'm just going to own up to things and admit that, yeah, I've eaten my cooking, and it's pretty good. I've worked at restaurants, as a prep cook, a sous chef, and a baker. I tend to make everything from scratch, using basic, fresh ingredients. I specialize in vegetarian meals but I can cook just about anything, breakfast /lunch /dinner /dessert /what-have-you, including vegan and gluten free food, or a meal that, if you wish, consists of nothing but a pile of meat. Fragrant meat with a nuanced blend of flavors. I should stop writing poetry and start writing menus, right? 

the breakdown.

  • In order to get to Seattle, I need $1000. That's way more money than a grad student/single mom/poet could ever dream of spending in one fell swoop. But I have big dreams! About $400 of that will go toward travel expenses, and the remaining $600 will cover room and board, a meal or two, and conference registration. 
  • If you choose to purchase a "perk," I will cook anyone local to the Topeka area a nice meal or a dozen baked goods and deliver it to you (within reason). You then let me know what you want me to make, or ask me to think up something. We should talk about it - my email is leahsewell [at] gmail.com. If you don't live nearby, please don't purchase one of the meals! Because I can't do that! If you want to buy a book from me, I'd be happy to sign it with an appreciative note and ship it to you.
  • Dinner ideas: I can make a good lasagna, quiche, pot pie, cajun pasta, spaghetti & meatballs, french dip sandwiches. You can choose any of those, if you'd like.
  • Your meal may not be hot when it's delivered. Thank god for microwaves, right?

don't fund this, that's okay too.

I probably haven't funded your projects in the past. That's because I'm usually just trying to make the bills. And if you find yourself in the same boat, maybe you could just share this page on your own various pages?

In closing, thank you from the bottom of my heart. My gratitude is deeper than my obscenely huge stock pot. Many, many thanks!

As the Association of Writers & Writing Programs (AWP) Conference in Seattle  draws closer, my usual mode is to pine wistfully about attending the event—the annual convergence of over 10,000 authors, writers, students and publishers—without actually being able to attend because of a lack of funds. This year, I thought I might cast about locally (in the Topeka, KS or Lawrence, KS area) to see if I could cook myself to Seattle. I think of myself as a halfway-decent writer, but other people seem to think I'm "talented." They're most likely exaggerating so wildly in order to get in my good graces so I'll eventually cook or bake them something delicious. But why should other so-so poets get to go attend the most important literary gathering in the nation and not me? I'm positing here that even I should be able to hang out with the big guns. I published a chapbook this year, which is possibly a step in the right direction. I also work as an assistant editor with Coconut Press and I'm a book designer for other small presses, making sure that the truly talented among us are presented in a positive light.
