story:
We have yet to meet someone who hasn't blown a big business deal, been dumped by a significant other, fallen off the corporate ladder or bankrupted their own business. Have you failed at something? 
Sure you have! That's why we want you to become part of a global movement of 40+ cities that is celebrating failure. It's okay to f*ckup every once in awhile and we've invited now-successful entrepreneurs to tell you all about it in this book.

The book is inspired by a manifesto we created to help people break free from the 24 key stigmas surrounding failure. For every stigma of the FuckUp Manifesto we wrote a short reflective piece, commissioned a funky illustration and crafted a guided activity to help you break free from it.
Get the book! That's 24 chapters plus 12 anecdotes from now-successful entrepreneurs, all designed so you can have your own breakthrough.

More than just a book, The FuckUp Book is about creating a global community that inspires each other by sharing stories of people who have risen from the ashes.

The global FUN community is growing... fast.Our story was just published on INC Magazine // Click Here


What We're Aiming for

So here’s our problem. We published the book in Spanish and our global community wants a version in English. Thanks to them we now know that there are lots of incredible lessons being told by leading entrepreneurs, artists, business executives, artists, chefs, and no way to share these lessons as a global network.

Here’s why we’re inviting you to back this project. With your contribution we boost the potential to flip the stigma on failure and grow a global community by transcribing the stories, ideas and advice from the mishaps of remarkable leaders.

Your contribution goes toward the translation, research and publication costs. So, think of your contribution as a pledge to become part of a global movement.

WHAT YOU GET

CONTRIBUTE WITH $14

CONTRIBUYE CON $16

CONTRIBUTE WITH $27

CONTRIBUTE WITH $75


<Our 1st Goal> 
Translate the book into english so we can share the stigmas and anecdotes of failure from the amazing book we just published in Mexico. (Stories and activities need to be professionally translated and editorially designed, etc.)
// If we get $5,000 USD, we'll create a translated digital and print version of the book. // 

<Our 2nd Goal> 
In order to make the book 3 times cooler, we want to commission a special section that includes 5 additional anecdotes from global entrepreneurs. (This section will take a bit extra time to generate content and be editorially designed.)
// If we surpass $8,000 USD, we'll start working on the special edition version of the book. // 

Your contribution will do something utterly crazy yet incredibly valuable.
We need 8k because we want to give good-old Deepak Chopra a break from the "books that transform lives" department. 

Help us take F.U.N. to the next level!

Over 100+ pages of stunning illustrations & photography that journey into the experiences, challenges and many perspectives facing men and woman whom have learned to celebrate their failed attempts at life.




Learn more about the FUN movement: 

Fuckup Nights is a global, vulnerability-driven lecture series focused on celebrating failure. Every month 42 communities around the world gather to celebrate their stories of failure. 

 

Two years ago, after a couple of tequila shots, five good friends empathized about their stories of failed businesses. This conversation brought them closer together and with it the curiosity of congregating a small community of people open to celebrating their failed attempts at life.

Fast-forward to two years later, this group of friends is working with 42 other communities from around the world, who, like them, understand the importance of breaking down the stigmas around the path to success. The best part is that they do this the second Thursday of every month -- it’s like an AA for people who have failed and risen from the ashes. 

Heal the world, support failure.

story:
Four men arrive at the same concert on a cold November evening. Each has reached a turning point in their lives, and each finds himself venturing into unknown waters. 

Layered in chaos theory and steeped in narrative, Spirals and Waltzes is a web of substance abuse, music and philosophy, woven into a dance of four searches for truth and manhood. 

Take a ride to the heart of Oregon, where destiny and mystery seem entwined. See the cautionary tale of a few loners and questioners, and their dizzying ventures around each other and the lodge that has drawn them together on a fateful night. Excepts of the book can be found on Youtube at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DTMKs8eSLc, http://youtu.be/wKUnCLTtrME, and http://youtu.be/gOk25-6P78Y. 


Additionally, a limited .pdf preview is currently available to view (and download, I believe) here.
All work is trademarked by E. Michael Lazzari, reachable via michael.lazzari@gmail.com.

story:
Witch & Wolf - Urban Fantasy Thrillers


Murder, magic, and mayhem: The world of the Inquisition is our own, touched by the secrets of the paranormal and the supernatural. Underneath the thin veneer of modern comfort and security is a violent society of men, women, witches, and werewolves, as well as those who go bump in the night.

Some are the hunters.

Some are the hunted.

All of them have been touched by the Inquisition.

NEWS: 
  1. Winter Wolf cover art has been updated.
  2. If this campaign reaches goal, all perks having things mailed will also include 1 copy of the Winter Wolf cover art as a print. 
  3. All perks $10 or more include a ecopy of Inquisitor. If you already have Inquisitor, you can contact me with info on who to send your extra copy to.
  4. Deposits for Blood Diamond and Silver Bullet cover arts has been paid.
  5. Sumi-e painting perk added!


My name is RJ Blain, and I am the author of Inquisitor, the first Witch & Wolf novel. I'm a bit of a cracked nut, with a fondness for MMOs, gaming, dice, art, and (most importantly) writing. I am also known for my addiction to moleskine journals, as well as my growing fondness for Levenger's circa journals. I'm owned by four cats.

If it's paper or pen, I probably love it.

You can read a sample of Inquisitor here. An unedited sample of Witch & Wolf 2, Winter Wolf, can be read here

UPDATE: All $10+ perks will include an ecopy of Inquisitor.


Due to life, sewage floods, and everything, I need your help...


With your aid, I will be able to pay my editors, my cover artist, the promotional fees to help make others aware of my novels, the copyright fees, and all of the other little things that go into turning a book into a professional product.

Here is the breakdown of the costs to produce the next three novels of the Witch & Wolf series:


Editorial - Winter Wolf $500
Editorial - Blood Diamond $500
Editorial - Silver Bullet $500
Cover Art - Blood Diamond $500
Cover Art - Silver Bullet $500
Copyright Fee - Blood Diamond $60
Copyright Fee - Silver Bullet $60
Typography, Layout, Interior Design - Winter Wolf $150
Typography, Layout, Interior Design - Blood Diamond $150
Typography, Layout, Interior Design - Silver Bullet $150
Promotion - Winter Wolf $500
Promotion - Blood Diamond $500
Promotion - Silver Bullet $500


I have already paid for the cover art for Winter Wolf, which is the next novel to be released. I am covering the copyright fee for Winter Wolf on my own as well. My editorial fees, for each book, pay the minimum fee for both of my editors. I try to tip my editors with royalty money as well, as they have both been so generous to give me such a great fee for their hard, stellar work.

Here is an early version of the Winter Wolf cover for your viewing pleasure:



What do you get? Perks! Perks! Perks!


Perks make the crowdfunding world go round. I don't know about you, but the bright, shiny things that can be acquired draw my attention to a campaign almost as much as the ultimate goal. It's in the extras a lot of the time.
Because of my situation, I don't have a lot of extra money to create really cool extras, but I do have a few things I can do... and I'm quite excited about it!

Note: All books are ebooks (epub, mobi, or pdf) unless specified as paperbacks.
Fun & Games

Tea Party: I will take a picture of a cup of tea I have brewed just for you. Each contributor will receive a unique photograph of a cup of tea with their name photoshopped onto the image. Then I will drink the tea and enjoy it. 


Deluxe Tea Party: I will draw a doodle on a dry-erase board and pose the cup of tea in front of it, handwriting your name for the image. Then I will drink the tea and enjoy it.


All tea party images will be showcased in a gallery on my blog, with a list of contributors.

Buy RJ a Cup of Tea: You don't want anything beyond the satisfaction of encouraging RJ's shameless addiction to tea. Thanks!


My Cats will Acknowledge You: I will take a photograph of one of my cats, being a cat, with a photoshopped acknowledgement of your support! My cats are jerks, so don't be surprised if jokes are cracked at the expense of all man kind.


I have four cats, but two are terrified of the camera, so they will not be making an appearance. Meet Princess and Tia! These two lovely ladies will mock, cajole, tease, and work their ways into your hearts. Tia is the one wearing the red collar.



Montreal Botanical Gardens Selfie Photo Walk: I will go spend a day in Montreal botanical gardens with my bestie, where photographing shenanigans will happen. I will take pictures of myself doing goofy things, or have my friend take pictures of me doing goofy things. Each contributor will get their name photoshopped onto an image.


Appear in the Novel!


Kill a Character:

So, you want to live forever in a novel, do you? Now is your chance... sort of. I will kill a character of your creation and naming, in one of the upcoming Witch & Wolf novels. Pick your perk wisely... and be prepared to be murdered in a gruesomely creative fashion.


I will send each contributor of this perk level a template for information relating to the character being killed.


Note: Due to legalities, it will be necessary for each contributor of the kill-a-character perks to sign a very easy-to-decipher document stating I can use the character and name without risk of legal persecution.


This is to protect both of us.


Noooo, I want to survive!


Dying in fun, humorous, or gruesome fashions isn't for everyone. Here's your chance to have a character named by you for inclusion in one of the upcoming Witch & Wolf novels. You'll get to survive the events of the novel... and the character named by you will get at least one speaking line.


Once again, due to legalities, you'll have to sign a little piece of paper to cover both of our asses from legal nastiness.


Note: If you want to name your character after a real person, that person will need to give their permission.


Due to how the novels are written, there is limited space for character creation.


Signed book plates:

Due to shipping limitations and costs, I won't be doing signed paperbacks in bulk. However, I will be doing signed art book plates. These are signed stickers you put in your copy of your books, or on your laptop -- anywhere you want! Each bookplate will have a different design for each novel, including Inquisitor!

Create a deity -- Claimed! 

Other Goodies!


Sumi-e Paintings
Contributors of this perk level will receive a sumi-e painting by RJ Blain. Each painting will be unique, and will likely feature spring blooms and branches.


Art Prints

Some of us love art a lot, and my cover artist makes fantastic art. I will have perks dedicated to the cover art from the Witch & Wolf series, for those who want something a little more physical.

Advanced Copies

Can't wait for the official release date? This perk will let you get an ecopy of the book at the same time the advanced reviewers do... without being required to provide a review.


The backstory...


In June 2014, the sewage line to my house blocked up. It resulted in a flood of horrible nastiness in my basement. Almost everything I owned down there has been ruined. A few items were salvaged, and have been carted away for cleaning, but a huge chunk of my material possessions have gone the way of the dinosaurs. This was once a tiled, fully-furnished basement. Now it's a literal cesspit. (Fortunately, the cleaning company has come and dismantled the basement, removing two feet of studs, all of the floors, and so on!)

Until this point, I have been paying for a great deal of my production fees through working as a developmental editor. 


But life has happened, and because of the sewage flood, I have to replace things -- things not covered by insurance. My electric box has to be brought back up to code. There's almost $2,000 right there. I have to pay for all of the plumbing... it's bad enough the insurance company hasn't told me the total cost of that nightmare yet.


This has eaten away at my production budget for my novels. I have had to choose between my career and my home, and my home has won.


I don't want to give up my career (or significantly delay it!) because of life. Writing is what I love, and I want to give my fans the best books possible.


Insurance is going to help transform the below nightmare into living space again -- living space I can comfortably write my books in. It won't pay for the new computer I desperately need, and was going to get for Christmas, but there is always next year or the year after. My computer still functions, albeit poorly.


Note: Everything photographed was destroyed due to sewage contamination, and this is after the first industrial-sized rubbish bin was filled and carted away... ouch.



Risks & Challenges


Let's face it: Writing a novel is hard work. No author can ever be certain of the success of a novel project. However, the vast majority of my fans love the Witch & Wolf series the most. I love writing them. They're fun, they're exciting.


But they aren't easy to write, and there is no guarantee of success. With your help, I'll be able to do what I love doing most: Writing. I'll be able to publish the next three books of the series, all of which are planned out and in progress. I'll be able to give these novels the chance they deserve, and continue pursuing my beloved writing career.


With all novels, a notable challenge is knowing when the books will be ready. How do you know I'll complete this work? You don't. You have to take my word on it. That level of trust is something very difficult to earn, and I do not want to take it for granted.


So, I'm going to be as honest and upfront as I can be. Here is a list of all of the projects I currently have underway, where I'm at with them, and the estimated completion times. I try to stick to my deadlines, but I am the type of author who will delay a release by a month in order to produce a better book. I have no shame in admitting that.


My fans deserve the best I can give them, even if it means a bit of a delay. Originally, I was going to release Storm Surge and Royal Slaves next, but because of so much interest in the Witch & Wolf series, and my intense love of these books, I'm taking my time with these two novels. I'm also letting myself write longer, more thorough books, which do take longer. I'll be working on Storm Surge, Royal Slaves, and City of Clocks for month or two month long periods between each of the Witch & Wolf novels.


The Witch & Wolf Novels

Inquisitor


When Allison is asked to play Cinderella-turned-Fianceé at a Halloween ball, the last thing she expected was to be accused of murder on the same night. She has to find the killer or she'll be put to death for the crimes she didn't commit. To make matters worse, the victims are all werewolves. 



On the short list of potential victims, Allison has to act fast, or the killer will have one more body to add to his little black book of corpses. 


There's only one problem: One of the deaths has struck too close to home, and Allison's desire for self-preservation may transform into a quest for vengeance...


Winter Wolf

  • Estimated Release Date: November 1, 2014.
  • Current Status: Drafting in progress. Outlining completed.

A few months prior to the events of Inquisitor, Nicolina Desmond bears witness to a horrific murder. However, the truth of the young man's death is far worse than she ever believed possible.

A plague is killing off the werewolves, and if Nicolina can't find a cure, her family will number among the dead...

Blood Diamond
  • Estimated Release Date: March 2015.
  • Current Status: Outlining completed.

The world is full of corpses, and Jackson knows them by name. When a group strives to destroy the Inquisition, his sight may be all standing between the supernaturals and extinction.

However, when he learns the truth behind the deaths of his wife and unborn daughter, Jackson may prove to be the greatest threat of all to the survival of mankind...

Silver Bullet
  • Estimated Release Date: August 2015.
  • Current Status: Outlining completed.

In the aftermath of Blood Diamond, Victoria Hanover once again finds herself in the middle of a mess. Used in the ritual to forge a blood diamond, she is severed from her witch and her wolf. Aging years in a day as her human shell reverts to its true age, she is running out of time.

With her witch powers on the loose, and her wolf spirit on the hunt, it falls to a powerless Victoria to fight the manifestations of herself.

Unfortunately, killing a werewolf isn't easy, and it's even harder to destroy a spirit. In order to protect humanity, she must forge the silver bullets meant to end her life once and for all. Diving into her past is only the start of her journey, and success will be the end of it.

Other Series / Titles
  • Storm Surge: December 2014. (1st draft complete, 2nd draft in progress.)
  • Royal Slaves: May 2015.
  • City of Clocks: TBD.

    You can help!


    Money doesn't grow on trees. If it did, I'd be a farmer, and I wouldn't be flaying my pride to ask for help to continue my writing career.


    Some of you can't afford to contribute, even on the lowest contribution levels. I understand that. I really understand that.


    But there are lots of ways you can help.


    Share this project with your friends, your family, and anyone you know. Exposure is extremely valuable, and every little bit helps.


    Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. Pin the cover of my first book, linking to this page. Talk about the books. Make people aware.


    It's free, and it's almost magical in how much help it can be.


    Thank you all so much for your help.

Note: All books are ebooks (epub, mobi, or pdf) unless specified as paperbacks.

Fun & Games



Tea Party: I will take a picture of a cup of tea I have brewed just for you. Each contributor will receive a unique photograph of a cup of tea with their name photoshopped onto the image. Then I will drink the tea and enjoy it. 

Deluxe Tea Party: I will draw a doodle on a dry-erase board and pose the cup of tea in front of it, handwriting your name for the image. Then I will drink the tea and enjoy it.


All tea party images will be showcased in a gallery on my blog, with a list of contributors.


Buy RJ a Cup of Tea: You don't want anything beyond the satisfaction of encouraging RJ's shameless addiction to tea. Thanks!

My Cats will Acknowledge You: I will take a photograph of one of my cats, being a cat, with a photoshopped acknowledgement of your support! My cats are jerks, so don't be surprised if jokes are cracked at the expense of all man kind.

I have four cats, but two are terrified of the camera, so they will not be making an appearance. Meet Princess and Tia! These two lovely ladies will mock, cajole, tease, and work their ways into your hearts. Tia is the one wearing the red collar.


Montreal Botanical Gardens Selfie Photo Walk: I will go spend a day in Montreal botanical gardens with my bestie, where photographing shenanigans will happen. I will take pictures of myself doing goofy things, or have my friend take pictures of me doing goofy things. Each contributor will get their name photoshopped onto an image.



Appear in the Novel!


Kill a Character:
So, you want to live forever in a novel, do you? Now is your chance... sort of. I will kill a character of your creation and naming, in one of the upcoming Witch & Wolf novels. Pick your perk wisely... and be prepared to be murdered in a gruesomely creative fashion.

I will send each contributor of this perk level a template for information relating to the character being killed.

Note: Due to legalities, it will be necessary for each contributor of the kill-a-character perks to sign a very easy-to-decipher document stating I can use the character and name without risk of legal persecution.

This is to protect both of us.

Noooo, I want to survive!

Dying in fun, humorous, or gruesome fashions isn't for everyone. Here's your chance to have a character named by you for inclusion in one of the upcoming Witch & Wolf novels. You'll get to survive the events of the novel... and the character named by you will get at least one speaking line.

Once again, due to legalities, you'll have to sign a little piece of paper to cover both of our asses from legal nastiness.

Note: If you want to name your character after a real person, that person will need to give their permission.

Due to how the novels are written, there is limited space for character creation.



Signed book plates:


Due to shipping limitations and costs, I won't be doing signed paperbacks in bulk. However, I will be doing signed art book plates. These are signed stickers you put in your copy of your books, or on your laptop -- anywhere you want! Each bookplate will have a different design for each novel, including Inquisitor!

Create a deity -- Claimed! 

Other Goodies!

Sumi-e Paintings
Contributors of this perk level will receive a sumi-e painting by RJ Blain. Each painting will be unique, and will likely feature spring blooms and branches.





Art Prints


Some of us love art a lot, and my cover artist makes fantastic art. I will have perks dedicated to the cover art from the Witch & Wolf series, for those who want something a little more physical.

Advanced Copies

Can't wait for the official release date? This perk will let you get an ecopy of the book at the same time the advanced reviewers do... without being required to provide a review.




The backstory...



In June 2014, the sewage line to my house blocked up. It resulted in a flood of horrible nastiness in my basement. Almost everything I owned down there has been ruined. A few items were salvaged, and have been carted away for cleaning, but a huge chunk of my material possessions have gone the way of the dinosaurs. This was once a tiled, fully-furnished basement. Now it's a literal cesspit. (Fortunately, the cleaning company has come and dismantled the basement, removing two feet of studs, all of the floors, and so on!)


Until this point, I have been paying for a great deal of my production fees through working as a developmental editor. 

But life has happened, and because of the sewage flood, I have to replace things -- things not covered by insurance. My electric box has to be brought back up to code. There's almost $2,000 right there. I have to pay for all of the plumbing... it's bad enough the insurance company hasn't told me the total cost of that nightmare yet.

This has eaten away at my production budget for my novels. I have had to choose between my career and my home, and my home has won.

I don't want to give up my career (or significantly delay it!) because of life. Writing is what I love, and I want to give my fans the best books possible.

Insurance is going to help transform the below nightmare into living space again -- living space I can comfortably write my books in. It won't pay for the new computer I desperately need, and was going to get for Christmas, but there is always next year or the year after. My computer still functions, albeit poorly.

Note: Everything photographed was destroyed due to sewage contamination, and this is after the first industrial-sized rubbish bin was filled and carted away... ouch.







Risks & Challenges

Let's face it: Writing a novel is hard work. No author can ever be certain of the success of a novel project. However, the vast majority of my fans love the Witch & Wolf series the most. I love writing them. They're fun, they're exciting.


But they aren't easy to write, and there is no guarantee of success. With your help, I'll be able to do what I love doing most: Writing. I'll be able to publish the next three books of the series, all of which are planned out and in progress. I'll be able to give these novels the chance they deserve, and continue pursuing my beloved writing career.

With all novels, a notable challenge is knowing when the books will be ready. How do you know I'll complete this work? You don't. You have to take my word on it. That level of trust is something very difficult to earn, and I do not want to take it for granted.

So, I'm going to be as honest and upfront as I can be. Here is a list of all of the projects I currently have underway, where I'm at with them, and the estimated completion times. I try to stick to my deadlines, but I am the type of author who will delay a release by a month in order to produce a better book. I have no shame in admitting that.

My fans deserve the best I can give them, even if it means a bit of a delay. Originally, I was going to release Storm Surge and Royal Slaves next, but because of so much interest in the Witch & Wolf series, and my intense love of these books, I'm taking my time with these two novels. I'm also letting myself write longer, more thorough books, which do take longer. I'll be working on Storm Surge, Royal Slaves, and City of Clocks for month or two month long periods between each of the Witch & Wolf novels.

The Witch & Wolf Novels
Inquisitor

When Allison is asked to play Cinderella-turned-Fianceé at a Halloween ball, the last thing she expected was to be accused of murder on the same night. She has to find the killer or she'll be put to death for the crimes she didn't commit. To make matters worse, the victims are all werewolves. 
On the short list of potential victims, Allison has to act fast, or the killer will have one more body to add to his little black book of corpses. There's only one problem: One of the deaths has struck too close to home, and Allison's desire for self-preservation may transform into a quest for vengeance...

Winter Wolf



Estimated Release Date: November 1, 2014.


Current Status: Drafting in progress. Outlining completed.



A few months prior to the events of Inquisitor, Nicolina Desmond bears witness to a horrific murder. However, the truth of the young man's death is far worse than she ever believed possible.

A plague is killing off the werewolves, and if Nicolina can't find a cure, her family will number among the dead...

Blood Diamond


Estimated Release Date: March 2015.
Current Status: Outlining completed.


The world is full of corpses, and Jackson knows them by name. When a group strives to destroy the Inquisition, his sight may be all standing between the supernaturals and extinction.

However, when he learns the truth behind the deaths of his wife and unborn daughter, Jackson may prove to be the greatest threat of all to the survival of mankind...


Silver Bullet




Estimated Release Date: August 2015.
Current Status: Outlining completed.


In the aftermath of Blood Diamond, Victoria Hanover once again finds herself in the middle of a mess. Used in the ritual to forge a blood diamond, she is severed from her witch and her wolf. Aging years in a day as her human shell reverts to its true age, she is running out of time.

With her witch powers on the loose, and her wolf spirit on the hunt, it falls to a powerless Victoria to fight the manifestations of herself.

Unfortunately, killing a werewolf isn't easy, and it's even harder to destroy a spirit. In order to protect humanity, she must forge the silver bullets meant to end her life once and for all. Diving into her past is only the start of her journey, and success will be the end of it.

Other Series / Titles



Storm Surge: December 2014. (1st draft complete, 2nd draft in progress.)
Royal Slaves: May 2015.
City of Clocks: TBD.





  You can help!
 Money doesn't grow on trees. If it did, I'd be a farmer, and I wouldn't be flaying my pride to ask for help to continue my writing career.

Some of you can't afford to contribute, even on the lowest contribution levels. I understand that. I really understand that.

But there are lots of ways you can help.

Share this project with your friends, your family, and anyone you know. Exposure is extremely valuable, and every little bit helps.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. Pin the cover of my first book, linking to this page. Talk about the books. Make people aware.

It's free, and it's almost magical in how much help it can be.

Thank you all so much for your help.

story:
Send Yocheved to electrology school, so she can provide no to low cost electrolysis to Trans folks across the country!

Hi! I'm Yocheved. I'm a working class trans woman of color living in Florida. I have a couple of problems I'm working to solve in one fell swoop and I want your help.

Number one: trans women are overwhelmingly poor, broke, unemployed, underemployed or otherwise strapped. Everywhere. Almost always. And in a country with a heterocentric medical industry, none of our basic care gets covered. One of the simplest things we need for our emotional health and physical safety is often one of the first people notice: we need to afford hair removal, especially on our faces.

Electrolysis is the most versatile, most permanent hair removal solution available and costs $65-$125 per hour on average (and can take between 100 and 400 hours of treatment time for a trans woman's full face). There are a very small handful of low-rate, trans-safe/friendly electrologists scattered across the country.

Number two: I am poor. Fun as it sounds, working in coffee shops the rest of my life probably won't leave me in particularly good health by the time I'm older. I'm willing to tug my own bootstraps, but the laws of physics don't support the likelihood of me lifting myself all the way up. I'm asking for a boost.

Receiving training as a licensed electrologist will provide me a career that could last a lifetime. This is a gateway to a much more stable life for me. I currently have no way to afford this on my own and FAFSA sure doesn't cover electrolysis school. I will be thrilled to give back to the communities of which I am a part.

So help me swoop both these the problems right into yesteryear by helping me build a carreer providing low- to no-cost electrolysis to my many trans communities!

The Deal

Let me break down this request, because $10,000 ain't pocket change:

Tuition at [tk school name]: $5,000

Dectro Apilus Senior 3G electrolysis machine: $4,000

Board Exam for license: $305

Electrolysis needles for use during schooling: $100

Total: $9,804 plus sales tax on the machine and needles

As part of my commitment to ethical crowdfunding, a ledger of my costs and expenditures will be available openly online at: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1vmodTgVgVbz9_nEKWE-6yv96ka6R4CJVG_PqCYX35e0/edit?usp=sharing

Furthermore

I feel strongly committed to maximizing the usefulness of this fundraiser--your donations will benefit myself, rural and poor trans communities across the South, and Wild Iris.

For the first year, I want to pledge 15% of profits to Wild Iris and 15% to a Trans Affairs account to fund medical transitions, charging a sliding scale of $0 to $140  for trans people. I'll lug my set-up to queer gatherings/conferences and attempt to tour lgbtq centers in an attempt to really share this resource as far and wide as possible.

This may sound cosmetic, but the impact will be much more than skin deep.

Other Ways You Can Help

Dear jeeb--get the word out! Share this on Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter, Ello, Diaspora, MySpace...whatever you've got. Send a personal request to friends and family who you know can afford to help.

And remember to subvert the dominant algorithm: always click "like" and "share" on Facebot so the posts can get popular enough to show up in more and more newsfeeds.

And thank you kindly for reading this far. Your support means a lot.

story:
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR BRINGING THE OTTIYA MAGAZINE TO LIFE! 

IF YOU MISSED THE CAMPAIGN, YOU CAN SHOP FOR THE MAGAZINE ON OUR STORE: WWW.OTTIYA.COM/SHOP 

 

 

Ottiya Magazine 

Ottiya is an international magazine co-created by children, educators, and creatives. Our work is driven by questions such as: what is meaningful, creative, and fun learning and education? What are schools really like in Denmark, Japan, or the US? What can education learn from creative fields such as architecture , photography, and design?  Through our magazine, we hope to share inspiring and thought-provoking ideas for educators and families, bring families and communities closer together, and start a grassroots movement to improve learning and education for children. 

Ottiya Magazine Vol. 1 Community 

For our inaugural issue, we are exploring the theme of community since this is the first time that we are bringing people together for the Ottiya magazine. Community is the warmth of a caring friend, the rich diversity in our neighborhoods, and the spaces that unite us together. And of course, schools are a community of learners and neighborhoods have a significant impact on children's well-being and upbringing.

You will read over one hundred pages of enriching articles and hands-on activities featuring design thinking experts IDEO, empathy education in Denmark, Finnish coding storyteller Linda Liukas, Sesame Workshop China and many others. Our contributors are students, educators, architects, and practitioners who are from from places as different as South Korea and Spain and represent organizations such as the Harvard Alumni for Education, the Capital of Children (an initiative of the Lego Foundation), Barefoot Nature, Danish Folkeskole. and leading International Baccalaureate schools. 

(pictured above: Design Learning Environments by Stephen, fourth grade teacher/educational architect; Kindness and Empathy in the Danish Folkeskole by Laura and Mathilde, two middle school students in Denmark; We.Are.Nature by James, founder of the Barefoot Nature) 

(pictured above: Hello Ruby, Hello Linda: Interview with Linda Liukas by Rufina, Founder of Ottiya and Director of International Engagement of Harvard Alumni for Educatin; From Sesame Street to the Communities of Left Behind Children in China by Rae, Program Manager of Sesame Workshop China; School is: artistic explorations of school design by children from Greece, China, and South Korea)

Introducing some of our contributors:

What is your vision and long-term plan for Ottiya? 

The Ottiya magazine marks the beginning of our work to spring forth positive change in education for children everywhere. We are driven by our mission to promote meaningful, creative, and fun learning and education for children everywhere and not restricted by what we do.

We are a platform for children, educators, architects, and practitioners to suggest creative and thought-provoking ideas for learning and education. For educators and families, we are a toolkit with enriching articles and hands-on activities. And for researchers, we are a light house to look into the future and discover creative practices and new areas to explore and study.

Hand-in-hand with you, we will bring families and communities closer together and start a grassroots movement to improve learning and education for children.

Ottiya= otter + ya (the Korean word 'hi') meaning hi otter! We are inspired by the warmth and support otters show their friends and families. Hold our hands as we begin this journey and help us make Ottiya a reality  :) 

Can you tell me more about the contents of the magazine?

In Hand-in-Hand, we present articles alongside hands-on activities that adults and children can enjoy together. In Learning Spaces, we explain how to think creatively about classrooms, cafeterias, and schools through perspectives in architecture and design. Lastly, in Community Voices, we take you on a world tour of diverse topics in education such as coding through storytelling with Finland's Linda Liukas, multicultural education in Japan by a graduate of Harvard University's International Education Policy program, and the importance of reflection in learning by a program manager of an Indonesian education organization .  

>> HAND IN HAND

  

>> LEARNING SPACES

         

     

 

>> COMMUNITY VOICES

                                                                                          

For Everything There is a Season: A Whimsical Ottiya Activity Book 

(offered through the family kit and storytelling packages!)

     

     

    How you can support this Ottiya Indiegogo campaign


     

    Follow us Social Media

     

    The Backstory of Ottiya: how it all began 

    As a former teacher, curriculum designer, and education policy researcher, Rufina, the Founder of Ottiya, looked around the world of education policy and research and thought, "Where are the children's voices? Why isn't there a platform to give a stronger voice to educators, students, parents, and the diverse people working in the field of education? Couldn't there be a better way to encourage more cross-sectoral collaboration for education?" 

    The Problem: Top-Down Educational Transformations Led by Standardized Data

    In the world of global education policy, it often seems like a small group of decision makers and influencers get to shape the conversation about what is good for our children and schools. With the absence of a proper forum for interaction of all stakeholders of education--the ones who really matter such as students, educators, and parents--are often left out of the conversation. Families and teachers are often too busy adapting to changes in the curriculum that they do not have enough time to reflect and think about what they think about what matters in teaching and learning.

    While we are not discounting the work of the decision makers and influencers, our concern is that what we believe to be good and necessary in education seems to increasingly depend on standardized datasets and generalizations that do not tell the full story. For instance, certain countries are deemed to have superior schools, curriculum, and teachers. Also, particular skills, subjects, and standards are said to be more valuable and necessary than others. 

    What Could Be: Grassroots Educational Transformations Driven by Diverse Stories

    We at Ottiya want to help give a voice to students, educators, and parents and seek-out thought-provoking and creative ideas from everyone who has a passion for education. We want to give a platform where diverse peoples can come to share stories about what teaching and learning is like in their individual school, what the unique challenges they faced in their communities, and how the overcame those hurdles. In the process, we believe that we can nurture a grassroots movement to improve education. 

    We want to hear from Laura and Mathilde, two students from Denmark who want to tell us how they learn about kindness in their schools; from Sam, a first grade teacher in Somerville, Massachusetts who invited her students to reflect on their hopes and dreams at the beginning of the school year; and from Jero and Bego, two architects with a big heart for education who explored how IDEO redesigned the school cafeterias in the San Francisco Unified School District. 

    Our Philosophy: Ottiya as a Community Garden for Learning & Education

    Our Indiegogo campaign centers on the launch of the Ottiya Magazine. But, we like to think of Ottiya as more than just a publication. It is a microphone for students, teachers, parents, and diverse people with a passion for education. It is a platform for storytelling and knowledge sharing about meaningful, creative, and fun learning and education. Metaphorically, we like to think of Ottiya as a kind of community garden where we welcome gardners young and old, expert and amateur to come together to think about the seeds we want to sow and the tools we want to use to help nurture a garden dedicated to learning and education. 

     

    Interview with the Founder 

    Rufina K. Park is the Founder and Creative/Editorial Director of Ottiya. She started this project in August 2016 after she realized that more needs to be done to (1) integrate the thoughts and opinions of the real stakeholders of education (young people, parents, and educators) into mainstream conversations, (2) to make academic research more readable, usable, and applicable to families and educators, and (3) to bring together people from diverse sectors with a common passion for youth and education.

    • What does Ottiya mean? :) Thanks for your question! Well, I love otters because they hold hands when they sleep to prevent each other from drifting away. Otter moms and cubs are especially cudly. I wanted Ottiya to embody the loving sense of family and community that otters display. So I took 'Ott' from otter and 'ya' from the Korean word which is kind of like 'hi!' and created the word Ottiya--it's kind of like hi otter!  
    • What are you covering in your next issue? Ahh, it's a top secret..! haha no, we are going to be covering 'Play' in the next issue. We would love for you to contribute in some way. Please find out more details here. If you're interested in advertising in the next issue about play, please contact us using our advertising form here. 

     

    Share the campaign with your friends & family!

    Thanks so much for your support! Please help us spread the word by using the hashtag #Ottiyamag and share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends!

     

    Funding Details 

    How will the funding be used? 

      • Most of the funds will be used to meet the production costs (printing, shipping, and handling), offset marketing costs, website maintenance costs,  and to ensure the production of Ottiya Magazine Volume 2: Play. 

      What are the risks and challenges? 

      • Ottiya is a licensed publishing company and we have experience printing, publishing, and distributing publications and notebooks--in fact our activity book is already being sold in Kyobo, which is the largest bookstore chain in South Korea. However, we are expecting this (Indiegogo campaign) will be our biggest undertaking of self-distributing a publication to date. While it might be challenging, we have already overcome enormous hurdles getting this far and assure you that our in-house publication team and volunteers will be working very hard to make sure you get your magazines and books!

In the world of global education policy, it often seems like a small group of decision makers and influencers get to shape the conversation about what is good for our children and schools. With the absence of a proper forum for interaction of all stakeholders of education--the ones who really matter such as students, educators, and parents--are often left out of the conversation. Families and teachers are often too busy adapting to changes in the curriculum that they do not have enough time to reflect and think about what they think about what matters in teaching and learning.
While we are not discounting the work of the decision makers and influencers, our concern is that what we believe to be good and necessary in education seems to increasingly depend on standardized datasets and generalizations that do not tell the full story. For instance, certain countries are deemed to have superior schools, curriculum, and teachers. Also, particular skills, subjects, and standards are said to be more valuable and necessary than others. 
What Could Be: Grassroots Educational Transformations Driven by Diverse Stories
We at Ottiya want to help give a voice to students, educators, and parents and seek-out thought-provoking and creative ideas from everyone who has a passion for education. We want to give a platform where diverse peoples can come to share stories about what teaching and learning is like in their individual school, what the unique challenges they faced in their communities, and how the overcame those hurdles. In the process, we believe that we can nurture a grassroots movement to improve education. 
We want to hear from Laura and Mathilde, two students from Denmark who want to tell us how they learn about kindness in their schools; from Sam, a first grade teacher in Somerville, Massachusetts who invited her students to reflect on their hopes and dreams at the beginning of the school year; and from Jero and Bego, two architects with a big heart for education who explored how IDEO redesigned the school cafeterias in the San Francisco Unified School District. 
Our Philosophy: Ottiya as a Community Garden for Learning & Education 
Our Indiegogo campaign centers on the launch of the Ottiya Magazine. But, we like to think of Ottiya as more than just a publication. It is a microphone for students, teachers, parents, and diverse people with a passion for education. It is a platform for storytelling and knowledge sharing about meaningful, creative, and fun learning and education. Metaphorically, we like to think of Ottiya as a kind of community garden where we welcome gardners young and old, expert and amateur to come together to think about the seeds we want to sow and the tools we want to use to help nurture a garden dedicated to learning and education. 
 
Interview with the Founder 
Rufina K. Park is the Founder and Creative/Editorial Director of Ottiya. She started this project in August 2016 after she realized that more needs to be done to (1) integrate the thoughts and opinions of the real stakeholders of education (young people, parents, and educators) into mainstream conversations, (2) to make academic research more readable, usable, and applicable to families and educators, and (3) to bring together people from diverse sectors with a common passion for youth and education.


What does Ottiya mean? :) Thanks for your question! Well, I love otters because they hold hands when they sleep to prevent each other from drifting away. Otter moms and cubs are especially cudly. I wanted Ottiya to embody the loving sense of family and community that otters display. So I took 'Ott' from otter and 'ya' from the Korean word which is kind of like 'hi!' and created the word Ottiya--it's kind of like hi otter!  

What are you covering in your next issue? Ahh, it's a top secret..! haha no, we are going to be covering 'Play' in the next issue. We would love for you to contribute in some way. Please find out more details here. If you're interested in advertising in the next issue about play, please contact us using our advertising form here. 


 
Share the campaign with your friends & family!

Thanks so much for your support! Please help us spread the word by using the hashtag #Ottiyamag and share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends!
 
Funding Details 
How will the funding be used? 

Most of the funds will be used to meet the production costs (printing, shipping, and handling), offset marketing costs, website maintenance costs,  and to ensure the production of Ottiya Magazine Volume 2: Play. 

What are the risks and challenges? 
Ottiya is a licensed publishing company and we have experience printing, publishing, and distributing publications and notebooks--in fact our activity book is already being sold in Kyobo, which is the largest bookstore chain in South Korea. However, we are expecting this (Indiegogo campaign) will be our biggest undertaking of self-distributing a publication to date. While it might be challenging, we have already overcome enormous hurdles getting this far and assure you that our in-house publication team and volunteers will be working very hard to make sure you get your magazines and books!

story:
Story of My Book

Rampant Ambition: Forever Untamed is a book about changing and creating a new mindset to achieve all the endeavors you want.

My name is Jamar Watkins, and I am the author of Rampant Ambition: Forever Untamed. I wrote this book because people spend too many hours chasing dreams that aren't theirs and they are stuck. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your true self and the ambitions that are meant for you, and build the right mindset to go achieve them. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement in you that I have for freedom and entrepreneurship. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you evaluate your passions and values and build the right mindset to go achieve them.

In this book, you'll learn about How to find the LIFE that is MEANT for you and How to make that life into a Reality. You'll read some inspiring stories, including those from:

Phil Knight and how he took just an MBA doctoral paper and used his “RAMPANT AMBITION” to turn it into one of the greatest sports companies in history. 

Jimmy Iovine and how he went from being a janitor at a record company to mixing and mastering for Bruce Springsteen. From there, he was Forever Untamed and has blazed a path in the music industry for others to follow. 

Randy Gregory and how he simply put the first rule into effect. He stopped listening to others and followed his wildest dreams. Today, he is seeing the fruits of his labor manifest in ways he couldn't have imagined. 

You will love this book if you want to take that next big step or that next transition in your life. Rampant Ambition: Forever Untamedis a non-fiction book that speaks to those who are looking at Altering their Mindset and Finding their path to success for the first time.

Rampant Ambition: Forever Untamed

The book is written in 3 Parts.

Part 1 is where you will learn the meaning of “Rampant Ambition”. You will learn what it looks like when it is working for you and what it looks like when it's working against you. We will look into the story of Randy Gregory, where he shares an important central theme that empowers you to take that first step to be “RAMPANT.” 

In Part 2, we will dive deep into the six essential steps on what it takes to truly be “Rampant.” We will look at stories from Ellen DeGeneres, Einstein, and more. We will look at these stories and see the common denominator in their life and how they used that as a turning point to unleash themselves and accomplish everything they wanted. We will cover things like Finding your Why and Mastering it to simply having faith in what you do. What is your dream 

In Part 3, we are trying everything together and simply being “RAMPANT.” Here you will see all 6 steps being placed into action and how that looks in your life. In the end, there will be a guideline on how you can continuously strive to be Forever Untamed.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Jamar Watkinsis founder and CEO of Rampant Ambition, a lifestyle brand that ties stories into products and products to people. He is a Junior at the University of Kentucky and interns at several places like I AM THIRD Sports and Louisville City F.C. 

He wrote this book because I was curious about how certain cultural leaders and icons had their hands in so many different pots. He was intrigued by how they were able to accomplish all their goals and ambitions without spiraling out of control and being stretched out too thin. 

Jamar is a self-starter entrepreneur who loves looking at individuals’ mindset. Over the past four years, he has strived to perfect his mindset to be the best entrepreneur he can be. 

For more information, you can connect with Jamar at Jamarwatkins1@gmail.comand Instagram: Jwatkins_4, LinkedIn: Jamar Watkins 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #RAMPANT and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jamar Watkins

story:
Story of My Book

Fly By is a book about international business and entrepreneurship. It includes the origin stories of successful founder CEOs like Howard Schultz of Starbucks and Dietrich Mateschitz of Redbull and showcases lessons from each of the 7 companies that helped them get to where they are now. 

My name is Grace Huang and I am the author of Fly By. I wrote this book because I’m really passionate about international business and I wanted to share all the ways that entrepreneurs can explore the different opportunities available to them in this realm. I love stories, so for me, the most compelling way to share international business is through the origin stories of founder CEOs, people who have already succeeded as an entrepreneur.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover ALL of the different ways flying to another country can change your life. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for international business. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you on your entrepreneurial journey, whether you are looking for ways to market or just find inspiration for your next BIG idea. 

In this book, you'll learn about entrepreneurship and international business. You'll hear stories such as: 
  • Howard Schultz’s first business trip to Milan and how that kickstarted the Starbucks we know about today 
  • Gordon and Carol Segal’s honeymoon to the Caribbean where they learned about wholesaling European furniture
  • David Chang’s stint in Japan as an English teacher and how that lead to his love of Ramen. 
You will love this book if you like learning about unique anecdotes of highly successful people, different industries ranging from consumer goods, skincare, restaurant, and beverages, and various business topics that entrepreneurs would love but no one really talks about.

Fly By is a nonfiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and business students who want inspiration in starting a business or to look at entrepreneurship and international business in a new way.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Grace Huang is a graduating senior from UC Berkeley, Haas School of Business majoring in Business Administration and part of the inaugural class of the Global Management Program. 

After learning about international business and studying abroad in London for 4 months, Grace was inspired by the different cultures and lifestyles that changed the way she lived her life in new and better ways. Then, she realized that companies were inspired and founded the same way; they changed, pivoted, and remixed to become industry leaders and pioneers. 

Grace enjoys traveling, writing, running, and finding the perfect scrambled egg recipe, she wants to explore the world at the speed New Yorkers walk.

For more information, you can connect with Grace Huang at grahua@berkeley.edu and at @gracehuang_author on Instagram or www.linkedin.com/in/gracehuang00.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #FlyBy and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Grace Huang

story:
Story of My Book

Perfectly, Imperfect. My book is about my journey through mental illness, and the rollercoaster that is recovery. I include stories from other people who have faced different mental health problems in hope that it will shed light on mental illness and let others know they aren’t alone.

My name is Tesa Drew and I am the author of Perfectly, Imperfect. I wrote this book because I wanted others to know that they aren’t alone, and to show people that recovery is possible from mental illness. I want people to be more comfortable talking about mental illness and seeking help.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that many people struggle with mental illness and it does get better. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn more about different mental health problems and to be able to talk more openly about mental health. Escape from your everyday life and learn alongside me as we navigate this world of recovery!

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of perfectionism and mental health and the struggles of navigating through recovery from an eating disorder through narratives like:

  • The time I woke up in solitary confinement in a psychiatric ward in the hospital. I wanted to end my life, I was in such a dark place, and I was saved by a paramedic.
  • How I let my Eating Disorder control me and my life for so long, and how I finally managed to take back the power my eating disorder had.
  •  How prevalent perfectionism is in everyday life, and how it affects people differently.
  • Different healthy coping mechanisms I have learned to use instead of relying on unhealthy coping mechanisms.


You will love this book if you have struggled with your mental health or know someone who is struggling.

Perfectly, Imperfect speaks to anyone who has struggled with their mental health and family members or friends of someone who has struggled with mental health problems who want to grapple with mental illness and learn more in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Perfectly, Imperfect inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Do we have enough adequate treatment centers for mental illnesses?
  • Is there enough support out there for those struggling with mental Illness?
  • Are people comfortable speaking up about their mental illnesses and seeking help?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing mental health.

The Book - Perfectly, Imperfect

The book is written in 4 Parts.... 

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This section is my story. The reader will learn about my journey through navigating with many different mental illnesses, and what that has looked like for my life.

Part 2 contains Chapters 7-11. This section is called other voices. In these chapters, I have many stories from other people who have had different mental illnesses, and I share their story and recovery journeys.

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-14.  I called this section recovery, and I talk about what recovery has meant for me and my life, and the things I do daily in order to keep on track!

Part 4 contains the afterword and the letter to my eating disorder.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

I will also be donating proceeds from every book sold, to help develop mental health programs in Canada and the United States.

About the Author

Tesa Drew is not only a mental health advocate, but also works as a flight attendant. She has been flying the skies for over four years and has a passion for travel as she has seen many parts of the world and learned a lot about different cultures. Tesa is kind and compassionate and is always willing to do anything to help others.

Tesa decided to write this book because she has a strong passion for mental health, ever since she sought help for her own Mental Illnesses five years ago. Tesa has struggled with Anorexia Nervosa, Anxiety, Depression and Obsessive compulsive disorder. Three years ago, she started her own recovery blog and Instagram, where she was able to share her story and inspire others. The day she started her advocacy journey, she made a promise to herself to be the person that she wished she had had when she was struggling with her mental illnesses. She also promised herself to always be open, raw, and honest in the stories and posts that she shared about her journey, because in doing so, she has been able to connect with others on a deeper level as well as engage more in her own healing.

Outside of this book Tesa enjoys staying active. She was a competitive cheerleader for five years, and played soccer for twenty years. She enjoys staying active now through yoga, running, and fitness classes. She loves spending time with her dog, friends and family. In the summer, she spends alot of her time at her lake house, unwinding. Most of all, Tesa loves getting to share her story, and talk with other people who are struggling, in hopes to give them some hope and inspiration.

For more information you can connect with Tesa by..
Email: tesa.drew@hotmail.com
Instagram: @recoveryisarollercoaster @tesadrew
Blog: www.recoveryisarollercoaster.wordpress.com
Facebook: Recovery is a Rollercoaster
TikTok: tesadrew
LinkedIn: Tesa Drew
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tesa Drew
story_txt:
Story of My Book
Perfectly, Imperfect. My book is about my journey through mental illness, and the rollercoaster that is recovery. I include stories from other people who have faced different mental health problems in hope that it will shed light on mental illness and let others know they aren’t alone.
My name is Tesa Drew and I am the author of Perfectly, Imperfect. I wrote this book because I wanted others to know that they aren’t alone, and to show people that recovery is possible from mental illness. I want people to be more comfortable talking about mental illness and seeking help.
My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that many people struggle with mental illness and it does get better. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn more about different mental health problems and to be able to talk more openly about mental health. Escape from your everyday life and learn alongside me as we navigate this world of recovery!
In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of perfectionism and mental health and the struggles of navigating through recovery from an eating disorder through narratives like:

The time I woke up in solitary confinement in a psychiatric ward in the hospital. I wanted to end my life, I was in such a dark place, and I was saved by a paramedic.
How I let my Eating Disorder control me and my life for so long, and how I finally managed to take back the power my eating disorder had.
 How prevalent perfectionism is in everyday life, and how it affects people differently.
Different healthy coping mechanisms I have learned to use instead of relying on unhealthy coping mechanisms.

You will love this book if you have struggled with your mental health or know someone who is struggling.
Perfectly, Imperfect speaks to anyone who has struggled with their mental health and family members or friends of someone who has struggled with mental health problems who want to grapple with mental illness and learn more in a new way.
Ultimately, I hope that Perfectly, Imperfect inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Do we have enough adequate treatment centers for mental illnesses?
Is there enough support out there for those struggling with mental Illness?
Are people comfortable speaking up about their mental illnesses and seeking help?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing mental health.
The Book - Perfectly, Imperfect
The book is written in 4 Parts.... 
Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. This section is my story. The reader will learn about my journey through navigating with many different mental illnesses, and what that has looked like for my life.
Part 2 contains Chapters 7-11. This section is called other voices. In these chapters, I have many stories from other people who have had different mental illnesses, and I share their story and recovery journeys.
Part 3 contains Chapters 12-14.  I called this section recovery, and I talk about what recovery has meant for me and my life, and the things I do daily in order to keep on track!
Part 4 contains the afterword and the letter to my eating disorder.
 
What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

I will also be donating proceeds from every book sold, to help develop mental health programs in Canada and the United States.

story:
¿Qué?

Mítica Navidad nos ofrece una revisión del mito navideño, de la naturaleza belicosa de un Santa Claus irreconocible, de unos elfos que reparten su tiempo entre envolver regalos y salvar al mundo de trols y ogros...

Ipsy Dipsy es un joven elfo que vive en la villa navidad, y él, al igual que sus antepasados, heredará la tarea de cuidar uno de los grandes tesoros del mundo mágico: La bolsa de Santa Claus. Sin embargo, Ipsy no quiere eso; él desea ser parte de los guerreros del Polo Norte que combaten contra troles de las nieves y ogros blancos. Y sobre todo, su gran sueño es volverse parte de las siete espadas del invierno, los soldados de élite.

Junto a su amigo, Elont, Ipsy viajará dentro de la bolsa de Santa Claus buscando encontrar su camino para convertirse en quien puede ser. Llegando así a la ciudad del alba, donde viven los elfos del verano, unos pocos del otoño y algún que otro Nibelungo... y seguirá hasta el mismo fondo de la bolsa, donde algo muy poderoso y peligroso aguarda. 

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Edher Juárez.

Nacido en México en 1989, Ingeniero Mecánico con una maestría en administración de negocios (MBA), se está desarrollando actualmente en el área cinematográfica con múltiples proyectos.

Un entusiasta de la ciencia ficción, la fantasía y el terror. Con cuentos publicados como «Una simple negociación» (2015), «En lo profundo del bosque» (2018), «Infinity Inc. y el secreto de E.I.D.» (2018), entre otros. Siendo también guionista de cortometrajes independientes como Vive por siempre (2017).

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Corrieron a refugiarse, pero mientras lo hacían, Ipsy Dipsy, el pequeño elfo, preguntó:
          —Viejo, ¿Dónde están todos los guerreros? Deberían estar aquí.
          —Están todos ocupados —dijo Trombo, un viejo guerrero, sin detenerse—. Ha habido un ataque masivo en las murallas, desde la gran guerra no había pasado. La bruja Gyülen también. Justo en Navidad.
          Todos los elfos comenzaron a detenerse, y al verlo, el viejo Trombo le extrañó, pero más que nada le preocupó. Pues delante de ellos, y no muy arriba en el cielo, la bruja preparaba algo malo.  Una burbuja oscura salía de su boca y no paraba de crecer, hasta que llegó a ser tres veces más grande que ella. Y fue entonces que la dejó caer.
          La masa, cual gota de lluvia, se esparció en el suelo.
          —Es hora de divertirse, elfos —decía con malicia Gyülen mientras reía montada en su escoba—. Levántense ahora, Krimps. Ya están en la villa navidad.
          De entre aquella masa negra formas humanoides comenzaron a emerger. Los Krimps llegaron. Del tamaño de un elfo promedio. Sin ninguno bello o cabello. Carentes de ropa y todos ellos hechos de la sustancia oscura como el alquitrán, que se veía pegajosa y en extremo caliente. Con vientres abultados y brazos algo largos. Con cabezas redondas sin ojos, nariz u orejas, pero sí con grandes bocas de las cuales se asomaban sus blancos dientes, con solo muelas con las que mordisqueaban todo el tiempo aunque no tuvieran bocado.
          Fue el viejo Trombo que gritó con desesperación:
          —¡Todos huyan de aquí! Vayan a la casa de Santa.
          —Viejo —dijo Ipsy asustado, aún tomando la mano de Trombo mientras todos corrían.
          —Ipsy, también debes irte. No podré protegerte si te quedas. Tal vez no parezcan temibles esas cosas. Pero créeme, son peor que los troles. Ve a casa y advierte a tu abuelo. —Ipsy lo soltó, mientras el viejo Trombo caminaba entre la multitud que huía despavorida en sentido contrario—. Corre, enano. Dile a tu abuelo que los Krimps ya van por la bolsa».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Edher Juárez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
