story:
Resumen

Todo el mundo puede ser creativo si cuenta con las herramientas adecuadas para desarrollar sus ideas. El Cuaderno de Vulcano es una caja de recursos que reúne las recetas, trucos y metodologías que hemos aprendido en nuestra experiencia con clientes, compañeros y amigos. Nuestra idea es ordenarlos, diseñarlos y compartirlos para impulsar la creatividad y hacerla llegar mucho más allá de nuestro círculo más cercano.

En Prodigioso Volcán cada año editamos una publicación especial que distribuimos entre nuestros clientes y amigos, como Aviario; sin embargo, siempre había gente que se quedaba con ganas de conseguir un ejemplar. Así que esta vez hemos decidido abrir nuestra caja de herramientas creativas para que todo aquel que la necesite pueda hacerse con una. Nosotros vamos a financiar la tirada habitual; a través de Indiegogo buscamos ampliar el número de ejemplares para que tú también tengas la oportunidad de conseguir el Cuaderno de Vulcano.

En Prodigioso Volcán nos encantan las buenas ideas. Desarrollamos e inventamos proyectos. Nos gustan: las estrategias de comunicación innovadoras, la visualización y el diseño, y la producción de contenidos de calidad. Nos apetece enseñar..., pero, sobre todo, aprender.

La creatividad es el hilo conductor que une todos nuestros proyectos. Anímate a participar. Tus ideas esperan un lugar en el que empezar a realizarse: prueba el Cuaderno de Vulcano.

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Para alcanzar nuestro objetivo necesitamos 2.000 euros con los que editaremos 100 ejemplares del Cuaderno de Vulcano. El 30% de nuestra recaudación irá destinada a una organización de ayuda a los damnificados por el terremoto del pasado 19 de septiembre en México, donde además de muchos amigos tenemos una oficina y un equipo de compañeros de Prodigioso Volcán. El 70% restante será para producir el cuaderno y pagar los gastos de envío y las recompensas.

En caso de que no alcancemos la cantidad que necesitamos enviaremos el dinero recaudado a la organización mexicana de ayuda a los damnificados de México.

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Si no puedes colaborar con esta campaña pero te gusta lo que hacemos sí que puedes ayudarnos: difunde nuestro Cuaderno de Vulcano para que llegue a más gente con las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Y eso es todo.

Gracias de antemano por tu colaboración

story:
My work as an animal communicator is the most powerful, most enjoyable and deeply fulfilling work I have ever done.  After an intense near-death experience, I was given psychic abilities,  such as mediumship, seeing people at a distance, hearing from those who are silenced by alzheimers and strokes, babies in embryo and one of most thrilling of all:  animal communication.

When people find out I communicate directly with animals they
always ask: if they’re talking to you, what do they say?’. And
this book was born. I am writing to present what the animals see,
feel and communicate which is generally very soulful, heartfelt
and often very funny and revealing.
Also in this book I share my experiences communicating with
those who have Autism, Alzheimers, stroke patients, babies in
utero and infants.

I am taking this book to an “indie” publisher.

Publication/distribution costs with Conscious Shift Publishing
come to $3700. This includes a listing with the Library of
Congress, a copyright with the US Gov’t, an ISBN number,
ebook formatting for Kindle and iPhone, etc. This will begin to
get the book “Look Who’s Talking” out into the universe
With a goal of helping animals and their people to better
understand each other and to create positive changes in their
lives, this book will blaze a trail in that direction.

Your support of this project would be so greatly appreciated in
bringing this book to fruition!
story_txt:
My work as an animal communicator is the most powerful, most enjoyable and deeply fulfilling work I have ever done.  After an intense near-death experience, I was given psychic abilities,  such as mediumship, seeing people at a distance, hearing from those who are silenced by alzheimers and strokes, babies in embryo and one of most thrilling of all:  animal communication.
When people find out I communicate directly with animals theyalways ask: if they’re talking to you, what do they say?’. Andthis book was born. I am writing to present what the animals see,feel and communicate which is generally very soulful, heartfeltand often very funny and revealing.Also in this book I share my experiences communicating withthose who have Autism, Alzheimers, stroke patients, babies inutero and infants.
I am taking this book to an “indie” publisher.
Publication/distribution costs with Conscious Shift Publishingcome to $3700. This includes a listing with the Library ofCongress, a copyright with the US Gov’t, an ISBN number,ebook formatting for Kindle and iPhone, etc. This will begin toget the book “Look Who’s Talking” out into the universeWith a goal of helping animals and their people to betterunderstand each other and to create positive changes in theirlives, this book will blaze a trail in that direction.
Your support of this project would be so greatly appreciated inbringing this book to fruition!

story:
Hi, I'm Kingi and welcome to my project - Kingi Goes Berserk and the NEW Silkscreen NOW.

 

Here is my story, and what the two parts of my book are about.  I then explain the funding I need, and why I'm totally good for it.  Thank you for reading and hope you enjoy....

About Me... 

Growing up on a farm near Kingston Ontario, I started by selling corn at the side of the highway. It started a love of love of independent biz.  Soon, I was making and selling hand drawn greeting cards, dyed corn-kernel necklaces any place that would take'em.  When I got older, I made myself dresses out of old pillowcases that were decorated with magic marker pictures.....

MY WORLD changed when I discovered screen printing fabric at art school. This combined my love of fashion, sewing, drawing, being creative with fabric and colour! 

At 24, I became an indie fashion entrepreneur opening my fabric/fashion design biz and shop, Peach Berserk in downtown Toronto.  It was different, very popular and was open for over 20 years, inspiring Fodor's Travel Guide to state that I was ‘the undisputed monarch of Queen St. West."

 

Peach Berserk..... 

Peach Berserk was unique, because the clothing and accessories were designed, screen printed and made to order in-house. There was nothing like it and people took notice. Most local and international fashion media were rushing to profile what we were doing. I held weekly silkscreening workshops. Long before the internet DIY craze, this  was wonderfully interactive, messy and fun, unleashing creativity everywhere.

My store was a Queen West landmark.... 

 

 

   

A year ago, a fire burnt down my entire silkscreen studio.
Most of my supplies, belongings and all copies of my original book Silkscreen Now were gone in flames and smoke.

Only a year later, I have rebuilt my studio in a brand new location.

 

 

 I teach screen printing and design in workshops reaching people in unlikely spaces. I am SO excited to recently be appointed an educational partner with the Toronto School Board.  Teaching kids of all ages in the schools has been exciting because it is something completely new for them, I teach my own way... and I see their eyes light up....

 I love teaching workshops in shelters, neighbourhood groups, outdoor community festivals and all over the city. It means so much for everyone involved.  Art changes people. 

...and of course, I am silkscreening my own stuff like crazy..... 

Two of my latest adventures are teaching screenprinting in  Cambodia to the Hill Tribe children through United World Schools.....

....and I have  a new project teaching on Indigenous Reserves in the Canadian North.  Since my last workshop at the  Atikameksheng Anishnawbek reserve,  two of the participants have set up silkscreen studios, based on my methods and have started businesses <3.  I have  such interesting stories to tell,  and so much more I can do. 

My Book.....

And my goal now is to redo my book how to screenprint (Silkscreen NOW) , enhanced FIRST, with my Peach Berserk, Queen St creative story, called....    

Kingi Goes Berserk...

It all started far-away.... with a trip to London in 1978. I stayed with my family, as a teenager, just off the Kings Road.  I spent my time immersed in the scene there - the music, fashion, art and of course the people .... I stumbled  into Vivienne Westwood's store and collected the fanzines (remember those handmade, cut and paste, punk rock publications?)....  and talked to the kids.....  it all blew my mind and filled me with ideas.... 

I got home, threw the fanzine posters on my wall and missed this incredible scene like crazy.....

UNTIL I discovered the happenings of Queen St W, soon after. The same grass roots art scene was actually beginning here!!!!   I dove in, stayed and created my biz and made a thousand stories for the next 30 years..... 

 

SO many people feel a close connection to my Peach Berserk store years.  Everywhere I go, I meet people who want to talk about and remember this amazing time in Toronto history.  In Kingi Goes Berserk I tell my tales in my unique,  raw, Peach Berserk drawing/graphic way... in my beloved fanzine style .... 

Highlights include.... 

How did I get from a young female art school drop out/ex farm girl.... to getting a small biz bank account in the 80s (YES it was hard!)... . (hint.... Don't wear a pillowcase!) ... and, from there,  turning it into a long standing, do-it-my-way biz. 

The days of pre-internet marketing and sales.... or taking your samples in a plastic bag to Flare Magazine on your bike... until it all got caught in the spokes somewhere around Yonge St.   Pieces are probably still there....  And I made the meeting anyway... tire tracks are part of the print, right ? 

Selling my first silkscreened dress ever printed with an Eiffel Tower... where else? by the Eiffel Tower -seriously, I thought this  was genius.  SO funny.... 

....How we actually hand-printed everything and made every piece different. We HAD to it, of COURSE, and we did....  and how we pulled it off.... (yes, you can do anything !!)

I am telling the stories behind my screenprint designs... why I made them, how they fit the times and why they meant something to those who bought them.  Yes, this print was on many wedding dresses... I think I know why...

 

 

 

My break-the-rules brilliant Air Force officer father became my biggest influence as a break-the-rules fabric/fashion designer..... I follow the same rules today... 

And how goofy drawings make great prints .... and even better silk dresses....  Create what you love, and others will too... 

 

I weathered recessions, the financial crash, single-motherhood, the H+M'ing of fashion, and how many hangovers (?)... but at least it makes for quite a story.......

 

and ..... Silkscreen NOW....

Silkscreen NOW… I teach silkscreening like no one else based on all my experience through ALL my designing and printing and the insane amount of teaching I have done.  I have taught everyone - from kindergarten classes to the older LGBTQ community.  From college fashion students to sex workers at a drop in program for elders.   My last book sold worldwide, and this one - the NEW Silkscreen NOW----is all new,  incorporating my newest experiences and all my travels and the new ways I've invented  to Do It Yourself!

If you read this book, you WILL be able to set up your own amazing screenprint studio for less money than a fancy Toronto dinner. And you will be more creative.  I guarantee it -- or l'll buy ya that dinner !!    

Funding

But I need to fund my project to make it work.... 

Then I want to self publish my book , as I did with the last one,  to keep complete control of the look and sound of my project - this is of course the DIY Peach Berserk way.  This will cost $7000 for 500 copies, including printing and special sewing (Of the handprinted covers, of course !) . 

$1000 to for editing, both the copy and design 

And finally, I want to launch my book the best I can.  I want to budget $2000 to launch the book with a bang !  This includes promotion and a party. 

 

My Plan... 

And I know my long record of hard work, designing, sewing, teaching, travelling, writing my other book and rising from the ashes of the fire shows everyone that I 100% will create a stellar product.    With my off the cuff writing and my genius editor Meryn Cadell on board, it's all now just beginning to ROCK....

With the Silkscreen NOW part of my book done.... here are 2 sample pages... 

 

 

 I am now writing the Kingi Goes Berserk part of the book.  I am spending large part of August - when I am not teaching,and printing -  writing and pulling all the stories together in the best way.  I will send the book to be printed November 1st.   It will then be out for everyone to enjoy by December 1st. 

And, if I don't reach my $10,000 goal , I will go to print by my set date , no matter what.  I have always, through all my years of business made do with whatever I have.  When I set a goal, whether it was opening my store, producing my first book, 'rising from the ashes'  or any other project along the way, I ALWAYS make it work, with what I call my Peach Berserk DIY way.  

 

 

Thank you so much for reading, and check out my perks.  And please... pass this on to your.... 

Peach Berserk, screenprinting, art, Queen St or fashion loving friends , I would appreciate that like crazy. 

  The world can only get better if we are all creative.  Happy reading ! 

xo Kingi

story: En el día de ayer 20 de agosto del 2013 un desastre natural tormento parte de la comunidad trabajadora de Villa España. El mogote que colinda con la comunidad se desplomo causando la destrucción de mas de cuatro hogares de familias trabajadoras y dejando decenas de familias sin acceso a su hogar. Muchas de estas familias lo perdieron todo y muchas de ellas todavía están en la expectativa si van a volver a su hogar o no. Este fondo es para apaciguar un poco las necesidades de las familias mas afectadas de este desastre entre ellas mi vecina Tati. Donen lo que puedan, que de dolar en dolar se llega a mil. Gracias y espero que le demostremos al mundo lo que es ser un buen Puertorriqueño.

story:
¿Qué?

El verano de los sueños es la historia del cambio en una trama de madurez, ese momento en que la seguridad de lo conocido comienza a diluirse al comprender que hay otros mundos más allá del calor del hogar...

No resulta sencillo para nadie, menos aún para un niño de once años, ver como todo aquello que ha configurado su existencia desaparece de la noche a la mañana. Sin alcanzar a entender plenamente las razones de dicho cambio una nueva vida comienza para él donde los viejos libros y los viejos héroes que durante generaciones han poblado el imaginario infantil le ayudarán a superar miedos y recelos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Jesús Castro.

Nací en Caborana, un pequeño pueblo minero del concejo de Aller, en los años en que Asturias vivía una atormentada existencia, cuando escribir con pluma era rasgo identitario de culta elegancia y en la escuela se leían, con diaria obligatoriedad, las Aventuras del Ingenioso Hidalgo Don Quijote. En mi juventud paseé libros entre Gijón y Oviedo con manifiesta ociosidad y con el discurrir de los años me vi padre de dos hijos, principio, razón y final último de esta novela. Desde hace tres décadas el sol de Andalucía calienta mis huesos, el mar de Málaga acompaña mis sueños y entre añosos viñedos discurren mis días en Manilva.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El verano de los sueños que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Jesús Castro vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Who We Are

I am Mary Ellen Lapsansky, co-founder of the Perfumed Plume Awards™ for Fragrance Journalism and scent aficionado. With deep connections in the fragrance industry – most recently as Vice President of The Fragrance Foundation - I have transitioned to become a resource for luxury brands and startup companies. My skills and expertise in developing innovative programs and event platforms led me to start my own consultancy.

I am Lyn Leigh, co-founder of the Perfumed Plume Awards™ for Fragrance Journalism and scent aficionado. As a former Vice President, Global Communications at The Estèe Lauder Companies and former Consultant for The Fragrance Foundation, I have the experience and respect as a communications specialist with a successful track record. As a PR consultant, I now develop highly visible campaigns for luxury fragrance and cosmetic clients. 

About the Perfumed Plume Awards(TM) for Fragrance Journalism.

Launched in 2015, the Perfumed Plume Awards™ is unique. It is entirely focused on recognizing and celebrating one art form writing about another art form. There is NO other all-inclusive awards program in the U.S. that specifically targets creative fragrance writing. The awards provide a showcase for writers whose published editorials or books provide a broader awareness and appreciation for fragrance through informative and entertaining “scent-centric” stories about the craft, the inspiration, the emotion and the sensory journey that are at the heart of fragrance creation.

While the awards recognize creativity, there is also a financial reward: each of the six winners is presented with a check for $1,000.00 and a symbolic, elegant writing instrument.

A milestone has already been achieved with the first Awards Ceremony held on April 8, 2016 at Rizzoli Bookstore in New York City.  The initiative has been well-received and enjoyed great success in its first year.

THE IMPACT

In this ever-changing and uncertain world, the one thing that offers an escape from the craziness around us is ‘art.’ There are many art forms that enrapture us and appeal to each of our senses.  The art and craft of fragrance appeals to our most primal sense – the sense of smell. It connects us to memories of our past and helps to make future memories.  It can relax, calm, invigorate, rejuvenate, and uplift the mind, body and soul. There is a never-ending well of creative fragrance stories waiting to be written.

Contributors will help the Perfumed Plume encourage writers to delve a little deeper, search a little further, reveal a little more about the intricate, intimate, complex art of creating fragrance.

What We Need & What You Get

All contributors will be added to the Perfumed Plume Awards™ database and listed on the website with your approval of course.  Will also share with you the very special scent stories before they are posted to the website and keep you in the loop about any newly published fragrance books or exhibits.

We need funding of $20,000 to allow us to move forward on the following:

·       Enhancement of website content, i.e., collection of the very special scent stories from the many niche fragrance brands on the market, from a historical, cultural or personal point of view.  This will provide a great resource for fragrance writers as well as a point of interest for consumers. Perfumed Plume will need to enlist an assistant to help with this project.

·       Focus on creative fragrance writing through the organization of special events (2 to 3 a year) – book readings, writing forums, panel discussions on creative fragrance writing, Q&A with fragrance book authors.

·       Establish a student merit award for fragrance journalism with a local college.  Merit award to be in the range of $5,000 to $10,000.

If we do not reach our goal, the funds collected will go toward one or two of the three initiatives listed.

Risks & Challenges

We faced many challenges in establishing this initiative but kept on going.  With the input and support of the Perfumed Plume Awards™ Consulting Committee and the commitment from several companies who believed in what we were doing, we made the Perfumed Plume a reality in a short amount of time. We are so grateful to the companies who have offered their support, but as you can imagine it is not enough to go forward with establishing and building this wonderful initiative celebrating creative fragrance writing. And as you know, support is never a given from one year to the next.

The Perfumed Plume can continue as it started out, but without additional contributions and support it can never grow into the all-encompassing independent recognition of creative storytelling that we set out to establish.

The positions we have held within the fragrance industry have afforded us the opportunity to develop and implement many successful initiatives and events over the years, large and small that have benefitted the industry and mostly the consumer and have garnered support from both.  Many of these initiatives and events are still in place.

We are confident that we can establish the Perfumed Plume Awards™ as an iconic symbol of excellence for fragrance journalists. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to any beauty writers you know.  Connect with the Perfumed Plume Awards on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest.  Ask any of your friends who are fragrance enthusiasts to do the same.

And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Who We Are
I am Mary Ellen Lapsansky, co-founder of the Perfumed Plume Awards™ for Fragrance Journalism and scent aficionado. With deep connections in the fragrance industry – most recently as Vice President of The Fragrance Foundation - I have transitioned to become a resource for luxury brands and startup companies. My skills and expertise in developing innovative programs and event platforms led me to start my own consultancy.
I am Lyn Leigh, co-founder of the Perfumed Plume Awards™ for Fragrance Journalism and scent aficionado. As a former Vice President, Global Communications at The Estèe Lauder Companies and former Consultant for The Fragrance Foundation, I have the experience and respect as a communications specialist with a successful track record. As a PR consultant, I now develop highly visible campaigns for luxury fragrance and cosmetic clients. 
About the Perfumed Plume Awards(TM) for Fragrance Journalism.
Launched in 2015, the Perfumed Plume Awards™ is unique. It is entirely focused on recognizing and celebrating one art form writing about another art form. There is NO other all-inclusive awards program in the U.S. that specifically targets creative fragrance writing. The awards provide a showcase for writers whose published editorials or books provide a broader awareness and appreciation for fragrance through informative and entertaining “scent-centric” stories about the craft, the inspiration, the emotion and the sensory journey that are at the heart of fragrance creation.
While the awards recognize creativity, there is also a financial reward: each of the six winners is presented with a check for $1,000.00 and a symbolic, elegant writing instrument.
A milestone has already been achieved with the first Awards Ceremony held on April 8, 2016 at Rizzoli Bookstore in New York City.  The initiative has been well-received and enjoyed great success in its first year.
THE IMPACT
In this ever-changing and uncertain world, the one thing that offers an escape from the craziness around us is ‘art.’ There are many art forms that enrapture us and appeal to each of our senses.  The art and craft of fragrance appeals to our most primal sense – the sense of smell. It connects us to memories of our past and helps to make future memories.  It can relax, calm, invigorate, rejuvenate, and uplift the mind, body and soul. There is a never-ending well of creative fragrance stories waiting to be written.
Contributors will help the Perfumed Plume encourage writers to delve a little deeper, search a little further, reveal a little more about the intricate, intimate, complex art of creating fragrance.
What We Need & What You Get
All contributors will be added to the Perfumed Plume Awards™ database and listed on the website with your approval of course.  Will also share with you the very special scent stories before they are posted to the website and keep you in the loop about any newly published fragrance books or exhibits.
We need funding of $20,000 to allow us to move forward on the following:
·       Enhancement of website content, i.e., collection of the very special scent stories from the many niche fragrance brands on the market, from a historical, cultural or personal point of view.  This will provide a great resource for fragrance writers as well as a point of interest for consumers. Perfumed Plume will need to enlist an assistant to help with this project.
·       Focus on creative fragrance writing through the organization of special events (2 to 3 a year) – book readings, writing forums, panel discussions on creative fragrance writing, Q&A with fragrance book authors.
·       Establish a student merit award for fragrance journalism with a local college.  Merit award to be in the range of $5,000 to $10,000.
If we do not reach our goal, the funds collected will go toward one or two of the three initiatives listed.
Risks & Challenges

We faced many challenges in establishing this initiative but kept on going.  With the input and support of the Perfumed Plume Awards™ Consulting Committee and the commitment from several companies who believed in what we were doing, we made the Perfumed Plume a reality in a short amount of time. We are so grateful to the companies who have offered their support, but as you can imagine it is not enough to go forward with establishing and building this wonderful initiative celebrating creative fragrance writing. And as you know, support is never a given from one year to the next.
The Perfumed Plume can continue as it started out, but without additional contributions and support it can never grow into the all-encompassing independent recognition of creative storytelling that we set out to establish.
The positions we have held within the fragrance industry have afforded us the opportunity to develop and implement many successful initiatives and events over the years, large and small that have benefitted the industry and mostly the consumer and have garnered support from both.  Many of these initiatives and events are still in place.
We are confident that we can establish the Perfumed Plume Awards™ as an iconic symbol of excellence for fragrance journalists. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out to any beauty writers you know.  Connect with the Perfumed Plume Awards on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest.  Ask any of your friends who are fragrance enthusiasts to do the same.
And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
"I sought clarity." So begins The Edge: Life Lessons from a Martial Arts Master, a new book I have co-authored with martial arts teacher Ray Fisher. At its heart, The Edge is comprised of three narratives. The first is Fisher's own story: his inner and outer journey, and a record of the insights he has gleaned along the way. But The Edge is also the story of my slow and sometimes painful transition from being "a man forever seated, bathed in the flickering glow of a monitor" into a more fully integrated human being: someone in whom the physical (which had always been given short shrift) can now take its place alongside, and perhaps even reign in, the cerebral. Finally, The Edge, in its dialogue-driven structure, tells the story of a friendship. This is the classic relationship of teacher to student / master to apprentice. The Edge is not just a book for martial artists. Rather, it is a book for anyone who has felt the stirring of a desire for self-transformation.

Mr. Fisher and I bring a wealth of experience to this project. Fisher, a member of both the United States and World Martial Arts Halls of Fame and holder of Black Belts in four different disciplines, owns and runs the ACS (Arizona Ch'uan Fa Society) School of Karate in Chandler, Arizona. In addition to his emphasis on external forms, Ray also teaches regularly in the internal arts of qi gong and t'ai qi quan. I am the author of No Certainty Attached: Steve Kilbey and The Church (Verse Chorus Press, 2009) and have written for National Review, Blurt Magazine, The American Conservative, Bootleg, and Chronicles. I first came into contact with Ray Fisher while training in Kenpo karate at ACS.

With this campaign, we are seeking the necessary funds to cover editorial, artwork, and publishing costs. The book is already written and ready to go. We intend to publish in partnership with CreateSpace and make The Edge available worldwide in both print and electronic formats.

Excerpts from The Edge can be read here and here.

Publication Budget

Our overall budget is $2700. This is to be allocated as follows:
  1. $1737 for CreateSpace publication package: copyediting, cover formatting, interior design, LCCN assignment, ISBN assignment, online distribution.
  2. $385 for our first 100 copies to sell locally (additional copies will be available online in print-on-demand and electronic formats).
  3. $500: cover-art budget.
  4. Remaining funds (approx $80) will cover miscellaneous local expenses (flyers, etc).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of ways you can assist even if you are not able to contribute financially. If you believe in this project and would like to see it come to fruition, please consider using the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.

Special thanks to Alma Alvarado for providing the photos for this campaign!

story:
Summary

 

Angels Never Die is the courageous true story of a mother who lost of all four sons to two rare diseases, and the struggle to maintain her faith during it all.

Two of the four boys suffered from Fanconi Anemia, one from Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome, and one of the boys suffered from both diseases. 

Gwendolyn gave birth to four boys and two girls. She explains what it was like to have all four boys’ ill at once; while at the same time her husband was hospitalized due to an explosion at the plant where he worked. Henry suffered third degree burns over thirty percent of his body. Through all the difficulties, Gwen fought to understand and maintain her faith; often asking the question, "Why me, Lord?"

When she lost her first son at age 11, she did her best to understand why he was taken so young. Then, as each of the other boys began to succumb to their disease (Fanconi Anemia, one from Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome), her faith was tested even further. At one point it looked as if one of her sons would make it. Unfortunetly, Randall died at age 19, during his first year in college. Despite all the hardships, Gwendolyn realized God has a purpose for everything. She came to understand that the blessing he gave her was the four boys and her two girls, even though all four boys lifes were cut short. 

Though they are gone, their memories will live on. This book will be their legacy. A portion of all proceeds, once the book is published, will go to the Fanconi Anemia Research Fund, Inc., located in Eugene, Oregon, and her church.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise funds ($1,500) to print the revised edition for Angels Never Die; originally published through an online publishing house, the printing cost per book was too expensive ($12 per book). The revision is necessary in order to offer the book to major retailers, nationwide. Gwen has already had an offer from a major store. They offered to possibly carry the book once it has been revised to meet their criteria; editing, cover, price. The revised edition will have professional editing and a new cover design (the sames as the one you see above - sky with and angel in the foreground and framed in stained glass).  

For your donation, you will recieve either an online, paperback or hardback copy of the published book (based on the donation amount).

Radio Host, James Kelly (Aspects of Writing) has offered to do everything within his power to make sure this book gets published, regardless of whether the entire goal is met or not. All donations will be used for publishing. Should we exceed our goal, Gwen's intention is to hire Travis Shortt with Aspyr Communications to handle all PR, and New York editor, Dana Micheli. Dana is a professional editor who has offered to re-edit Angels Never Die and give it a commercial-ready appeal.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute, please tell your family and friends about this book project, Angels Never Die. You can even use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Our Story


Mainline, the City College non-fiction magazine, is produced by students of the Journalism 403 and Graphic Communications 319 classes once a semester.

Founded in 1995, by former city college students Doug Herndon and Paul Estabrook, Mainline complements the campus newspaper, the Express, and provides students space for creative freedom.

The magazine's current adviser, Rachel Leibrock, is also a former Sacramento City College journalism student. Leibrock has worked for the Sacramento Bee and Allstar Music Magazine, a New York-based music publication. She currently works as a features writer for the Sacramento News & Review in addition to advising Mainline and co-advising the Express.

This semester Mainline writers, designers and photographers will craft literary profiles, features and photo essays into a quality color magazine that reflects Sacramento City College life and the Sacramento community at large.

The goal of Mainline is to inform, entertain and enlighten our readership with an in-depth exploration of all aspects of the Sacramento City College experience.

The views expressed in Mainline do not necessarily reflect those of the City College Journalism Department, Sacramento City College or the Los Rios Community College District.

Learn more about Mainline here.


The Impact

We’re inviting you to become a part of the Sacramento City College community. We’re asking for your support to help us bring Mainline to students and the larger Sacramento community! Please help support student journalism! Many of our published authors, designers and photographers have gone onto larger projects, including book publication, graduate school, editing, or full time writing jobs.


What We Need & What You Get

Though we do receive some financial support from the college to fund these programs, we must raise the balance of funds necessary to print the journal and support the writers’ series. We are looking to raise at least $1200 dollars each semester. Your donation to our programs will be gratefully acknowledged in the next edition of Mainline. All donors will receive a "thank you" in the next issue of Mainline as well as a complimentary copy of the issue.  All contributions are tax deductible.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute at this time, we appreciate your moral support, and invite you to keep in touch with us. Please spread the word and share this link.

If we can offer any further information, please contact creative writing professor Rachel Leibrock at (916) 233-7352.

story:
Soy una joven diseñadora sin recursos económicos propios, sin una familia que provenga del mundo de la moda, creadora de mi propia marca sin presupuesto. Pretendo realizar todas las tallas de ropa sin hacer distinciones de tallas grandes o pequeñas.

 Que no haya etiquetas más allá de las necesarias para el uso de la prenda. Quiero personalizar cada modelo, entregar con cada venta un pequeño poema, sorpresas, que el cliente se sienta único y especial. Deseo realizar vestidos de noche, de novia, de calle, pero poniendo un precio de venta y otro de alquiler para que se adapte a todos los bolsillos.
Que se sea tan feliz adquiriendo mis prendas hechas a manos como yo creándolas.

  Solicito financiación para desarrollar mi proyecto y poder llevarlo a cabo de forma limpia y perfecta. Hasta este momento he realizado todo el proceso sola, algo así como seis profesiones a la vez, tarea de la que estoy orgullosa pero que obviamente, no tiene un acabado necesario para ponerlo en el mercado.
Por lo tanto con el dinero recaudado, invertiría en tejidos, un diseñador/a  web/gráfico para crear una página con tienda online y acceder a un mayor público, podría contratar talleres de confección para un acabado perfecto, realizar los prototipos de novia por ejemplo y luego vender según encargo para que la inversión no tenga que ser tan grande y nos beneficiásemos todas las personas.

www.facebook.com/puraramos

http://purificacionramosmoda.tumblr.com/

www.pinterest.com/pramosvzquez/

http://puraramos.wix.com/purificacionramos

story:
Hey Heffas! 

Heffa, one of the many words of endearment that I use to address just about anyone. I appreciate you stopping by. My long lived goal of writing a novel has come to fruition and it joys my heart every time I think about it. My debut Novel "When Wrong Feels Wright" is a fiction love story that encompasses so many emotions evolving around love/lust/trust/envy/betrayal/deceit. I wanted to capture my readers and take them on a joy ride with their imagination when reading my salacious love scandal. My affinity for writing takes me back to my adolescent years when I started writing short stories and music. My passion grew stronger once I came to terms with "ANYTHING IS POSSIBLE" . Those words spoke volumes and have danced around me during my literary journey. Now that my novel is completed, I want to proceed with  the process of getting it to the masses.  I NEED HELP! Lots of help and I'm letting my guard down in order to receive help from those who understand this titillating/stressful process. My goal is to have my book reach the masses and soon, write a screen play for it and have it produced by a major film company or an independent one. 


DILIGENCE!! THIS IS WHAT YOU CALL DILIGENCE.


Please follow my journey on Twitter/Instagram @CheyNaRey

or visit my Blog CheyNaRey.com


This picture is a piece of my vision board...


I've had the grand opportunity be be published in an anthology called "Drink F**k Sleep" back in 2012 and the experience was amazing. Since then, I knew I wanted to fulfill my inner itch of becoming an author. So, once the universe shifted, an opportunity (time) presented itself and I took full advantage.


For those of you who believe in my literary journey and my passion to inspire others with my work, please consider making a donation towards making my dreams a reality. Any amount is GREATLY APPRECIATED! I'm extremely grateful. The list below is the distribution of funds.  Thank You...

I'm extremely grateful for any dollar amount that I raise during my campaign. If I walk away with less than 100 dollars, just know that I am extremely blessed and happy for those of you who decided to help out. Thank you...

Your literary gift will be used for the following:

For this project I will need an estimated 6,400:

1,000 for editing.

700 for cover graphics, all art work on the inside

200 for typesetting

3,000 to print hard copies

1,500 for marketing

I'm so blessed to have this opportunity and truly elated. Those of you who know me personally, know the sincerity of my heart. To all the aspiring artists, I commend you and keep following your dreams. Anything is possible, stay humble and remain optimistic. 

If you have any questions please leave a comment with your email and I will make sure to answer them as promptly as I can. 

If you are apart of a book club or know of any book clubs, please connect with me by leaving your email in the comments.

I am extremely grateful for your time. Thank you. 

Please do not hesitate to share my story with others, providing the link to this page. 


THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU so much, CheyNaRey!


Smooches Heffa!!!

story:
Short Summary

Would you like 17 short stories from award-winning writers of novels, games, comics, TV shows, and movies? And would you like to help me pay for spinal surgery? Read on!

My name is Chris Pramas and I've been working as a game designer, writer, and publisher for the past 20 years. I am the founder and president of Green Ronin Publishing, and you may have enjoyed games of ours like Mutants & Masterminds, Dragon Age, A Song of Ice and Fire, and DC Adventures. I need an operation and my insurance is not going to cover all the expenses. 

I have a pinched nerve in my neck and I’m going to get a spinal fusion operation in September to fix it. My insurance will not cover the whole thing so I have turned to author friends to put together a dark fantasy fiction anthology called Cadaver Bone. Each author is donating a brand new story and the proceeds will go to paying my medical bills. I’m going to have cadaver bone in my neck; you should get Cadaver Bone for your favorite e-reader!

Confirmed authors for the Cadaver Bone anthology are: Cecil Castellucci, Christopher Robert Cargill, Richard Dansky, Ed Greenwood, Matt Forbeck, David Gaider, Steve Kenson, John Kovalic, Robin D. Laws, Jess Lebow, Colin McComb, Chris Pramas, John Rogers, Lucien Soulban, Melinda Thielbar, John Scott Tynes, and James Wallis. See below for bios of all the authors. They are a talented bunch and I am so grateful for their help. 

Update: Stretch Goals!

We have reached my initial funding goal and for that I am so grateful. With drugs, physical therapy, new x-rays, and follow-up visits, however, I can easily put to use any extra funds we generate. Plus, the book itself is going to be awesome and I'd love as many people as possible to check it out. 

But wait, it's about to get even more awesome! When this campaign was announced, more author friends came forward to volunteer their talents and you know what that means? Stretch goals! You can read more about the new volunteers in the Meet the Authors section below. 

$14,500: At this level I'll add a story by Aaron Dembski-Bowden to Cadaver Bone! 

$16,000: At this level I'll add a story by Erik Scott de Bie to Cadaver Bone! 

$17,500: At this level I'll add a story by Greg Stolze to Cadaver Bone! 

$20,000: At this level I'll give a little back to my talented friends by paying the authors $75 each for their stories. I really appreciate their help in my hour of need so it'd be great to at least give them an honorarium. 

At I write this there are 5 days left in the campaign. Let's get out there and smash some stretch goals!

What I Need & What You Get

Since April I have tried a variety of treatments, including physical therapy, drugs, and even a spinal injection. While I have had relief from the worst pain, none of these things provided a remedy for what ails me. I have a pinched nerve between my 5th and 6th vertebrae and I need surgery to correct it.

The doctor will put in a titanium clamp in my neck to keep the vertebrae from compressing my nerves. The procedure involves the use of cadaver bone to help fuse everything together. That means I get titanium and the bones of a dead guy in my neck! Fingers crossed for superpowers. 

The procedure costs $60,000 at base. Thankfully, even my crappy insurance is OK for something like this, so my out of pocket expenses will be roughly $10,000. That, naturally enough, is my goal. That will cover the surgery itself and some of the drugs and physical therapy required afterwards. 

What do you get? An awesome anthology of dark fantasy fiction from an all-star lineup of writers. I must say, I have awesome friends. When I first had the idea to put this benefit together, I wasn't sure if it would fly. Enormous thanks to my friends who responded so quickly and in such numbers. 

There are to things to note about Cadaver Bone. First, this campaign is just for electronic versions of the book (PDF, epub, and mobi; you get the them all). Since I am running this campaign myself and I have recovery ahead of me, I didn't want to get into printing and shipping physical books. However, I will likely offer a Print on Demand version after the project is finished, and if so, backers will get a discount on that. 

Second, I've kept this campaign simple. There are not a whole ton of perks full of novelty items and the like. Again, this is to make Cadaver Bone easy to fulfill. 

The Impact

These last four months have impacted my work and life dramatically. There was a point at which I could not sit at a computer for longer than 15 minutes at a time. The spinal clinic and a neurosurgeon both recommended I get this surgery to fix the problem. 

If you'd like to read the nitty gritty of my situation, I wrote about it on my blog back in July. You'll note that at the time I hoped the the steroid shot in my neck would fix the problem. Obviously, it did not. 

We've got a lot of plans at Green Ronin Publishing and I want to get in good health to see them through. If you back this project, you'll be making that happen. 

Meet the Authors

Cecil Castellucci is the author of books and graphic novels for young adults including Boy Proof, The Plain Janes, First Day on Earth, The Year of the Beasts and Odd Duck. Her picture book, Grandma’s Gloves, won the California Book Award Gold Medal. Her short stories have been published in Strange Horizons, YARN, Tor.com, and various anthologies including, Teeth, After and Interfictions 2. She is the YA editor of the Los Angeles Review of Books, Children’s Correspondence Coordinator for The Rumpus and a two time Macdowell Fellow. She lives in Los Angeles.

Christopher Robert Cargill is a screenwriter, novelist, and film critic. Known to many as Massawyrm, he wrote movie reviews for Ain’t It Cool News for many years. He went on to co-write the 2012 film Sinister with Scott Derrickson. His debut novel, Dreams and Shadows, was released this year. 

Writer, game designer and cad, Richard Dansky was named one of the Top 20 videogame writers in 2009 by Gamasutra. His work includes bestselling games such as TOM CLANCY’S SPLINTER CELL: CONVICTION, FAR CRY, OUTLAND, and most recently, SPLINTER CELL: BLACKLIST. Richard's writing has appeared in magazines ranging from The Escapist to Lovecraft Studies, and his most recent novel, VAPORWARE, is available from JournalStone. He was also a major contributor to White Wolf’s World of Darkness RPG setting, with credits on over a hundred RPG supplements. Richard lives in North Carolina with his wife, statistician and blogger Dr. Melinda Thielbar, and their amorphously large collections of books and single malt whiskeys.

Stretch Goal: Erik Scott de Bie is a speculative fiction writer and game designer, probably best known for his work in the Forgotten Realms setting, including his signature Shadowbane series. He is the author of the forthcoming Shadow of the Winter King, first in the epic World of Ruin fantasy series from Dragon Moon Press (Spring 2014). Erik lives in Seattle where he is married with pets. Find him at www.erikscottdebie.com, www.facebook.com/erik.s.debie, and www.twitter.com/erikscottdebie.

Stretch Goal: Aaron Dembski-Bowden's middle initial is W, and he prefers not to tell anyone what it stands for. He's a two-time New York Times bestselling novelist (a fact his in-laws like to bring up randomly at parties when they introduce him), and responsible for several novels in the Warhammer 40,000 universe, such as Soul Hunter, The First Heretic, and Armageddon. In the wild and carefree days of the early 2000s, when Earth still knew the haunting screech of dial-up modem sounds, he worked on a mountain of books for White Wolf's World of Darkness game lines. Since then, he's briefly dipped into video game work, but the hours were a bit too much like a real job.

He lives, reads, (and occasionally breaks the speed limit) in N. Ireland.

Matt Forbeck has been a full-time creator of award-winning games and fiction since 1989, designing games and toys and writing stories of all sorts. He has twenty-seven novels published to date, including the award-nominated Guild Wars: Ghosts of Ascalon and the critically acclaimed Amortals and Vegas Knights. His latest work includes the Magic: The Gathering comic book, the MMOs Marvel Heroes and Ghost Recon Online, and his novel The Con Job, based on the TV show Leverage, as well as the Dangerous Games trilogy of thrillers set at Gen Con. For more about him and his work, visit www.Forbeck.com. 

David Gaider has worked as a writer and narrative designer for Edmonton-based developer BioWare since 1999, having worked on such titles as Baldur’s Gate 2, Neverwinter Nights, and Knights of the Old Republic before becoming a lead writer on the Dragon Age series: Dragon Age: Origins, Dragon Age 2 and the upcoming Dragon Age: Inquisition.

Ed Greenwood is an amiable, bearded Canadian writer, game designer, and librarian best known as the creator of The Forgotten Realms® fantasy world. He sold his first fiction at age six, and has since published more than 200 books that have sold millions of copies worldwide in over two dozen languages. Ed writes fantasy, sf, horror, steampunk, pulp adventure, and comic books, and has won dozens of writing and gaming awards, including multiple Origins Awards and ENNIES. He was elected to the Academy of Adventure Gaming Art & Design Hall of Fame in 2003. He has judged the World Fantasy Awards and the Sunburst Awards, hosted radio shows, acted onstage, explored caves, jousted, and been Santa Claus (but not all on the same day). Ed’s most recent novel is The Wizard’s Mask from Paizo, and his upcoming books include The Herald from Wizards of the Coast (the last book of The Sundering Saga), and The Iron Assassin, a steampunk novel from Tor Books.

Steve Kenson has been writing professionally since 1995. He got his start working on the Shadowrun and Earthdawn roleplaying games and designed Mutants & Masterminds, True20 Adventure Roleplaying, and ICONS Superpowered Roleplaying, amongst others. Steve has written ten novels, including Crossroads, Born to Run, Pirate's Gold, and Ghost of Winter. He maintains a website and blog at www.stevekenson.com.

John Kovalic’s cartoons have appeared everywhere from the NEW YORK TIMES to DRAGON MAGAZINE. His creations include the critically acclaimed comic book sensations such as DORK TOWER and "DR. BLINK: SUPERHERO SHRINK," as well as SNAPDRAGONS, NEWBIES, WILD LIFE, BEACHED, and panel cartoons including MURPHY'S RULES, THE UNSPEAKABLE OAF and more.

A co-founder and co-owner of Out of the Box Games, and a cartoonist for Steve Jackson Games, John has illustrated over 100 games and game supplements, and is at least in part responsible for best-sellers like APPLES TO APPLES, MUNCHKIN and CHEZ GEEK. He was inducted into the Games Manufacturers Hall of Fame in 2004, the first cartoonist to be so honored. He’s drawn more than 4,000 cards for MUNCHKIN, and wouldn’t mind a spot of whiskey because of it.

John’s latest party game, ROFL!, was released in 2013. In his spare time, he searches for spare time.

Robin D. Laws’ most recent works of fiction are the fantasy novel Blood of the City and New Tales of the Yellow Sign, a collection of weird tales. Other novels include Pierced Heart and The Worldwound Gambit. As Creative Director for Stone Skin Press, he has edited such anthologies as Shotguns v. Cthulhu and The Lion and the Aardvark. He is best known for his groundbreaking roleplaying game design work, as seen in Hillfolk, The Esoterrorists, Feng Shui, and HeroQuest. He comprises one-half of the Golden Geek Award-winning podcast Ken and Robin Talk About Stuff, and can be found online at www.robindlaws.com.

Jess Lebow is a best-selling novelist and an award-winning game designer. He has also written short stories, magazine articles, restaurant reviews, a television pilot, and the list goes on. He has even published poetry, although he tries not to these days. Jess spent many years editing the Magic: The Gathering and Dungeons & Dragons novel lines for Wizards of the Coast. He was a World Designer and story writer for Guild Wars and Guild Wars Factions, the Content Director for the Pirates of the Burning Sea MMO, and then spent several years in Shanghai working for Ubisoft. Jess has published five novels: Master of Chains, Wind of War, The Darksteel Eye, and Obsidian Ridge under his own name, and Return of the Damned as T.H. Lain. 

Colin McComb decided to write something new for this bio, preferring to gloss over his 20+ years in the game industry, his award-winning contributions to TSR's Birthright and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons lines (not to mention his years developing the Planescape campaign setting), his work with Black Isle Studios and Planescape: Torment, extensive freelance work for various tabletop publishers, his Oathbreaker series, other assorted miscellanea (such as being the Creative Lead for Torment: Tides of Numenera), and ownership of his company 3lb Games. Instead, he would like to assure everyone that he is a decent father, generally pretty happy, and only occasionally does he descend into the mire of gloom and despair. He would also like to apologize for pretending not to mention the items on his resume and then totally mentioning them. It was a transparent, regrettable ruse.

Chris Pramas is an award-winning game designer, writer, and publisher. He is best known as the designer of the Dragon Age RPG and Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, 2nd Edition, and as the founder and President of Green Ronin Publishing. He has been a creative director at Wizards of the Coast and Flying Lab Software and a lead writer at Vigil Games. Green Ronin continues to thrive under his leadership, publishing games like Mutants & Masterminds, DC Adventures, and A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying. His short stories have appeared in such anthologies as Into the Maelstrom, Let the Galaxy Burn, Realm of Chaos, and Secrets of Magic. 

John Rogers has written for film, television, comics and games. He created the TV shows JACKIE CHAN ADVENTURES and LEVERAGE, the comic book BLUE BEETLE for DC Comics, and recently contributed to Evil Hat Games FATE CORE RPG.

Stretch Goal: Greg Stolze will turn 43 in 2013, hasn't worn a watch in over a decade, is happily married, known for designing the One Roll Engine, writes novels, has a bunch of free stories available at www.gregstolze.com/fiction_library, and used to get mistaken for Chris sometimes, before Greg's hair all turned white and Chris got his _first_ distinctive neck scar.

Melinda Thielbar is a fiction writer, software developer, and martial arts enthusiast. Her stories have appeared in Weird Tales, Escape Pod, and Bull*Spec magazines. By day, she saves the world with math--it's surprisingly effective.

John Scott Tynes is a writer and game designer in Seattle. He's the founder of Pagan Publishing and the creator of The Unspeakable Oath magazine and the Puppetland roleplaying game, as well as the co-creator of Delta Green, Unknown Armies, The Hills Rise Wild, Call of Cthulhu D20, and many other works. His recent book Delta Green: Strange Authorities collects his short stories and novel set in the Lovecraft-meets-Le Carré world of Delta Green.

Lucien Soulban is a veteran of the roleplaying game industry and a BAFTA-nominated videogame scriptwriter for Far Cry 3. He wrote Far Cry 3 Blood Dragon, Rainbow Six: Vegas, and Warhammer 40K: Dawn of War, and contributed to Deus Ex: Human Revolution. This is in addition to the DS ports of games like Kung-Fu Panda, Enchanted, Kim Possible, and The Golden Compass. He's contributed to numerous fiction anthologies including HWA's comedy-horror anthologies: Blood Lite I, II & III. He's written five novels including Warhammer 40K: Desert Raiders and Dragonlance: Renegade Wizards, and has contributed to over 90 roleplaying books as writer and editor. He is currently senior writer on an unnamed project at Ubisoft Montreal.

James Wallis is an award-winning games designer and author. In the 90s he ran Hogshead, the largest publisher of role-playing games in the UK, but he's also been a TV presenter, Sunday Times columnist, university lecturer, and managing editor of Bizarre magazine. He's written books for Penguin and Puffin Books, Virgin Publishing and the Black Library, and his game designs include the storytelling games Once Upon a Time and The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen. He runs the games consultancy Spaaace and lives in London with his wife and 1d4 –1 children.

Other Ways You Can Help

First, you can spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, message boards, etc. That's always important in a crowd funding campaign. 

If you'd like to help more indirectly, you can always buy something from Green Ronin Publishing. That money doesn't go to me, but anything that makes GR healthier is appreciated too. 

I will need one or more editors down the road. If you have experience and would like to help out with that, drop me a line here on IndieGoGo.

senior writer on an unnamed project at Ubisoft Montreal.

James Wallis is
an award-winning games designer and author. In the 90s he ran Hogshead, the
largest publisher of role-playing games in the UK, but he's also been a TV
presenter, Sunday Times columnist, university lecturer, and managing editor of Bizarre magazine. He's written books for
Penguin and Puffin Books, Virgin Publishing and the Black Library, and his game
designs include the storytelling games Once
Upon a Time and The Extraordinary
Adventures of Baron Munchausen. He runs the games consultancy Spaaace and lives in London with his
wife and 1d4 –1 children.



Other Ways You Can Help
First, you can spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, message boards, etc. That's always important in a crowd funding campaign. 
If you'd like to help more indirectly, you can always buy something from Green Ronin Publishing. That money doesn't go to me, but anything that makes GR healthier is appreciated too. 
I will need one or more editors down the road. If you have experience and would like to help out with that, drop me a line here on IndieGoGo.

story:
"Whether you are an awestruck visitor on your first ride up the Peak Chair or a seasoned local diving into your favourite swimming hole, Polek offers one of the most in depth and beautiful photography books of the Sea to Sky corridor." John Baldwin - BC Coast Mountain explorer/pioneer.

 

My name is Polek Rybczynski, and welcome to the pre-sale of my second hardcover book, the Sea to Sky - a Photo Journal of the Howe Sound. I am the photographer and publisher behind this ambitious project. One photograph a day for a whole year of this stunning landscape. Whistler, Pemberton, Squamish, West Vancouver, Sunshine Coast. 216 pages, colour and black and white. Printed by Canada's leading print house, Friesens.

My previous photo journal, Valley of Light - a photo journal of Pemberton, BC, was a mental exercise turn pillar in my creative outlet realm. With that foundation down, it felt a natural step to expand the boundaries. Perhaps one of my frustrations in doing the Valley of Light photo journal was not being able to include and share the amazment just down the road. Patience, intuition and discipline proved their worth as little did I know back then that a few years later I would conclude yet another year long photo journal of that amazement just down the road, the Sea to Sky Corridor. And in true cosmic mystery, as during the Valley of Light year my wife and I being blessed by the birth of our first child, during the Sea to Sky year we were again blessed by the birth of our second child. Perhaps a sign of life on its intuitive path.

As mentioned previously, this is a pre-sale. All funds raised in this campaign will go directly towards the first print run. I feel that a pre-sale event like this is a beautiful and personal way of getting a book out. As the Sea to Sky is both beautiful and personal, it makes for a fitting way of being released.

You have the unique opportunity of being a part of somethings special; the making of a book like no other of the Sea to Sky Corridor.

You can pre-purchase as many copies of the book as you like. Perks also include prints of the photographs featured in the Sea to Sky Photo Journal. 

Feel welcome in sharing this campaign. As important as pre-purchasing your copy is helping to spread the word. 

Thank you for your time reading and pre-sale support!

story:
Now Shipping! We are over 80% funded and the books are going out to supporters already. Thank you! 

 

"The story of the world is changing ... and we are the ones changing it."

- Rivera Sun

Inspiring. Visionary. Exciting.
Support the Community Publishing Campaign.

These books are changing lives and changing the world! If we want to build a culture of peace, we have to tell a new story. The old myths, epics, and legends rehash outdated war and violence narratives.  The exciting and groundbreaking Ari Ara Series changes all that! In Ari Ara's world, heroes and sheroes stop wars and wage peace. They use active nonviolence to make powerful change.

By supporting these books, you're changing the story of the world!  Ari Ara's adventures are part of the New Story - a global movement to transform outdated, destructive narratives to life-affirming and socially-just stories.  By reading and sharing these stories, you're planting the seeds for a new culture. You're nurturing a new kind of shero. You're honoring peace and nonviolence heroes in fiction and real life. You're supporting mythic legends and epic adventures that are rooted in waging peace.  Thank you for being part of the magic . . . and the movement!

 

"There's magic in these books . . . and there's magic in the way
we - YOU and me - bring them into the world." - Rivera Sun

 

Give boldly. Give generously. Get books for YOU, your friends,
and the young people in your life!

THANK YOU for supporting the Community Publishing Campaign.

(Note: CLICK on the perks to read about all the wonderful thank-you gifts in each perk.)

 

Get ready for an adventure! Two books are better than one!

For the first time ever, I'm releasing two books at once: Desert Song and The Adventures of Alaren. Support them both through our Community Publishing Campaign. Together, we're changing the story of the world by telling and sharing a different kind of story, one rooted in waging peace instead of war.  Give boldly and generously. These books exist because of the loving support of visionaries like you!

 

About Desert Song

A girl in exile, a trickster horse, and the women rising up!

Exiled to the desert, young Ari Ara is caught between the warriors trying to grab power . . . and the women rising up to stop them! Ari Ara has to find her place - and her voice - in this strange culture . . . but time is running out. One by one, the women's voices are being silenced, cut from the Desert Song. Can Ari Ara and her friends restore the balance before violence breaks out? Readers of all ages will love this adventurous tale of strong women and mighty girls!

"An amazing story about how young people must navigate
the space between fitting in and standing out from the crowd."

 

About The Adventures of Alaren

"The folktales of Ari Ara's world prove that waging peace is more exciting than waging war!"

These stories will make your heart sing! In a series of clever and creative escapades, the legendary folkhero Alaren rallies thousands of people to take bold and courageous action for peace. Weaving new epic tales from real-life inspirations, author Rivera Sun brings a new kind of hero to life. Get ready to be inspired . . . and to share the joy with others! The Adventures of Alaren offers perfect stories to teach peace at home, conflict resolution in the classroom, and nonviolence in faith and peace centers.  Each fictional folktale includes a footnote on the real-life inspiration and discussion questions for classrooms and small groups. For readers of all ages, The Adventures of Alaren warms hearts, opens minds, and gives us ideas for waging peace!

"Kids, parents, and teachers will love the adventures and escapades of this creative and clever peacebuilder! Add The Adventures of Alaren to your library today!" 

 

About the Community Publishing Campaign

Be part of the Community Publishing Campaign to launch these books!  Your contributions support my year-round writing work and cover the publishing costs for these fantastic books. Thank you in advance for seeing - and supporting - the BIG vision. Click on the perks to find out about the unique thank-you gifts I'm offering to everyone who supports the campaign.

 

Don't miss these special gifts!

Desert Song stickers, bookmarks

Discount Code for Rivera Sun's other books and novels!

Rivera Sun's 2019 Poetry Chapbook - unique to this campaign!

Desert Song Short Story from original manuscript

2020 Calendar with original artwork by Rivera Sun

"New Story" song and album by singer/songwriter Jenny Bird

 

 

It's exciting. It's heartening. It's utterly magical.  The Ari Ara Series is inspiring hearts and minds everywhere! I've received lots of emails and notes from parents, teachers, grandparents, and young people telling me how much they love these books. The stories bring tears to the eyes and warmth to the heart. Kids play the Way Between in the backyard. Parents talk about it with their children to teach them how to deal with conflict.  Teachers are reading it in schools with students.  This past Halloween, two girls even dressed up as Ari Ara and the Urchin Queen from the second book of the series! 

With magic like this, we can change the world!

I've always believed that if we want humanity to shift to a culture of peace and active nonviolence, we have to tell a better story. Currently, our myths, epics, and legends reinforce war and violence as the setting for heroics.  The Ari Ara Series challenges and transforms these narratives.  In Ari Ara's world, stopping wars (not winning them) is how sheroes are born! The Ari Ara novels are a light in the dark as we shift from the Old Story to the New Story.  As a writer and a peace activist, it's an honor and a joy to contribute in this powerful way.

The story of the world is changing ... and we are the ones changing it.

Your support of these books helps grow a new kind of shero and hero, one who uses active nonviolence to wage peace and work for justice.  Your contributions to the Community Publishing Campaign keep me writing and get the books out into the world. I can't do it without you!

Get books for YOU, for friends, and for young people!

The best way for kids to get these books is for YOU to give them to them.  The next best way is for you to put them in schools and public libraries.  Support generously and boldly . . . it all goes to making magic happen!

Thank you for being part of this adventure!

Rivera Sun

 

Praise for the Ari Ara Series

 

"Rivera Sun is an amazing author. The way she threads the principles of nonviolence into the fabric of her novels is a beautiful experience. It is an education that everyone in the world needs - now more than ever."

- Heart Phoenix, River Phoenix Center for Peacebuilding

 

"In this book Rivera Sun pulls off an impressive feat, creating an original exciting story that deftly teaches ways to create a world that works for all.  Thank you, Rivera Sun, for another outstanding contribution to the field of nonviolence through this series!"

- Kit Miller, Executive Director, M.K. Gandhi Center for Nonviolence

 

"During times when so many of us, especially the young, are still figuring out how to make this planet more just and livable, this book couldn’t have come at a better time."

- Patrick Hiller, War Prevention Initiative

 

"Five stars. It's Harry Potter with a contemporary message."

- Gayle Morrow, retired Y/A Librarian

 

"Ms. Sun has created a world filled with all the adventure and fun of mystics, martial arts, and magic contained in The Hobbit, The Ring Trilogy, and the Harry Potter series but with deeper messages. There are not enough superlatives to describe this series!"

- Brenda Duffy, Retired Teacher

 

"Rivera Sun has once again made the practice and methods of strategic nonviolence clearly accessible and understandable to both adults and youth in an entertaining and exciting story." 

 - Michael Colvin,  Oregon Fellowship of Reconciliation

 

"Rivera Sun deserves an international audience and I hope she gets it."

- Amber French, Editorial Advisor, International Center on Nonviolent Conflict

 

"Rivera Sun's creativity, wisdom, insight and joyful nonviolent activism for all ages fills me with awe and hope. If we were all to read her books the way we have read Harry Potter's, we would be well on our way to sending a different message to our children."

- Veronica Pelicaric, Pace e Bene/Campaign Nonviolence

 

 

Excerpt from Desert Song:

A burst of laughter rang out from behind them. They whirled. A group of desert youths drew close, led by the young warrior Gorlion.

"Let's race, riverlands girl," Gorlion challenged. 

The others repeated the last phrase in a chant. The golden stallion, Zyrh, came dancing over, skin quivering and nostrils flaring. He snapped at the warrior youths and hung his head over Ari Ara's shoulder in a surprising show of solidarity. Ari Ara set her chin. She may not be a skilled rider, but she'd seen Zyrh galloping. He was fast. She waved aside Emir's protests and took a running leap to the golden horse's back. He let her land - which she took as a sign that he wanted to race as much as she did.

Gorlion's stallion pranced and paced, pawing the ground impatiently. Zyrh held stark still, except for the twitching ripple of tension that shivered in his flank. One of the youths drew a line in the sand. Another held up his scarf. A third counted down.

"Three . . . two . . . one . . . go!"

The two horses burst into motion. Ari Ara clutched fistfuls of Zyrh's ivory mane. The horse morphed into a mass of muscle and thundering energy. He moved in long, leaping strides. The ground beneath her blurred. Gorlion's stallion sprinted, lithe and swift. The desert youth rode well, tucked low to his horse's back. As they pulled ahead and left her in the dust, he ducked his head under his elbow and laughed mockingly.

"Go," Ari Ara urged her horse, refusing to give up.

Zyrh bolted forward, doubling the length of his stride. Ari Ara clutched the band of muscle at the arch of his neck and clenched her legs tight around the horse's torso. His legs stretched forever as they flew across the sand. The shore of the lake sped past. Despite her white-knuckled grip, a surge of thrilled excitement whipped through her. She let out a whoop of exhilaration. Zyrh sensed her enthusiasm, lengthened his neck, and exploded. Ari Ara's eyes widened. The golden horse galloped as if he was made of wind. They gained on Gorlion. They caught up to the stallion. Then they passed the other horse and pulled ahead. The sound of the competing racer's hoof beats fell back. Ari Ara cheered as Zyrh reached the end of the lake yards ahead of the other horse.

And then the horse kept on running.

 

Read the rest by supporting the Community Publishing Campaign.

Get your copies of Desert Song and The Adventures of Alaren today!

story:
Diary of a Mad Man

I started writing Diary of a Mad Man a few years ago as a pet project. I have since written two prequels to the book: Diary of a Mad Man : 12 Years Ago and Hitman for Hire. 

I have two small children and work a full time job. 

My plan is to write Diary of a Mad Man as a script. I want to write it my own way and have a vision of how it will go.

As a movie lover and fond follower of cinema, it is my dream to turn my script idea into a reality. I have been to film classes so I know exactly where I need to start.

Contributions

I want to take a month (or more) as unpaid leave from my full time job to concentrate on writing. This should give me the time I need to write the full script and edit it a few times over. Because I have two children I cannot afford to take the time off work without extra funds.

Other Ways You Can Help  

If you cannot contribute, please help by spreading the word. This can be done via social networking and the Indiegogo share tools!

For more information, feel free to contact me at : Joker2023@hotmail.com

story:
We are raising money for publication and distribution of a Native American themed fiction novel. This novel is a suspense/thriller with a faith based message. It opens new doors in the literary world by combining mainstream fiction with a christian theme in a Native American setting. The author, a member of the Wichita Tribe of Oklahoma, believes this novel will create more opportunities for Native American writers and open the door for broader understanding of the world of Native America.

This story is based upon a native teen’s search for spiritual direction in his young life. The character lives in a reservation village which is dominated by ancient traditional practices and beliefs. Two years earlier he loses his mother and sister in a violent attack by spiritual leaders. Although he has grown up with his father’s influence of the traditional ways he now reflects upon his mother’s teachings of the christian faith. After discovering true faith he battles pursecution and hightened spiritual visions of his people’s dark mysticism. The main character quickly grows in his new found faith as the shamen and leaders close in around him. This story has many twists and turns and is extremely riviting to the point of exciting the reader to desire more. This novel is the first installment of a trilogy.

You can share in bringing this inspirational suspense novel to readers around the world. This story has also been developed as a screenplay. This opportunity is monumental for hope and growth of Native people across America. Donors of $40 or more, will receive an autographed copy of the novel. Donors of $100 will receive along with the autographed book a beautiful Native American sand painting. Donors of $500 will recieve in addition to the autographed novel a turquoise bracelet. Donors of $1000 will receive in addition to the autographed novel a one of a kind Native American pottery from one of the local Native artisans. Donors of $5000 or more will receive in addition to the autographed novel a Native American concho belt from one of the local Native silversmiths.

We are beginning with a minimal amount of funds for this project. We are hoping to raise a minimum of $12,500 to get this project started. Please contact others you believe might be interested in supporting this work.
