Donors of $100 will receive along with the autographed book a beautiful Native American sand painting.  Donors of $500 will recieve in addition to the autographed novel a turquoise bracelet. Donors of $1000 will receive in addition to the autographed novel a one of a kind Native American pottery from one of the local Native artisans.  Donors of $5000 or more will receive in addition to the autographed novel a Native American concho belt from one of the local Native silversmiths.
We are beginning with a minimal amount of funds for this project.  We are hoping to raise a minimum of $12,500 to get this project started.  Please contact others you believe might be interested in supporting this work.

story:
What is Smart Rhino Publications ... and Why This Indiegogo Campaign?

Smart Rhino Publications began in 2012 with the horror anthology ZIPPERED FLESH: Tales of Body Enhancements Gone Bad! The book included stories by Graham Masterton, John Shirley, Lisa Mannetti, L.L. Soares, Scott Nicholson, and 15 other notable authors. The book was so well-received, we decided to do a second anthology with the same theme.

In 2013, Smart Rhino published ZIPPERED FLESH 2: More Tales of Body Enhancements Gone Bad! This anthology included two Bram Stoker Award nominees--"Primal Tongue" by Michael Bailey and "The Hunger Artist" by Lisa Mannetti--as well as 20 other stories. We're incredibly proud of this anthology.

And now we are pulling together the third in the ZIPPERED FLESH series ... and this time you can help with the project! Our main goal for this Indiegogo campaign is to (1) fairly pay our authors, (2) cover our layout and production costs (editing, formatting, proofreading, etc.), and (3) purchase the cover art (and other art is feasible). In short, we need your help to make the anthology happen!

As a small independent publisher, Smart Rhino Publications strives to publish quality books and provide venues for talented writers. Any help you can offer would be greatly appreciated ... and rewarded! Check out the many great rewards we're offering for your support! We're sure you'll find something of interest, especially if you love horror and suspense fiction.

Thanks so much!

 

Who Are the Authors Selected (So Far) for ZIPPERED FLESH 3?

Graham Masterton—Author of The Manitou, The Djinn, The Devil in Gray, Charnal House, Ghost Music, The Hell Candidate, and the Katie Maguire, Rook, and Night Warriors series, and many other novels and short stories. The Manitou, a huge bestseller, was made into the classic movie starring Tony Curtis. His story “Sex Object” was published in the first Zippered Flesh anthology.
 

William F. Nolan—Author of Logan’s Run, Logan’s World, Logan’s Search, Like a Dead Man Walking, Night Shapes, Things Beyond Midnight, Helltracks, Night Shapes, and other books and short stories. He also wrote the screenplays for Burnt Offerings, Logan's Run, and Trilogy of Terror.
 

Billie Sue Mosiman—Author of The Grey Matter, Carnival Freak, People of the Tower, A Little Life, Night Cruising, and many other works. Her stories “The Flenser,” “The Night Gordon was Set Free,” and “Second Amendment Solution” have been published in Smart Rhino anthologies.
 

Jack Ketchum—Best-selling author of Off Season, The Girl Next Door, Offspring, I’m Not Sam, The Box, Red, The Crossings, and other novels and short stories. Many of his novels have been adapted for film.
 

Jeff Menapace—Author of the Bad Games trilogy, Wild Life, Cling, Numb, Side Effects, and Warped: A Collection of Short Horror, Thriller, and Suspense Fiction. "Worm," to be published in Zippered Flesh 3, is Jeff's first story for Smart Rhino.
 

Shaun Meeks—Author of At the Gates of Madness, Shutdown, Dark Reaches, and The Gate at Lake Drive. His stories “Taut,” “Despair,” and “Dead Bill” have been published in Smart Rhino anthologies.
 

James Dorr—Author of The Tears of Isis, Tombs, Darker Loves, Poludnitsa, Strange Mistresses, and other works. His stories have also appeared in many anthologies, the most recent being The Great Tome of Cryptids and Legendary Creatures.  His short story "The Wellmaster's Daughter" appeared in Smart Rhino's Uncommon Assassins, and "Labyrinth" in Insidious Assassins.
 

Meghan Arcuri-Moran—Meghan has written short stories for various anthologies, including Chiral Mad, Chiral Mad 3, and Miseria's Chorale. Her story "Worse Ways" was published in Smart Rhino's Insidious Assassins.
 

Jason Brock—Author of Simulacrum and Other Possible Realities, Disorders of Magnitude: A Survey of Dark Fantasy, and The Dark Sea Within and Other Macabre Revelations. Jason has also contributed to anthologies, including Qualia Nous, Night Terrors II, Shrieks and Shivers, Drive-In Creature Feature, and many others.
 

Sandra R. Campbell—Author of Butterfly Harvest, Dark Migration, and The Dead Days Journal. Sandra also occasionally writes short stories--including her first story for Smart Rhino, "The Gehenna Division - Case #609." Her stories have been published in Suspense Magazine, and her story "Abandoned" is in production with Chilling Entertainment.
 

Adrian Ludens—Adrian has written for a number of anthologies, including Slices of Flesh, The Mammoth Book of Jack the Ripper Stories, Gothic Fantasy Science Fiction Stories, Blood Life 3: Aftertaste, Shadows Over Main Street, and Darker Edge of Desire. His story "Slay It Forward" appeared in Insidious Assassins.
 

E.A. Black—Author of many short stories that have appeared in anthologies, including Midnight Movie Creature Feature 2, Mirages, Wicked Tales, Teeming Terrors, Heart of Farkness, and Stupefying Stories. She also writes erotic fiction under the name Elizabeth Black. Her story "We're All Mad Here" was published in the first Zippered Flesh.
 

Christine Morgan—Christine's stories have appeared in many publications, including The Book of All Flesh, Strange Stories of Sand and Sea, Fear of the Unknown, Hell Hath No Fury, and many others. Her stories "Thyf's Tale," "The Sun-Snake," "Sven Bloodhair," and "No One of Consequence" have been published in Smart Rhino anthologies.
 

L.L. Soares—L.L. Soares is the Bram Stoker Award-winning author of the novel Life Rage. He also co-writes the Bram Stoker-nominated horror movie review column Cinema Knife Fight. His novella, Green Tsunami, written with his wife Laura Cooney, was published by Smart Rhino, and his stories "Sawbones," "Seeds," and "Sometimes the Good Witch Sings to Me"  have appeared in our anthologies.

We'll be adding more authors to the list, largely dependent on the funding we receive here. We have several stories already waiting in the wings. Throw us some support so that we can make the anthology even "meatier" than it is now. Trust us, you won't regret it!

 

REAP THE REWARDS!

Bring on the Pain! ($5 or more)

Thanks for giving us the thumbs up! We deeply appreciate it. We'll add your name to the supporter list at the back of the book.

 

Tattoos Level ($10 or more)

We'll add your name to the supporter list at the back of the book, and we'll email you a PDF/epub copy of ZIPPERED FLESH 3 when it is released.

 

Eyeball-Jewelry Level ($25 or more)

You'll receive a paperback copy of ZIPPERED FLESH 3 when it is released, with stories by William Nolan, Graham Masterton, Jack Ketchum, Billie Sue Mosiman, James Dorr, Shaun Meeks, and many others.  Plus we'll add your name to the supporter list at the end of the book.

 

Monster-Steroid Level ($45 or more)

A special, limited-edition, wrap-around Smart Rhino Publications coffee mug (or desk pen holder), plus a paperback copy of ZIPPERED FLESH 3 and we'll add your name to the supporter list published at the end of the book.

 

Ear-Sculpting Level ($50 or more)

You'll receive a beautiful, high-quality print of the original cover art, signed by the artist Shelley Everitt Bergen, plus we'll send you a paperback copy of ZIPPERED FLESH 3 and add your name to the supporter list published at the end of the book.

 

Tongue-Splitting Level ($60 or more)

Really want a taste of body modifications gone awry? How about all three of the ZIPPERED FLESH anthologies? Oh, and your name appears in the supporter list.

 

Branding Level ($80 or more)

You'll receive a beautiful, high-quality print of the original cover art, signed by the artist Shelley Everitt Bergen, plus we'll send you the entire ZIPPERED FLESH trilogy and add your name to the supporter list published at the end of the book.

 

Face-Transplant Level ($100 or more--limit of 3)

At this level, we'll name one of the characters after you in one of the stories we publish. Plus you'll receive all three ZIPPERED FLESH anthos, and we'll add your name to the supporter list.

 

Brain-Piercing Level ($150 or more--limit of 10)

Definitely one of our best offers! You can get all 11 books published by Smart Rhino, including all three ZIPPERED FLESH anthologies; the two ASSASSINS anthologies; the SOMEONE WICKED anthology; both editions of THE NEW ADVENTURES OF TOM SAWYER AND HUCK FINN (Adult and YA); THE BOX JUMPER novella, with Houdini as a central character; the SF/horror novella GREEN TSUNAMI; and BROKEN, a collection of short stories by Smart Rhino editor Weldon Burge. And, of course, your name will be included in our list of supporters!

 

Microchip-Implant Level ($200 or more--limit of 2)

Have a horror/suspense short story you'd like critiqued/edited? At this level, Smart Rhino's Executive Editor, Weldon Burge, will work over your manuscript (max. 6,000 words) and discuss with you options for submission. You'll also receive a paperback copy of ZIPPERED FLESH 3 and we'll add your name published in the supporter list at the end of the ZIPPERED FLESH 3 anthology.

 

Cyborg Level ($250 or more--limit of 2)

Perhaps our best reward of all! Not only will you receive all three ZIPPERED FLESH anthologies, but Smart Rhino's Executive Editor, Weldon Burge, will critique/edit a horror/suspense short story that you've written (max. 6,000 words) and discuss with you options for submission. Plus your name will be added to the supporter list at the end of ZIPPERED FLESH 3.

"i know somebody somewhere is my hero/s. i may not have life threatening diagnosis' BUT i live daily with life changing Abilities just proving to myself and everybody else i can do it and i am KIM POSSIBLE".

 

Dear jessie kim ,

After your interview we have determine that we can train a Service Dog to assist you with your needs. ECAD is happy to consider you as a candidate for our Team Training. In order for you to accept you as a candidate, we require a $500.00 non-refundable deposit. This deposit is due within the next thirty days. You will be notified when we have identified a dog for you and when the team training class is schedule to take place. The schedule is determined on the level of skills you will need the dog to perform as well as availability of a dog.

As discussed during the interview the cost of team training is $8500. Your deposit of $500 is part of the $8500, leaving $8000 that must be paid prior to entering team training. Unfortunately we do not accept credit cards for payment of team training. ECAD has a fundraising packet to offer ideas and you certainly may pay in installments before the start of Team Training if you wish. Because of the demand for Service Dogs, we will not be scheduling Team Training until late 2013 to 2014.

 

update just found out that kim's service dog even though is $8500 this does NOT include travel and/or food for the 2 weeks we will be in NY. gonna have to raise more funds to cover this. good thing kim is on formula and i only eat one meal a day. thank you all for your continued love, support and prayers for kim and her family.

Follow Up:

Our Journals are printed and in! Order HERE by December 17th and get free shipping for delivery in time for Christmas: http://www.indiegogo.com/gratefulchicsgratitude...

Hi Indiegogo Friends! We are Claire and Joy, the Grateful Chics.  After so many customer requests and a lot of research and development, we are very excited to be able to present our next dream to you today - a fresh and unique spin on a proven favorite!

"Live a Grateful Life" Interactive Gratitude Journal Set with App, E-Book, printed journal & bookmark!

Thank you for viewing our project! Here is what's on this page:


_________________________________

Our company started when Joy received the very first Grateful Bead as a thank-you gift (see full details below in #3). This strand of ten simple and meaningful beads sparked a passion to share the concept of Living a Grateful Life with the world and Grateful Chics became a reality.

Now, three years later, the wide variety of Grateful Chics Grateful Gift Products are available online and in retail stores all over the US and Canada. Claire, another Momtrepreneur joined this year. This dynamic duo of creative energy is a catalyst for bringing more Peace, Love and Joy through Gratitude. Read more about us in our bio or online...

_________________________________

There is great demand from our existing customers and retail store buyers for Grateful Chics Grateful Journal Sets.  Each comes with a printed journal, Grateful Bead Bookmark, E-Book and App codes for Smart Phones. These additional features in the set make it super cool and unique over all other gratitude journals. A soon as this Indiegogo campaign is fully funded we are ready to push the "Go" button for all production and finalization.  Our goal is that this set will be ready for shoppers by Holiday 2012!!

App and written journal prototypes (To enlarge images press CTRL+)


It's widely recommended by some of the most inspirational leaders and teachers to keep a gratitude journal as one of the best ways to stay positive.  Dr. Oz just interviewed Dr. Andrew Weil in July 2012 on the show talking about the power of gratitude journals!  Dr. Weil said, about writing in a gratitude journal, "doing this for one week has been shown to boost mood for as long as 6 months". We say, "Count 10 blessings a day to keep the worries away!"

Inside pages with quotes and watermark. Page count is 200.

In addition to the roll-out of the Grateful Journal Sets that will be sold for $25 ($38 value) on our site, in retail stores in the US and Canada, and on Amazon, we will sell the App and E-Book separately for those who just want their journals "On the Go" (no pun intended).  This creates a unique marketing tool to introduce more people to our brand and products. Occasionally, we will GIFT the App code or E-Book to customers for promotions. So you see, this Indiegogo project is something that will move our business forward in many strategic ways once fully funded with your keen business sense and generous contributions!

Really, our customers have been begging us for Grateful Journals!
This is where YOU, our Indiegogo contributors, come in! We’re asking for $10,000 for this Campaign. This covers all expenses for the initial Grateful Journal Sets: design, printing, binding, shipping and distribution, marketing; App and E-Book design, production and registration, and production of the Grateful Bead Bookmarks, which come standard with EVERY journal set...yes, you read right!

App icon, Welcome Page and Journal Page (to decrease page size press CTRL - )


The Grateful on the Go App will be available for Android and ios (iPhone and iPad) user interfaces (UI).  After clicking on the GC App icon the user is directed to a Welcome Page.  There the user can click to write in their own journal pages and be inspired by fun and chicy inspirational quotes.  These journal pages from the App can be shared on Facebook and Twitter and saved for referring back. The E-Book version of the "Live A Grateful Life Journal" is for Kindle and as a simple download that can be printed for less than half the cost of the journal set. We have sourced the development of the techy versions of our project and for us to be able to afford the highest level of quality for our App & E-Book, we have been quoted a minimum of $3000.

_________________________________

A Grateful Bead Strand is a meditation, mala or prayer strand to help remember all the blessings, BIG and little, that you’re thankful for each and every day!  Prayer beads have been around for thousands of years. Ours are for ANYONE that wants to generate more good in their life no matter their faith practice.  Plus, the owner decides what the beads represent each time they are used making them unique to each person.

Visual reminders throughout the day.

  • The LARGE bead is for the Creator.  We're all wonderfully and miraculously made.
  • The three MEDIUM beads are to remind us of people in our lives.  Three people (or groups of people) that touch our lives in any way.  
  • The six SMALL beads are to remind us of things, places, events, happenings, little or big - all you’re grateful for each day.

Each Grateful Bead comes with a Grateful Chics signature charm and easily attaches to whatever you want. This Indiegogo Project will fund the initial roll-out of the Grateful Journal Sets which includes the printed Gratitude Journal, Grateful Bead Bookmark, plus the promo code for the App/E-Book free with each set.  See how this makes it a truly unique and very modern Journal for anyone?


This dream will become a reality with your contributions of $10,000 or more.

_________________________________

          We’ve lined up some pretty sweet perks for you at every level including our App, E-Book, or the whole Journal set and more.  Please see photos below for the additional perks from our existing products.  Please support us and share our project with your contacts so we can be one step closer to spreading ☮ ♥ ☺ around the world.  We firmly believe that when you count your blessings and keep in mind what you’re thankful for that life will flow better.  PLUS, we found that our good energy has a ripple effect that others notice and want for themselves.  Thank you from the bottom of our grateful hearts for helping us achieve our dream!

************

COOL THING...You can pay on PayPal now as a guest with no PayPal account, using YOUR credit card.  This allows us to get our funding quicker so that we can get this project to market faster.  PayPal is the number one, most secure, most trusted form of paying online.

************

*If we reach the full $10,000 we will create and offer the App! We have offered a back up plan perk, just in case.

_____________________________

 

"My daughter & mom said this about the gifts I gave them: "The Grateful Beads have made such a difference in my life! Thanks so much for them and I just had to tell you that they have brought me much more peace! I might wear them out I use them so much." " ~Elizabeth V.


"I can always count on the Grateful Beads. They are one of our consistent Best Sellers. When are you printing those Grateful Journals???" ~Tracy C. at Unity Church Bookstore Houston

  • Live TV spotlight on Great Day Houston with Deborah Duncan
  • National Magazine Skirt! Feature
  • Best of Show: Denver INATS 2010 Winner  Page 28
  • Blog Talk Momtrepreneurs Radio Show
  • More...

Remember this is ALL OR NOTHING!!!  So, we really hope you will support us and share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family, and others on social media.  Spreading the word is a great way for us to succeed.


If we EXCEED our $10,000 request we will expand our "Live a Grateful Life" Journal Sets to different versions, larger distribution and more marketing to get our message of Peace, Love, and Joy out to the world! Thanks so much!


With Gratitude, Joy joy@gratefulchics.com & Claire claire@gratefulchics.com

 

Grateful Pocket Stones (revamped worry stones), Live a Grateful Life Wristbands & Grateful Guardian Earrings (8 colors available)

Hand Made Peace, Love and Joy Magnets

Hand drawn Inspirational Note Pads


***Grateful Beads are trademarks of Grateful Chics, Inc.***

Music in video is an original creation by Claire & PJ Stuckey. Cover artwork on journal drawn by Sandra Filer, aka Diosa Feliz. All rights reserved 2012.

Follow Up:
Our Journals are printed and in! Order HERE by December 17th and get free shipping for delivery in time for Christmas: http://www.indiegogo.com/gratefulchicsgratitude...
Hi Indiegogo Friends! We are Claire and Joy, the Grateful Chics.  After so many customer requests and a lot of research and development, we are very excited to be able to present our next dream to you today - a fresh and unique spin on a proven favorite!
"Live a Grateful Life" Interactive Gratitude Journal Set with App, E-Book, printed journal & bookmark! 
Thank you for viewing our project! Here is what's on this page:
_________________________________

Our company started when Joy received the very first Grateful Bead as a thank-you gift (see full details below in #3). This strand of ten simple and meaningful beads sparked a passion to share the concept of Living a Grateful Life with the world and Grateful Chics became a reality. 
Now, three years later, the wide variety of Grateful Chics Grateful Gift Products are available online and in retail stores all over the US and Canada. Claire, another Momtrepreneur joined this year. This dynamic duo of creative energy is a catalyst for bringing more Peace, Love and Joy through Gratitude. Read more about us in our bio or online...
_________________________________

There is great demand from our existing customers and retail store buyers for Grateful Chics Grateful Journal Sets.  Each comes with a printed journal, Grateful Bead Bookmark, E-Book and App codes for Smart Phones. These additional features in the set make it super cool and unique over all other gratitude journals. A soon as this Indiegogo campaign is fully funded we are ready to push the "Go" button for all production and finalization.  Our goal is that this set will be ready for shoppers by Holiday 2012!!

App and written journal prototypes (To enlarge images press CTRL+)
It's widely recommended by some of the most inspirational leaders and teachers to keep a gratitude journal as one of the best ways to stay positive.  Dr. Oz just interviewed Dr. Andrew Weil in July 2012 on the show talking about the power of gratitude journals!  Dr. Weil said, about writing in a gratitude journal, "doing this for one week has been shown to boost mood for as long as 6 months". We say, "Count 10 blessings a day to keep the worries away!"

Inside pages with quotes and watermark. Page count is 200.
In addition to the roll-out of the Grateful Journal Sets that will be sold for $25 ($38 value) on our site, in retail stores in the US and Canada, and on Amazon, we will sell the App and E-Book separately for those who just want their journals "On the Go" (no pun intended).  This creates a unique marketing tool to introduce more people to our brand and products. Occasionally, we will GIFT the App code or E-Book to customers for promotions. So you see, this Indiegogo project is something that will move our business forward in many strategic ways once fully funded with your keen business sense and generous contributions!Really, our customers have been begging us for Grateful Journals! This is where YOU, our Indiegogo contributors, come in! We’re asking for $10,000 for this Campaign. This covers all expenses for the initial Grateful Journal Sets: design, printing, binding, shipping and distribution, marketing; App and E-Book design, production and registration, and production of the Grateful Bead Bookmarks, which come standard with EVERY journal set...yes, you read right!

App icon, Welcome Page and Journal Page (to decrease page size press CTRL - )
The Grateful on the Go App will be available for Android and ios (iPhone and iPad) user interfaces (UI).  After clicking on the GC App icon the user is directed to a Welcome Page.  There the user can click to write in their own journal pages and be inspired by fun and chicy inspirational quotes.  These journal pages from the App can be shared on Facebook and Twitter and saved for referring back. The E-Book version of the "Live A Grateful Life Journal" is for Kindle and as a simple download that can be printed for less than half the cost of the journal set. We have sourced the development of the techy versions of our project and for us to be able to afford the highest level of quality for our App & E-Book, we have been quoted a minimum of $3000.
_________________________________

A Grateful Bead Strand is a meditation, mala or prayer strand to help remember all the blessings, BIG and little, that you’re thankful for each and every day!  Prayer beads have been around for thousands of years. Ours are for ANYONE that wants to generate more good in their life no matter their faith practice.  Plus, the owner decides what the beads represent each time they are used making them unique to each person.

Visual reminders throughout the day.


The LARGE bead is for the Creator.  We're all wonderfully and miraculously made.


The three MEDIUM beads are to remind us of people in our lives.  Three people (or groups of people) that touch our lives in any way.  


The six SMALL beads are to remind us of things, places, events, happenings, little or big - all you’re grateful for each day.

Each Grateful Bead comes with a Grateful Chics signature charm and easily attaches to whatever you want. This Indiegogo Project will fund the initial roll-out of the Grateful Journal Sets which includes the printed Gratitude Journal, Grateful Bead Bookmark, plus the promo code for the App/E-Book free with each set.  See how this makes it a truly unique and very modern Journal for anyone?
This dream will become a reality with your contributions of $10,000 or more.
_________________________________

          We’ve lined up some pretty sweet perks for you at every level including our App, E-Book, or the whole Journal set and more.  Please see photos below for the additional perks from our existing products.  Please support us and share our project with your contacts so we can be one step closer to spreading ☮ ♥ ☺ around the world.  We firmly believe that when you count your blessings and keep in mind what you’re thankful for that life will flow better.  PLUS, we found that our good energy has a ripple effect that others notice and want for themselves.  Thank you from the bottom of our grateful hearts for helping us achieve our dream!

************
COOL THING...You can pay on PayPal now as a guest with no PayPal account, using YOUR credit card.  This allows us to get our funding quicker so that we can get this project to market faster.  PayPal is the number one, most secure, most trusted form of paying online.
************
*If we reach the full $10,000 we will create and offer the App! We have offered a back up plan perk, just in case.
_____________________________
 

"My daughter & mom said this about the gifts I gave them: "The Grateful Beads have made such a difference in my life! Thanks so much for them and I just had to tell you that they have brought me much more peace! I might wear them out I use them so much." " ~Elizabeth V.
"I can always count on the Grateful Beads. They are one of our consistent Best Sellers. When are you printing those Grateful Journals???" ~Tracy C. at Unity Church Bookstore Houston

Live TV spotlight on Great Day Houston with Deborah Duncan
National Magazine Skirt! Feature
Best of Show: Denver INATS 2010 Winner  Page 28
Blog Talk Momtrepreneurs Radio Show
More...
Remember this is ALL OR NOTHING!!!  So, we really hope you will support us and share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family, and others on social media.  Spreading the word is a great way for us to succeed.
If we EXCEED our $10,000 request we will expand our "Live a Grateful Life" Journal Sets to different versions, larger distribution and more marketing to get our message of Peace, Love, and Joy out to the world! Thanks so much!
With Gratitude, Joy joy@gratefulchics.com & Claire claire@gratefulchics.com

 

Grateful Pocket Stones (revamped worry stones), Live a Grateful Life Wristbands & Grateful Guardian Earrings (8 colors available)

Hand Made Peace, Love and Joy Magnets

Hand drawn Inspirational Note Pads

Music in video is an original creation by Claire & PJ Stuckey. Cover artwork on journal drawn by Sandra Filer, aka Diosa Feliz. All rights reserved 2012.

story:
Festival Internacional Comunitario: Conviviendo sin Fonteras

 

Asociación Masaya, ubicada en Costa Rica, es un grupo de personas que crean espacios para la reflexión y creación de relaciones sociales mediante herramientas lúdicas y teatrales con el fin de disminuir la violencia.

En conjunto con Asociación Masaya (Costa Rica), el Grupo de Teatro Las Voces Del Viento (Costa Rica) en asociación con Maraña (España-Suiza) y Grupo Levante de Teatro do Oprimido (Brasil) se lleva a cabo el FIC, el cual tiene como objetivo principal ser un espacio de diálogo para aprender a través del teatro social junto a comunidades segregadas por el estigma de la violencia y/o inseguridad.

Dicho festival se realizará del 12-18 de diciembre en la comunidad de La Carpio, San José Costa Rica, y se pretende fortalecer la formación de personas jóvenes en su camino a ser mejores individuos y gestores culturales que sigan llenando de excelentes acciones a dicha comunidad estereotipada por la violencia.

En el FIC se podrán encontrar actividades tales como:

  • Talleres: Teatro Social, Teatro del Oprimido, Teatro de la integración, Redes de apoyo mutuo ¿cómo fortalecerlas?.
  • Presentaciones: de grupos de teatro, nacionales e internacionales acompañados de buena música.
  • Exposición fotográfica: Proceso de levantamiento de información: Patrimonio Cultural de La Carpio 2015.

 

¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS PARA HACER DE ESTE SUEÑO UNA REALIDAD?

Aportando en algunas de estos requerimientos podrá convertirse en “coproductor” de esta hermosa historia

  • Pasajes de avión para las personas que vienen de otros países: Brasil, Ecuador, Alemania, España, Argentina, Nicaragua y El Salvador.
  • Alojamiento.
  • Alimentación e hidratración.
  • Transporte terrestre.

 

Co productores del FIC: 

  • Maraña 
  • Las Voces del Viento 
  • Grupo de teatro Levante 
  • Asciación Masaya 

Nos apoyan:

  • Parque La Libertad  
  • RET International 
  • Jóvenes Madiba 
  • Aso Codeca 
  • ACAU 
  • OIM Oficina Nacional de Costa Rica

 

International Community Festival: Coexisting without Borders

 

Masaya Association, located in Costa Rica, is a group of people that create spaces for reflection and the (development) creation of social relationships through fun and theatrical tools with the purpose of reducing violence.

In association with Masaya Association (Costa Rica), The Wind Voices Theater Group (Costa Rica), alongside Maraña (Spain-Switzerland) and Levante Theater of the Oppressed Group (Brasil), the FIC takes place which has as main purpose to be a space for open dialogue to learn through social theater skills next to segregated communities by a violence and/or insecurity stigma.

The festival will be held on December 12-18 in the community of La Carpio, San José Costa Rica, aiming to strengthen the training of young individuals on their way to becoming better people and cultural managers, so that they can continue to contribute to their community-which is being stereotyped as violent- through their excellent contributions and actions.

 

YOU CAN FIND ACTIVITIES IN FIC SUCH AS:

  • Workshops: Social Theater, Theater of the Oppressed, Improvisational Theater
  • Live Performances: national and international theater groups, good music
  • Photography exhibition: La Carpio Intangible Cultural Heritage (documentation process)

 

WHAT DO WE NEED TO MAKE THIS DREAM REAL?

By supporting us with any of these requirements you can become a co-producer in this story

  • Plane tickets for participants in Brazil, Ecuador, Germany, Spain, Argentina, Nicaragua and El Salvador
  • Accommodation
  • Food
  • Shuttle and transportation

Co producers: 

  • Maraña 
  • Las Voces del Viento 
  • Grupo de teatro Levante 
  • Asciación Masaya 

Supported by:

  • Parque La Libertad  
  • RET International 
  • Jóvenes Madiba 
  • Aso Codeca 
  • ACAU 
  • OIM Oficina Nacional de Costa Rica

story:
My Discovery Campaign for Heroes of Valinthia

My name is actually Daniel A. Roberts, that's not some pen name. I'm a relatively unknown author who's published five full length novels as of this time. With Heroes of Valinthia releasing in December of 2012, I'd like to give this series a powerful shove in the right direction. 

My novels go before volunteer beta readers before they're published. I use their feedback to make sure my story is at its best level of entertainment. My work is edited and a I get an excellent cover artist.  

What I'm running short on is the marketing, trailer production and advertising spots in places where people who love to read science fiction and fantasy lurk, live and play. Obscurity is a difficult wall to break down; it takes a little more money than I currently have to give this series the shot it truly deserves.

I don't believe in getting something for nothing. Every reward I listed is tiered. You get the previous perks added up to the point of your generosity, so the third Perk is built upon Perk One and Perk Two, plus something extra as an example. 

$750 is the bare minimum I need to get the ball rolling in the right direction. If I exceed my goals, then I'll be able to do so much more. I can extend promotion times, print more copies for those reviewers who want the physical novels in their hands. With enough, I would even be able to afford the digital assets for a graphics program called Daz Studio 4.5 to make my own covers for future novels. 

If I don't meet my goals, I will fulfill all of the Perks claimed, and work from the bottom up, using whatever is there to fund promotions and advertising spots. However, I'm a born optimist. I have a feeling that when you know what kind of fun series this is, you'll be happy to be a part of helping it get discovered. Maybe we can get it on a best-seller list somewhere, when people discover its existence with your help. That one day in the future, you might be sitting down to watch a new film based upon my novel. (Oh what a dream that is for me!) Then you can turn to your date/spouse/friend and proudly say, "I helped to make this possible." 

Here is a link to my Blog where I share an example from each of the novels. Scroll down and they'll have bold headers.  

Perk Time! 

*Please note that each link below is to an example of the novel itself.  I linked to Amazon because you can 'peek' inside to get an idea of the actual product.  I will not be ordering the novels for you from Amazon, I'll be getting them directly from the printing press and shipping to you from my house after they're signed.

Digital Valinthia - $5: You state the format, you'll get both ebook editions of Defenders of Valinthia and Rulers of Valinthia. Both ebooks retail for $2.99 each, so you're saving a few pennies on this one! 

From Earth - $10: In addition to getting the $5 perk, you'll have your name mentioned in the back of the novel, in both ebook and paperback formats, in a section titled: "People From Earth Who Made This Possible" So your name gets immortalized with my fun fiction, inside a real novel that will be fore sale worldwide when it's released. 

Defenders of Valinthia - $25: You get the $5 and $10 perk along with a physical trade paperback copy of the novel Defenders of Valinthia, to the address you specify. It will be signed by a real live pen, no ink signature stamps are allowed for my readers! (Outside of the United States? Please add $10 for International Shipping.) 

Rulers of Valinthia - $40: You get the $5, 10$ and $25 perk, plus the physical trade paperback copy of the novel Rulers of Valinthia, sent to the address you specify. Both paperbacks will be signed by my pen, no ink signature stamps are allowed for my readers! (Outside of the United States? Please add $10 for International Shipping.) 

Plus 3 More - $100: At this level of help, you're getting more than just my finished Valinthia series. You get THREE more paperback novels from my Passion Trilogy. Every novel sent out will be brand spanking new. Passion of the Different, Passion of the Same and Passion of the Unknown. All 5 novels will be signed by me, shipped to the address you provide. (International Shipping is already covered in this donation level.) 

Money Nuke - $1500: Just do it already, Daniel. I'm loaded with cash, this is an awesome idea, now everyone who donates at the lower perks gets the maximum rewards. Why? Because I'm wicked cool like that. You will thank me profusely on your Facebook page, Blog and Twitter. You will also write me in as a Hero/Villain in your very next novel. You will use my eye color, hair color, gender, and make me the coolest thing to cross the written page, or the most diabolical evil being to make the world tremble, my choice of course, to be either the hero or villain. This will also get me all the Perks previously mentioned. Oh yeah, don't forget, Daniel... I also get 10 free copies of that future novel, signed by you, to give away to whomever I wish for ultimate bragging rights! 

Funding Goals Surpassed Rewards! 

If you help me reach my goals, beautiful! I couldn't ask for more. In the case you think 'more is good', well partner, I agree with you 100%! So I am willing to go an extra mile for you with these goal markers in mind. 

$1000 Reached: Everyone in the $100 level gets a physical copy of "Heroes of Valinthia", author signed, when it's released in December of 2012. All other Perk levels get the ebook version in whatever format they've previously chosen sent in an email.  

$1500 Reached: Everyone in both the $100 and $40 level gets a physical copy of "Heroes of Valinthia", author signed, when it's released in December of 2012. All other Perk levels get the ebook version in whatever format they've previously chosen sent in an email, PLUS a one-of-a-kind digitally rendered wallpaper featuring one of my main female characters, a bard named Jasra Songweaver, giving her thanks. (She's the woman on the cover of 'Rulers of Valinthia' only she'll be much larger!) 

Broke?

You can still make a difference! You can still help. Spread the word. Post this campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter, Blog, email it to somebody you think might be interested. All such efforts will be highly appreciated. 

Don't forget, Indiegogo has some cool share tools to help you spread the word!

story:
POETRY AND ARTWORK SUBMISSIONS FOR FALL 2017 PUBLICATION OPEN FROM JANUARY 1ST - MARCH 31ST


 

ARTISTIC PAYMENT STRUCTURE

We are hoping that supporters of poetry and the need to highlight more poets identifying as black, indigenous, and people of colour (BIPoC) will help provide funding. 

Because this project is not being funded with any government grant assistance, the decision was made to run an Indiegogo campaign in tandem with the call for submissions.  The reason for this is to help us gauge community interest and support, and so that the project would not rely entirely on poetry submissions for financial support, resulting in a significant reduction of the fees (approximately 40% less).

The fees paid from poetry submissions as well as the Indiegogo campaign will be used for paying the following:

  • the poets and artists whose submitted work is accepted for publication. 
  • the BIPoC Community Editors involved in reviewing the material and ensuring that it is in accordance of our Visibility, Inclusion, and Anti-Oppression mission statement.
  • minor administrative costs, which include the online submissions manager (Submittable), as well as a payment processing fee.
  • the graphic designer with producing the work for print. 
  • a portion of initial costs associated with marketing and publishing the final collection (ideally, however payment to the poets and artists submitting is our priority). 

Our goals are:

  • to offer payment to each poet for each poem that has been accepted for publication, in the amount of fifty ($50) Canadian dollars ($100 for visual art).
  • to publish a total of approximately a total of approximately 50 combined poems and artworks in the first publication, the majority of which being poetry. 
  • to offer the publication at a discounted rate for any and all who submitted poetry that was not accepted for publication. 

At time of writing, we’re unfortunately unable to determine or guarantee if any of our goals be met, or to what degree, as they all depend on the success of the Indiegogo campaign, the quantity of poetry submissions we receive, as well as the quality of the work being submitted. 

More poetry submissions and donations to the Indiegogo campaign mean:

  • more funding to meet our goals
  • more poems we can publish,
  • more we can pay out to artists whose work is accepted, and
  • the higher the discount we can offer to those whose work was not accepted for publication. 

This collection is created with the intention of promoting and paying BIPoC-identifying poets and artists to create artistic-presence-as-resistance to an antiquated system of publication that appears more and more to favour white writers, and merely tokenize BIPoC writers to pay lip service to inclusivity. 

As we believe in supporting artists, this project will always be more about artistic fecundity and fostering community than financial success.

 

VISIBILITY, INCLUSION & ANTI-OPPRESSION:

The publication's main mission is to provide a platform for black, indigenous, and people of colour (BIPoC) from across (Colonially Known As) "Canada" to speak about the social impact of mental health through the lens of racialized experiences.

The project originally comes from a need to highlight more BIPoC artists and writers in the predominantly-white "Canadian" spoken word scene (especially wimmin, femmes, and folks outside the binary), as well as the social and psychological impact of mental health narratives long dominated by white supremacy.

Although explicitly titled and focused for BIPoC, this project also recognizes the need for welcomed inclusion LGBTQQIP2SAA, queer, genderqueer, trans, non-binary, bigender and agender representation, visibility for disabled individuals, and across intersections of all social marginalization.   

There will be no consideration for any material embodying or representing the same hateful, discriminatory, and oppressive systems which currently exist as the object of our resistance.  This includes (but is not limited to): anti-blackness, homophobia, ableism, Islamophobia, misogyny, misogynoir, cis-sexism, transphobia, anti-Semitism, serophobia, classism, etc. Kyriarchy is a Rubik's cube of various systems we can unlock and break down with time, patience, energy, care (for self and community), and most importantly, love as radical justice.

For the time being, the first edition will highlight and showcase contributions from (Colonially Known As) "Canada". If successful, future editions will be open to folks of other geographic locations.

POETRY AND ARTWORK SUBMISSIONS FOR FALL 2017 PUBLICATION OPEN FROM JANUARY 1ST - MARCH 31ST ARTISTIC PAYMENT STRUCTUREWe are hoping that supporters of poetry and the need to highlight more poets identifying as black, indigenous, and people of colour (BIPoC) will help provide funding. Because this project is not being funded with any government grant assistance, the decision was made to run an Indiegogo campaign in tandem with the call for submissions.  The reason for this is to help us gauge community interest and support, and so that the project would not rely entirely on poetry submissions for financial support, resulting in a significant reduction of the fees (approximately 40% less).The fees paid from poetry submissions as well as the Indiegogo campaign will be used for paying the following:
the poets and artists whose submitted work is accepted for publication. 
the BIPoC Community Editors involved in reviewing the material and ensuring that it is in accordance of our Visibility, Inclusion, and Anti-Oppression mission statement.
minor administrative costs, which include the online submissions manager (Submittable), as well as a payment processing fee.
the graphic designer with producing the work for print. 
a portion of initial costs associated with marketing and publishing the final collection (ideally, however payment to the poets and artists submitting is our priority). 
Our goals are:
to offer payment to each poet for each poem that has been accepted for publication, in the amount of fifty ($50) Canadian dollars ($100 for visual art).
to publish a total of approximately a total of approximately 50 combined poems and artworks in the first publication, the majority of which being poetry. 
to offer the publication at a discounted rate for any and all who submitted poetry that was not accepted for publication. 
At time of writing, we’re unfortunately unable to determine or guarantee if any of our goals be met, or to what degree, as they all depend on the success of the Indiegogo campaign, the quantity of poetry submissions we receive, as well as the quality of the work being submitted.  More poetry submissions and donations to the Indiegogo campaign mean:
more funding to meet our goals
more poems we can publish,
more we can pay out to artists whose work is accepted, and
the higher the discount we can offer to those whose work was not accepted for publication.

story:
Twilight of the Hobo

Last summer, thanks to a commission from The Sunday Times (UK) newspaper, I got to realise the lifelong ambition of a congenital runaway. I travelled across the United States for six weeks by freight train, in the traditional - that's to say, illegal and zealously policed - manner of the hobo, that stock character of American literature, cinema and songbook, the grizzled avatar of Free America. My journey followed the First Transcontinental Railroad from Reno, Nevada, to Omaha, Nebraska, finishing at the National Hobo Convention in Britt, Iowa.  
 
What I found was a fugitive, fabulous landscape peopled by a stupendous cast of refugees: squatter punk kids; illegal labourers; veterans of four wars; thrill-seeking, gadget-geek college kids and the bail-skippers who prey on their baubles; the FTRA, or "Hells Angels of the rails"; anarcho-activists shuttling between anti-globalisation protests (in the year that Occupy achieved critical mass); and, for the first time in 70 years, homegrown economic migrants, modern-day Joads fleeing ghost towns of foreclosed homes in what Bloomberg has labelled "the Great Recession".

A disparate - often wild - bunch, but there was one thing on which they all agreed: the hobo's number is up, that there is no place for a restless spirit, even one with a long and noble history, on Homeland Security's watch...
 
The article (http://www.josephwoby.com/?p=29), which was accompanied by a short film of interviews (conducted by me, featured above), generated a great deal of buzz, in the UK and US, proving that our appetite for the open road remains as voracious as Jack London's or Jack Kerouac's, and it wasn't long until I was contacted by agents wondering if I'd be open to writing a book on the subject. I was ahead of them by 40 years - it's the book I was born to write: a definitive hobo history, a wide-ranging contemporary account and a considered lament for a fast-dying community in one tome, the like of which has never been produced. I will take ten trips, one for every chapter and touching 10,000 miles, to cover ten topics: folklore, music, film, literature, the black economy, crime, labour history, social anthropology, politics and Fortress America. I consider myself uniquely qualified for the job, with feet firmly planted in every relevant camp: I will be interviewing - and hopping freights with - "celebrity tramps", film-makers, gang members, writers, academics and Occupy organisers, and can count the documentarian Richard Grant (who made American Nomads for the BBC) and the novelists Robert Olen Butler and Toby Litt among those rooting for me. I will also be filming my progress. 
 
I arrive in the States in August, without an advance, but on the back of a media blitz and publisher encouragement to work the project as a partnership, pulling in funds and steering publicity myself. This appears increasingly to be the way of the world now, particularly if your field is marginalised people and the makeshift, legally dubious lives they lead. I am looking for assistance with every aspect of writing the book: there are distances I can't travel by freight train; I need equipment, rations, the odd room in which to recuperate (research rarely comes more dangerous or physically demanding) and, of course, time to write. I will be on the road for a minimum of six months, three months before the election and three after. I intend to deliver the manuscript by July 2013.
 

About me

Joseph Woby writes as a freelance for a number of newspapers and magazines, including The Times, The Sunday Times, The Guardian, Metro, Spin and Q. Having worked as a stringer for Reuters in Latin America, he has always preferred an office with a view of the stars.
 

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute financially, perhaps you could spread word of my campaign to friends, associates and organisations that you think might be interested.

story:
"Like a latter-day Rashi, Rachel Pollack has co-created an iconic midrash on the secrets of the creation, with the help of Robert Place’s dazzling art. This masterly tarot shines into the hidden heart of all life, revealing the mysteries!'

___________________________Caitlín Matthews, author of Untold Tarot, Lost Book of the Grail, and Singing the Soul Back Home.

 

THE PROJECT

            The Raziel Tarot is a deck co-created by writer Rachel Pollack and artist Robert M. Place.  Based on thousands of years of Jewish lore, teachings, Kabbalah, magical practices, and the vast treasure house of stories, inspired by the Bible but going far beyond it, it nevertheless is solidly rooted in Tarot tradition.  The cards are drawn in the sensual Jewish Art Nouveau style created by E M Lilien in the beginning of the 20th century, but they are also inspired by the classic Waite-Smith Tarot, often with an extra layer.  For example, Strength shows a woman with a lion, but now the woman is the Queen of Sheba, the mysterious figure who comes to test King Solomon, and was probably the female lover in the Song of Songs.  Solomon himself is the Magician, his posture subtly recalling the Waite Smith Magician.

            The title comes from a medieval Jewish myth that an angel named Raziel (“God is my secret”) gave a book to Adam and Eve that contained all the mysteries of existence and could predict all future events.  This is exactly the myth that has dominated the Tarot for the past 250 years—the idea that the structure of the Tarot contains the Hermetic secrets of the universe, but when we mix the cards and set them in a spread they can predict the future.  Raziel himself appears in The Lovers, one of the cards directly inspired by The Rider-Waite-Smith.

            The card most connected to the Waite-Smith deck is the High Priestess, where we see a seated woman between black and white pillars of a temple.  This is no accident, for Waite refers to the woman as “the Shekinah,”  a term which he does not bother to explain.  In the Raziel Tarot the Shekinah becomes central, reappearing in various cards, and we learn that She is the female aspect of God—the male is the Holy One.  This idea, that god is both male and female, seems radical and modern, but in fact goes back at least two thousand years.  It also sets up the all-important theme of exile and return.  In Jewish myth, the Shekinah has gone into exile with humanity, and cannot be re-united with the Holy One until human beings re-discover their true selves.  This too is a major theme of the Raziel Tarot.

            The deck also contains two extra major arcana cards: The Tree of Knowledge and the Tree of Life.  Despite all these levels and extra cards, the divinatory interpretations for the deck are straightforward, combining traditional meanings with some of the implications of the pictures.

            Special note: while the Book of Raziel began as a myth people  have actually created magical texts with that name, in particular a full-length book published in 1701, in Hebrew, in Amsterdam.  It is said that if you have a copy of The Book of Raziel in your home it will never burn down.  We cannot promise you that having The Raziel Tarot will allow you to cancel your fire insurance, but it can’t hurt!

The Box Cover

In this deluxe edition the cards will measure 6" high and have gold edges

 

We are planning on making a full 80-card version of The Raziel Tarot with standard 5” high cards and an expanded book.  It may take over a year before this is complete, but anyone who buys the deluxe Raziel Tarot: Majors Edition will receive a special offer.  Before the deck is made available to anyone else,  you will be able to buy the set at a 25% discount.

 

OUR STORIES

            It begins with oracles.  For each of us, cards, sticks and shells, ancient temples and secret traditions have been a way to experience the mysteries of life brought into a practical reality.  Oracles, omens, and tools of divination are as old as humanity.

            Here is Robert on how he came to his life’s work:

 

            As long as I can remember, I have always looked to my dreams as a source of guidance. I have even had dreams that have predicted the future. So I can see now that my dreams were a natural form of divination, similar to the experience of shamans in many different cultures.

 

In 1982, I dreamed that I received a phone call from a law firm in England. The phone was a symbol to indicate that the communication was coming from outside of my consciousness, and I was aware of that in the dream, thinking, “how can someone call you in a dream?  I didn’t know that that could happen.”  The dream told me that I had an inheritance coming from an ancestor in England.  The object I was inheriting had great power and I had to use it wisely.  It was called “the key,” and I was told that I would recognize it when I saw it.  Within a few days, a friend brought his new Waite-Smith Tarot Deck to show me.  I immediately recognized it as my inheritance.  In another day or so, another friend spontaneously gave me a Tarot of Marseilles deck and later I bought a Waite-Smith deck for myself. Because of the way I was introduced to the cards, I usually say that I did not entirely choose to become involved in the Tarot.  It seems more like the Tarot chose to become involved with me.

 

Since then, cards and divination have become the focus of my life, a satisfying subject for my artistic abilities and for my interests in history, philosophy, symbolism, and mysticism.  All of these fuse into one thing in my decks, and the practice of divination with the decks makes them relevant in the lives of the reader and the client.  

 

            And Rachel:

 

Like Robert, I’ve often said that I did not discover Tarot, Tarot discovered me.  I have loved myth and tales of magic all my life.  Then, in early Spring of 1970, a friend read my cards and I was amazed at these images that were like doors into other worlds.  They seemed like frozen moments in a story, or a dream.  At the same time, they meant something, there were meanings, and ideas, and even history attached to them.  They could speak to us, and make statements about people’s lives.   Over time, I discovered that Tarot was only one expression of a vast world of oracular traditions.  I worked on different decks, designing some with artists, and drawing my own.  Twice I visited Delphi, the site of the most famous oracular temple of all, and known to the ancients as “The center of the world.”  I’ve used cards for magic, and for storytelling, and to help people—myself included— make difficult decisions, or understand relationships, or recover from trauma, or talk to the gods.  Once, Wald Amberstone, co-director of the Readers Studio, interviewed me and asked if there was a thread that connected all the different kinds of work I’ve done, the divination texts, the art, the novels and poetry and translation.  And because I’ve also written comics he asked if I had a secret identity.  I told him I considered myself a Knight of the Imagination.

 

Angelo Nasios interviews Rachel and Robert about The Raziel Tarot

 

THE TWENTY-FOUR CARDS


THE FIRST REVIEW

The Raziel Tarot is a stunning presentation of significant mystical narratives bound within the tarot deck. In the precise artwork of Robert Place, Rachel Pollack has re-told the tales of spiritual ascent and glorious unification, through the lens of Judaic myth. In doing so, these cards provide us an illustrated architecture of paradise through which we may ascend and descend in our own life story through every shuffle and spread.

 

Rachel writes that the deck deals with the “great theme” of genuine reunification and liberation; and also the Shekinah, the presence of god most often depicted as feminine. The leading Kabbalistic scholar Moshe Idel in his ‘Ascensions on High in Jewish Mysticism’ explores the process of reunification through spiritual ascent and this deck provides us a means of realising that ascent; it is indeed a “palace built for her [the divine spirit of Shekinah], namely a sanctuary for her holiness, sanctified and inscribed with all the inscriptions of the supernal sanctuary” (Sepher ha-Temunah).

 

Should a tarot deck work with Jewish themes? None other than the great Kabbalist and mystic Abulafia wrote “know that most of the visions of which Raziel saw are based on the Name of God and its gnosis” and scholar Gershom Scholem continues, “the identity of prophecy with the love of God also finds its proof in the mysticism of numbers” (Major Trends in Jewish Mysticism, p. 138). Rachel points out that divination does indeed come from the divine, and prophecy is an essential if occluded element of Jewish myth.

 

The story-telling element of both Judaism and the tarot is merged together and emphasized in Rachel’s text accompanying the deck. This provides ample opportunity for the reader to explore the midrash, or narrative, of the process of spiritual development through the kabbalistic framework naturally underpinning the deck. This kabbalah is woven lightly but powerfully through Robert’s illustrations and is an ideal gateway into the avenues and orchards of that profound subject.

A final note that Robert’s artwork again meets the challenge of presenting the most enigmatic of concepts in the most accessible manner; his World card, illustrating not only the “Bride of the Earth” but also “the King” with whom she is united, is a triumph of illustration.

 

Marcus Katz & Tali Goodwin

Authors; The Magister, The Magician’s Kabbalah, Secrets of the Waite-Smith Tarot, Abiding in the Sanctuary.

 

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

            The deck and book set are designed and written and ready for the printer

                                   

            And this is where we need your help, to raise the $6000 necessary to make this happen.  Of course, we are not just asking you to contribute.  Every level of participation brings its own reward.

Here is a list of the amounts and perks:

One Raziel Tarot Set shipped in the USA $40 plus $7 shipping

One Raziel Tarot Set shipped International $40 plus $35 shipping

Two Raziel Tarot Sets shipped in the USA $80 plus $7 shipping

Two Raziel Tarot Sets shipped International $80 plus $35 shipping

Three Raziel Tarot Sets shipped in the USA $120 plus $7 shipping

Three Raziel Tarot Sets shipped International $120 plus $35 shipping

Ten Raziel Tarot Sets shipped in the USA $320 plus $15 shipping

Ten Raziel Tarot Sets shipped International $320 plus $75 shipping

           

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

            Finally, we ask your help to spread the word. If you have enjoyed reading this, if the project excites you (as it has consumed us), then please help spread the word.  Even if you do not decide to pre-order the deck at this time, pass on this announcement any way you can—Facebook, Twitter, email lists, blogs, simple one-on-one communications…

            WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!

This kabbalah is woven lightly but powerfully through Robert’s illustrations and is an ideal gateway into the avenues and orchards of that profound subject.A final note that Robert’s artwork again meets the challenge of presenting the most enigmatic of concepts in the most accessible manner; his World card, illustrating not only the “Bride of the Earth” but also “the King” with whom she is united, is a triumph of illustration. Marcus Katz & Tali GoodwinAuthors; The Magister, The Magician’s Kabbalah, Secrets of the Waite-Smith Tarot, Abiding in the Sanctuary.  WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET            The deck and book set are designed and written and ready for the printer                                               And this is where we need your help, to raise the $6000 necessary to make this happen.  Of course, we are not just asking you to contribute.  Every level of participation brings its own reward.Here is a list of the amounts and perks:One Raziel Tarot Set shipped in the USA $40 plus $7 shippingOne Raziel Tarot Set shipped International $40 plus $35 shippingTwo Raziel Tarot Sets shipped in the USA $80 plus $7 shippingTwo Raziel Tarot Sets shipped International $80 plus $35 shippingThree Raziel Tarot Sets shipped in the USA $120 plus $7 shippingThree Raziel Tarot Sets shipped International $120 plus $35 shippingTen Raziel Tarot Sets shipped in the USA $320 plus $15 shippingTen Raziel Tarot Sets shipped International $320 plus $75 shipping            OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP             Finally, we ask your help to spread the word. If you have enjoyed reading this, if the project excites you (as it has consumed us), then please help spread the word.  Even if you do not decide to pre-order the deck at this time, pass on this announcement any way you can—Facebook, Twitter, email lists, blogs, simple one-on-one communications…            WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!

story:
Over the last 10 years as a campus minister, I've spent a lot of time meeting with people to read stories together and talk about Jesus.  Yet there have still been too many occasions where circumstances cut into significant questions and curiosity, and I wished I could have walked further down the road with someone without just recommending that they try reading the bible or go to a church.  In some way, this book is what I wish I could have given people for all those years.  

The book is based on what I often do with students, reading stories together, explaining some background, asking some questions, all so that the reader can step into the story and see what is happening.  Using a conversational style, the book moves back and forth between the scriptural texts of these stories and my commentary to help explore the life of Jesus.  Each section includes references so that the reader can look up the included passages in a bible if they prefer, or they can simply keep reading.  

 

 

Contributors and Reviews

 

To complete this project, I worked with local editor Julie Garbus and artist Wesley Sam-Bruce who used their unique talents to assist me in this endeavor.  The book includes 16 different illustrations (maps, diagrams, and other graphics) that help to tell the story.  The book also has a website at strangerevolution.com that includes a FAQ section, printable illustrations, study guides, and other resources.  For those interested in a small taste, you can currently view a sample of the book there as well (limited unfortunately due to some permissions with the translation).

 

 

This project has also benefited immensely from the assistance of several readers.  Here is what a few of them had to say...

"Strange Revolution is a refreshingly new approach to understanding the relevance of the Bible for our world.  Rather than telling you what to believe or how to think, Trevor Petty equips the reader with a deep comprehension of God's message to the world.  This book is a revelation that will appeal to long-time believers and people just starting to ask questions about Jesus and God."

  • Dr. Josh Packard, Director of The Dechurched Project, author of Church Refugees and Associate Professor of Sociology at the University of Northern Colorado

"Beautifully written and filled with marvelous insights, this is a truly unique introduction to the Christian faith for this generation.  Rev. Petty's engaging narrative, focused on the Gospels themselves, introduces readers to the Person at the heart of those texts in a way no other book I know does.  If you are looking for one book to give to enquirers and those new to the faith, this is it."

  • Dr. James P. Ware, author of Paul and the Mission of the Church, editor of Synopsis of the Pauline Letters in Greek and English and Professor of Religion at the University of Evansville

"I've been blessed to both hear Trevor Petty speak and to read his writing.  Trevor is a gifted communicator and wordsmith.  His writing reflects a wisdom beyond his years and a gift for presenting profound truths in an accessible way."

  • Arron Chambers, pastor and author of Eats with Sinners: Loving Like Jesus (Navpress 2017)

 

 

The Campaign

 

This is less of a "fundraiser" and more of a presale and book launch.  Using a medium like Indiegogo provides a variety of useful benefits:

  1. I can include some creative perks (book signing, limited release Hardcover, correspondence) not possible through other avenues like Amazon.
  2. I can utilize unique combinations of goods and better discounts by selling directly to you.
  3. I have a better opportunity to connect first with and communicate to those most interested and excited about this project.
  4. It allows me to recoup some initial costs with guaranteed bulk orders rather than depending solely on costlier methods (the high costs of print-on-demand) and merchants (retail commissions).  
  5. Finally, it's more fun!  

The funding goal is flexible which means that you get what you buy regardless of totals.  If I reach my goal though I'm allowed to continue using this platform for an extended period (with some additional perks that I don't completely understand yet).

Product Specifics

 

There are a few basic items available through a variety of combinations and discounts.  As you'd probably expect, the more you buy, the bigger the discount.  

  • 5.5 x 8.5 Paperback (391 pages, includes 16 illustrations)
  • 6 x 9 Hardcover, case laminate with matte finish (337 pages, includes 16 illustrations)
  • T-shirt with the cover design by Wesley Sam-Bruce minus "Exploring the Life of Jesus."  Sadly, shipping with this item costs more due to a change in USPS classification, my apologies!

There are also a couple of special perks available like...

  • signed copies
  • followup correspondence with the author to discuss the book

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

After a few years of work on this, I'm thrilled to finally get to share it with you.  If you're also excited about this and want to pitch in, would you help to spread the word?  You could...

  • use the indiegogo share tools to post this on facebook, instagram, or twitter
  • share this personally with someone that might appreciate it
  • if you can swing it, by an extra copy or two to pass along to others

Awesome, that's all for now.  Thanks for checking things out and stay tuned for more updates!

story:
Short Summary

Hello. My name is Robert Wood. As some of you may know, I have been writing in one form or another for most of the last five years or so. 

I found my muse when I tapped into my seemingly endless well of emotions. It began with two incidents that felt more bothersome than productive: A series of irate emails sent to my health insurance company, and an angry letter addressed to a local politician, within weeks of each other. 

When writing these diatribes, I quickly realized that when I was drawing on my feelings, my writing was clear, concise and passionate. 

And it wasn't half bad either. 

I soon launched my own sports blog called Sportaholics Anonymous, which I then parlayed into a freelance writing gig with the national sports website Bleacher Report. After an unsuccessful foray into the sports writing industry. I took a step back from writing while I sought gainful employment. 

But that break from writing only lasted so long. 

In fact, I currently have four active writing projects, with three at or near the finish line. The most complete is a collection of poems that has been accepted by Dorrance Publishing (see YouTube video). 

Writing this poetry allowed me to release a lot of thoughts and feelings I had been holding in over the years on a myriad of topics. Not surprisingly, the collection is titled "Catharsis: A Poetic Purge." 

Since I am a first-time author, Dorrance (along with the other publishers I spoke to) was only willing to offer a self-publishing option. This allows me to keep a percentage of the royalties while also retaining the rights to the work itself. 

The catch? I need to provide an investment. Up front. 

That's where you come in.

At this time, I cannot provide the necessary investment on my own. Therefore, I need financial assistance to fund this project. 

Here are the particulars: 

  • Publisher requires an initial investment of $500.00. 
  • Publisher requires three (3) successive payments of $500.00, to occur every 60 days. 
  • Total investment will equal $2,000.00

 It sounds like a lot. And it is. Hence the request for assistance. 

But like I said, I am in line to keep a portion of the proceeds from the book. More precisely, Dorrance will pay me 20% of the proceeds from each book sold via retail transaction and 30% of the proceeds from each book sold via Direct to Consumer purchase. For the record, I submitted my poetry to multiple publishers and these royalty percentages are competitive. More importantly, Dorrance Publishing is legit. 

Now, if you are interested in contributing, here are the details of the crowdfunding campaign: 

  • Campaign lasts 60 days from the day it is launched. 
  • Initial campaign goal is $500 (equal to the first payment due to Dorrance). 
  • If monetary goal is reached, the campaign will continue as an "InDemand" campaign, and can continue raising money until the 60-day deadline. This allows me to raise money not only towards the initial payment, but towards the successive payments as well. 
  • If either or both goals are not reached, the monetary contributions will still be put towards the paying of the installments. The more money raised the better, but every little bit helps.  

So, what do you get if you contribute?

  • $10 Contribution: A thank you. It may seem trivial, but you deserve my gratitude. 
  • $25 Contribution: A copy of the work once it is published. Seems like a fair reward for your contribution. 
  • $100 Contribution: A copy of the book along with a Direct to Consumer postcard, to use for future purchases or to pass on to another interested party if you choose. Plus, a reservation at an author's appearance in the future. 
But what it really comes down to is the "Why?" Why should you contribute to this particular campaign? 
I know, I already said that I don't have the funds to get this work published. But beyond the financial reasons: Why should you help get this work of literature get published?

First of all, because it would mean something to me. I have put an immense amount of time, effort and energy into completing this work, and I want nothing more than to see it published. 

Second of all, and more importantly, because it would mean something to those who are able to read my poems once they are published. My poems are about a wide array of topics -  love, loss, birth, death, addiction, depression, and the search for meaning in the world, to name a few - and they seem to strike a chord. One poem in the collection - about addiction - was actually read in a Narcotics Anonymous meeting by a former classmate who saw me post the poem on Facebook. He later said it really helped him as well as those who heard it. 

It may help that I tend to explore the topics I wrote about more deeply than my readers are accustomed to, forcing them to explore these ideas and concepts in their own lives. If my poems weren't deep, then they wouldn't be worth writing, let alone publishing. 

At this point, I think I've generated enough pixels on my own behalf. I would again ask you to please contribute to my campaign to help me publish my work of poetry. But at the very least, I would like to thank you for your time and consideration. 


-Robert Wood

story:
Here's How It Works

By reading Timbo's Tales, children will believe that they are consuming a super power elixir that elevates their spirit!

 

 

 

 

Timbo's Tales is the story about a young superhero who sets out to find the ingredients of a magical potion and delivers it to sleeping children (like a Santa Claus or Tooth Fairy for sick kids). 

When the child wakes up she or he will see a cup with the Timbo symbol on it and know that whatever is in the cup is powerful!

As we intuitively know, and science has shown us, the mind is a powerful tool! Through expectation and belief, the mind can actually heal the body (see references below)!    

 

Using the “Placebo Effect” in conjunction with a child’s limitless imagination, we are helping children feel enthusiastic about taking their medicine by instilling optimism and hope to speed up the recuperation process. 

 

Check out these articles on children and placebo!

Placebo effects in children: a review

The authors screened over 50 scientific articles published on the placebo effect in children and adolescents and found that across a number of illnesses, children respond significantly higher to the placebo effect than adults.

Putting the Placebo Effect to Work: A Harvard health letter that encourages using the power of mind healing, claiming that the placebo effect is a critical part of any good medical care.

Mind over Medicine: A book dedicated to exploring how positive thoughts in the mind might in turn create spontaneous healing in the body, or the phenomenon of the “mind making itself well.”

 

 

   

 

1. Timbo's Tales Hardcover Book

Timbo's Tales will come in a beautifully bound A4 hardcover book. Sturdy enough to visit the playground and delicate enough to make you dream. 

 

 

2. Timbo's Magical Stickers

Place Timbo's magical, glittery stickers on all those difficult-to-take medicines and hot water bottles to help your kids feel the warmth and support of Timbo.

 

3. Timbo’s Tales PDF Coloring Book

You and your kids will have hours of fun while plunging into Timbo’s Universe. Get a 10 page PDF coloring book that will consist of the creator's 10 new Timbo's Tales scenes. Exclusive for Indiegogo! 

(example)

4. Name inside the book

How amazing would it be for a child to see her or his name on the inside of their favorite superhero book? It would be incredible.

5. Timbo School and Hospital Kit

Empower as many kids as possible by sharing the Timbo's Tales book! With the Superhero Kit you can share 10 books with different schools, libraries, hospitals, foundations, or anyone else!

It includes: 

- 10 signed Hardcover Timbo’s Tales Books

- 10 Timbo’s stickers

- A PDF Timbo’s Tales Coloring Book

- One E-Book 

 

6. Limited Edition Timbo Art Prints

Own your very own beautiful limited-edition Timbo Tale’s prints that you can put up around your home! The artist has chosen 5 of her favorites to share with you!

(Note: comes unframed)

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Hello! We are Edrea Evstad, the creator and founder of Timbo’s Tales, and Taha Bawa, the co-creator.

Over the past few years, we have been dedicated to bringing you the extraordinary adventure of Timbo's Tales! We are both passionate about creating impact for children and have spent many late nights ruminating on how to make something meaningful...until the concept of Timbo's Tales finally took form. We would help sick kids heal by introducing medicine as a magical potion!

While Taha was working full-time on growing an organization called GoodWall, Edrea took the Timbo's Tales project under her wing to create the storybook while volunteering at a hospital. Her role in the pediatric ward exposed her to the perfect audience for experimenting with the Timbo’s Tales story, and getting it just right! 

 

Please Help Us!

We need your help to get Timbo the superhero recognized by kids around the world! This story can help change the perspective children have on being sick and taking medications. Together, we can shed a positive light on recovery, giving the conviction to heal to those who need it most.

Please share our story with colleagues, friends, family, educators, and anyone who you think might be interested in helping! Together we can change children's perspectives of taking medicine and help them believe in their own power to heal.

We are launching a Timbo's Tales referral contest! Share our Indiegogo with 5 people who contribute to the campaign and you'll receive a signed "Timbo's Tales" hardcopy and E-book for free! 

Please promote the Timbo's Tales campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique referral ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits. 

All referrals that come during the dates of this campaign will be tallied, and winners of the referral contest will be notified in the coming weeks.  

Thank you so much for your support!

 

Risks & Challenges

As always, there are risks with any endeavor, otherwise where is the fun? However, the risks corresponding to this project are minimal. 

We have already been working on this project for nearly three years! This means that we have researched the possibilities for making this the best-quality book possible.

In October 2016, we connected with a trustworthy printing house at the Frankfurt International Book Fair, where we had the opportunity to meet with the sales manager and peruse several prototypes that left us trusting the quality and professionalism of our chosen printing house.

We have also insured the delivery of all products, making sure that we will be able to import the books at low-risk. 

The book has already been illustrated and edited and is just waiting to be printed, which means that it will take a shorter time than commissioned works!

 

THANK YOU!
