We need your help to get Timbo the superhero recognized by kids around the world! This story can help change the perspective children have on being sick and taking medications. Together, we can shed a positive light on recovery, giving the conviction to heal to those who need it most.
Please share our story with colleagues, friends, family, educators, and anyone who you think might be interested in helping! Together we can change children's perspectives of taking medicine and help them believe in their own power to heal.

We are launching a Timbo's Tales referral contest! Share our Indiegogo with 5 people who contribute to the campaign and you'll receive a signed "Timbo's Tales" hardcopy and E-book for free! 
Please promote the Timbo's Tales campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique referral ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits. 
All referrals that come during the dates of this campaign will be tallied, and winners of the referral contest will be notified in the coming weeks.  
Thank you so much for your support!

 
Risks & Challenges
As always, there are risks with any endeavor, otherwise where is the fun? However, the risks corresponding to this project are minimal. 
We have already been working on this project for nearly three years! This means that we have researched the possibilities for making this the best-quality book possible.
In October 2016, we connected with a trustworthy printing house at the Frankfurt International Book Fair, where we had the opportunity to meet with the sales manager and peruse several prototypes that left us trusting the quality and professionalism of our chosen printing house.
We have also insured the delivery of all products, making sure that we will be able to import the books at low-risk. 
The book has already been illustrated and edited and is just waiting to be printed, which means that it will take a shorter time than commissioned works!
 
THANK YOU!

story:
Gracias por el interés de contar con el libro en Español. Gracias a su apoyo lo publicaré en Español también! Si me ayudan a llegar a $10,000 podremos también contar con el audiolibro. 

Thank you for the interest shown in having the book in Spanish.  Thanks to your support I will also publish it in Spanish! If you help me reach $10,000 we can also have the audiobook.

Story of My Book

At Risk of Greatness is a book about a movement that is finding new approaches to attain 21st century skills and abilities, and with it, a better life for individuals and communities. Particularly for disengaged young adults.

My name is Carlos Carpizo and I am the author of At Risk of Greatness. I wrote this book because I’ve experienced the challenges faced by young adults up-close and personal. We tend to look for technology to solve challenges; however, after a career in technology my collaboration with an arts entrepreneur clarified a powerful vision for me: arts are essential to help us humans avoid thinking like machines. The intersection of art and technology allows us to better develop 21st century skills and abilities.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover in simple terms how we’ve gotten to our present state of confusion and difficulty managing too many choices. I also offer a guide to the future by exploring how the intersection of art and technology can be the best path forward to restore harmony to our communities, and a great alternative for millions of disengaged young adults around us.

I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for effectively developing a success mindset through stories of individuals that have achieved it in spite of facing difficult circumstances. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you choose a path to achieve 21st century skills and abilities.

In this book, you'll learn about the importance of art to maintain our humanity in this age of accelerations and its intersection with technology:

Why we’re experiencing a slingshot effect with advanced technology, particularly since smartphones became popular.

That a success mindset is more important than success itself.

That it’s not mandatory to go to college to achieve your success in this 21st century and the many alternative paths that exist to a ‘traditional education’.

You will love this book if you’re a young adult and feel disoriented by too many choices because it’ll help you understand the difference between success and a success mindset. You will also like this book if you’re a parent or teacher who recognizes the challenges faced by young adults because you will better understand their world, the impact of technology on them and how to make better use of arts and technology. Or if you’re an entrepreneur it’ll give you ideas on how effectively intersect art and technology.


The book is written in 4 Parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and it clearly explains the exponential acceleration of advanced technologies in our everyday lives, and its impact on our human condition particularly since the arrival of the smartphones. What I call the slingshot effect.

Part 2 hones into the impact on young adults. A trip through changes throughout history and how adolescents have evolved into GenZ or iGens, the generation that grew-up with a smartphone on their hands.

Part 3 is a collection of interesting stories from individuals that developed a success mindset, which allowed them to overcome difficult circumstances to achieve success in their own terms.

Part 4 narrates the multiple approaches that exist to improving individuals and communities following alternative paths to what we understand as ‘traditional’ education or employment.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [Month, Year]

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author


Carlos Carpizo is a former technology executive, now entrepreneur passionate about social innovation. He is a GenXer. Mexican by birth and Texan by choice. Proud parent of two GenZers or iGens.

His mission is to increase economic growth and social inclusion for young adults in disadvantaged areas of North America (US & Mexico).

Carlos is well known by his friends and family for being a failed artist so they’re grateful he was born in an era where he could put his abilities in the high technology space to good use. His boys, now men, are proud of him for having gotten his OCD and CEO style under control at home. His newfound best pal is his ‘grandpup’ Pookie.

For more information you can connect with Carlos at carlos.carpizo@coevolution.online or @CarpizoCarlos on Twitter, @carpizocarlos on Instagram, and ccarpizo on facebook.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AtRiskofGreatness and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Carlos

story:
About the Author

Shoshanah graduated as an Occupational Therapist (OT) in 1990 and has worked in 4 countries and in several different types of facilities. She has been published in a professional publication, a magazine, on websites and blogs. Her first book "Tuvia Finds His Freedom" was written and photographed with her husband Rabbi Eliyahu Shear.

The greatest challenge in OT that Shoshanah has encountered, is a lack of adequate knowledge or recognition of the profession. This results in poor or limited referrals with many clients having to wait months or years for an appropriate referral, if it happens at all. It does not have to be this way if only the profession would be well understood. 

A number of her patients and their families requested that Shoshanah write a book to help to promote this important profession. This book has taken many years to reach the stage that it is nearly ready to be made available to the public. Your help is needed to help to get the book to its final goal, i.e. to be well marketed and known by all those who could benefit from reading the book 

Why Self-Publishing?

Along the journey in writing this book, Shoshanah consulted with the American Occupational Therapy Association who encouraged her to self-publish so as to reach as wide a readership as possible. Self-publishing also gives her more control over content, layout, how and where to market and promote the book.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The amount requested will be used to cover:

- Editing, including being able to convert this book into audio for the visually impaired: $4000

- Cover Design: $2000

- Marketing and Promotion including paid adverts, printing items for marketing, giving out copies to obtain book reviews etc: $10 000

- Book Launch: $2000

- Interior book design, layout and finishing touches, including purchasing certain stock photographs which would enhance the book : $5000

- Printing: $10 000

- Upgrading our website, software and equipment: $4000

- If sufficient funds come in, Shoshanah would love to have the book translated into Hebrew too.  Confirmation as to cost involved is still required.

For those who contribute, copies can only be ordered once Shoshanah has received the funds Following this, 1 - 3 weeks needs to be given for shipping of books. All those who donate will be notified as to when the book launch will take place and will be invited to join the book launch, provided that a minimum amount is received to bring the book to the stage of a book launch. 

 

The Impact

The lack of sufficient recognition of the profession leads to a reduction in appropriate referrals. To illustrate, when networking to obtain letters to support this book, Shoshanah approached several doctors, among them a family doctor (G.P.) The family doctor, upon reading the title of the book, was convinced that OT is involved in using sport in therapy and had no idea what OT actually is. She grappled to understand that activity can be more than just sport. Further in the discussion it transpired that the doctor does not refer to OT at all, due to lack of understanding as to what OT can offer her patients. She is one of many medical practitioners who are not referring to OT. In addition, their patients suffer through not receiving the intervention they require. 

The potential impact can best be described through the following excerpts from letters to support the book that have been obtained thus far. I am working on obtaining further letters.

Excerpts from Letters to Support the Book:

1) "... This book will be read with interest by patient's families, all health care students, medical practitioners, who will be enlightened further, and gain significant understanding of patient care." ~ Emeritus Professor Tuviah Zabow

2) "... Undoubtedly you are performing a wonderful service by helping us all, not only in the medical profession, but in the general public, to be more aware of what occupational therapy can offer." ~ Norman Samuels, M.D., Medical Director and Retired Obesity Surgeon

3) "... I love it so much ... It applies to so many audiences..., patients, caregivers, parents, professionals, etc..." ~ Amanda, Beta Reader and mother of a child who received OT

Target Audience:

As indicated in the excerpts above, the target audience includes but is not limited to:

lay people (i.e. potential clients and their families), the medical team especially doctors, all students in fields related to healthcare and education, professionals, secretaries of organizations / healthcare facilities. business consultants. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Considerable time has already gone into writing this book in order to get it ready for publishing. The book shown in the video and photograph is the 3rd proof copy that has been ordered and is currently being proof read, edited and revised. Your help is needed to help reach this final goal of making the book available to the public and working to promote it effectively. We would love to bring out this book in the next few weeks. The biggest risk to not receiving the necessary funds will be that those who could benefit from the book will not know that it exists. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in this book but are unable to donate, you can assist in the following ways.

- If you have a blog that is in any of the following genres and are prepared to host a post about the book, please let me know. The types of blog topics would be: occupational therapy, health and wellness, medical, entrepreneur (especially social entrepreneur) , parenting, books or writing

- If you are able to do a book review, please be in touch. If you are unable to contribute but could purchase the book when it comes onto Amazon and write a book review to post onto Amazon, that would help too

- Please share this campaign with anyone who might be able to assist and also on your social networking forums FB, Twitter, LinkedIn etc

- Invite Shoshanah to give a talk about the book (Talks can be via Skype with webcam or other online classrooms too)

- Write / publish a press release to help to promote the book

- Interview Shoshanah about this book for your blog, podcast, radio or publication

- Recommend to the editor of your favourite blog or publication to interview Shoshanah about this book

- Visit Shoshanah's website www.beahappymom.com and join her newsletter 

- Be in touch to join her FB group

- If you have contacts with any companies who offer corporate sponsorship, Shoshanah is currently seeking appropriate sponsors

- If you have a blog, website or publication that pays freelance writers, you can hire Shoshanah to write an article related to occupational therapy, health and wellness, parenting, benefits of infant massage, creativity, importance of creativity in our lives

- Purchase a copy of her book, "Tuvia Finds His Freedom" in English on this link:  https://www.createspace.com/5325068  or in Hebrew on this link:  https://www.createspace.com/5683162  The links provided are for the CreateSpace eStore, however the books are available on other major online retail bookstores. If you enjoy the book, do write a review or send Shoshanah a positive comment about what you enjoyed.

Thank you for participating in this exciting project and any way in which you can help to bring this book both into print and to the public.

story:
The phrase “Losing Ground” is often used to describe failed efforts to reduce poverty and disease in developing countries. Gaining Ground tells a different story. This is the story of how a small, volunteer-based organization –Mano a Mano International Partners – has steadily and dramatically improved the health and economic well-being in one of the poorest corners of the world, Bolivia.

 -Christine Ver Ploeg (From the Introduction of Gaining Ground)

The Book

Gaining Ground: The Creation and Evolution of a Private International Aid Organization is written by Joan Velasquez, co-founder of Mano a Mano International Partners. It describes how, in just twenty years, this private, largely volunteer, humanitarian aid organization has dramatically improved the health and economic well-being of rural villagers in Bolivia. Joan has written this book to respond to many requests from international humanitarian non-profits and non-governmental organizations for guidance regarding their own efforts to alleviate the worst effects of world poverty. Gaining Ground describes in detail a unique model that has been amazingly effective. It also tells the compelling story of a husband and wife who made a dinner table vision come to life. That vision has resulted in an organization that in just two decades has provided over one hundred Bolivian villages with medical clinics, school buildings, teacher housing, sanitation facilities, roads, landing strips, agricultural programs and water.

Twenty years after its modest starting point, Mano a Mano finds itself uniquely situated to offer counsel and encouragement. Its experiences in Bolivia have differed markedly from those of many other non-profits with similar humanitarian objectives. This book is offered as an account of one organization’s humble beginnings and how it grew into an international aid organization that has made such a dramatic difference in a developing country. The hope is that others will take the best of the Mano a Mano experience, shape it to meet their own needs, and then tackle the challenges of acute poverty in their own corners of the world.

Gaining Ground has now been written and is currently undergoing a final edit. We now turn to YOU for financial support to publish it. When published all sales proceeds will go to Mano a Mano. This organization has been built on principles of stewardship, frugality, tens of thousands of volunteer hours and private donations. This means that nearly 100% of all donations go to support the projects in Bolivia. Your financial support will make Gaining Ground a reality without diverting limited funds that are already committed to projects that literally mean the difference between life and death in Bolivia. For examples, see www.manoamano.org 

Please help support our vision, so that together we can help eliminate poverty around the globe.

Thank you, 

Mano a Mano International Partners

Our Model

Mano a Mano’s successful model, participatory development, is not a product of conventional international development literature or research or US based non-profit practices. Instead the organization has disregarded preconceived notions of how things are supposed to be done and focused on what makes sense and how to make things happen. The Mano a Mano community-based model rejects conventional top down approaches in favor of trust and reliance on grassroots expertise and reflects what the organization has always seen as its greatest strengths: integrity, frugality, commitment, ingenuity and nimbleness. The dramatic difference Mano a Mano has made to the lives of hundreds of thousands of Bolivian paisanos in just twenty years affirms the efficacy of that model. Every Mano a Mano project is or soon will be self sustaining. For further details please see www.manoamano.org

Our Results

Since its humble beginnings in 1994, Mano a Mano has: 

Shipped 3.5 million pounds of medical, school and construction supplies to Bolivia

Built 144 clinics to provide health care access to over 700,000 Bolivians

 

 

Constructed 1400 kilometers in roads, helping isolated communities gain access to markets

 

Constructed 6 large agricultural reservoirs and 153 water ponds, improving the crop yields, nutrition and income for thousands of families

Built 49 schools, with teacher housing and community bathrooms

 

And provided air rescue to 2,000+ patients


However, NONE of this would have been possible without both the hard work and community support of the Bolivian people, and financial support of people like YOU. 

Rewards

All backers will receive a 501(c)(3) receipt, making your Indiegogo contribution tax deductible. 

2014 Calendars, written in Spanish and English, are available at the $25+ level and include pictures of many of the great things Mano a Mano has done over the past year. 

Hand woven coin purses and oven mitts are available at the $100+ level. These handcrafts help support both the rural Bolivian families who make them and Mano a Mano's work within their communities. 

Hand woven Alpaca Scarfs are available at the $500+ level.  

Handmade Bolivian purses/bags are available at the $1000+ level.

 

We are only able to ship rewards to US addresses.

Thank you notes and 501(c)(3) receipts will ship out immediately after the campaign is over, while Bolivian crafts, calendars and books will ship out in April at the latest.
story_txt: The phrase “Losing Ground” is often used to describe failed efforts to reduce poverty and disease in developing countries. Gaining Ground tells a different story. This is the story of how a small, volunteer-based organization –Mano a Mano International Partners – has steadily and dramatically improved the health and economic well-being in one of the poorest corners of the world, Bolivia. -Christine Ver Ploeg (From the Introduction of Gaining Ground)The BookGaining Ground: The Creation and Evolution of a Private International Aid Organization is written by Joan Velasquez, co-founder of Mano a Mano International Partners. It describes how, in just twenty years, this private, largely volunteer, humanitarian aid organization has dramatically improved the health and economic well-being of rural villagers in Bolivia. Joan has written this book to respond to many requests from international humanitarian non-profits and non-governmental organizations for guidance regarding their own efforts to alleviate the worst effects of world poverty. Gaining Ground describes in detail a unique model that has been amazingly effective. It also tells the compelling story of a husband and wife who made a dinner table vision come to life. That vision has resulted in an organization that in just two decades has provided over one hundred Bolivian villages with medical clinics, school buildings, teacher housing, sanitation facilities, roads, landing strips, agricultural programs and water.Twenty years after its modest starting point, Mano a Mano finds itself uniquely situated to offer counsel and encouragement. Its experiences in Bolivia have differed markedly from those of many other non-profits with similar humanitarian objectives. This book is offered as an account of one organization’s humble beginnings and how it grew into an international aid organization that has made such a dramatic difference in a developing country. The hope is that others will take the best of the Mano a Mano experience, shape it to meet their own needs, and then tackle the challenges of acute poverty in their own corners of the world.Gaining Ground has now been written and is currently undergoing a final edit. We now turn to YOU for financial support to publish it. When published all sales proceeds will go to Mano a Mano. This organization has been built on principles of stewardship, frugality, tens of thousands of volunteer hours and private donations. This means that nearly 100% of all donations go to support the projects in Bolivia. Your financial support will make Gaining Ground a reality without diverting limited funds that are already committed to projects that literally mean the difference between life and death in Bolivia. For examples, see www.manoamano.org Please help support our vision, so that together we can help eliminate poverty around the globe.Thank you, Mano a Mano International PartnersOur ModelMano a Mano’s successful model, participatory development, is not a product of conventional international development literature or research or US based non-profit practices. Instead the organization has disregarded preconceived notions of how things are supposed to be done and focused on what makes sense and how to make things happen. The Mano a Mano community-based model rejects conventional top down approaches in favor of trust and reliance on grassroots expertise and reflects what the organization has always seen as its greatest strengths: integrity, frugality, commitment, ingenuity and nimbleness. The dramatic difference Mano a Mano has made to the lives of hundreds of thousands of Bolivian paisanos in just twenty years affirms the efficacy of that model. Every Mano a Mano project is or soon will be self sustaining. story:
De Zorgbus

Vraag jij je ook wel eens af "wat als ik ouder ben? Hoe ziet mijn leven er dan uit?" 

of

"Zal ik later nog wel voor mezelf kunnen zorgen?"

Die vragen hebben wij ook gesteld en de conclusie was schrikbarend. Steeds meer ouderen en gehandicapten kwijnen weg in verzorgingstehuizen. Waar zij vroeger een acceptabel budget hadden om het vervoer  naar activiteiten, familiebezoek of gewoonweg de supermarkt te bekostigen, zitten zij nu voorál binnen. De overheid verminderd jaar op jaar de besteedbare budgetten waardoor ouderen en gehandicapten de dupe worden. 

Stichting Mobiliteit Voor Iedereen haalt met haar Zorgbus mensen uit dit sociaal isolement door samen te werken met zorginstellingen en deze kwetsbare groep het vervoer te bieden dat zij zo hard nodig hebben. 

Wat vragen we van jou?

Samen met zorginstelling Archipel  willen we een nieuwe Zorgbus laten rijden. Dagelijks zal deze bus enkele honderden ouderen voorzien van een betere oude dag. 

Om dit te realiseren hebben wij jou nodig, help ons daarom nú! 

De volledige kosten om de bus vier jaar lang te exploiteren bedragen 80.000 euro. Echter met een bedrag van 40.000 euro kunnen we het project starten. 

  • Hiervan wordt de aanschaf van de bus bekostigd; 
  • En de volledige exploitatie voor 4 jaar (onderhoud en brandstof)
Wij werken met vrijwilligers die de bus dagelijks besturen, er worden dus géén loonkosten gemaakt. Het volledige bedrag komt ten goede aan het project. 
Jij maakt hét verschil!

Door jouw bijdrage:

  • Halen we ouderen en gehandicapten uit hun sociaal isolement. 
  • Bieden we hen een positiever uitkijk op het leven. 
  • Zetten we de eerste stappen naar een échte participatiemaatschappij.

Hoe kun je ons helpen: 

Natuurlijk zijn we hard op zoek naar financiële steun, maar wellicht ben je hiertoe  momenteel niet in de gelegenheid. Gelukkig zijn er ook  andere manieren om ons te helpen. 

  • Sharing is caring: Deel dit crowdfundingproject met zoveel mogelijk anderen. 
  • Wordt een vrijwilliger op een van onze zorgbussen. 

Andere succesvolle projecten

Neem eens een kijkje op https://stichtingmobiliteitvooriedereen.nl/projecten/ om meer over onze succesvolle projecten te weten te komen.

story:
The Wild Mushroom Cookbook: Recipes from Mendocino

We're Alison Gardner and Merry Winslow, and we're mushroom nuts! We've written a cookbook with hundreds of recipes for around 40 species of wild mushrooms we've found  in Mendocino, California. We were finding so many mushrooms, and cooking so many dishes, and nobody had done such a cookbook, that we had to share the possibilities with you!
It's more and more important to be self sufficient, and local food is on everyone's mind. Wild mushrooms are a wonderful source of nutrition, being high in protein, minerals, and healthy carbohydrates.
Our book includes recipes for appetizers, sauces and gravies, pickles, marinades, breads, sandwiches, soups, salads, side dishes, entrees, drinks and desserts. We'll teach you how to smoke, dry  and preserve your harvest. We will inspire you with creative ideas for sharing your bounty, and we will give you the courage to invent new recipes of your own using our introduction to the species.
It's the most diverse and comprehensive local mushroom cookbook ever published. Its focus is on west coast mushrooms, but many species are found globally, and across the U.S. If you love mushrooms, but don't eat wild ones, you can adapt many of our recipes to store-bought mushrooms.
Alison has been mushrooming for 44 years, and cooking for 42 years. She's had a number of jobs as prep cook and cook in restaurants, and has also done catering. She's teacher-aided for college level mushroom identification courses, and leads mushroom walks and tours.
Merry used to be a newspaper restaurant critic in San Francisco, and now, as journalist and editor, artist and mushroom enthusiast, she loves food and feeding  people.
We've spent four years inventing, writing down, and testing recipes. We are working with a company that helps people self-publish. The book is typeset, and will soon go to the indexer. We're hoping to raise the money to print the book through pre-selling as many copies as we can, and by using this website to offer perks and incentives to contribute.  Our most special perks include private mushroom forays and  catered mushroom dinners.

story:
About the Perl/Raspberry Pi eBook

In the usual Perl tradition, a number of Perl modules for the Raspberry Pi already exist, including RPi::WiringPi and Device::WebIO::RaspberryPi. There are also modules for interacting with sensors, such as Device::TMP102 (a temperature sensor) and Device::Gyroscope::L3GD20 (a gyroscope). Despite this, there are few writeups on Perl-based hardware projects in the wild.

As Perl programmers, we all like to use existing CPAN modules whenever possible. Still, new hardware devices are coming out all the time, and there won't be modules available for all of them. That's why this book will walk you through how to read a datasheet and implement a new piece of hardware. It's easier than you think, and will help expand Perl into a whole new niche.

Basic knowledge of Perl will be assumed. If you would like to learn Perl before the book is released, we recommend Learning Perl by Randal L. Schwartz,‎ brian d foy,‎ and Tom Phoenix. You should also know how to use basic Linux commands. The Raspberry Pi itself makes a good platform for learning Linux, so why not pick one up ahead of time and start playing around?

Existing knowledge of hardware interfacing or the Raspberry Pi is not required. Knowing how to solder will be helpful, but this is something you can learn as you go.

The eBook will be self-published on Leanpub. It's expected to be completed by August 2018.

Outline

Here's the currently planned material:

  • RPi Models, and Tools/Hardware You Need
  • Basic Setup
  • GPIO [blink an LED, read from a switch, pullups/pulldowns]
  • SPI
  • i2c 
  • Camera [GStreamer1, face tracking with OpenCV]
  • Serial
  • Expanding with Firmata
  • Interfacing from the Web [Device::WebIO]
  • PWM and Analog Input
  • Asynchronous code
  • Build Project: Temperature Logger
  • Build Project: Garage Door Opener
  • Build Project: Indoor Grow Room

Stretch Goal

If we make it to $4000, we will add chapters on:

  • Infrared remote control
  • MQTT
  • Developing a device module in C and interfacing with Perl

About Timm Murray

I've been programming Perl professionally for 15 years, and have authored 33 CPAN distributions. I've also written for Perl.com, and keep a regular blog at wumpus-cave.net. Many of my modules cover hardware integration, such as Linux::IRPulses (parsing infrared control signals from LIRC) and UAV::Pilot (a framework for controlling drones).

About Steve Bertrand

I've coded in Perl since 2001.

I have 40+ published CPAN distributions, and currently author berrybrew, the Perlbrew for Windows.

My main focus in Perl has been writing software to help the developer; test software (Test::BrewBuild) (testing reverse dependencies included), examination software (Devel::Examine::Subs), and over the last two years plus, I've been focusing on writing software for the Raspberry Pi, including WiringPi::API and numerous custom sensor and Integrated Circuit (IC) software based on C/XS code.

Risks & Challenges

Hardware can be a tricky subject with lots of hidden pitfalls. You may spend hours trying to figure out why you can't communicate with a module, only to find out it works fine after wrapping a ground wire around a signal wire to block interference. That said, the authors have gone down this path before and have already amassed some hard won experience.
